name: Eternal Legend
description:
You are an Eternal Legend, a warrior who has the ability to take on at least a hundred men and survive. A hero who has fought many battles and come back with trophies, gold and many tales to tell.

Such heroes and heroines of adventure and wonder travel the land to seek their own destiny and fortune. Yet there is only one true way to gain such fame and that is on the field of battle. Any hero can go down into a dark dungeon or save a maiden from a tower, but it takes a true hero to fight alongside fellow men and outshine every one of them.

Eternal Legend is a hack and slash adventure where you play one hero or heroine who has to cleave their way through years of war in order for their name to go down in history. Every turn a card is drawn and the player can choose to fight in that war or pass it by. If they pass they begin to fade into obscurity but if they succeed the Hero gains more riches and fame.

As the years go on the world gets harsher, new wars are fought and less is understood. Can your hero survive all eight eras of battle or will their name go down in just a few sections of history?

Play one hero or compete for fame with friends as you cleave your way war by war, becoming the victor or dying a (hopefully) heroic death. The objective is to claim fame in as many wars as possible and amount the largest pile of gold and riches before your inevitable defeat. Everyone dies someday, so why not go out in a shower of bloody but heroic glory.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Gramo The Grammar Game of Skill and Chance
description:
60 grammar terms and their descriptions are the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAMO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has a grammar term number and it's description. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 60 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, M, or O), a grammar term, and optionally, that term's number. If that term's description is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, term, and term number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some grammar terms thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the term number, but players have access to a "Epi/Gramo" booklet in which they can find the terms and descriptions.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory all terms and their description.

A player calls "Gramo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

name: Multifactor
description:
Develop a nimble mind by computing basic multiplication facts or, inversely, breaking products down into factors and possibly prime factors. In the game, players use two spinners to generate numbers, and have cards that track the results of the spins, depending on the game.

In Product Capture, players claim the product of two factors they spin. Three or more chips in a row earn points keyed to the color zones.

In Factor Pursuit, players compute the product of two spinners and mark any set of factors for this product on their scorecards. Be the first to fill your scorecard and win! A bonus investigation guides students in exploring the multiplication table for repeating, reflecting, and growing patterns

name: Willitip
description:
Balancing/dexterity game for 2, 3 or 4.

Players in turn place weights over pegs on a five-armed structure balancing on a central pivot. A weight placed too far out along an arm causes the structure to overbalance, costing the player points. As the game progresses and more weights are placed on the arms of the structure, it is possible to place weights at the end of the arms.

There are three different scoring mechanisms that can be used within the game, allowing for a certain degree of strategy to be employed.

name: The 19th Hole Classic Golf Card Game
description:
From the box cover:

Golfers
Get your favorite foursome together and discover the fantastic entertainment in eighteen holes of golf, played with cards.

Played using cards, each player is dealt a hand of cards representing the number of strokes scored for a given hole. Each player chooses the card that they want for each hole, with the winner of each hole playing last on the next hole. Play continues in this fashion until 18 holes have been completed; the player who won the most holes wins the game.

name: WordPress Board Game
description: In the game, each player takes a role as a web developer who works on a team to set a new blog by implementing the WordPress engine. Each player need to set the optimal combination of plugins. It sounds easy, right? But there are some elements on the game that will make that simple task much more challenging. There are 3 dices that represent the request from the boss that the player must obey – some time those will destroy all the work. When to cooperate and when to compete is another challenge that each player need to solve.

name: Coccinella's Racing
description:
This is a racing game, freely inspired by the egiptian game of Senet.

The aim of the game is to bring all you pieces to the other side of the 30-spaces board; the piece move according to the dice throw: with 2,3,4,6 you can chose to move one piece of that amount. With 1 you move one piece of 1 space but can repeat the turn. With 5 you move ALL your pieces of 1 space. Spaces already occupied by own pieces can never be reached. Opponent pieces can instead be captured or jumped, unless they are in groups of 2 or 3 respectively.

From the box:
Who will be the first to bring his beetle to the finish line ?
A fun tactical contest....with a little bit of luck.

name: Angle Tangle
description: An abstract game for two players. Each player gets square and triangle pieces in two colors, and must alternately place pieces on the board so that they touch a piece of the other color and do not touch pieces of the same color. The player with the smallest total area of remaining pieces wins.
publishers: Orda Industries Ltd., Skye Marketing Corporation

name: Myriad: The Word Game
description:
In Myriad, each player has a board and a set of letter chips. The chips are placed on the boards to form words, with the score per letter being the number of letters in the word. Unusual features of the game include:


After playing a word to their own board, a player may place their letters on other players' boards to form words. Each player with letters in a word scores for them.



When a word is formed that contains shorter words (e.g., KIN which contains IN), the shorter words are scored as well.



The center section of each board can be rotated to put the letters in different positions.


Several levels of alternative rules are provided for children.

The game was sold in two and four-player sets.

name: Unforced Error Tennis
description:
Simple statistical game on tennis, being an adaptation of the system pionereed in Olympic Tennis.
Each player is rated for Service and Return, plus his ability to win Tie Break and be more decisive than his/her opponent in the hotter phases of each match.
As almost all statistical sport game, is better suited for solitaire gaming and you may complete a match in a matter of minutes, as the score is calculated game after game.

name: Topeka-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

A board game about the GREAT city of Topeka!
We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some hot air balloons, sunflowers, a great big motorsports facility, and some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Topeka-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Houston-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the HOUSTON we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, art, breathtaking parks, space technology, and a bayou or two! Looking for a fun way to experience Space City? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite HOUSTON properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go HOUSTON! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in outer space!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Fort Worth-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the FORT WORTH we could into this box. It’s filled with old west flare, stunning art, Texas hospitality, Honky-Tonk, and a Cattle Drive or two! Looking for a fun way to experience Cowtown? Here it is!
Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite FORT WORTH properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go FORT WORTH! You may soon be running for mayor... or lost in
The Cowtown Cattlepen Maze!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Abducted by Aliens
description:
Escape from an alien spaceship by overcoming obstacles and helping the visitors to learn more about the planet Earth.

Movement on the map can only be done between adjacent spaces. Every space you land on has a play card that reveals quests, grant items, or pose challenges, such as finding a key, competing with another player, drawing a picture, acting out a pantomime or really anything. The outcome of any performance or challenge is decided by one of the othere players or by voting with special cards. Try to pass it as many times as you wish or just find your way around.

The goal of the game is to be first to the finish square after opening a certain number of play cards.

The game is very engaging and requires some logic and strategic skills.
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Voting

name: Duelers
description:
Duelers is an action figure based collectible game where players amass exciting armies to battle their friends. Duelers miniatures stand two to three inches tall and represent a vast variety of genres and archetypes. Duelers are meant to be easy to pickup and play. Players can choose to play with two duelers or twenty; there is no minimum or maximum army counnt. Like other miniatures games systems, Duelers is based on 6-sided dice to randomize combat. However, in addition to dice, Duelers utilizes "combat cards" to add an extra level of strategy to the game. Attack Cards can give you an extra edge in battle, and Defense Cards will cause your opponent's carefully laid plans of men (and mice) to go awry.

In addition to total enemy annihilation, players are vying for special game objectives in the form of Treasure Chests. Successfully defending your own chests is good, but capturing your opponent's chests is what separates the winners and the losers. Gameplay proceeds as players alternate turns until one of three things happens. Either all of the Treasure Chests are captured, or all of a player’s Duelers are slain, or there’s an earthquake that shakes the pieces onto the floor.

name: Junior Dessinez c'est gagn√©
description: User review: One player tries draws the object designated on the card while the drawer's teammates try to guess what the object is. There are three catagories: personne (person), lieu (place), and chose (thing). This children's game is very similar to Pictionary.

name: Space Ork Maintenance Crews!
description:
For every slavering ork wielding a kill-a-zap gun with a bowie knife duct taped underneath, there's another trying to remember which is the crescent wrench and which is the end wrench. No ork chieftain wants to be in charge of this lot, so the bosses strive against each other to assign more competent crews to more important jobs in the hopes of getting transferred back to the combat arm.

In this tactical card game players try to win points by playing better orks to the higher value assignments, while watching out for a couple kinds of back-stabbing. This game lies between the dice game Catego and the card game Schotten-Totten, but with space orks!.

(From the introduction.)

name: Cameroon
description: This is a promotional game from Northwest Orient Airlines that his very much like Yahtzee. The player has three attempts to roll ten dice. On each attempt they may choose to keep as many dice as they like and only re-roll the rest. Scoring is done by checking to see where your best poker hand lies. A player loses a certain amount of points depending on which poker hands they were not able to get after five rounds. The person with the score closest to zero wins.

name: Atacar es Vencer!
description:
Fields of Battle scenario-campaign set during the Spanish Civil War. The scenarios cover the drive on Madrid early in the SCW. Fields of Battle may be used with other systems.

from the editor website
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Racers Ready
description:
Packaged in a giant whistle, Racers Ready presents players with 52 challenges divided into three categories: Time Challenges, Contests, and Races. Playing either as individuals or in teams, players compete in the various challenges – such as building a tower out of oat rings by using tweezers or catching a tennis ball with kitchen tongs – and whoever has the most points after five challenges wins.

A deluxe version of Racers Ready includes 12 additional challenges and an electronic timer. Racers Ready will debut April 2011.

name: Prime Suspect
description:
The game begins with each player selecting one of seven secret identities - each a character from the Cogno games and books. The object of the game is to collect five of six character cards that match your secret identity before your opponents collect their cards or can guess who you are.

In this game, players ask their opponents for certain numbers or number ranges to collect the cards they need - while trying to keep their identity hidden. Meanwhile, they keep an eye on what everyone else is requesting in hopes of zeroing in on their opponents.

name: Eddie Arcaro's Sweepstakes Game
description: This game, publisher unknown, is a horse racing game endorsed by Arcaro in 1954. It has 4 different racing games included - Round Robin - Win,Place,Show - Point Handicap - Rookie. Each is a dice game with different rules for how you win and includes different betting options.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: War Game: A Prototype for Peace
description: This is a 2-player card-driven war game, in that you play cards and use your pieces to remove your opponent's pieces from the territories on the board. When both players no longer have any cards left in their hands, the game is over. How many cards each player will use before they empty their hands, however, is entirely up to him or her. At the end of the game, it is the players who decide who are the winners, and who are the losers. There are opportunities for both competitive and cooperative play, and a single game can have phases where each is present. Table talk is encouraged, both during and after the game.

name: Monolith
description: This is a dice game; 27 white dice are stacked in a 3x3x3 cube (the building or monolith). Players take turns rolling their color die to remove white dice from the building. Once the building is gone the most removed earns the player a point. Then you roll the dice you removed; highest # gets you a point. Finally, the last phase you rebuild the building by each playing rolling their die and putting all the cubes that match onto the building. First one to put all their cubes back gets a point. You play multiple rounds until one person gets 5 points total.

name: Huckleberry Hound Out West Game
description:
Roll and move game from the 1950s. The aim of the game is to reach the court house observing penalty and advantage spaces along the way.

The six player tokens are Huckleberry Hound, Yogi Bear, Boo Boo, Lil' Tom Tom, Mr Jinks and Pixie & Dixie.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fiddlers End
description:
Fiddlers End is a roll and move game. Players win by either making their way around the board to the bus on square 90, or collecting three Home cards.

Players collect a card whenever they land on a Fiddlers End square. These can be taken from the pack or from an opponent. Cards are kept face down and only three may be held at any time.

However, there are also Police cards. If anyone obtains three of these they are automatically out of the game.

From the box: "Fiddlers End - a Game for All the Family - Fun on the Run"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star-Board!
description:
Star-Board! is a yacht racing game with a unique dual-layer board: the bottom paper layer has a square grid showing a constant wind direction, the top layer is clear plastic and shows islands, wind holes and the like. Players' ships and the goal buoys sit on the plastic layer. When the wind changes, the whole board rotates.

Movement is via actions: You have two actions, and can either perform two moves ("advances") or two rotations of your boat ("maneuvers"), or one of each.

Advanced variants include cards, dice for APs, bigger races, tweaks to the wind shifting rules, etc.

The game is US patent number 3871656.

name: It's Snoopy!
description:
This is a card game where the object is to collect the largest number of complete sets of Peanuts comic strips.

Each player starts with 2 cards. Each turn, the player will either draw a card or pick up a discarded card, then must either discard a different card, start a comic strip by laying down two of the matching color cards in front of them, or adding a card to one of their comic strips. All discarded cards are available for pickup, not just the top card.

Other players cannot play on one's comic strip, each player individually builds on their own. A player can have up to two comic strips of two cards each, but cannot start a third until one of the two has at least three cards.

When all of the draw pile and discarded cards have been picked up, any remaining cards in the player's hand that match one of their own strips is laid down. The largest number of complete strips wins the game.

An advanced variant is to collect the comic strips in the correct order, and only those in the correct order are counted at the end of the game. The correct order is not shown on the cards, but a solution card is included.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Aquaquest
description:
Aquaquest is situated in an imaginary world with a central mountain and six countries. Each player is leader of one of the countries. Each country has a large lake, two rivers that are shared with other countries and a sea.

There are two kinds of water tokens in the game: blue for clean water and brown for dirty water. The goal of each player is to get the water situation in the country right, which means there is no dirty water in the country and there are exactly six clean water tokens in the lake.

Water flows from the mountain to the sea. Also hovering clouds evaporate water or rain down water on the land, depending on weather conditions.

The game has three levels, increasing in complexity but also making the game less random.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Voting

name: Greeny Grasshopper's Card Game
description: In turn, players spin the spinner and may discard one card from his hand if it matches an object that the spinner points to. Only one card may be discarded at a time even though a player may have duplicates. If a player's spin lands on a "Bug" space, and the player can discard "Greeny Grasshopper" from his hand, he may take another turn. Upon landing on the spaces marked "Take 1 or Take 2", the player must draw the amount of cards from the discard pile, unless there are no cards in the discard pile at this time. The first player to get ride of all his cards, wins the game.

name: Winfall
description:
WINFALL is for anyone who has ever dreamed about what they would do if they won the lottery. The object of the game is to do things in order of how you would actually do them in real life (if you won the lottery) and end up with the highest net worth.

Pretend you just won TEN MILLION DOLLARS what would you do first? New car? New house? Take a vacation? Then what? Invest in stocks or business? It’s time to make some decisions and see if you can build an empire. Purchase cars, homes, stocks, businesses, toys, sports teams, give money to family members and take holidays. There are 3 prices for each product, you decide how much you want to invest and at the end of the game each category has a new value. The game ends whenever you like or when one player runs out of money. Each player then adds up the total amount spent in each category and the player with the highest net worth wins.

name: Face Off
description:
Abstract strategy game with the game board of woman's face.
Game involves moving pieces off the face and onto the outer squares. You can move Your piece 1 step to any direction including diagonally or leap-frog it over other game pieces to make huge advances towards your final destination.
Player who gets his pieces off the face first is the winner.

name: Your World: 5 Games About You and Your World
description:
Your World is a five-game compendium designed to help a child explore different aspects of their world. The games come in a boardbook format, with each two-page spread opening into a different game board. The games included are:

Who's Who? A Family Tree Game
In the House: A Room-By-Room Search Game
Uptown, Downtown: A Community Game of People and Places
All Around the World: A Game of Countries and Cultures
Space Race! A Space Exploration Game

Each of the five games are spin-and-move, and the rules of each require players to perform an action or answer a question on the topic when they land on certain spaces. The object of the game is to complete the circuit and reach the finish space before any other player.

name: The Talking, Feeling and Doing Divorce Card Game
description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Talking, Feeling & Doing Shyness Card Game
description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Talking, Feeling and Doing Anger Card Game
description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Talking, Feeling and Doing Good Behavior Card Game
description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Talking, Feeling & Doing Teasing Card Game
description:
These cards can be used with The Talking, Feeling, And Doing Game.
It contains 99 cards and follows the format of the original board game, focusing on specific problem or concerns of children. Like the original game, the card game is sure to help children communicate their feelings and develop insight into their problems.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Journey to Friendsville
description:
In this game players roll the die to take a trip from the Start space to the town of Friendsville. On the way they will win friends (round tokens) by answering questions. To object of the game is to reach Friendsville and have at least 4 friends.

Components:

Game board,
pawns,
die,
game cards,
round tokens

name: The Bully Free card game
description:
Based on The Bully Free Classroom by Allan L. Beane, Ph.D., this card game plays like Crazy Eights (players must match an element of the top card of the discard pile to play), so most kids will have some familiarity with the process. The cards are divided into four categories: What Would You Do If...,Self-Esteem Boosters, Ways to Stay Bully Free and Why Should You Do This?
Kids get rid of cards (and move closer to being out, or bully free) by offering reasonable suggestions and responses to questions. Meant to be played with adult supervision (a teacher, counselor, or youth worker familiar with anti-bullying themes).

name: Madeline Matching Game
description:
Specially designed for fun-lovers on the go! The Madeline Matching Game features artwork from the beloved Madeline books. Comes in a beautifully designed carry bag...Games to Go!

No reading required. Builds memory/matching and social skills.

Contents: Carry-along cloth drawstring bag, 36 tiles, rules for multiple games to play

--publisher

Play Four Games With This Set Of Illustrated Madeline Tiles: Madeline fans can now play the classic concentration game of memory match with a Madeline twist. Featuring illustrations from classic Madeline books, this set includes 36 high quality Madeline matching tiles and directions for four memory games including the traditional version, a cooperative version, a version for beginners and an imaginative story telling version.

name: I SPY Ready to Read Game
description:
Let’s get ready to read with I SPY! See the riddle on your game board and find the color highlighted object in the I SPY picture…children identify the word and the picture of the object to begin their learning-to-read journey. Punch out the tokens then play the game in reverse by finding the match and putting it back in the proper place in the riddle. Many fun activities included to help capture children’s focus and interest. Four ways to play.

Game-play has players read the riddle on their gameboard, find the objects the riddle refers to, and punch them out. The game can be played in reverse by reading the riddles, naming the objects, and placing them back into your board.

Contains 6 double-sided game boards, 24 double-sided tokens, rules for several ways to play. For ages 4 and up, 1-6 players.

name: Pack 1: Sylvania
description:
Extension for Killpower Ball
French Version

- 80 new powers with 79 new illustrations and a QUIDAULT Pascal Josselin Grange.
- Powers adapted to the rules in 2.1 or 2.0
- New powers to double the lifespan of the game
- Powers always original and never redundant: Create mountains, freeze your enemies, cancel the score, starting with the ball ....
- With the base game, you will have a total of 160 power and 43 680 possible combinations to create a random team (considering that eels powers and failing damage and increased protections that have the number of combinations to infinity) .
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Killpower Ball, Extension 1: Destin, Critiques et Fric
description:
Extension for Killpower Ball
French version

- Fate in the game with 100 possible cases.
- Reviews with more than 240 possible cases.
- 5 new races (clone, pygmy, Amazon, Dwarf, Zombie) with their special abilities.
- Rules on the master
- Money: A new way of managing his team with a risk of losing it if mismanagement of his bank account.
- The Rules 2.1
- Sell Sheet and team in 2.1

name: Squarbles
description:
Square Marbles

Players use a spring-loaded plastic "shooter" to launch their plastic Squarbles as close to the "target" Squarble as possible. After all shots have been made, each Squarble within a certain distance (the length of the plastic "shooter") score points.

name: Halloween Party
description: The game consists of 71 tiles. 56 sweets tiles and 16 monster tiles. The tiles are all put on the table face down. On each player´s turn he reveals one of the tiles on the table. If it is a sweets tile the player has two options. Either take the tile, put it in front of him and the next player takes his turn or continue revealing tiles unil he chooses o stop. He than colects all revealed tiles and the next player takes his turn. If at any time a reveald tile shows a monster the active payer´s turn ends and the next player collects al the revealed sweets tiles. Than that player starts his turn with revealing at least one tile. This continues until all 16 monster tiles have been reveald. The player with the most tiles win the game.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Waldemars Gartenspiel
description: The game consists of 72 tiles showing either plants, the sun or a watering can. Each player has his own "garden" (a small gameboard) in front of him. The players have to complete their garden with 4 sun tiles, 4 water tiles and 8 different plant tiles. They colect tiles from the middle of the table with a special die. The first player to complete his garden wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Let's communicate!
description: This is a party game similar to Activity. There are hundreds of words or phrases players have to find out. The active player has to discribe, draw or "explain in pantomime" and the others have to find out what he is discribing. Since this is a game by "Deutsche Telecom" all the words have to do with communication.

name: Dallas
description:
This game collection comes in an gatefold sleeve like for vinyl records. It contains 3 games:

1.) Dallas-Dominoe: a standard domino game but instead of numbers the two sides of the tiles have the portraits of some Dallas characters.

2.) Dallas-Memo: a standard memory game with pairs of portraits of some Dallas characters.

3.) Dallas-Bluff: the 32 cards are dealt between the players. The first player puts one of his cards face down on the table in front of him and says wich of the Ewings that is. The next player either believes him and puts a different Ewing card face down in front of him or he doesn´t believe him and says so. If he was right the player that lied about his card receives a card from each player. If he was wrong he gets the cards himself. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

All cards for the games have portrait pictures of the main characters of the the TV-series "Dallas".
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mach was draus!
description:
This game is about recycling the different types of waste like glass, paper or plastic. It shows the ways of the waste through the recycling process.
The players buy goods in a supermarket or collect it "on the street" wile moving their pawn (a nice truck you night know from "Auf Achse") and than have to recycle the waste. On the game board their are different places where players have to dispose their waste but each of the recycling centers takes only one kind of waste. The more waste of the same type is disposed at once the more points the players receive.

name: Milky Way Sternenwelt-Spiel
description: Milky Way is a simple roll and move game with the Milky Way theme. Players move around the board and collect Milky cards whenever they land on one of the special fields.

name: Panic Post
description:
Panic Post - A Rollicking Party Game With No Upper Age Limit!

Panic Post is a party game originally dating from the 1930s. Six small postboxes are placed in various locations around the playing space and six sets of cards corresponding to these postboxes are then mixed together face down. Players take one card each and when play begins they rush to deliver it to the correct box. When one card is delivered players come back for another. This continues until the time is up, whereupon points are scored for correctly delivered cards. The winner is the one with the most points at the end of a prearranged number of rounds.

The game can also be played over a wider play area, even incorporating indoor/outdoor locations for the postboxes.
publishers: Heritage Toy & Game Co. Ltd., Russimco Games

name: Big Game Hunt
description:
Object: To follow the animal tracks and capture the wild animal before the other players can reach it.

Before Playing: One player lays out the trail by placing footprint cards and the round stop/go cards at spaced intervals to form a trail that will eventually lead to the Big Game (the wild animal card). The trail can be set up inside or outside and even have trails that branch off with ones leading to dead ends.

To Play: The person who spun and drew the lowest number gun goes first. They spin the spinner and move their gun the number of spaces as indicated along the animal tracks. When a hunter reaches a stop or go card they follow what is printed on the card. The first hunter to follow the correct path and find an animal card gets to keep it and lay out a new trail with another animal (or use the same trail if desired)

name: Pocahontas Card game
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first player to make two differents complete scenes. Each scene is made up of 4 cards, which all have a dot of the same colour. To complete the scene, all you need to do is collect the 4 cards with the same colour dots.

Contents:
- 40 picture cards showing 5 different scenes (each scene, repeated twice, is made up of 4 cards with the same colour dots).
- 10 character cards as follow:
5 Governor John Ratcliffe
1 Pocahontas
1 Capitain John Smith
1 Chief Powathan
1 Grandmother Willow
1 Meeko

Play a Governor Ratcliffe card allows to destroy an opponent scene , but if it is protected by any other character cards, the scene is safe (the two character cards are discard however).

Rules in 5 languages, italian, english, german spanish and french.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Lollipop Tree
description:
A 'Pop-o-Matic' fun game for younger children.

The Lollipop Tree is a roll-and-move children's game where the aim is to be the first player to get a lollipop token to the top of a tree playing board and back down again. Movement of the tokens is determined by a Pop-o-Matic die which has three sides marked with solid colours - red, yellow and green, and three sides marked with split colours - yellow/red, green/yellow and red/green. These colours correspond to coloured spaces on the playing boards. Rolling a solid colour allows vertical movement and a split colour denotes a horizontal move.

name: Making Change
description:
Players buy and sell items from stores to practice making change and counting up. Play simulates money transactions between customers and store owners.

Each player gets their own store based on the side of the board on which they are sitting. Each player is also given money and 8 chips at the start of the game.

On their turn, the player uses the spinner to determine which store they will shop in. If it lands on their own store, they choose any other store to shop in. The player then purchases an item out of the designated store using their money. The owner of the store counts back change from their money supply. After the transaction is complete, a chip is placed over the item to indicate that it is no longer available for purchase.

The game ends using a method determined before the game, such as using a time limit, using a certain number of turns, or selling a set number of items.

name: Silben lesen
description:
The game consists of syllable cards. Each player has a face-down stack of cards in front of him/her. The players take turns flipping open a card and placing it in the middle of the table. A player who notices that a word can be formed out of the open syllables shouts out the word and can keep the involved cards. At the end of the game, the player with most cards is the winner.

A second variant of the game lets players flip open two cards (all of which are face-down on the table at the start of the game), check for complete words, then hide one of the cards, so memory becomes a factor.

Finally, the game contains letter cards. One player thinks of a word, shuffles the letter cards and lets the other players find out the original word. The first player to do so gets a point.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Dreierlei
description:
The game consists of subject, verb and object cards, depicted as images. Each player flips open two cards, then all players check whether a meaningful sentence (SVO) can be formed. The first player to point to the cards involved can keep them. At the end of the game, the player with most cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Adventure of Jack Sparrow and Barbossa: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the film "Pirates of the Caribbean." In this game, Jack Sparrow and Barbossa are trying to get the Gold Medal first.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- player tokens
- Gold Medal token
- cards
- game board showing routes to the Gold Medal

Players take turns drawing cards and moving their ships on the map. Players can sail closer to the Gold Medal or be damaged by bombs or even blown backwards.

The person who gets the Gold Medal first wins.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates, Print & Play

name: HOME ALONe: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the film "Home Alone." In this game, Kevin tries to beat the thieves with some traps, and the thieves try to arrive at Kevin's home.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- trap tokens
- life points
- thief tokens
- game board showing a map of Kevin's home and neighborhood

In this game, Kevin sets moveable traps on the board and the thieves start from the edge of the map. The players take turns rolling a 6 sided dice and, if Kevin, moving the traps, or, if the thieves, trying to avoid the traps while moving closer to Kevin's home. The thieves take damage for each trap they hit.

If the thieves’ power becomes zero, Kevin wins. If the thieves arrive at Kevin’s house before their power becomes zero, the thieves win.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tonari no Totoro: The Print and Play Game
description:
This game is based on the film "Tonari no Totoro," specifically the scene in which Mei lost her way. Players play as Satsuki and Kanta and need to catch Mei and bring her back home.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
- movement cards
- player and Mei tokens
- board with hexagonal spaces

In each round, a 6 sided dice is rolled to determine the movement of Mei. Then, the players take turns rolling the dice and choosing appropriate movement cards. The players take turns playing movement cards to move their character on the board.

The game ends when one player finds Mei.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Goblin Factory
description:
This game is currently seeking publishers.

Goblin Factory is a cooperative tile-laying puzzle game for 1-6 players that can be played in less than ten minutes. Players take on the role of industrious goblins. A Challenge card drawn from the Challenge card deck determines what sort of machine the players must build.

Players take turns drawing two tiles from a community pile and adding one card to the machine. The other tile is discarded. This represents parts coming down a conveyor belt faster than can be grabbed and bolted/welded/hammered onto the machine. Parts are added by matching color-coded shapes on the edges of the tiles. The players must work together in this fast-paced game to beat the clock.

Most challenges are only three minutes long. A single game can take less than five minutes to set up, shuffle, and play! There are also rules and challenges for competitive play.

name: Riddle Master
description:
This is a reading comprehension game that uses a labyrinth adventure theme. The children are deep inside a network of underground caves and must answer the questions presented by the Riddle Master to reach the surface.

The questions are light riddles based on information presented on the cards. Some spaces offer secret tunnels that allow clever players to move faster. The first kid to reach the surface is declared the winner.

This educational game is designed for 2 to 6 players. The Blue Level edition is for older children in 4th or 5th grade and the Red Level edition is for children in the 2nd or 3rd grade.

Includes a colorful board, 6 pawns, a timer, 125 cards, answer key, spinner, and rules.

name: Merkmal
description:
This educational game is supposed to train auditive perception and consists of two equal sets of cards, each showing three or four pictures. One set of cards is spread out openly on the table, the other one is stacked face-down. One player picks up the top card and says what's on it. The first player to touch the matching card on the table keeps it.

The game is produced in three incarnations called "Merkmal", "Merkwürdig" and "Merkbar". "Merkbar" has different colors as an additional distinguishing feature.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Fighter Pilot
description:
Fighter Pilot is a children's game. A plane in the centre of the game spins around while smaller target planes pop up around the outside. The goal of the game is fly the central plane into the targets and knock them down. The game has a joystick to control the central plane's altitude, and a throttle to keep the plane moving. The game works by way of an elastic band underneath which is connected to all the components.

From the box: "All Action Flip Out Flying Game - Dive - Pull Up - You're at the Controls - Knock the Planes Out of the Sky."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game

name: Frame-Up!
description:
Frame-Up! is a card game dating from the 1950s for two to four players which uses the principle of 'three-in-a-row', but on a larger scale.

In the basic game, each player has a 3x3 'frame' board on which they lay yellow, blue or red cards depicting 'O' or 'X', and points are scored points for making rows of three. Red cards are worth the most points. Some of the cards have black corner markings which alter the points value. When all cards are laid, the boards are scored, with points available for each horizontal, vertical and diagonal line.

There are also rules supplied for an advanced version of the game.

name: Alice in Wonderland Game
description: Players take turns spinning the spinner and move according to the direction on the outer ring. As soon as a player has passed a space which says the small circle may be used, a player can announce which ring of the spinner they will use prior to spinning. The outer ring is slower and safer, the inner ring is faster - if you are lucky. There are special spaces on the board that you follow the instructions when you land on them. First player to reach the finish space wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Mercury Boulevard
description: From the rules: The idea of the game is to get out of town. To do so you must reach either the Hampton Roads Tunnel, the James River Bridge, or the Williamsburg Pottery Company. However, before arriving at one of these exits, the player must visit a landmark within the town. Landmarks to visit are designated at the start of the game by a card drawn by each player from the deck on the All America Game Symbol. The game starts at Fort Monroe. Players roll one die and move their markers along Mercury Boulevard the number of squares indicated. Two to eight players may play the game.

name: BOZ's BIG World Adventure Game
description:
Based on the Christian preschool DVD series "BOZ the Green Bear Next Door"

Object: Be the first to make it around the world and back to BOZ's treehouse by completing challenges along the way.

1. The first player draws a card and completes one of the following Adventure Card challenges:

Counting (Red): Look at the picture on a RED card. Is it a nose? Count the noses in the room.

Charades (Blue): Use your imagination to act out what you see on a BLUE card.

I Spy (Yellow): Colors and shapes are everywhere! Can you spy the color or shape you see on a YELLOW card?

Thank You, God (Orange): When you draw an ORANGE card, tell God something you're thankful for.

Go (Green): Find the matching picture on the game path and move to that square when you draw a GREEN card.

2. After you complete the challenge on your turn, move to the next square that matches the color on your card. If you draw a green card, immediately move forward or backward on the game path to the green square with the matching picture.

3. Play continues to the left until someone reaches the striped square at BOZ's treehouse and wins.

name: Kinyama's
description: Kinyama's is a roll and move game with collectible player figures (Kinyama’s figurines). It was created as an advertisement for a Luxembourgian supermarket. You have to be the first player to reach the end of the circuit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kipper's Pick-up Pairs
description:
A children's board game based on the books by Mick Inkpen.

Flip cards over to make simple matches and collect tokens that represent Kipper's favorite toys. If your card makes a match on the starter board, take a token and put it in your basket. The first player to fill their basket with Kipper's 12 toys is the winner.

name: Erste Hilfe
description:
Educational game about first aid.

In their turn, the players select a card from her hand. On the front it is a question and three possible response alternatives (A, B, C). The player chooses the supposedly correct answer.
If the answer is wrong the player, the card remains on the card hand and the player loses the stated amount of points. He must miss a turn if necessary.

After a pre-agreed number of rounds the points of the players are compared. Who could collect the most points is the winner. Alternatively, can be played without points. In this case, the end is simply the number of discarded cards of players compared.

Game has electronic pen for choosing answers.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Electronic, Medical, Trivia

name: TEXsTORY
description: TEXsTORY is a word game of improvisation. Mimic, sing, whistle or tell a story are the ingredients of this entertaining game. First, by drawing of 3, 4 or 5 letters, try to ask each turn all of his chips by forming a word. The word must be placed hidden from other players by placing the letters upside down on the table. Then in a second time by drawing card option: it will discover its hidden word, the other players by mimicking or imitating 3 clues or telling a "Story" improvised story or singing or whistling a improvisation. Put the word will be validated if another player guesses the hidden word.

name: Handel Ehrlekh
description: Jewish-themed Monoply Clone with an educational message aimed at teaching Torah values to kids.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rally Ho!
description:
Trivia games about RV (Recreational vehicle) lifestyle.
Rally Ho! challenges participants to correctly answer trivia questions and rewards the correct answer with the right to roll the dice and move their RV forward!
Trivia questions are grouped in 4 categories; RV Travel, The RV Lifestyle, The Great Outdoors, and American Nostalgia.
The more knowledge they have about America, travel and the RV lifestyle, the faster they'll reach the rally site and win!

Components:

game board,
360 question cards in 4 categories,
36 Road Hazard cards,
20 Road Rescue cards,
4 mini RVs,
1 timer,
2 dice

name: Vendetta
description:
Vendetta is a chess variant for four players. The game is not very original - very similar games like 4 handed chess exist already since a long time.

Vendetta is played on a cross shaped board: attached to each of the four sides of a standard 8x8 chess board there are four 4x8 parts.
The final board has a 192 squares, differently from most 4-way chess sets which have only 160 squares, as the additional parts of the board are only 3x8.

Here, queens start the game always on black squares. The rules suggest to play in two teams of two, or each player for itself, but do not mention what the conditions to win are.

The pieces, colored white, black, blue and red are hollow and should be filled with sand.
On the reverse side of the board, a normal chess board is printed.

The box tells that
The game is copyrighted by J. Deak, Ewing, N.J. 08638, U.S.A. U.S.A. patent No: 4,778,187. 1986

Made in Holland. Marketed By: Bonne Nuit, Inc. 743 Alexander Road Princeton, N.J. 08540 U.S.A. Tele: 609-987-1269, Fax: 609-520-1350.

Also distributed in tube format - first edition 1987

name: Geometra
description: A satirical science fiction card game created for the February Design contest; the game revolves around creating positive feedback loops formed out of individual cards, each of which must connect to the previous card. There are three 'suits' that the cards convert between, and three possible values. Players use pawns to perform various actions over the course of a turn, and can either work cooperatively by building card systems jointly or competitively by taking over systems. Thematically, players take the roles of members of the Society of Learned, Orderly, and Beneficent Beings, a society of aliens devoted to bringing about cosmic unity as they attempt to harmonize a planet with three species locked in warfare.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Searchquest for Kids
description: Kids love looking for things - and SearchQuest For Kids will have them searching, scribbling, and shouting for more. Everyone gets their own game card for the round, which has three words hidden inside a Letter Grid. The hidden words may be animals, types of food, verbs, objects, or any other everyday words. With the help of tracing paper and a pencil, kids race to become the first to find the hidden words. At the end of the round, they flip the cards over to check their answers. The more words they find, the more spaces they move on the board. There's no waiting around to join the fun, since everyone plays every round. Kids can play against adults,or even on their own.

name: Freu' dich nicht zu fr√ºh
description:
Don’t halloo till you’re out of the wood!

Goal. Be the first, moving all of your five meeples from 'start' to 'target' by crossing four turnable wheels.

The player's action: Move one of your meeples backwards or forwards after rolling the die with by '1 -5'; make up your mind out of three possibilities with a roll of '6':
1. Move one of your meeples
2. Turn one of the four wheels to open/shorten your route
to the target
3. Turn one of the four wheels to block your opponent(s)

Your meeples are safe within weel 1 to 3, can be knocked down passing the fourth (final) wheel.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tom & Jerry's Trap Game
description: Tom & Jerry's Trap Game is a very basic game published on the back of a Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal box. The board is a spiral of 16 squares which leads towards a mouse trap at the centre. Card tokens depicting Tom, Jerry, Spike (the bulldog) and the housekeeper must be played as the game progresses and the winner is the first to use up all their cards.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Snap, Crackle and Pop Look at Nature
description: "Play this Springtime Wildlife Spotting Game". This is a simple roll-and-move game printed on the back of a Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal box. The game has a nature theme and involves players attempting to spot animals from the British countryside. Players move around the board and follow the instructions printed on certain squares. Some squares allow players to make a sighting of an animal, and the player who spots the most animals wins the game.

name: Second Course
description:
Expansion of the game "Food Lover's Trivia"
additional game card packs! 600 new all-food questions in each course!

name: Team
description:
subtitle: 'a game for parents and their children'

Goal: Be the first to reach the target with your 3 meeples

A roll-and-move game where players are trying to reach the end of the game with their tokens. Players may take shortcuts on marked areas by looking for partners to 'bridge' the distance; the more you cooperate the higher the chance to win, as those who don't cooperate to cross areas must complete the full-path of the game.

Team is 'Snakes and Ladders' without snakes, but you may use ladders only if you allow someone else to use this shortcut, too.

Cooperative version: Collect additional chips for every cooperative action you are involved in; use those chips as a multiplier for your winning points according final ranking.

name: W√ºrfeljoker
description:
Goal: Score most by accomplishing given dice combinations.
Combinations e.g. are:
easy => just a '6'; '1' '2' and '3'; .... up to 'parade' '1' up to '6'(very difficult).

Game 1:
Roll three dice and accomplish step by step the given combinations. If you can't use a die's number you are not allowed to use this die further more during your turn.You may choose to take a higher risk for the most valuable combinations/scoring - but if you fail you are going to loose your whole turn; three jokers can be used/added as multipliers, but only by increasing your risk.

Game 2:
Flip the tiles you are using to build up dice combinations over and try to be the first to strike the numbers

name: All About Football
description: Officially licensed by the National Football League, All About Football is a trivia game consisting of a deck of 50 cards with 5 questions per card, 1 question each from 5 different categories. Once a player correctly answers a question from the first category, they get that card and advance to the second category. After collecting 5 cards (one for each category), a player must answer a question from whatever category the opponent chooses in order to win. There are multiple decks available, each centering on a different team.

name: Crazy Clown
description:
A simple dexterity game for children, in which the object is to add clowns to a shared "clown tower"; if a player, on their turn, causes a clown to fall off or causes the tower to fall over, they're out of the game. Players can either be responsible for one (or more) colors and add clowns one at a time, or roll a die and add that many clowns of any color to the tower.

Similar to Stacrobats but with some slight variation of game play.

name: Taktiko
description:
From the back of the box:

Tactico is an exciting game for two players. The progress of the game depends entirely on the skill and strategy of each player.

Equipment:
There are thirty-two white chips used in the game. These are marked with four different shapes (square, circle, diamond, triangle) in four different colors (red, blue, yellow and green). Thus in each color set there are two chips showing squares, two showing circles, etc. The board shows a target area for each player (nine circles either red or orange, numbered 1-9) and a number of grey circles to give freedom for the chips to be moved. Each circle is joined to other circles by horizontal, vertical and diagonal lines.

Object of the game:
Each player tries to be the first to have nine chips arranged on his target area so that in the three horizontal and the three vertical lines or columns of the target area no two chips carry the same color or shape. As soon as the player has his chips arranged in this way he wins the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Deutschland deine Schwaben
description:
Goal: Collecting all of those 8 remarkable qualities of a typical Swabian citizen - but none of them twice or more

According to the eponymous book of the literary man 'Thaddäus Troll' you are deeply overwhelmed by the typical Swabian qualities like thriftiness, tidiness, sobriety, acquisitiveness, cleverness, agility, slyness, scorching criticism.

Collecting event-cards by rolling and moving (on a circle on the board) you are able to learn these qualities by studying their broad dialect, being confronted with -- sometimes weird -- subtle humour. If you picked up too many of those qualities, -- which is going to happen -- you may get rid of them transferring those to your opponents who can't use them, too.
These deals may increase the trouble -- until the lucky one scores.
It is recommended to consume a small portion of red wine during the game, called 'Viertele'; thus you may avoid loosing even your remaining 'confidence in mankind'
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Jungdeutschlands Schlachtenspiel
description:
Goal: Defeat your opponent by eliminating all of his/her troops

1. Create a terrain (with buildings - houses, church, castle, trees, creeks, rivers, lakes, swamp, barbed-wire obstacle, streets, bridges...)
2. Place your units (as agreed between the players) onto the map
3. Start manoeuvering your troops by turns ('Halma'-like, but also backwards)

From Friedrich Helfferich in Fire & Movement #48:


"The original game, published in the late 1920s [sic], came with a set-up book for eight or ten battles of the 1813 German War of Liberation. This was soon followed by set-ups for the battles of the 1814 and 1815 campaigns against Napoleon, the Wars of 1864 and 1866, the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-71, and finally some of the mobile battles of World War I (Tannenburg, Isonzo, Rumania, etc.)."

name: Man Hunt
description:
Man Hunt is an exciting and fast-paced game where you and your friends become a crack squad of Federal Marshalls charged with bringing in the world’s most wanted! You can play with your friends, against your friends, or even by yourself. It is fun to play and easy to learn.

Features


Fast play time (5 minutes - 1 hour).
Easy rules.
Solo and multiplayer support.
Three different game modes: solo, cooperative, and team play.
A TON of replay value.


Each player takes turns flipping up the top card of the Man Hunt deck hoping to find a suspect that is on the Most Wanted List.

When they do, the entire team rolls to try to catch them. If they succeed, they get sent to the jail house. But in order to convict them you'll need evidence and the only way you'll find evidence is if you stake out their hide out. Only then will you be able to collect their reward and get one step closer to victory!

But beware, if they get out of jail scott free, they claim their reward, and might commit another crime such as murdering an innocent and if you don't have any innocents on the board, the game is over and the criminals win.

So compete against your friends and the bad guys (or just against the bad guys) to try to see who can acquire the most cash!

Some Assembly required, suitable for ages 8+

Also available at: http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/man-hunt

name: Cheat the Reaper
description:
From publisher's description:
"We all have to knock on Deaths door, but eventually he will catch you. In this game you and your opponents will attempt to CHEAT THE REAPER, and live to tell about it.

You and your friends will attempt to meet or exceed the current number in play until one of you cannot. That person must take their life in their hands and knock on Deaths door. Maybe he'll catch you, maybe he wont. You wont know until you draw your card from the REAPER DECK and find out.

THRILLS, CHILLS, AND STRATEGY.

CHEAT THE REAPER is about strategy, as much as it is about fun. Lowering the number lowers the number of cards your opponent has, but raising the number increases his hand size and ability to compete with you. Do you pass to the next person in line or skip them all together? Careful what you choose, because it may come back to haunt you...or claim your life.

DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO CHEAT THE REAPER?"

The immediate goal is to reach or exceed the active number (starts at 0, adds numbers played on top, or subtracts negative numbers) and try to keep your neighbor from doing the same. Use
action cards to avoid being caught unable meet the active number. If a player cannot meet or exceed the active number, they draw from the "Reaper Deck", which could eliminate them from the game, or reset their hand. Once all but one player has been eliminated, the game ends.

name: Global Futures Game
description:
The Global Futures Game is a simulation intended for classroom use at the high school or college level. The players are divided into eight teams representing various regions of the world. The game is played over nine rounds, each consisting of a ten-minute negotiation session and a five-minute calculation session.

Each region starts with different levels of population, food production, and technology. Small amounts of population can be sent to other regions with their consent. Food and technology can be given to or traded with other regions, and can also be traded off inside each region. Investment can be made in education, which provides delayed benefits (two turns - 10 years - later).

The object is to keep your region fed and with a reasonable level of technology, and ideally to achieve zero population growth, all while avoiding world destruction points.

name: Expedition Europe, Asia & Oceania
description:
This card game is designed to help players learn facts about the features, history, people, countries, and capitals in Europe, Asia, and Oceania. The game includes 100 cards divided into 5 separate subdecks: Western Europe, Russia and Eastern Europe, Middle East, Far East, and South Pacific and Australia.

Each round of the game is played with one subdeck. Each card features a question, the answer to the matching card, a map of the country, and an illustration accompanying a fact about that country. Players take turns asking each other for cards that answer questions on the cards in their hand. When they ask for a card with an answer that correct answers their question, the pictures on the two cards will match. The object of the game is to have the most card matches when play is over.

name: Yaleopoly
description:
This is a Monopoly variation featuring Yale campus and area businesses.

From the box: Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's list and collect a $200 scholarship.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: I SPY Link-Alikes
description:
Match "alike" I Spy objects and numbers. Great for fun on the run...Games to Go!

Contents: 24 double-sided Link-Alike dominos

Objective: Use up all your dominos by linking them to dominos with matching objects or numbers.

There are three different game plays: 1) Link-Alikes; 2) Square-Alikes; 3) Bingo-Alikes.

Matches are not all the same exact image, but are of the same object category. Images do have an associated word that is the same to assure the match is appropriate.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Tee-Off Championship Golf
description:
Tee-Off Championship Golf is a game from the 1970s. Players simulate an 18 hole round of golf on a double sided board. This is accomplised by rolling dice to determine how far a player's shot travels, with cards being played to modify the outcome.

From the box: "Tee-Off - Championship Golf - The Great Board Game. Tee-Off reproduces the tactical thinking and thrills of championship golf. What scores will you achieve in this exciting, skilful and totally absorbing game, can you shoot a course record? 9 different types of golf game can be played. As in the real game it takes both luck and skill to shoot the best scores."

name: Convers     Spiel-Stadt-Strategie
description:
Goal: Become the mayor of a new city.

Rebuild ('convert') an old military area near Potsdam to a new town district with all infrastructure needed. Invest your money into different projects like area development, construction projects, parks ...

Start with a zoning map, but be active within common tasks, too; your different activities should be driven by yield and votes 'values'. Combined with the (luck) element 'die' it's just an 'in time investment', when evaluation takes place. You may build alliances, which can reduce the influence of luck.

How to play:
Everything is driven by the die; if you roll a:
1 - you possess parts of a park or get a zoning map
2 - everyone earns money (yield from all of your investments)
3 - draw and execute an 'action'card
4 - draw a 'chance'-card
5 - everyone earns money (yield from the housebuilding)
6 - everyone earns money (yield from commercial buildings)
The money you earn should be reinvested to increase your income

name: Dizzy Dice:  Ludo / Race & Chase
description: Dizzy Dice is a children's game. The board is double sided - one side is a ludo game with standard ludo rules, and the other side is a straightforward roll-and-move game which is a race around the board, the winner being the first to cross all the bridges. The thing that the game is most remembered for is its Dizzy Dice character used to roll the dice. This is a transparent red plastic cube with legs and pressing down on the top of its head causes two dice inside to bounce around. One dice is a standard 1-6 and the other has coloured spots.

name: Nguyen Hue: The Communist 1972 Spring Offensive in South Vietnam
description:
Nguyen Hue is a play-by-mail wargame for two players. A map is provided on which players indicate their positions by either writing on a plastic overlay or sticking in pins. On each of the twelve game turns, the Communist player sends in orders which are executed, with the results then sent to the Allied player, who then sends in his or her orders. Each game turn represents one week.

The game is of moderate complexity, with rules for attritional vs. direct combat, multiple ways of moving Allied troops around, etc. It is possible to win via a political, morale, or territorial victory.

While the game is designed to be played by mail, this is just to facilitate limited knowledge of opposing unit positions, so it could be played face-to-face with suitable double-blind movement rules.

name: Bushi no Yume
description:
From the back of the book:

Welcome to the land of the samurai and ninja. Contained within this makimono (scroll) is all the ancient teachings and waza (techniques) of the legendary warriors of old, enabling you to perform like them. Follow the patch of Bushi (samurai), the Ronin the Oni (devils) or even the Kusa (ninja).

Well OK not quite. But what you will find within the covers of this fast play set of skirmish rules is everything you need to play out the historical, theatrical and even the fantastical action of fact and fictional Japan. Build your Tomozei (retinue) from a wide range of characters, all with different abilities and weapon skills. Fight for your honour, Giri (duty), money or just for the pure ‘fun of it’. Sample scenarios lead onto the simple advancement and campaign ideas. You may see your Tomozei fighting for control of the neighboring fief or even seeking to become the next SHOGUN.

Optional weapon detail, Ki Points and Karma Cards add even more fun to your games.

The game can be played using any figures from your collection in any scale. A standard game in 28mm uses a 3’-4’ square table and is over in about 50 minutes.

name: 2000 Miles to Paradise
description:
2000 Miles to Paradise is a fast paced game of auto combat. Players take on the role of scavengers trying to survive in a savage wasteland, filled only with road, sand and danger. Each has heard rumors that there is a paradise, and it’s about 2000 miles away. To get there, the player will have to face many battles, and manage their resources well enough to reach their goal. 2000 Miles to Paradise is not meant to simulate real-world physics, rather it mimics the fast paced and frantic combat found in movies like Mad Max.

Vehicle customization and combat have been streamlined for fast play, yet allow players to be creative. Players start by selecting a vehicle type, then spend salvage points on various modifications. The players then assign bonus dice to sections of the vehicle to tune the attributes of their vehicle.

The game is then played in a series of duels, with each player fighting to drive 2000 miles to reach the rumored paradise. Each duel won gets the driver 200 miles closer, as well as gas, ammo and salvage to upgrade their car. If the scavenger loses a duel though, it's all over. Do you have what it takes to reach paradise?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: This Way to Jobs
description:
This is a politically motivated game for 2-6 to reinforce the ideas for job creation; it is based on promoting business and through tax breaks and other incentives will be created, while tax increases or regulatory actions will erode job growth.

You move around the board based on a spinner and board spaces and cards provide answers to the above from the perspective of the US Chamber of Commerce.

name: Block Balancing Games
description:
Instructions for 10 games designed to inspire action and lots of laughter are included in this box. The 20 colorful blocks (of varying silly shapes) are used for matching, stacking, memory, and relay racing games that will get kids up and moving. Sample games include:

Tower Transport (players build towers of blocks - winner is the first to race to the blocks, build the tower, and return across the finish line with an intact tower).

Blocked Memory (players attempt to build the tallest tower using blocks won by matching block cards by color).

Contents:
20 colorful blocks
20 block cards
4 discs

name: Arctic Hunting
description:
In Arctic circle, a seal cuts 12 breathing holes in the ice in 2 square kilometer region. Polar bear needs to choose one from the 12 holes and wait for hours to days for his prey to rise. Once he misses the chance, he might not survive the winter.
"Arctic Hunting" is a party and family card game for 1-8 players. 1-2 people play the roles of Polar Bear or/and Eskimos who become the hunter. Other people play the roles of Seals, Walrus, or/and Beluga Whale who become the prey.

Each player receive a deck of 12 cards. There are 5 turns in a game and 3 phases in one turn. Each player receive 3-6 cards according to their roles. Hunters and Preys play one card simutaneously. If the prey and the hunter play the same number, the hunter eats the prey. If there is a difference between their cards from 1-3, the hunter can discard 1-3 cards to pursuit the prey. On the same time, the prey can discard 1 card to escape.

Once the hunters kill 2(4) preys or 2(4) prey discard all of their hand cards before the last turn in 4(8) players game, hunters win the game. If not, the preys win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Klaus die Maus entdeckt den Bauernhof
description:
In Klaus die Maus entdeckt den Bauernhof, players visit a farm to see cows grazing on grass, a farmer harvesting apples, and so on. The problem is that to see these happenings they must first assemble small puzzles.

The game includes sets of tiles that are divided into different groups. A player uses his memory to find tiles to complete a 2x2 image within a particular group, and once he completes that farm scene, he receives a reward marker and moves to the next station at the farm. The player who collects the most reward markers will receive a tractor ride in the country. A mental tractor ride, mind you...

name: Revlon's $64,000 Question Junior Quiz-Game
description:
One player acts as quizmaster for up to four other players. To begin a turn, a player activates the spinner to generate a random category and question. If the player can answer the question correctly then that player scores and gets another turn. if the player fails to give the correct answer then the other players are given a chance to answer.

The first to get ten answers has answered the $64,000 question correctly to win the game.

The game only contains ninety six questions so it has limited play value.

name: Venture Vietnam
description: A boardgame where players travel round a map of Vietnam visiting sights. Players start with 6 randomly dealt sight cards and 1 million dong. They need to locate their sights then calculate how to travel to all of them. They may travel by car (10,000 dong per step), boat (50,000 dong) or plane (100,000 dong per step). Once they arrive at the sight they need to answer a question about Vietnamese culture, history or general knowledge (many questions are multi choice). If they answer correctly they move on to the next sight. If they throw a 1 they pick up a chance card, which may add a random element by sending them to other parts of the board (eg to Nha Trang to go snorkelling, to the nearest hospital for treatment of a monkey bite). The aim of the game is to be the first to travel round all 6 sights without running out of money. In the process players learn the geography and other interesting information about Vietnam. The board is colourful with photos and counters are china figurines of Vietnamese folk.

name: The Royal Geographical Pastime or the Complete Tour of Europe
description:
A board game using a map of Europe with a city-to-city path of spaces from Dover (#1) to London (#103).
Players roll an 8-sided teetotum (because dice were heavily taxed at the time) and move along the path. Each space is a city in Europe, with a description given on the edge of the board. Some spaces have a favourable or unfavourable penalty (miss a turn, advance, go back etc).
e.g.
"63. Florence - The capital of Tuscany, the residence of the Grand duke.
64. Rome. the Traveller, who is supposed to have indiscreetly kissed the Pope's toe, must be banished to Bergen, in Norway (No.11) and miss four turns."
To win a layer must land exactly on London. If he overthrows, he returns to Paris. (#86) and tries again.
Like the traditional Game of goose, there is a prison space (Algiers #68) and a death space (Scilly #89).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wallis's complete Voyage Round the World: a new geographical pastime
description:
A double hemisphere map of the world overlaid with a point-to-point track. Players start at Portsmouth (#1) and roll an eight-sided teetotum (dice were heavily taxed in Britain at the time) to move along the track, trying to get to London (#100).
Each space has a description to help the player learn about the place he is visiting, and some have favourable or unfavourable effects.
e.g. #62. Hudson's Bay - the English have several forts. Stay one turn and trade with the natives for beaver and other rich skins and fur."
Like the Game of Goose, there is a 'death' space (Magellan Straights #89) where "the traveller is shipwrecked and loses his chance of the game".
The game was published until at least 1802.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: It's a Green Life
description:
The point of the game is to race from a recycling center to a green planet Earth. A player advances through the 52 spaces on the board (which represent the 52 weeks in a year that people can follow environmentally friendly practices) by drawing cards that either reward them for being environmentally responsible or correct them for making mistakes. The reward and correction cards include tips about different environmentally friendly practices and they list the number of spaces a player will advance or move backwards.

Components:

game board,
4 pawns,
52 cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Racing

name: Let's Save Our Earth
description:
Let's Save Our Earth is an educational non-competitive board game which has been created to teach children and adults alike, simple things they can do to make a difference in helping the earth.

Let's Save Our Earth has a clever game scheme and a cast of characters known as the Eco-Angels and the Schmutzies. Players select their favorite tokens and spin to proceed. The object of the game is to move from start to finish, collecting trees along the way. Trees are awarded for answering questions correctly and when landing on certain spaces that result in drawing from a stack of cards. However, landing on Schmutzie spaces or answering incorrectly can result in a loss of turn or having to go back spaces.

The Eco-Angels are earth-friendly and help educate the players with the wisdom found on certain cards. The Schmutzies, on the other hand, do not abide by such rules and have left their stains on the land.

name: Santiago 1898
description:
Santiago 1898 is a mini game of the naval battle between the US NAvy and the Armada española off Santiago in june 1898.

The game is played an undetermined number of turns in a boxed mapboard. Each unit is one ship.

The turn has two phases, one for player. Each player writes his movement orders for the own ships, pointing the letter and number of the square he want to move. Movement is simultaneous, and at the end ships of the active player can fire at enemy ships in artillery range. There is a hit if the dice are equal or more than the artillery factor + distance in squares to the target, and consult the damage table.

Some special rules cover ramming, shore batteries and heavy armour of US battleships.

The conditions of victory are for the spanish exit twoships off map, and for the US player avoid this.

name: Search 4 Dinosaurs
description:
Search 4 is a game that entertains while teaching early learning skills. The children search for the space on the board that matches a selected game card.
