The players use a plastic frame to "surround" the dinosaur and capture that card. The player with the highest card total at the end of the game is declared the winner.

Designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players ages 4 and older. No reading is required to play. There are two levels of competition for kids at different skill levels.

Includes a colorful board, 24 dinosaur cards, 4 plastic locators, and the rules.

name: Sheen It!
description:
Some people are normal, some are special, and some have tiger blood in their veins! If you’re tired of pretending you’re not a bitchin’ rock star from Mars then, grab some friends from your pool of magic assassins, and get ready to crush some fools in your underwear!

Sheen It! is a card game for 3 or more players ages 13 and up.

Sheen It! is a game in which players compete to create the most epic sayings out of Charlie Sheen-isms. Combine cards that contain elements from Charlie’s best quotes to create your own new sentence or phrase. If the Judge thinks yours is the best, you score. Be the first player to reach 10,000 points and you can truly say you are WINNING!

name: Buzzword Bits
description: Buzzword Bits miniature version of Buzzword in which players compete to give answers to five clues that all have a certain two-letter combination in common. For example, answers to the combination "MW" might be "Monkey Wrench" or "Most Wanted" - whatever fits the clue! It consists only of a deck of cards and is great for travel.

name: Fantail Rugby
description:
You will be protagonist of a new and realistic Rugby Board Game where the different situations that this vibrant sport presents, are intertwined by means of smart charts. Fantail Rugby is an agile and dynamic Board Game that combines all the action of Rugby within the rules that govern. Fantail Rugby allows you to make (one or two) handed pass, line outs, scrums, kicks, tackles, mauls, rucks, tries, penalties and drops, besides other actions inherent to the Rugby Game. Fantail Rugby combines action, strategy and luck.

About Fantail Rugby Board Game
Fantail Rugby is played by two coaches who must lead their teams to the victory. The smart charts are the soul of the game by having each of them a special design to be used according to game development. On the game board can clearly see the current situation of the game that is taking place in the smart chart in use, because the symbols of the board are in accordance with the symbols of the smart charts.

Attention:

New updated version (2020) of the most entertaining and agile Rugby Game you have ever seen.
Now, smart cards have focused on an even more dynamic game by being designed to simulate a Seven Rugby Game . In addition, the images have been improved and the chances of reaching the try or a conversion are more common.

Teams can be made up of one player, two or three and the playing time is agreed in advance. The fact of being played with an eight-sided dice has a lot of random, but since smart cards have the possibility of deciding in various game situations, it gives to the same a touch of strategy which will depend on the score and the remaining playing time.

name: Ramses Rage
description:
Ramses II reigned over Ancient Egypt for 67 years. Today, you can shake the tomb, but beware of his rage.

This game is played with six standard dice and one multi-colored pyramid. The object of the game is to reach 10,000 points. Points are acquired by rolling the dice and the pyramid.

Each player rolls the dice and tries to earn as many points as possible in each turn. A highly successful roll or set of rolls allows the player the option of throwing the pyramid.

name: ProBingo
description:
Every player has one bingo card.
Then they roll 2 dice & move around the central play board in the same direction as the arrows. Everybody uses the Number you stop on.
The first to make any full line wins! Two or more winners split the winnings. Play for Fun or decide on a Jackpot to play for in the middle.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hot Wheels Motorsports
description:
You are on a truly hot ride. Hop into the supercar and... give it a kick!!! Just check if it's fuelled up and there's no traffic jam on the way. Whoever is first to have tried all the cars, wins the game.
(from publisher's blurb)

Card game based on HotWheels license. Get rid of your cards first by playing cards following the color of model of the car depicted. Watch out for special function cards.

name: Hot Wheels Highway
description:
Do you dream of speeding up and getting an unforgettable thrill? Set off with us! Change your cars and drive on, straight to victory.
(from publisher's blurb)

Card game based on HotWheels license. Get rid of all of your cards by playing them in numerical sequence. You may play more of the same-value cards simultaneously. If you cannot play, draw 3 new cards.

name: Little Burro Chase Game
description: One of the players plays the "Burros" and the other player tries to get them back into the "Corral", before they can reach the "Cave". The player for the Burros, spins first, and spins 3 times for each Burro, moving them the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner. From this point of the game, the Burros receive 1 spin for each marker, spinning for the leading marker first, second next, etc., and moves each forward the amount on the spinner. After the Burros each have their turn, the other player spins again as before, moves all the Burros backwards the amount spun. If a Burro moves back into the Corral, or if he lands on a space marked "Trap", remove this marker from the playing board. if of the Burros reach the Cave, the Burros win the game. If all of the Burros are caught, they lose the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

name: Aurora-opoly
description:
According to the rules:

The Object of the game is to be the only player not to become bankrupt.

To Set Up the game each player chooses a token and begins on the start square. Each player is given two each of the $500s, $100s and $50s; six of the $20s; five each of the $10s, $5s and $1s. During the game the bank cannot go broke. The bank sells and handles the bankruptcies of the businesses and charges for the customers. If the bank runs out of customers, no more can be obtained until some are sold back to the bank.

To Win the game, a player has to be the only player not to declare personal bankruptcy. When a player owes more money than he can raise by selling customers and bankrupting his businesses, he is out of the game. Any bankrupt businesses a play has, goes to the persona or bank that he owes money to. The player who receives the bankrupt businesses immediately has to pay the bankruptcy charge plus 10% for any business he wants to own. If he does not pay the charges, the business goes back to the bank to be sold to anyone who lands on the square. Players may trade and sell businesses between themselves.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bodensee-Reise
description:
Pick up as many as possible 'sight-seeing' markers and souvenirs.
All the players have the same starting place - Lindau.
Depending on your amount of luck - and collecting a bonus for
being the first one who finishes the race - you are going to win.

1. Rotationally you travel along the red route - broken or continous line - as many stations as points diced with your meeple
2. You also may choose the blue (sea)line - you may switch from one to the other at any place where the lines meet
3. If your meeple lands in 'marked' cities - someting happens, depending on the color of the city - picking up souvenirs etc.
4. Meeting another player you are going to be invited getting a present (=souvenir)
5. First player who arrives back in Lindau receives 5 additional souvenirs
6. The winner is the one who has collected the most souvenirs, after all players have returned from the trip

name: All Wrapped Up!
description:
This is a memory game for children age 4 and older. The players travel around the board collecting gifts. The cards matching each gift are placed in a plastic rack in front of the child... but the kids turn the cards away so only the other players can actually see the images.

The first player to collect seven gift cards and name them correctly in the proper order wins the game.

Includes a colorful board, 4 plastic racks, 4 tokens, 33 cards, a die, and the rules. No reading is required to play... the cards have images and descriptions but the kids can just remember the pictures.

name: E.C.W. D.B.A.
description:
This is a set of miniatures wargame rules for refighting the english civil war.

The rules set is a derivative of WRG's DBA rules. The smallest unit is a "stand" containing multiple models as opposed to handling individual figures.

The emphasis of the rules is quick-play. Combat is resolved by the roll of two standard dice, and movement is controled by a single die roll for "Command Points".

name: In ze boite
description:
Game from the TV show of the same name on Gulli.

Two teams compete in different fun and educational tests (mime, quizz, songs) to earn time for the final.

for the final, teams confronte "the black box" with the time they earn during the first step of the game.
each team lead a blindness member who try to take some cubes from the box.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Hans Christian Andersen's Thumbelina Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Will you get to the wedding on time? Follow your heart and nothing is impossible!

A simple set of rules, short duration of play and bright illustrations offer excitement and fun for young Thumbelina fans. With the added surprise of chance cards, children learn to identify pictures and colors while enjoying the fantasy world of Thumbelina and her charming prince, Cornelius.

Object: Try to be the first player to get to Thumbelina's wedding.

On your turn, roll the color die and move to the first space that matches the color rolled. If there is another player on that space, that player must go back to the start.

If you roll white, take the top chance card. Find the matching picture on the board and move to the space beside it. Sometimes this will enable you to jump ahead, but other times you will have to move backwards.

To win you must land on the orange space at the end of the trail and you must roll orange to do so.

name: MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck
description:
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck provides a sneak peak at the next expansion for the MelodieXpress family of games. The 52 card deck showcases some of the new cards available.

Rhythm Deck Contents
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck includes playing cards based around music notation as the basis for games and activities. The deck includes cards for a range of notes –quavers, crotchets, semibreves and minims; dotted crotchets and dotted semibreves; along with doublet and triplet crotchets and doublet, triplet and quadruplet quavers. It also includes the corresponding rests for quaver, crotchet, semibreve and minim.

The card designs differ from the earlier decks. As the cards focus upon elements of rhythm, the notes are depicted on a plain background without staff lines. This allows players to visually focus upon the individual note values rather than positioning against the staff to discern the pitch of the notes.

Games
The MelodieXpress Rhythm Deck provides a set of cards only. The cards may be used with the games from the MelodieXpress Note Reading and Composing Music packs. ‘Snap’, ‘Memory’, ‘Rows’ and ‘Rhythm Lunch’ all work well with this deck – though the players focus upon matching the note duration rather than its pitch.

Next Steps
This deck provides fans with an early look at some of the cards which will be used in the upcoming MelodieXpress Rhythm Pack. This will include a further 150+ cards which can be integrated with this Rhythm Deck, along with a 16 page game guide.

The MelodieXpress System
MelodieXpress is a fun, educational and easy way to learn to read music. Using the approach that we learn best through play, MelodieXpress uses games and activities to introduce the key concepts of musical notation and music theory. This step-by-step approach allows you to learn at your own pace, while the games provide an enjoyable way to learn and consolidate your knowledge of music.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition

name: TOP
description:
Avoid to spend the most valuable tokens of your collection for building 'waste pyramids', because the remaining ones are going to score

1 place your - different sized - tokens on the board corresponding to the roll of three dice; chose the most favourable one to build a back-up-system for your more precious tokens
2 form 'waste pyramids' (all together) to reduce the supply of your opponents - also by the roll of three dice

name: Prophet Search: Ezra Taft Benson
description:
Objective:
To gain more knowledge of the life and personality of the prophet.

To play each player takes a game card, and as questions about the Prophet Ezra Taft Benson are shared. Players who have the answer on their game card put a marker on that spot. First one to have four markers in a row wins.

name: Sein Letzter Dollar
description:
Goal: Collect as many chips as possible before 1st player goes bankrupt

1. Each player receives 10 wooden chips
2. Place your 'chip-team' by rolling three dice into your own area
3. Prepare your team to challenge your opponents - roll the dice if you win ==> rolling a '6', you may collect set chips
4. If you own only one last chip (=letzter Dollar) you may play 'all or nothing'

name: Timopoly
description: This Monopoly clone is themed with Canadian-based Tim Horton's "coffee and bake shops". Players buy and sell the restaurant's most popular items. Player tokens include (among others) a coffee cup, a donut, and a "Zamboni" ice resurfacing machine. (Tim Horton was a famous NHL hockey player).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Nu Monte Carlo Blocks
description:
Is is a set of 58 colored tiles, small discs and cardboard cards (like bingo)that enable players to play a number of different games: Nu Monte Carlo Blocks, Poker, Rhumy (sic) Dominoe (sic), Cassino (sic), checkers, Color Lotto, Hoo Doo and Color Blocks.

Rules for Nu Monte Carlo Blocks: "To start the game a dealer is chosen. The blocks are placed on the table same as dominoes, face down and are shuffled. Each player draws one block starting from the right of the dealer. When a Red block is drawn, the drawer neither puts or takes from the kitty. When Green block is drawn the player places one chip in the kitty. When a Yellow block is drawn the player places two chips in the kitty.

"TO WIN, the player getting the first three in a row of same color receives three chips from the kitty. The player getting first four in a row of the same color receives four from the kitty. The player getting first five in a row of same color receives all the chips in the kitty. At no time is a winner to pay any chips to the kitty."

If that makes sense to you please explain it to me. Rules for other games are included in the images section.

name: Hippimill
description:
Goal: Be the first moving all of your 4 (large) meeples into
the target area

1. Roll three dice - allocate the numbers to appropriate meeples you may - if useful - allocate all numbers to one meeple
2. Try to hit opposing meeples - you may decide, of you want to use your movement points either forward or backwards
3. Rolling a 'triple' you have another turn

name: Marooned
description:
Marooned is designed to be played by 2-4 players on various different boards each with different set ups.

The aim of the game is to get as many of your peices from your 'IN' block to your 'OUT' block. This is done by moving the movement blocks around the board and fashioning a 'stepping stone' path across the various hazards whilst also attempting to scupper your opponants chances.

Squares on the board include the 'Sudden Death' square, the 'Quicksand' Square and the 'Conveyor Belt' Square.

name: Ten Sided Solutions
description:
From the box:
"Ten Sided Solutions. The dice game made of strategy and fun. A game of chance, skill and strategy, where thinking things through is more important than luck."

In this Yahtzee-like game, you roll ten d10 dice up to five times, trying to maximize your score by completing one of the 34 slots on your score sheet each turn. The player who has the highest points from filling the categories wins.

name: Chessyball
description:
While called Chessyball, the game really has little to do with chess, it is more a soccer game. The game plays on an 11 x 18 board, and each team has 10 players and one goaltender.

Pieces move as Queens in chess, i.e., moving as far as they want in a straight line, or until reaching the outer edge, or another piece. When stopping by the ball, the ball shoots in the direction away from the moved piece, until it hits another player, or wall. The idea is to maneuver the ball for a goal, a three square wide area on a player's home side. Player one gets one initial move, player two gets two and then each player had 3 moves a turn. There are some additional advanced moves.

name: Millenium 2.2: the boardgame
description:
Reproduces as a boardgame the famous computer game Millenium 2.2: return to Earth.
The Earth has been made a lifeless planet by some catastrophe and the players (the few living in remote outpost in space) must collect resources around the solar system to make it habitable again.
spaceships! techno-babble! aliens! all this sort of things, but in a quite reasonable mixture.

A giant asteroids wiped away any form of life from Earth and made it inhabitable. Fortunately, mankind was able to found a few little outposts through the Solar System before the
catastrophe.
There are blueprints of forgotten technologies lost on the planets and the satellites of the Solar System, and some of them will allow to build some machine, which, once constructed and transported to Earth with a suitable space craft, will be able to solve one of the many Earth’s problems.

Once found such buleprints, the players will have to accumulate the resources to build the re-terraforming machine (there are several resources in the game, from Aluminium to Uranium).

Such resources could be mined from the asteroid belt (sending an appropriate ship there) or exploring celestial bodies until one rich in that resource is found (a drawing card system is used in exploration to determine randomly which planets will be strategically valuable and which one will be worthless pieces of rock, so that no two games will be the same).

The same resources will be used also for the construction of othe ships a player can use for further exploration.
There are several kinds of ship a player can build, each one having its own abilities and its own price in resources

When the Earth has become habitable again the game ends and the one having contributed most to restore its environment win, since his sub-specie will be able to colonize Earth while the others will have to remain in some worthless piece of rock
lost in space.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Penalty Pong
description:
In Penalty Pong, players split into two teams, each with the goal of humiliating the members of the other team by making them do embarassing tasks while avoiding such punishment themselves.

If you manage to throw or bounce your ball into an opponent's cup, that player must draw a penalty card and perform the task shown on it: call one player "Master", sing "I'm a Little Teapot", admit to a lie you've told to someone. Blank cards are included so that you can create your own penalties, penalties that you might end up suffering if you're not careful. Good times – and a bit of after-game penance – await!

It is the 1830's. The United States is a young republic, at whose heart is a constitution guaranteeing the rights and privileges of all its citizens.

A stone's throw away, on the other side of the Niagara River, is Upper Canada. Here rights and privileges are determined by familial and social connections. The province is controlled by a small clique of Tories who govern the province as though it were a family business.

Opposing these ruling elites are the Reformers - men who espouse dangerous, American ideas: Justice, liberty, and equality.

In this game of the Upper Canada Rebellion, players assume the role of Tory or Reformer. Using an impulse system and point-to-movement, players move their leaders throughout the province rallying supporters, and react to historical events.

The Reformer, through legislation, petition, and rebellion must cause enough trouble in the province that Her Majesty's Government takes notice. But be careful! Cause too much trouble and your rag-tag rebels could find themselves squaring-off against regiments of British regulars.

The Tory, through control of the churches, and intimidation, must retain the status quo. Don't be too harsh, however, lest Her Majesty's Government get wind of your corruptions.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: MyQuest
description:
The town of Dragon’s Ridge is being threatened by a powerful Dark Lord and its deadly Minions. The call has gone out for a Hero to rise up and undertake a series of Quests, each designed to bring ruin to the Dark Lord’s dark plans. Do you have what it takes to solve the Quests before Darkness consumes Dragon’s Ridge and its inhabitants?

MyQuest is a solo game designed to allow you to explore a fantasy town and its surrounding wilds in an attempt to thwart the plans of the enemy - a Dark Lord and its deadly Minions. Players choose from one of six different Heroes and must undertake 3 Quests, chosen at random from a deck of 30 Quest cards. Before the game begins, one of 10 different Dark Lord cards will be selected (at random) for the player to rise up against, each with a unique power and the command over one of four different Minion types: infernal demons, unrelenting undead, savage beasts, or elemental primordials. In this way, the game will offer variety each time it is played, as the Quests, Heroes and enemies can be different.

Heroes must overcome terrible Misfortune cards that get in their way and will even have to face Encounter cards that provide various skill checks that they will have to master. The central mechanic for the game revolves around rolling six-sided dice and trying to get at least one 5-6 to pass the myriad of tests facing each Hero. From the spoils of their victories in battle and chance encounters, Heroes will also earn gold that can be used in town to heal wounds, remove curses, buy items of power, and sail to distant spots on the board.

But time is not on the player's side, for the Threat of Evil track grows as Minions reach the town square or certain cards are drawn from the Misfortune deck. Does your Hero have what it takes to battle back against the likes of Evil such as the Demon Prince, Insane Horror, Ancient Dragon, Troll King, or Lich (to name a few)? Only the brave, cunning and quick will be victorious.

name: Der Tempel des Schlangengottes
description:
Central idea and goal of the game

Players are adventurers trying to find the temple of the God of Snakes in the jungle. Unfortunately, this is a rather dangerous endeavour as the jungle is full of poisonous snakes. The expedition that is first to reach the temple wins the game. Be careful not to run out of snake antivenom though...

Game-play (short summary)

Each player moves their token on a board. Normal movement is one space, but moving 2, 3 or 4 spaces is possible via a push-your-luck element (pulling an item out of a bag, which, depending on what you draw, allows you to move more spaces or costs you some of your antivenom). A player who has no antivenom left is eliminated from the game. Event cards add another luck element.

Game-play (detailed description)

Each player gets a player token (wooden jeep) and 6 bottles of antivenom (cardboard chits). The jeeps are placed on the starting area of the board. Players try to get their jeep to the temple by moving it on the board. The board has four types of spaces: normal spaces, swamp spaces, river spaces and event spaces.

Normally, players move their jeep one space per turn. On each space, there can only be one jeep, and players must move their jeep. Instead of moving one space, players can choose to call upon the God of Snakes - either because they want to get on more quickly or because moving one space would take them on a space they can't stop on (because it is already occupied by another player's jeep or because it is a swamp space on which players are not allowed to stop).

To call upon the God of Snakes, a player has to reach into the "magic bag". The bag contains 4 wooden snakes, two green ones, a blue one and a red one.
If a player draws the dangerous red mamba, they are not allowed to move on and immediately use up one of their antivenom bottles. The red snake is then put back into the bag.
If a player draws a blue or green snake, it means that the God of Snakes has answered their prayers. The snake is put on the next free altar space in the center of the board. The number on the altar space tells the player how many spaces they move (2, 3 or 4 spaces). When the last blue or green snake has been drawn, all snakes are returned to the bag.

Drawing the blue snake announces dangerous water snakes. If any player is on a river space when the blue snake is drawn (or if they would land on a river space after moving), they lose a bottle of antivenom.

If a player lands on an event space, they have to draw an event card. Event cards are either positive or negative: losing/gaining a bottle of antivenom, choosing a player to lose a turn, having to draw a snake from the bag, getting another turn, losing a turn, moving forwards/backwards one or more spaces.

If a player has lost all their antivenom, it becomes too dangerous to continue the expedition and they are eliminated from the game.

name: Sum Fun
description: "Sum Fun" uses 10 colored and number dice which are rolled and arranged in a particular manner according to the rules. Based on the roll the dice are arranged into runs, a series greater then 3 consecutive numbers(that is 3,4,5,6) or sets, all numbers which are the same(that is 4,4,4). One of the 10 dice is the KEY cube which is held seperate and effects scoring the roll, loss of a turn or taking an additional turn. Based on the arrangement of the numbered sets and runs and the color matching of the KEY cube scores are tallied. Play progresses around the table allowing each player equal opportunity. First to 250 wins. A variation to the primary rules allows for play to 1000 or as player decide.

name: Andalusia
description:
Andalusia is a Chess variant played on an Alquerque board. Pieces move along lines on the board. It uses a slightly modified quadruple Alquerque board, with every other horizontal and vertical line removed.

The Object of the game is to checkmate the opponent's King.

From Zillions of Games:

King - a King can move one step along a line in any direction. Like Chinese Chess, it has the special power to threaten the enemy King across the board along an empty line. For this reason, it is not permitted to make a move that leaves the two Kings facing each other with nothing in between. Unlike Chinese Chess, the King is not restricted to a particular area of the board. So it can threaten the enemy King along any line and in any direction.

Chariot - a Chariot can slide any number of spaces along a line in any direction.

Soldier - a Soldier can move one step along a line in any non-retreating direction. It can move two spaces from it's starting position, as long as it is not a capturing move. A Soldier promotes to a Chariot on the second to last rank.

name: Altairian
description:
From Zillions of Games:

Altairian Checkers, recently decoded from SETI transmissions, is a checkers/draughts type game played on a radial hex board with four hexes to a side. Each player starts with ten pieces called Pods arranged on opposite sides of the board.
A Pod moves by orbiting a neighboring piece of either color, called the pivot. A Pod can orbit around a pivot through any number of empty spaces or through outer space (off the board) provided it comes to rest on an empty space on the board. It must land in a space adjacent to the pivot in the forward direction. A Pod cannot capture.
When a Pod reaches the shaded area on the far side of the board, it promotes to a War Pod. A War Pod moves like a regular Pod, with the exception that it can land on any orbital space (i.e., forward progress is not required), and it captures any enemy piece that it orbits around.
When a War Pod returns to the shaded area on its own side of the board, it promotes to a Death Pod. A Death Pod moves like a War Pod, with the added condition that it captures any enemy piece that it lands next to.
Because pieces must have pivots to move, an isolated piece is frozen. The game is won by scattering the enemy fleet and leaving it with no move. A player who has no pieces or no moves at the start of a turn loses.

name: Sulahai
description:
4 different Games:

1st Sulahai:
4 participants - 30 - 60 min everyone gets 4 small seashells and 12 tiny bamboo sticks; goal: collect as many sticks as possible within a given time.
A Each player selects 4 different winning numbers (out from 16), two players with odd and two with even numbers
B Who comes first proposes a number (='open' seashells) and uses all 16 seashells as dice; if predicted number is achieved you collect bamboo sticks from all the opponents, with a flop you have to pay sticks to everyone; the one whose number was proposed collects or pays the double amount;
C If prediction fails the one whose number was proposed is next in line

2nd Dittar-Pradesh:
Goal: get as many sticks as possible
unlimited participants - all the bamboo sticks, 16 seashells
A each player adds an mutually agreed number of sticks into the jackpot;
B try to estimate the accurate number of roll witht 16 seashells;
C if you win you get the pot, if several persons win pot is splitted; if everybody looses jackpot will increase.

3rd Bamboo and Cowrie:
2,4 or 6 participants (form two parties), 48 sticks, 6 seashells
Goal: Get all of the sticks
Use six seashells as a die: depending on the result you or your party may get or pay sticks

4th Pancha Kelya
see BBG 'Pancha Keliya'

name: Photo Flight
description: Player are press photographers who charter aircraft to fly across the British isles taking exclusive pictures.

name: Spirax
description:
Spirax is played on a board of concentric circles. The circles have paths connecting them which spiral inwards towards the central vortex.

Each player has four pieces which start along one spiral. Each turn the pieces can be moved by allocating movement points, with movement becoming more expensive the closer a piece is to the vortex. In addition, on some turns every piece on the board will move one space closer to the vortex.

Pieces can attack others by moving over them. The result of a successful attack is to send the defending piece in towards the vortex. Pieces which enter the vortex re-appear along the edge. The object of the game is to make a certain number of successful attacks.

name: Of Course You Realise This Means War
description:
In this game, two players are theoretically nations competing in seven named areas. However, the game is highly abstracted, with each area represented by a track. Each player has seven cards which are secretly allocated to the areas each turn. The player allocating the higher card to an area (with the values wrapping around) moves a marker one space closer to their end of the track.

The object is to win four of the seven areas by getting their markers to your end of their tracks. Markers on shaded spaces move double, and markers reaching an end don't move again. Cards are also removed when this happens.

name: Olelo
description:
Olelo is a Hawaiian word that means talking and telling, and that is just what the board game Olelo is all about getting to know better the people you are playing with!

A fun, easy, and engaging game, players move around the board by rolling the die, moving to a colored square, and answering questions, the first player to answer all his question cards wins!

Questions are all about Home and Family Life, School and Life Lessons, Jobs, Travel, Achievements and What Do You Think. And the Purple Silly Cards keep everyone laughing. A Children's Deck of Question Cards is included in every game.

Components:

1 Family Game Board,
5 Decks of Children's Cards,
5 Decks of Adult Cards,
1 Deck of Silly Cards,
6 Playing Pieces

name: Forfeit
description:
A family game of fun, knowledge, strategy and hilarious embarrassment!

The game of FORFEIT is to move around the board, answering questions correctly as you go to win 'letter tokens' to spell the word F O R F E I T and win the game.

The winner then decides on who will do the ultimate FORFEIT.

name: Slotsadee
description:
The object of the game is to roll winning combinations and cover the four slot circles at the bottom of the slot machine card.

The game can be won three different ways: Be the first player to cover the slot card circles; Be the last player with slot coins left to make bets or Roll six WIN's.

name: The Collector Game
description:
If you are a collector of whatever or you are a lover of board games then you will love this game. It is a simple fast paced fun new board game. Go around the board and collect cash and collector items like Art, Antiques, Cars, Coins, Stamps, and Sports Items. Collect all six collector items to finish the game. Whoever finishes the game first doesn't mean they are the winner. The player that has the most value of collector cards and cash combined wins the game.

Contents:

1 Game Board
10 Antique Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Art Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Car Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Coin Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Sports Item Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
10 Stamp Collector Cards - Valued from $100 - $1000
20 Option cards
Play Money Denominations $100, $500, $1000
6 Pawn Pieces
1 Die
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bankers Revenge
description:
Build your score by playing all the colored money cards from your hand into your bank before your opponents do. Players who reach one million dollars in their score, receive a millionaire token! The player to get 3 millionaire tokens first wins the game!

2 decks of cards (Action & Money Decks) and special Bankers Revenge dice keep this edge-of-your-seat game play rolling at a fast pace! The Action deck of cards is packed with countless challenges, including a wide variety of scenarios such as lotteries, playing stock markets, robbing banks and much, much more!

name: Theodore Tugboat Rootin' Tootin' Card Game
description:
"Players flip their cards over one at a time. Who sees the pair of matching cards? Quick! Toot the tooter so you can claim the pair! But be sure they are identical matches before you toot. If you make a mistake, you'll have to hand your cards over to your opponents. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!"

If you successfully toot the tooter you win all discarded piles and add them to your play stack. Once someone runs out of play cards the game ends and whoever has the most cards wins.

The game comes with an electronic bell and 54 large cards.

The game uses the characters from the Canadian based childrens television series.

Has the Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Best Toy Award Gold Seal.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Player Elimination, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: Jukebox Trivia
description:
Move around the board, answer trivia question correctly and win records. The object of the game is to get to the music hall of fame within a minimum of 15 records.

Components:

1 Game Board
2 CD's (or Audio Cassettes)
2 Song Title Answer Wheels
25 Red Records
25 Green Records
25 Purple Records
25 Yellow Records

name: Operation Dovecote
description: The game comes with two 11x17" map, 280 counters, rules. The map scale is about 1.5 miles per hex. Each combat unit is one platoon to battalion. Turns are 8 hrs. The game simulates the opening few days of the dramatic Egyptian assault across the Suez Canal in October, 1973. The game includes an air game system, a ground system and unique rules where command and control are critical for movement purposes. Use of SAM missiles and SAGGER AT play important roles to keep the Israeli at bay. At first, it appears as a "David vs Goliath" battle because of the disparity of forces. The Egyptian needs to create breaches and bridging and move quickly before the balance favors the Israeli. Time is not a friend to either side at various times in the game.

name: Infla: Defla
description:
The game is an extension to the classic Monopoly. In INFLA:Defla the objective remains: to avoid bankruptcy and ending up as the richest player. The game is enhanced by introduction of the monetary gold standard scenarios, inflation, boom, hyperinflation and deflation. The players are thus introduced to the operation of monetary policy and the importance of economic activity. In addition, there are new event and corporate cards, such as the terrorist or the Recovery Plan, and the purchase of crisis safe investment options available in the form of gold and silver.

8 tables with economic cycles for each player
5 Signal Card (Gold Standard, boom, inflation,
Hyper inflation and deflation
9 additional event cards
9 additional community cards
24 mortgage markers
10 ounces of gold
10 ounces of silver
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Orbital
description: Orbital is a space exploration game where players cruise around the galaxy with the aid of an Orbital Drive, which converts inertia/momentum into power for launching and consequently slinging around space. Players manage crew actions and resources to travel, discover new worlds and find secret missions. The "space" in which Orbital takes place is free form (no board). Using a simple measurement system, players place new planets after assigning their science officer to scan for them. Planets bring with them their own dangers, as do space anomalies and the occasional heap of space junk.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Die neuen Eroberer
description:
Goal: Be the first to dominate the market (gain more than 50%)

1. Players start with 20 chips (used as markers) and 15.000 money units, acting by turns
2. Your company is busy launching new products into the market; move your token by rolling the die; depending on the area you enter you may
A Collect information (card), the more the better, but with increasing costs (buy)
B Draw a 'chance'-card
3. If you think that you have enough information about a special product you want to launch you may announce to do so - tempting your fate: the higher the amount (=percentage) of knowledge you have the better your chance to score (=placing chips to dominate); otherwise you obtain a penalty
4 Games ends with domination or bankruptcy of a player

name: Joel of the Island Men
description:
Throughout the galaxy, mankind drifts alone, surviving within self-contained space stations known as Islands. They dedicate their lives to trying to build the most magnificent Island in order to impress the mysterious and alluring ‘Angels’ who are believed to offer eternal life, rebirth and all one could desire.

Life on the islands is hard, mining asteroids for ore to refine in hot furnaces to increase the power and prestige of their Islands. The presence of weapons is known to anger the Angels, but some Islands develop them regardless, seeking to increase mining production, for defence, or for attacking their rivals.

When the Angels arrive, their whims are capricious. Sometimes they merely observe, sometimes they attack. Only the most magnificent Island in the eyes of the Angels will be chosen to be visited by them.

INTRODUCTION
A game for one to three players who must navigate through space, looking for asteroids to mine in order to obtain the ore needed to build and improve their Island. They must avoid deadly asteroid collisions and the aggression of their rivals as they await the coming of the Angels, bringing with them the promise of eternal peace and the threat of destruction. The winner has the greatest island (decided by points) at the end of the game.

GAME PLAY
Each player controls an 'island' a fully self-sufficent space station. Players must move through the asteroid dense area of space on the board, destroy asteroids and then collectthe shattered remnants. This can then be refined to create pure ore, and the different ores can be used to create different additional sections of the island, or repair damaged ones.

Needless to say, eventually the islands will come into conflict with each other.

The game's length is determined by the appearences of the mysterious angel-ships, players do no know how long the game is going to last exactly (20-45 minutes on average) and so must judge wen to build offensive weaponry (which score negative at the end), and when to capitalise on point scoring with certain sections (such as more luxurious living quarters and armour) nearer the end of the game.

The angels appear throughout the game, often dealing death and destruction to the island sections. The final angel's appearence ends the game, points are scored, and one player wins, becoming the chosen recpient of the angel's love.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: High Adventure Cliffhangers: War Against the Han
description:
This adventure source pack is intended to create an ongoing campaign for the High Adventure Cliffhanger: The Buck Rogers Adventure Game rules.

The War for Freedom Continues! Deep within the Grand Canyon lies a secret Han airbase. Hidden here is an irresistible super-weapon that will bring the rebellion to its knees. The only defense is for a small band of heroes to infiltrate the base and foil the plot before final disaster strikes! Armed with the best available weapons, and allied with both native American freedom fighters and the mysterious Golden Dragon Society, the heroes must attempt to stop the unstoppable.

This boxed campaign set expansion includes the following:


A 32 page full-color World at War book, which expands the world giving loads of information on new technologies, new places, and the people of the 25th Century.



A 48 page, full-color Campaigns vs. the Han book, which shows GM's how to construct campaigns, giving expanded tables for quick creation of adventures and gaming sessions. It also has a great adventure that pits the player characters against the Mongol Overlords.



2 full-color, poster-size maps put the 25th Century on your gaming table, including a large-scale playing map of a Han airship.



Lots of stand-up counters and terrain tiles.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Judge, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Konterfix
description:
Goal: Depends on variant you choose

Variant A:Try to get four of your pegs in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row
Players use a 7x7 board with 25 pegs each - by turns. If a player succeeds he may
remove an opponent's peg - winner is the player who removed the most pegs

Variant B: Use a pegged board and move your pegs to get a row of 4; if you succeed you may
remove an opponent's peg It is allowed to open and close it once more (see German
checkers)

Variant C: Form two facing rows and move your (14) pegs to reach the opposite side first, you
may walk and leap (like Halma)

Variant D: - Sologame

name: Tiques Attack
description:
Attention owners of nice little fur balls! Ticks are here to come and bite! Will you be quick enough to protect your pet from these pests vampire? Hope you are cause Tiques Attack is a game of speed that will put all your senses to work. When you see or hear that your pet may be infected with parasites, you must react faster than ticks and expose an animal other than yours to their terrible voracity.

Warning! Ticks attack! Sharpen your reflexes and get ready for a party filled with laughter and action with Tiques Attack.

The goal of the game is to have as few as possible ticks counter at the end of the game. The player with the fewest win. To do so, you must be faster than your opponent to protect your animal by covering it with cards from your pile as your animal shows up in the danger zone. Players can also get ticks counter by making mistakes.

name: Beat Debt
description:
Beat Debt is a financial strategy game that educates consumers about investment principles and good economic choices. Players use disposable income to purchase investments and pay off credit card debt. The first player to have $5000 put away for investments and a zero credit card balance is declared the winner.

Includes a board, six tokens, play money, dice, financial statement forms, and rules.

"Break the cycle of credit card debt in your home the fun way!"

name: NSKK und HJ-Verkehrsspiel
description:
This pre-WWII title turned a typical traffic-rules game into a propaganda vehicle for Hitler Jugend and the NSKK (Nationalsozialistisches Kraftfahrkorps or National Socialist Motor Corps). The box cover features young men in HJ uniforms, while Wikipedia describes the latter as a small paramilitary organization within the Nazi party that both provided roadside assistance like the American Automobile Association and trained members in the operation and maintenance of motorcycles and automobiles.

The game content includes a large 33" x 24" game board, seven grey wooden non-player vehicles, six colored player vehicles and eight people figures, some pedestrian and some matched with vehicles (e.g. the red motorcycle and rider).

The combination allows for a total of nine players, five pedestrians and four vehicles. Each player gets a set of five cards: a starting location, a final destination, and three intermediate stops. The first player to complete his route while respecting all of the traffic rules wins.

name: Going to the World's Fair
description:
A souvenir item game promoting the 1939 New York World’s Fair.
The players visit the of the Fair attractions. The game is a simple roll and move

Content:
1 board
a box of silver coins - denominations of 5¢ (Teddy Roosevelt), 10¢ (Jefferson), 25¢ (Washington), and 50¢ (Lincoln)
4 colored wooden player pieces,
1 lead weighted metal spinner,
2 Bakelite dice,
instructions,
attractions cards.

name: Safety 1st Auto Traffic Race
description:
A battery operated board game which uses the concept of a traffic light and a rondel to move diecast cars around the rectangular board.

The traffic light lights up red, yellow, or green depending on where the rondel's arrow stops. The rondel features six options for stop, go , or caution. The board is illustrated as a city block.

name: An Amusing Game of Horse Show
description:
A spin the spinner and move game with the theme of horse shows where the players compete for show medals.

Game contents:
1 board,
eight wooden playing pieces,
a cardboard spinner with a metal arrow and
eight cardboard "medals"

name: Kroko und die Affenbande
description:
What it is: Relatively simple roll-and-move game for children.

Main idea: Crocodile "Kroko" is trying to take a nap at noon but monkey "Jumping Jo" and his friends are robbing him off his sleep by jumping around the pond, trying to reach the trees. This isn't easy, because Kroko can scare them away.

How it is played: Each player gets eight "monkeys" and tries to move them towards the trees. Throwing a 1-4 means moving the same number of spaces. A 5 means you have to move one of your monkeys away from start. If you throw the Kroko side of the die, you give Kroko a push, i.e. you tip the crocodile-shaped spinner in the middle of the board. When Kroko stops, his big tooth points to a specific section of the board. All the monkeys in this area are scared and run back to the start.
Special spaces include Kroko spaces (player has to push Kroko), spaces where a monkey is safe, and liana spaces which allow a monkey to climb to a free space in a tree. The game ends when all tree spaces are occupied. The player who got the highest number of their monkeys to the trees wins.

name: CodyCards
description:
CodyCards is a fast and light card game based on the traditional games of 31/Scat/Blitz/Ride The Bus; players compete in rounds to avoid having the lowest scoring hand of 3 cards. It is played with a custom deck of 54 cards in 4 suits (with values ranging from 1 to 10) but can be played with a normal deck with slight modification. A print-to-play edition exists.

The story of the game is that a bird named "Cody" is trying to steal coins from the players. At the start of the game each player gets 3 coins. At the end of each round one of the players will wake him up and he will then steal a coin from the weakest player at that time. Players try to avoid having the worst hand at the time that the bird wakes up. The game ends when all but one player have lost all of their coins. Players have to decide when it's to there advantage to try to force the end of a round -- but trying to end the round may invoke a penalty and often results not in the end of the round but in a sneak peek at a trump card which affects scoring.

Basic Gameplay:

At the start of each round, the dealer (who rotates clockwise after every round) shuffles the deck and deals 3 cards to each player, and then shuffles 2 random cards along with the special Cody-the-Bird card and sets these aside face down as the "nest" pile. The dealer then places the remaining cards face down in a draw pile, and turns the first one over face up as the discard pile. Starting with the player to the dealer's left and going clockwise, a player's turn consists of either: Taking the top face down card from the draw pile, or taking the top face up card from the discard pile, or knocking on Cody's Nest door.

If the player chooses to take a card, they then immediately discard one card from their hand face up on the discard pile and play proceeds clockwise (exception: once per round players may "bury" their discard face down). If they choose to knock on Cody's door, they take a peek at the top card in the Nest. If it's Cody the Bird, then it is turned face up and everyone has one more round to try to get a better hand. If it's not, the peeked at card is set aside in a special "Trump" pile, and the player who peeked has some advance information about how hands will be scored at the end. There are also a few special cards that allow players to perform actions out of turn.

The round ends when Cody the Bird is revealed, and at that point hands are scored and the lowest scoring player loses a coin. Hand value is based on: The sum value of up to 3 cards of the same suit, OR having a 3-card straight of the same suit (33 points), or having 3 cards of same face value (33 points). But having cards in a revealed trump suit will decrease the hand score. There is also a penalty for being the player to knock on Cody's Nest and end the round.

Strategy:

While there is a lot of luck in the game, there are some real strategic elements as well. Players must decide which cards to hold and draw that will be most likely to give them the highest scoring hand. To do this they must consider which cards have already been discarded and they must take into account the information they reveal to other players when they discard or choose a face-up discard card. In addition, players must decide when they have a good enough hand to take the risk of trying to end the round -- knowing that they will pay a scoring penalty for doing so. The moment when a player "Knocks on Cody's Door" is typically accompanied by curses and laughter as players find out if the round is really ending, or if a Trump suit is being revealed that will help or hurt them, and make emergency plans to quickly improve their hand before the round ends.

name: Grunt Deluxe: Siege Warfare
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Siege Warfare expansion set for Grunt. Adds 3D castle kit, 2 City kits, siege warfare props, advanced castle and castle siege rules, new battle cards and more.

Back of Box:

Grunt Deluxe Diege Warfare provides you with inexpensive three dimensional Castle, Cities, and Battlefield Marker kits (assembly required) and a 40 page expanded rule booklet covering all aspects of Siege Warfare. The expanded siege warfare rules add more depth to your Grunt battles and opens more strategies for players to explore. No other miniatures game offers you a complete 3D castle set and comprehensive siege rules at such an affordable price.

Purchase Grunt Deluxe Siege Warfare Expansion Boxes for additional modular castle and city kit pieces and customize your own Grunt castle to match your army's play style. Minimize your castle and expand your army or fortify your cities. Or make a huge castle and place your cities within, and stnad ready to fend off the largest of siege armies. Also check out Grunt Deluxe Siege Warfare card expansion packs to customize your Battle and Spell Card decks for siege warfare.

name: Bingo Ball (Chart Football)
description:
"This game is played in pairs and is enjoyable for 2 players as it is for 10"

A game inspired by Battleships. Each player gets a card with two football pitches marked on it. One is for 'Your score sheet", the other marked as 'Opponents score sheet". You keep your card secret at all times. Each pitch is divided up into 10 squares across and 6 squares down. The rows across are represented by the letters A to F. The columns down are marked 1 to 10. So every square can be chosen by giving a letter and a number A7 or C2, for example. The idea is to trace a line from Row F up to row A, without running into a T square which represents a tackle.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Chase the Enemy
description:
The board is like a chess board but 9 x 9 instead of 8 x 8. This is really a Draughts variant. All pieces start on the black squares and cannot jump or move on to a white square.
One player is the Attack and the other the Defence.
Pieces are assigned as sea-going vessels such as a Battleship, a U-Boat and even a Sea Plane.
The object for the Attack player is to capture as many vessels as possible. The pieces are assigned a point value. The Defence tries to get as many vessels into a Harbour square, where they are safe from attack.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Underworld Couriers
description:
Underworld Couriers is a pick-up and deliver game with a twist.

Players are couriers contracted to carry illicit goods around a map of the globe.

Using a timeline, players must plan the most effective mode of travel between pick-up point and delivery location (air, road, rail or ship). Each of these types of transport takes travels at a different speed, costs various amounts and entails certain risks (passing through customs).

Successfully completing a delivery will earn the player Notoriety and money. But be careful not to get caught or you risk a stint in jail.

The most Notorious player at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Frontline: Guadalcanal
description:
Take the fight to the Pacific!

Frontline is a tactical WWII ground combat card game for 1 to 4 players. This second game in the series covers small unit action during the battle for Guadalcanal.

Each player commands a squad of 4 to 10 American or Japanese soldiers and vehicles. Each card represents one soldier or vehicle. Each unit has inherent actions each turn including moving and attacking with different modes of fire. An action card deck enhances basic actions, and provides units with spur of the moment options.

The game uses counters to illustrate vital game information such as wounds, range, ammo, command, and morale. The range system is easy to use and simulates the movement of forces on the battlefield.

Frontline can also be played solitaire using the enemy Tactic cards. These cards give general, specific, and conditional orders to the enemy troops based on the current battlefield situation.

You can create battles by purchasing your starting forces, playing pre-made scenarios, or using the balanced randomized engagement rules.

Scheduled Components:
165 Full color cards (63mm x 88mm)
1 Full color counter sheet
Rulebook (Full Color)

Complexity:
Low to Moderate
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Crashbot Derby!
description:
Welcome to Crashbot Derby! In this board game, you play as one of 8 superpowered robots competing in the ultimate mechanized demolition derby! Attack your enemies with wild weapons, treacherous traps, or just by crashing into them! Don’t get sidetracked, though: the object is to cross the finish line first!

Gameplay

You're in a race with up to 5 other players; your goal is to complete 3 laps (enter a checkpoint space 6 times, essentially) first. Along the way, you may step on special spaces that will give you sparks (the "currency" of this game), cards, or allow you to activate your unique Robopower!

On your turn you may do these things:
- roll a 6-sided die 2 times
- spend sparks if you have them
- play cards if you have them
You can do these in any order. You can spend sparks
or play cards between die rolls.

Of course, racing is only part of it: the other part is fighting! You can attack your opponents with the cards in your hands , which usually represent a gizmo you can use offensively. You can also spend 3 red sparks to shoot opponents... and of course, as the name implies, you can crash into them!

Players are never eliminated from the game, they continue racing until a winner crosses the finish line!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Little Cowboy Game
description:
One of the first western themed games released. The game was a simple roll and move, or rather spin-and-move.

Box content:
16 circular wooden disks
a cardboard spinner with a metal arrow
board (attached to the box)

name: Space Traders
description:
Launch into the black of space to save your Home Planet!
Space Traders is a family strategy game for 3-5 players, ages 10 and up. Players mine their Home Planets for resources, then launch trading or raiding missions to the neutral Trading Planets. Space Traders uses modular building bricks for its game pieces, allowing players to upgrade ships during the course of the game. Multiple paths to victory are possible, some players will build many ships and try to restrict access to the Trading Planets while others may build only a few ships and rely on lightening-fast raids.

name: Public Transit
description:
Making city committee meetings fun…
Public Transit is a light strategy game for 3-6 players, ages 12 and up. Each player is a member of the city committee responsible for planning new routes for the public transporation system. Of course, you have different priorities than the other members of the committee — wanting to make sure the route goes to certain destinations while avoiding the other member’s pet projects. You’ll lay new route markers or adjust the route on your turn, all trying to make sure each color route goes to the destinations in your hand. You might even run two routes together, to make a junction and score extra points.

name: Universal Life
description:
The object of the game is to accumulate the greatest number of "sales" (points) by completing sales of insurance to prospective clients.

Universal Life was specifically designed to be played by financial security advisors of the AXA insurance company. This roll-and-move game has a predetermined course for each player to follow. Along the course, each player will encounter "clients", who will ask questions of the financial security advisor. Correctly answering the questions by providing sound advice and suggesting products will result in "sales" -- and points.

The game play is straightforward: each player, in turn, spins the wheel and moves his token the number of spaces indicated on the wheel. When a player lands on a coloured space, the player to the right must pick a card from the corresponding stack and read the question on the back of the card. If the player answers correctly, he has made a "sale" -- and gets one point.

After having completed the course, the player who has accumulated the largest number of "sales" (points) is the winner.

name: Spy World
description:
Spy World is a simple game of deduction. Each player is a spy belonging to one or two secret agencies (ROCK, PAPER or SCISSOR).

The goal of a spy is to identify and reval three agents belonging to the opposite agency of his agency. Rock agents seek for Scissor agents who seek for Paper agents (who seek for Rock agents).

The game contains 9 loyalty cards and 9 cellphone cards.
mechanics: Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: SuperMegaCon
description:
Welcome to SuperMegaCon, the convention board game. The game for SCIFI, GAMING, HORROR, and COMICS convention fans. This is the weekend of 24-hour fandemonium you’ve been waiting for all year!

The goal of this convention is to be the Attendee that has the most fun by collecting more Swag and attending more Events than all the other Attendees. Don’t let the lack of Food, Sleep, or Bathroom Breaks slow you down.

During SuperMegaCan you can grab Swag and attend Events, visit our lovely Gift Shop, run to FastGoQuikMart for Snacks and Drinks, rest at one of our convenient area Hotels, eat at fine area Restaurants and our own Snax Bar, catch the Auction where you can get tons of Swag or extra Cash, visit our Registration booth to sell your own Swag to other Attendees, enjoy Special Events in our spacious Auditorium, Volunteer for extra cash, and Much, Much, More!! So get SuperMegaCon and Play the Convention!!!
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Auction Anagrams
description:
From the rulebook:
"The game consists of a pack of 56 cards, each bearing a LETTER and about 150 discs with which to purchase the letters.
The OBJECT of each player is to make a word of FOUR LETTERS from the cards which he buys at auction in competition with the other players. The first player completing a WORD OF FOUR LETTERS wins the game."

name: Barnyard Brawl
description:
The barnyard is getting crowded and the animals are getting bored. So what do you do to fill an afternoon? Why not battle it out for bragging rights and first go at the trough tonight?

Barnyard Brawl is a two player abstract strategy game in the spirit of Chinese Chess. Players control armies of farm animals across the barnyard.

Each animal has its own movement rules and some come with special abilities. Animals may defeat opponents of equal or lesser value, or two lesser pieces may sandwich a higher value piece to take it out.

Players also begin the game with two randomly drawn Combat Cards which allow them to break the rules at some point in the game.

To add to the mix there are fences and a mud-hole that may be set up in different patterns to change the barnyard.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Noddy Quoits
description:
Players have to throw small rings, made of rubber, trying to land them on a board with hooks on it. You score points depending which hook it lands on (indeed, if it lands on one).
The board is illustrated with Noddy in the centre and Big Ears to the left and Policeman Plod to the right.

name: Winnie the Pooh
description:
Card game featuring characters from the Pooh stories by A. A. Milne.
A variation of the traditional playing card game called Beggar My Neighbour in Britain.
Players turn over a card from their stack. If it is a card without a number, the next player has a turn. If one of the numbered cards is drawn (they feature Christopher Robin, Kanga and Roo, Piglet and Winnie the Pooh) then the next player has to add cards to the central stack, how many cards being decided by the number on the previous card. If a player runs out of cards, he or her is out of the game. 'Last Man Standing' wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Combat, A Game of Skill
description: Very cheap game, transferring a Battleships' type game to land rather than sea. Sold in packets of charts and rules, no box. Very rare to find. Probably from the Second World War period, when every boy wanted to be a General

name: Five-A-Side
description: A football board game from this mainly card game publisher. The board is made up of 13 squares the length of the pitch, and 7 squares wide. Players move their lead footballers around the pitch. Sadly, I don't have the rules, so I don't know how they are moved but it is probably by dice roll (given the age of the game). The box does say "The NEW Soccer Game of SKILL".

name: Run Around Fractions
description:
6 games (3 outdoor games and 3 indoor games) that get kids off the couch and running while learning fractions.

Outdoor Games:
- Whole Lot: Learners race to join hands in order to become wholes.
- Order Order: Teams race to put fractions in order from lowest to highest.
- Line Up - Move-Up: Learners setp forward if a fractions is higher and step back if it is lower.

Indoor Games:
- Fraction Attack: Highest fraction card takes all.
- Trade Away: Trade cards with other poayers and become the first to make a whole..
- Fraction Solitaire: Beat the clock to make as many wholes as you can before time runs out.

Components:

100 fraction cards (Including Half's, Thirds, Fourths, Sixths, and Eighths)
15 Cips
1 Timer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Marketeer
description:
"An exciting game of skill and chance with all the thrill of Stock Exchange speculation", from the box lid.

The board looks interesting at first glance but prepare for disappointment. Players move round the track on the edge of the board (using the die) and they have a choice when they land on certain squares, to buy or sell stock. Chance cards here are called Ticker or Private Line cards. After an hour or so of play, the Markets close and players' stock are converted into cash. The winner is the player with the most money.

The game was produced in both a large box version and a small box version (but both had the same rules and components).

name: Turnover
description:
A word game that has elements of Reversi in that you turn over letters to your colour when you form a word.
2 player or a 4 player (partnership) game. Each player uses an identical set of 50 tiles, one marked with red, the other blue.
The first player lays down a letter, the second player lays a letter beside it (at the back or front). Play continues like this. If a player forms a word, all tiles in that word are turned over to his colour. Words are built up crossword fashion.
When all the letters have been used, the winner is the player with the most of his colour in the crossword.

name: Music Maestro Parade
description: Music Maestro introduces your child to the sights and sounds of the orchestra. Play the audio cassette, Listen to the sounds of 32 Instruments in a narrated parade, Learn to match the sounds with the instrument names and pictures in a "Lotto" game.

name: Gear Jacket
description:
Gear Jacket is a print-and-play combat-based game for two to four players. Each player takes on the role of a Gear Jacket pilot and battle his or her opponents in a variable arena.

In the not-too-distant future, a struggling television network gambled on the idea of a reality show about giant robots battling each other. The concept was a huge hit. Across the globe, young men and women dreamed of becoming Gear Jacket pilots and fighting for wealth and fame.

With Gear Jacket, you can take control of one of the famous Gear Jacket giant robots and take on one to three opponents!

There are twelve arena cards, each with six spots on which a player can land. Any number of these arena cards can be combined in any configuration to create the combat arena in which players will battle. Terrain tokens can be added to further diversify the arena.

There are twelve different Gear Jackets in the base game, with more planned for future expansions. Players select the Gear Jacket of their choice. Each player also takes five combat cards and a damage card. Each combat card represents a different section of the Gear Jacket--Head, Chest, Arms, etc. Combat is based on predicting the opponent's moves. The attacker selects two combat cards, while the defender chooses three. These cards are simultaneously revealed. Any cards revealed by the attacker that are not matched by the defender count as hits. Hits in different sections cause different amounts of damage, and may have extra penalties for the defender, as well.

There are also rules for game variants such as King of the Hill, Death Race 2000, and Tag that allow for further game diversity.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bloodline "The Family Tree"
description:
The Kings Health is failing. You have a very small claim to the throne; if only your bloodline were just a little stronger! Always a bright child, you realize that history is written by the winner and it’s time to think like a winner. You’re going to rewrite a little history. The problem is that your opponents are trying to rewrite history as well. Can you create the strongest bloodline and become the ruler of the land?

Stratagy, Hand Management, Bluffing and a liberal dose of fun are all mixed into this game.
140 cards
6 [You] cards in 6 colors
14 [wild] family tree cards (white)
120 family tree cards
20 in each of 6 colors

Each set contains
5 Great Grand Fathers (1 special)
5 Great Grand Mothers (1 special)
3 Grand Fathers (1 special)
3 Grand Mothers (1 special)
2 Fathers (1 special)
2 Mothers (1 special)
1 YOU card

Set up-
Take 1 set of cards for each player and the wild cards
Take the You cards for each of those sets and randomly distribute them to each player. This card is your color for this game. You will only score points for wild cards and your color played.
Shuffle all sets and the wild cards together and place them face down on the table where everyone can easily reach it.
Deal out 6 cards to each player
You are ready to begin.
On your Turn:
You may do only one of the following things on your turn.
Play 1 card
Draw 1 card
Discard 3 cards and draw 2
Swap an opponents played card with one from your hand
There is a hand limit of 7 cards. you may not have more that 7 cards in your hand at any time. (this included your YOU card.

You Start building your family Tree from your Great Grand Parents down to You. You must have played a Great Grand Father and a great Grand Mother next to each other (This creates a Mariage) in order to play a Grand Mother or Grand Father on that set.
A complete family tree will consits of 4 married Great Grand Parents. The Second row will have 2 sets of Maried Grand Parents. The third row of course will have Your Mother and Father. Last but certainly not least is you, in the fourth and final row.

The game ends when one player places their YOU card. At this point the round continues till everyone has the same number of plays, and points are tallied.
The person with the most points in their family tree is the winner of the game and becomes the ruler of the land.

Keeping your color secret from the other players as long as possible is a key factor in winning the game. If plyers dont know what color you are they cannot steal a card from your family tree.

name: Quble
description:
Quble – A Twisting, Turning, Fun Word Game!

It's a cross between Boggle and a Rubik's Cube.

To play Quble, players have the option to twist and turn the cube to build words in 60-second rounds using letters worth varying point values (point values are indicated on each letter). The strategy is to search for the most or longest words and accumulate the highest score possible. Each player must decide how to best allocate their play time between moving the cube or searching and calling out each word with its point value. Typically, a game consists of 2 to 5 rounds of play. Players compete for the highest score by adding up the letter values for all words appearing anywhere around the cube. The letters can wrap around the sides of the cube from one face to another and must links diagonally, vertically, or horizontally. In QUBLE JUMBLE and FIRST TO FORTY, scoring may be based upon the length of the word. The more letters in a word, the more points.

Besides word game play, QUBLE can also be played as a conventional brain teaser by matching up each face of the puzzle by solid colors.

Rulebook includes 7 variants, mostly in the scoring and win conditions.

name: Kings & Queens Rummy
description:
Kings & Queens Rummy is a variant on contract rummy in which each round consists of two separate hands and players must play certain combinations of sets and runs with each hand while working toward the bigger goal of playing all of one's cards first.

To set up a round, the 216 cards – four decks, plus eight wild cards – are shuffled and each player dealt two separate piles of eleven cards. Players swap piles, then choose one of the two piles they hold to serve as their Queen hand. On a turn, a player draws the top card of the deck or the top three cards on the discard pile, optionally plays sets and runs and plays off opponents, then discards one card. To open, a player must first play a set and run from the Queen hand of 3-7 cards. Once the player does this, she may meld additional cards and play off opponents.

Once a player has run out of cards in the Queen hand, she picks up the other pile – the King hand – and needs to play a set of 3-7 cards from this hand before being able to play off opponents once again. The round ends when a player runs out of cards in her King hand. The other players are penalized based on the value of cards remaining in hand, and the player with the lowest score after five rounds wins.

name: Popeye Knock Out
description: 36 cards featuring Popeye characters regularly seen in the TV version which started in 1961. Popeye is pictured on the box. The game play is simple. Each player gets a stack of cards. These remain face-down in front of him. The first player turns over the top card of his stack. If it is a character card, play passes to the next player. But if it is a Spinach card, the next player must 'Put' the nimber of cards indicated on the can of spinach (either 1, 2 or 3). If no more spinach is added whilst he is taking this action, all the cards played go to the player who played the spinach card and he puts them face-down under his stack.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Huckleberry Hound 'Booby'
description:
This is a slightly altered variant of Old Maid or Donkey. 36 cards featuring characters from The Huckleberry Hound Show, such as the Hound himself, Mr. Jinks, Yogi Bear and Pixie & Dixie.
Players must collect pairs of the same card. Curiously, the company have included two 'Booby' cards and added the instruction 'one is spare and should be removed before dealing'.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tilt Score
description:
Object of the game is to manipulate Your marbles into the scoring wheel and be the first player whose scoring wheel makes one complete revolution.

Each player places his marbles into the outside channel of his teeter board. A player's scoring wheel is the same color as his teeter board.
At the word "GO" players work their teeter board in a teeter-totter motion manipulating their marbles up & down the teeter board and through the opening, attempting to manuever them into the scoring wheel. The first player whose scoring wheel makes one complete revolution wins the game.

name: Reaching for the top
description:
In this game the players build a pyramid of glass marbles. Aim is to place the last marble on top of the pyramid.
Besides placing a new marble of his color on the board, a player can move one of his marbles already on the board by raising it one or two levels. Or a player can take back two marbles from the board by making a square using four of his own marbles.

This way a dynamic game is going on with a rising and shrinking pyramid.

name: Pinpoint the Bomber
description:
This is a book game. Published as a book it includes multiple black & white and color maps. There are 3 games described, the Red, the Green and the Black game.

The Black game is a solo effort to see how long it takes and how accurate you can be with determining your map pinpoints.

The Red game is meant for 4 players or fewer. It is a game of chance and is won by the first person to reach the bombing target (the German city of Coblenz).

The Green game is for any number of players, again as a game of chance but requires finding Pinpoints via Latitude and Longitude.

In the Red and Green games a number of aircraft set off from their base in Kent to bomb a target at Coblenz.

The games requires the player to copy and create miniature airplanes, Compass Rose, 10 deg angle indicator and Latitude/Longitude Finder.

The game includes maps as well as extensive briefing triggered by either a draw from a deck of cards or dice roll. The players continue to roll/draw cards until they land on the target by exact count. Any overshooting requires the bomber to fly back around.

A briefing can have extensive instructions causing the player to head off track or be attacked by enemy fighters ending in a change of course and position on the map.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Wargame, World War II

name: Sky Castles
description:
Sky Castles is a tile and worker placement game where the players collect gemstones from castles in the clouds. The theme is aimed at children, but the game claims to provide scope for strategic play at all levels.

The tiles depict a cloudscape dotted with gemstones. Each turn the player selects one of four face-up tiles and places it into the cloudscape so that the borders match adjacent tiles, and can optionally place a sprite token to claim a cloud or section of sky.
