There are three scoring rounds where the players score points for the gemstones that their sprites have claimed.

The gameplay is similar to other tile placement games (e.g. Carcassonne) but Sky Castles has less complexity and claims to be suitable for a younger audience while retaining similar strategic options.

name: Tic Tac Throw
description:
Aim! Throw! Claim a square! Or knock your opponent out of there!

The classic 2-player skill game Tic Tac Toe just got more action-packed with Tic Tac Throw! Players must throw the cubes with "x" and "o" on the vinyl board in right places to form the row.
Try to be the first to get Tic Tac Toe!

name: Socker
description:
Socker is a two player breakthrough abstract board game that simulates a soccer or rugby-like game where socking opposing pieces is a means to the end zone.

Socker is played on a 9x11 field, 9 columns and 11 rows. Each player has five man tokens (for example meeples), called sockers, and there is a ball token.

To set up the game, the ball is placed in the center space of the board. Players toss a coin to see who plays first. Starting with the toss winner, each player places all his or her sockers upright on any empty spaces that are in their nearest half of the field, but not adjacent (vertically, horizontally or diagonally) to the ball and not in the center row.

Players continue alternating turns and do the following.

On a turn, a player must perform one to three actions listed below using any of his or her upright (referred to as active) sockers.

Move. An active socker may be moved to any adjacent empty space. This includes the goal and out of bounds areas. However, at the end of a player’s turn, no more that three of his or her sockers may be in the goal and out of bounds regions.
Kick. If an active socker is adjacent to the ball, the ball may be kicked directly away one space provided the destination space is empty.

Sock. If an active socker is adjacent to an opponent’s socker, then the opponent’s socker may be pushed directly away one space provided the destination space is empty. The pushed socker is then put on its side to indicate that it is inactive and will not be able to perform any actions for one turn.

Any action or active socker may be used multiple times. Player may use any combination of actions and active sockers, and in any order they like.

When a player completes his or her actions all that player’s inactive sockers are put upright and become active again. This ends the player’s turn.

The goal of the game is to kick the ball over your goal line, into your farthest 1x9 row. Players can choose either of the following winning conditions: first to score a set number of goals (usually one), or most goals after a set number of turns followed by sudden death if necessary. After a goal, players should use the setup procedures with the non-scoring player going first. For sudden death, only two sockers per player are used, and a coin toss is used to determine who plays first.

Special Rules

Out of Bounds: The first and last columns of the playing field excluding the goal spaces are out of bounds. If the ball is pushed out of bounds, the ball is immediately moved to the center space of the same row. If the center space is occupied, the owner of the occupying socker can choose any empty space adjacent to the center space.

Repeat Positions: When a position is repeated, the player that plays next gets one extra action (total of four instead of three) to break the deadlock.

Static Positions: The maximum number of sockers on the edge is three. This prevents unmovable defensive positions behind the goal line or along the sides of the board. That is, positions where the offensive player can not push the ball or an opponent's socker.

name: Tenis: Diana
description: This is a very simple, turn-based, game, aimed mainly at kids. The objetive is to score the more points possible, using little rackets to throw some badminton-like plastic cones into a score field. The one who get the most points, wins.

name: Gold Stock
description:
This game is composed of eighteen wooden chips (pawns) in two colors (nine for each player) and a board with seventy-seven cells, of which eighteen are marked with two different colors.

Each player place his pawns in their respective colour cells and the game begins. Players move their pawns alternately one by one. The movement is one square forward or sideways, but never diagonally or backward. It’s forbidden not move a pawn in the player's turn.

When a player, after moving a pawn, trap a chip of the other player between two of his own, that chip is removed. Only one chip can be removed in each turn.

The game ends when no piece can be moved forward, being all in the last cell. The player who gets the most pawns to the last row of the board, opposite to the area in which he started, wins the game.

This game is part of the rare "Club series" from NAC, a company more known for his wargames than for this kind of abstract games. The other known titles from this series are: The Backbone, Manhattan and Daiquiri

name: Tifon 4
description:
4 spinning tops for 4 different games, that's essentially Tifon (Typhoon) 4.

Although other elements like marbles or a shooting platform are included, the metal spinnings tops, identified as "spaceships" in the gamer's manual, are the main element in the different games described:

-Cosmic Soccer: The marbles are placed in the center of the field and, then, a special spinning top is released on it, throwing the marbles into the different scored goals on each side of the field. The player with the most points, wins.

-Starship stop: A spinning top it's thrown into a flat surface and the players try to "catch" it with the shooting platform and its magnetic projectile. 10 points are given to the one who catch the top and 5 to the one who just knock it down.

-Competition: The players spin their tops and the one with the top that falls last, wins.

-Fight: The four tops are thrown into the field and crash against each other. The player with the last top standing, wins.

The manual encourages the players to create it's own games and variations, and suggest some possibilities.

name: Imperial General
description:
In Imperial General, the armies are equal, the odds are equal, the strengths are equal, the difference is you!
In Imperial General both sides have identical decks and start in identical setups. Then, each turn, the players select what their next formation change, or order, will be for the next turn. The changes are compared and a matrix on the bottom of each card shows how may points your opponent loses.
Rounds continue until one side has lost an entire company. THen the game ends and the side with the most points (men) remaining-wins.
Imperial General is part of the Warcoach Games "10 Minute War Game" series.

name: Senator Please
description: Players move around the board to complete with all "Senators" and 48 state questions (which is the amount of states in the USA at the time). They have to collect enough cards and answer "special" question to become President and win the game.

name: Autobackgammon
description:
When backgammon became a fad in the early seventies, the game went from that thing on the back of inexpensive checker boards to the gambling rage of the jet set.

This solitaire game was created to cash in on the craze. Sixty pre-programmed games have been divided into four courses of fifteen games. Place one of the games into the tray. Using the slides in the frame of the tray, the player only sees one move at a time. After sizing up any given situation, the player advances a slide to see what backgammon champion Tim Holland would have done.

The game contains the tray, a really cheap backgammon set, thirty two game cards and rules.

name: The KINGPIN! Game
description:
The PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
"Finish them! Before they finish you!"

Gain the reign of the nefarious organized underground.

Rollers (players) will gamble and make deals, purchase and flip (sell) from the various high-end illicit contraband markets (on domestic soil/US & foreign lands).

This is a roll-and-move game. Rollers roll the dice and move their game piece throughout The KINGPIN! Game world's cities, states and countries. As rollers travel The KINGPIN! Game world they are allowed to buy or sell available products, pick a PUSH YOUR LUCK card (like "chance" or "community chest") which gives rollers a 50/50 chance of getting or losing monies. Rollers can also gamble in "La$ Vega$", "3Card MONT3 CARLO", or "AC", for their chance at the 7 / 11 jackpot roll. Rollers must increase their wealth and their worth while eliminating all street competition.

Rollers can hire one of The KINGPIN! Game's paid "KILLA$" to attempt to assassinate other rollers in The KINGPIN! Game, done by paying for hire - The KINGPIN! "KILLA$" (hit-men/assassins). The KINGPIN! "KILLA$" are hired killers in The KINGPIN! Game that operate for various fees/costs {$75,000 - $1M}.

The goal of The KINGPIN! Game is to be the last one standing! The solo survivor ~ the realized vision of the primary objective...

The KINGPIN!

The KINGPIN! Game comes with:
The Official The KINGPIN! game rule book and soundtrack
(hard copy of the rule book and CD with rules set to KINGPIN! MU$IK as well as a The KINGPIN! Game related score/sound Track) on one CD
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Economic, Mafia, Mature / Adult, Music, Negotiation, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: My Conquest Is a Sea of Stars
description:
Based off of the cult classic series of science fiction novels, Legend of the Galactic heroes tells the story of two empires in space, fighting a war for total control. On one side, the Free Planets Alliance, a corrupt democracy lead by a charismatic fraud, and on the other side, The Empire, a Benevolent Monarchy, lead by the Imperial Kaiser.

Legend of the Galactic Heroes: My Conquest is a Sea of Stars. puts you in command of one of these nations, on the eve of war, will you come out victorious, or will the underhanded dealings of your neighbor with the neutral world of Phezzan put you at a loss.

Game play is based around two boards, one is the strategic board where you command all the resources of your nation, and the other is the tactical board, where you can fight out the battles between massive fleets, numbering in the thousands.

Complexity - Moderate, only slightly more complex then a game of Axis and Allies.

Length - In Excess of Ten hours for a full game, individual battles take up to thirty minutes or so.

Suitability for Solitaire Play - Moderate, some elements of the game revolve around hidden units, but the rules for that are easily removed.
categories: Economic, Novel-based, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Abel-Klingers "Grosse Fahrschule"
description:
Goal: Be the first, who visits all 12 lettered points (A-M) avoiding major mistakes

1 Preparing the map first you have to cut trees, buildings, a bridge and glue/insert these into the
board, place policemen...
2 Follow the streets/roads in recommended directions by rolling the die
3 Stop at lettered places (and policemen)
4 Explain the traffic signs you pass by; various mistakes will lead to penalties

name: Unsere Lufthansa
description:
Goal: Be the first to travel with 'Lufthansa GDR' from Berlin via Praha to Budapest

1. Choose your coloured plastic plane and roll the die by turns - you may start with a '6' at once, otherwise follow a circuit - Kicking your teammate(s) is not allowed
2. Follow instructions if you land on a marked area
3. Stopover in Praha
4. Step out in Budapest and win - that's it

name: Geus en Spanjool
description:
This game is situated in the low countries during the revolt against Spain, resulting in the independency of the Dutch Republic.
One player takes the Spanish side and the other the Dutch. Control of the land is achieved by controlling the various cities. To signify the control each city is covered with a chit which has a Spanish side and a Dutch side.
At the beginning of the game the players decide on the number of rounds they will play (about 10 rounds per hour can be played, 20 to 30 round are recommended) and a die is rolled for each city. On a roll of 1, 2 or 3 the Spanish side is up, on 4, 5 or 6 the Dutch side. Each player gets three leaders to control their armies and 15 units of infantry. The Spanish get an extra two units of cavalry and the Dutch two units of naval troops (watergeuzen)
Each round both players roll a die. Their separate scores are the number of action points they have for that round. The combined number of both dies is used to decide on a random effect to be carried out before the round is started.
Victory points can only be scored as the result of a specific random effect. For each province (there are 16 provinces with 1 to 8 cities) where one players controls all cities that player scores a victory point for each city in the province.
The player with the highest roll starts the round, in case of a tie the Spanish player. Units are moved over the board by leaders, they cannot move alone. The naval units can move independently but only from one coastal city to another. Movement costs actions. A player can conquer cities by spending action points storming, starving or tricking them. A random event can cause the city to change its alliance at the start of a new round as well.
Battles between armies are a special affair: both sides take only one turn rolling dies, one die for a unit of infantry, three for cavalry and three for each point their best leaders ability is higher than the other players best leaders. First the defending player rolls the dies, scoring a hit for each 6 rolled. Then, after taking her losses, the attacker does the same, the defender taking her losses. The winner of the battle is the player who rolled the most sixes or, when both rolled the same number, the defender. The defeated player loses the entire army, both units and leaders!
After the last round there is a final victory point calculation. In this calculation a point is awarded for each city the player controls, regardless of province control.

name: Win the Spell Card Battle
description:
User summary:

A light-weight card game, a version of UNO, based on characters from Project Shrine Maiden, a series of amateur shooting games for Windows.

Of a deck consisting of coloured cards numbered 0–9 and some cards with special effects, players are dealt 7 cards each. A card from the deck is drawn and placed on the table, and the starting player may then only play a card from his hand that matches number or colour. If he can't, he must draw a card from the deck. Play goes on until someone managed to get rid of all his cards and thus wins.

Of the cards with special effects, there are cards that change the turn order, cards that jump the next player's turn, cards that forces the next player to draw cards, wild cards that change colour, counter cards that counter whatever the latest effect was, and so on.

About every single card has a unique illustration.

name: La gara motociclistica
description:
It reproduces the development of a race of motorbike of the duration of 4 turns.
Every player chooses a motorbike and takes the relative card with tachometer.
Using of the cards movement he moves himself to us along the distance. Who wins arrives for first to the goal.
Contained: map he represents a track, cards, 4 motorbike in plastic, 4 cards with tachometer and handbook.

name: Do-D√©
description:
Goal: Be the first to get rid of all taken 'Dominoes'-cards

Game consists of 2 black/red dice and 78 cards, which show two different sides - halfway through
printed in red and black with symbols from 1 to 6, infrequently a joker.

1. Each player draws 6 cards
2. Roll the dice: If someone owns a card with matching symbols he/she may start putting this side up in the middle of the table. If no one has a matching card all the players must draw an additional one and roll the dice again.
3. Now proceed adding your cards by turn according 'Dominoes', but you must roll the dice first or you choose the dice result of your predecessor: Only the those numbers can be placed with matching numbers to cards on the table AND on the dice; a Joker may be placed at any combination. During your turn you may add further cards, which have to match with cards on the table only.
4. If you have finished your turn draw a new card from the pile
5. Check the dice results of the other players carefully; if you possess a matching card the turn is yours, as long as you are quick enough
6. Placing your last card on the table - you win
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Dungeon of Dread
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Fantastic treasure lies deep within the Dungeon of Dread, but to find it you must survive a deadly gauntlet. Heroes band together to form adventuring parties and face off against monsters and villains in the dungeon—but the adventure doesn't end there!

Dungeon of Dread is an exciting, cooperative board game experience in which heroes unite in battle to achieve a common goal and defeat the enemies standing in their way. If they succeed, glory and fortune will be theirs for the taking. If they fail, all could be lost!

This cooperative board game experience is designed for 2-5 players, ages 10 and up. One player is the Dungeon Master who runs the villains and monsters; the remaining players are the heroes. The game includes four adventures, each one featuring a unique villain.

Update, August 11, 2011

Apparently Dungeon of Dread was not as "exciting" as Wizards of the Coast hoped for, as the company announced at Gen Con 2011 that the title was no longer scheduled for release.

name: Street FM
description:
User summary:
A basic set of skirmish-level miniatures rules for urban combat between street gangs, law enforcement, special forces, etc. Game scale is 1:1 with each figure representing individual fighters, vehicles, etc. Each turn equals 5 seconds of "real" time and the ground scale is 1.5 centimeters equals 1 meter. These rules are intended for use with 28-30mm miniatures but could easily be adapted to smaller scales. Individual models are assigned individual skill levels (Streetwise, Brawling, Ranged Combat) and are given an allotment of Option Points to further customize each figure. Players equip each of their forces based on an Equipment Points system which allows them to add weapons, ammo, and miscellaneous equipment. Combat rules cover close combat, ranged, and special weapons such as RPGs and other heavy arms.

From the introduction:
'Street F.M.' is designed to represent small-scale conflict in a modern or near future urban environment. By employing scale models to represent the combatants and their surroundings it is possible to create clashes between street gangs, criminals, law enforcers and small military units. In fact any group entering urban combat, armed with everything from improvised weapons through to rocket launchers can be covered by the system.

name: Teach Key Math
description: A 3M EduPLAYtional game. A "schoolhouse" holds cards that show basic math problems. Insert the key (a peg) into the hole with the correct answer and the card will slide free. Pick the wrong answer and the card is held in place. A very simple educational game, the math version of Teach Key Reading and Spelling.

name: Barbie Just Us Girls
description:
With a spin of the wheel, you must tell your secrets or take the challenge! Game makes childern act out or dance various Barbie scenerios, such as "Reciting a favorite Poem", Doing a 1 Minute Aerobic Routine, Changing Barbie's clothes in 30 Seconds or trying to do different dance routines. Try to Collect Cards w/Barbie Fashions, Cars & Other Accessories to Win! Sounds easy, right? However, a spink of the Barbie Wheel tells you if first you must tell a secret or perform a Barbie Challenge, such as Accepting an Award lik Superstar Barbie.

Components:

random spinning wheel,
25 What To Wear cards,
25 Going In Style cards,
25 Places to Go cards,
5 Ken cards,

name: Mystery Maze
description: The Inscrutable Game of Skill and Luck. The object of the game is to guide all the marbles, one at a time, into the hole in the game center, and score the most points in each round

name: Un Milione al Secondo
description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors trying to answer questions on movie, music and sport subjects. The game develops in 2 phases. In the first phase, players collect points according to the difficulty of the trial by answering the questions or guessing the caricature of famous characters; in the second one, each player will have to answer to a number of questions on a subject chosen between movie, music and sport equal to the collected score divided by 3; for each correct answer, the player earns 3 millions £. The player who scores higher wins.

name: Transport: A Fascinating Card Game
description:
60 cards, featuring Goods Cards, Conveyance Cards and Obstruction Cards.
It is a trick-taking game really, but quite advanced for its age. The first player in any round must offer a Goods Card. The next player may offer a Conveyance Card, suitable for carrying the Goods on offer. If he does, he collects the Goods Card. The third player may play an Obstruction to this arrangement and snaffle the Goods himself.
The winner is the player who collects the highest tonnage of Goods.

name: Dealer's Choice
description:
Players lays the tiles on the gameboard playing:
Gin Rummy, Canasta, Poker, Fan Tan, Black Jack and Solitaire.
Some bonus squares in the game board are marked as cards and if players place the tile to any of this bonus squares they recieve high score.

Components:

game board
108 tiles, equal to two decks of cards, plus four jokers
4 tile racks.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Ghoulash: Scenario Pack 3
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Features these three classic GHOULASH scenarios: "Now, Where Was I?" "Password" and "Pyramid Scheme".

SCENARIO: NOW, WHERE WAS I?

Warp zones keep you starting over time and again.

SCENARIO: PASSWORD

It's a Ghoul hunt! No, it's a word puzzle! No, it's both!

SCENARIO: PYRAMID SCHEME

No mummies in this pyramid, just plenty of Ghouls!

name: ThriveTime for Teens
description:
Players pick cards from the draw deck and make decisions based on the information given on each card. Document your decisions on your Game Sheet and move your Player Piece on the Board.

Some of the Choices You Will Make: Is it the right time to buy a car? How will I pay for college? Should I start a part time business? Should I pay for those concert tickets with cash or use my credit card? etc.

Thrive Score measures the decisions you make in the game.
Good decisions = positive Thrive; poor decisions = negative Thrive. Everyone starts out with a zero Thrive Score (Survive).

You WIN if your Player who's game piece reaches Thrive first wins the game.

name: J√§ger und F√ºchse
description:
Goal: Be the first who has captured 4 foxes

1 Hunters and foxes are placed on the tagged spaces of the board
2 Players roll the die by turn and try to catch a fox; you may move horizontal, vertical or
diagonal, but not in combination - excact number, jumping not allowed
3 Jump on the fox if you roll appropiate number
4 With appropiate number you may jump on an opponent's hunter if he carries one or more foxes
- he is sent back to his base immidiately
5 Foxes delivered to the base are safe

name: Gef√§hrliche Br√ºcken
description:
Goal: Be the first who fills up all 7 empty own target spaces

1. Each player places all meeples on his/her base
2. Roll the 2 dice by turns - with a '6' you have to put one of your meeples on the starting area
3. Move your meeple(s) by rolling the dice - you may use either one die or the other
4. Catching an opponent => you aquired a prisoner you may use for to fill up your targets, too
5. Rolling a double you catch all meeples on a line (bridge) - you may choose - at once

name: City of Brass: a game of colonial exploration
description:
from the introduction:
The Expedition Afrique

In 1892, the French led a military campaign in Dahomey, the "Slave Coast" between Nigeria and Togo, against its kings so that they might have control of Porto Novo, a coastal city. They marched all the way to Abomey, the capital of the land, and found the rulers gone. They amused themselves by looting the city for souvenirs. The French press was most impressed by a white parasol decorated with human jawbones.

They never saw the inside of that parasol. Inside it was a map drawn in human blood, a map that pointed to a legendary city deep in Afrca's interior. This city was called the City of Brass, a bastion of ancient African civilization full of treasure, both gold and knowledge.

Sadi Carnot, the president of France, sent a expedition on that doomed journey. It only took three weeks for them to become hopelessly lost in an uncharted land. To this day, no one knows what happened to them. According to legend, only one of them made it, and his greatest wishes were given unto him.

In this game, you will play those lost souls. Trapped in Africa's interior, with a map drawn on a parasol and not enough resources, you search.

A note about the content of this game

While there is no magic in this game, it is a fantasy. The nobility found among the people of Africa is not balanced against the savagery found here. Like all peoples, the historic Africans had both high nobility and awful destruction found in them. Even though this game depicts the negative side of culture disproportionally, the author is fully aware that is not the only side, or even the dominant side.

User summary:
This game is a form of highly abstracted, limited scope role-playing game with a fixed set of characters and goals.

Each player takes one of 6 different pre-defined characters: the Explorer, the Official, the Doctor, the Priest, the Naturalist, and the Native Guide. A minimum of 4 players is recommended and one player must play the Explorer. The Explorer nominates the Leader and the Leader selects a Companion. The Leader narrates the obstacles that face the expedition.

Each player must name their character (a French sounding name is recommended) and answer the question: what does your character seek in the City of Brass.

Each character has 6 predefined statistics and each Ability has a corresponding Resource that replenishes it . The Resources are drawn from a deck of resource cards during play.

The game is divided in 5 Acts, in each of the first four Acts there are 5 Obstacles. The fifth act is the City of Brass and final scoring is done at the end of this act.

Points are scored by defeating the obstacles and players may help one another during play, but are free to refuse help. Obstacles are defeated by rolling a pool of dice against the target set by the Leader for that obstacle. The number of dice rolled is determined by the Ability that is required to defeat it.

Each player totals their Quest Points earned during play and plays out the endgame story. The endgame has a blind voting/bluff mechanism that offers a point bonus based on player voting, bluffing is possible during the vote count.

At the end of play, the player with the most points is the winner. Ties are possible.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Jokk
description:
Jokk means "all is correct in legally" in Estonia.

There are a 101 colored spaces in gameboard where players move.from 1 to 101.
1-40 spaces are for local level
41-82 spaces are for state level
83-100 spaces are for upper class level

In his turn player roll the die, move his pawn and draw a card same color as space he stands. Different colors mean different categories of questions: Varia, Local, State, Internatinal, President. Player who answer correctly gives 1 point. Wrong answer gives -1 point.
Player may move to next higer level if he has at least 5 points to give or he must take another round to get more points.
Player who reach first in 101th "Jokk" area wins the game.

name: Junior Couch Potato Game
description: A cartoon-watching game designed to teach children to observe carefully while watching TV. Kids search each cartoon for a series of objects or characters shown on their hand of playing cards or on the game board. The first to spot them all is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Apostles
description:
Apostles is a card game for 2-4 players. Players compete to be the first to play out their entire hand of cards in numerical order, while alternating colors, onto any of the four starting piles. Simon/Peter(#1) cards can start new piles in the corners of the gameplay area. Based on the classic game "King's Corners", Apostles is a fun way to learn about the 12 Apostles.

Great for Sunday Schools, Youth Groups and Family Game Nights. Part of the Sporadic Games Educational Line.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Number, Party Game, Religious

name: Arrr!
description: Arrr! is a semi-cooperative pirate game where the players control pirates on a ship and try to board the enemy, get treasures and gold and don't get sunk. Internal struggles forces munitys and backstabbing but the players can only survive as a team. If the ship sinks, all players lost, if the game ends, the player with the most gold in his treasurechest wins.

name: Edelsteinsuche
description:
Each player tries to complete a row of five numbered cards with one kind of precious stone.
There are four kinds of stones. Each player secretly has a kind of stone that s/he collects, and a row of five face-down cards in front of him/her. In a turn, a player takes a card from another player and looks at it. If it is the kind of stone s/je is looking for, s/he places the card face-down in front of him/her (in the right position, 1-5). If it is a different kind of stone, the card can go to any of the other positions. In any case the card that was in that position before goes to the position of the card that was drawn.
A player who reveals what kind of stone s/he is looking for gets two bonus moves.
The first player to complete the row of five cards of his/her preferred kind in the right order is the winner.

The game was published in WIN - Das Spielejournal 418 in January 2011.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
publishers: √ñsterreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., WIN: Das Spielejournal

name: Dodgem
description:
There is no date on the rules but the style of the graphics and shape of the vehicles suggest post 1945 and likely to be in the early 1950's.

The mechanics of the game is similar in style to ludo/pachisi but involves moving both a pedestrian and a vehicle from Home to Base to win. The four routes around the board intercept each other. The pedestrian dodge the motorists to avoid being knocked down and sent to hospital. The vehicles avoid the pedestrians as well as the police car to avoid being sent to prison.

A die is thrown and as you move along your route you hope to avoid landing on the many penalty square which may throw you into the path of other players' vehicles or pedestrians

Every time a 6 is thrown the police car is moved to try and catch jaywalkers and cars

name: Fancy Nancy Going Places Game
description:
Visit all of Fancy Nancy's favorite spots, collecting Souvenir Tokens as you go. When your luggage is covered with mementos of where you've been, race home as fast as you can. The first one home is the winner.

Encourages simple decision making and strategic thinking; visual interpretation and social skills.

Game contains 1 Board, 1 Spinner, 4 Fancy Nancy Game Pieces, 4 Suitcase Boards, and 16 Souvenir Tokens.

Age 5 and up.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Force of Fiction
description: 2-4 players take turns influencing a central character in an attempt to end each chapter of her life to their advantage. The several mechanics that drive the game; playing color-based scenery cards in connection to her location, drawing tokens with positive or negative words on them, and taking 'characterized' actions -will all be used by the players to tell the story as it happens. Whichever player's decisions had the strongest influence on the story, wins!

name: Red Sun
description: This puzzle puts brain versus brain in the spot light. All around the red sun! In this game, two players must face off with each other. Each gets two pegs to use. Players take turn moving a peg from one of the holes to the other. The first player to make it so the other cannot move loses and will not get the glory of the red sun! It is a think quick act quick game. The rules do not allow for time to think and strategize. You must be on your toes and always think one step ahead!

name: minifig World: BATTLELINES
description:
BATTLELINES is a collectible card game based on LEGO miniatures. However using miniatures is not required for game play.

Each Character card represents a miniature of miniFig World. Other cards types include Equipment and Weapons.

The game play is simple and battles are resolved with a dice D6. It is a 2 player game, with a customizable deck.
BATTLELINES uses a unique system to keep track of Characters Ammo and Health using LEGO studs attached to each Character card.

Legendary miniFig Characters like "Brodie SARGE Munro" battle against each other using their Power (PWR) and Defence (DEF) and whatever Equipment or Weapons are available to beat their opponents.

miniFig World is an Australian based internet business which specialises in LEGO miniatures and accessories.

name: Destination: Rain Forest
description:
This is an educational game to help with speech and communication skills using a rain forest theme.

A Game of Syntax, Morphology, and Phonology.

Contents include:
- Rain forest gameboard
- 5 card decks
- 21 token cards
- 7 token boards
- 4 playing pieces

There are 2 versions included in the rules:
- 1: secure more token cards than any other player. You receive a token card when you land on the "Explore the rain forest" square and answer a question correctly.
- 2: be the first to secure the three specific tokens that correspond to the token board held by the player. You do this by landing on a desired space that matches a space on your token board and correctly answer a question.

name: Hank's Golf Resort
description:
Hank Powerman’s dream was to run the perfect golf resort. He’d just won the one million dollar lottery; problem is, he doesn’t know how to design one. That’s where you come in. Hank will hire you to design the world’s greatest golf course.

In this unique card game, players must build a golf course by buying holes, and amenities (IE Pro Shop, Pool area, etc.), then using your "Fore!" cards that you were dealt with in the beginning of the game, by constructing your course, laying down the cards on the table making sure the cart path connects with each other. Continue to lay the cards until you have all 18 holes on your course, but beware your opponents can sabotage your course with gophers and floods. Don't forget, you also need employees to help you run Hank's Resort to help you combat your opponent's disasters.

"Its a game that's Par for the Course!"

name: Roll Around
description:
This is a handheld action/skill game. By tilting and rotating the tube, try to maneuver the ball around the inside track. It's tricky but FUN for the whole family! The perfect score is 23, achieved by moving the ball back and forth across the track 4 times.

Components:

Roll Around game unit,
two steel balls

name: The Slippery Slope
description:
The Slippery Slope is a board game designed to help players open up and deal with their emotions and feelings that are associated with the grief they feel when separated, going through a divorce or living through the aftermath of a single parent family.

Each player selects either a frog, race car or person, and starts moving down the slope. The slope is labeled for the stages you go through – Denial, Bargaining, Depression, Forgiveness, and Acceptance.

Each player receives one Grace Card at the beginning of the game. As each player rolls the die they will move 1, 2,or 3 spaces. As they move ahead they will have to either select an Action Card (a question designed to ask – What would you do…) or a Feelings Card (a question designed to ask – How would you feel…) Every now and then they may land on a miss a turn or move ahead or behind space. Depending on their roll, they may also acquire additional Grace Cards. The Grace Cards can be used at any time if they select a question they may choose to pass on. First one to reach Acceptance wins the game.

name: 'Inventus-Patentus'
description:
A "roll a die and move" round a track game where one buys/charges royalties on patents rather than streets in the Monopoly manner when players land on these squares. Having adjacent sets of patents enables enhanced royalties to be charged.
There is an added quiz element whereby when a play lands on an un-owned square, they may obtain the property for free if they can answer a question of the "Who invented ...." form.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Yrrr' it!
description:
Two classic games - Hot Potato and Tag - are rolled into one with the talking musical disc!

Yrrr' It! is the fun new game that will have the whole neighborhood hopping, skipping and rolling around with excitement! Music starts to begin "Hot Potato" as the disc is passed from player to player. If you are the last player to touch the disc before the buzzer then... Yrrr' It! To avoid getting tagged, all other players must jump, hop, skip, and even somersault away as commands are spoken from the talking disc. Careful, you'll never know what the talking disc will say or how much time you have before the buzzer sounds in this wildly hilarious game where the winner is truly up in the air!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Slap-Shot Hockey
description: Players try to slap the puck into the opponent's goal with his stick in the hockey-board.

name: Match Point Tennis
description: Cadaco Match Point Tennis takes the Cadaco Bas-Ket game and adds a twist - rackets. The two players volley back and forth over the net playing by the rules of tennis using the standard flipper mechanism. Each player also has a racket which he can use to block shots.

name: Bistourisq
description:
Bistouris is a game of plastic surgery.
Each player is a patient AND a doctor.

The game takes place in two rounds.

First round, each player roll dice, move on the board and draw cards to create their own (and awful) bodies.
When the body of each player is done, the second round begin.

At the begining of the second round, each player draw a "perfect body" card to know what they need to change on their bodies.
Now players roll dice and move again on the board and try to reach on "surgery" squares to have surgery from other players... but beware... surgical procedures may fail and you end up with a body worse than before and you have twice as much work !!!
Other players bet on the result of the surgery and if it fail, the surgeon must explain what's went wrong.

The first player who manages to have a perfect body (as his "perfect body" card") is the winner
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tabakitaba
description:
Tabakitaba is an educational and fun game on tabacco.
A bit of monopoly, a hint of trivial pursuit, an inch of strategy game and some educational datas on tabacco.

One player play the tabacco industry and other players are citizens.

The goal for the tabacco industry is to convert up to citizens to smoking.
The goal for the citizens is to safeguard their health and stop smoking.

Players move on a board (the city) consting of several kind of squares (events, temptation, disease risks, tobaccological consultation) and a hex map (the rural) where citizens and tobacco industry can plant cereals or tobacco.

At the end, the player with the best health is the winner and the tobacco industry too if there are more smokers than non-smokers.
categories: Educational, Party Game, Territory Building, Trivia
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grunt Deluxe: Castles Expansion Set
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The 3D Castles Expansion Set provides you with additional modular card stock castle pieces to allow you to customize the shape and size of your Grunt castle. It also provides an additional 3D city and siege towers, ballisti, and more.

name: 18NAC
description: 18NAC is an 18xx game that includes railroads across the North American Continent. 18NAC is played on a 55" by 34" map depicting northern Mexico, southern Canada, and the continental United States. The game includes 29 U.S. railroads, 14 in the East and 15 in the West, as well as 5 Mexican companies and the Canadian Pacific. The game includes several mechanics that are unique to the 18xx genre, including a system of subsidiaries (rather than privates) that allow players to customize their railroads, an anonymous auction, and land grant companies.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simulation, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: History of War: Axis Troops
description:
Publisher Blurb:

History of War (HoW) presents the Second World War from the tactical point of view of units. Retaliatory weapons, atomic bombs or personal names like those of generals are deliberately excluded from the game.

The goal of the game is a conquest of land cards until 15 win points are accumulated. This is accomplished by bringing together units from all three arenas of the war: land, sea, and air.

The Axis starter deck contains 55 cards and a rulesheet. The deck is fully playable. Each player needs their own deck to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Bridal Shower Pictionary
description:
In Bridal Shower Pictionary game each team chooses a Picturist for the first round. A Picturist is the person who will sketch for their team. One Pictionary card is selected out of the bowl. Each Picturist looks at the bridal shower theme word and begin sketching for their team when time is started. Remember not to use letters of numbers in your sketch. The first team to guess the word correctly in one minute or less scores a point on the score card. The Picturist rotates for each team and play continues until one team has scored 10 points.

Game for 2 teams

name: Teletubbies Match & Stamp
description:
With three different ways to play, the Teletubbies Match & Stamp game is both an activity kit and a game. It comes with 4 cans of different-colored Play-Doh; 12 Teletubbies stampers that fit nicely into their own sturdy holder; 6 Teletubbies cards, each with 4 different images; and 4 plastic trays, plus a wooden roller for rolling out the Play-Doh. Players match the pictures on the stampers to the pictures on their Teletubbies card. The corresponding Teletubbies images are then pressed into the Play-Doh with the stampers.

Just roll the dough, pick a stamper and make a picture.
In the beginners' game, the youngest fans will search for "lookalikes," matching stamper pictures with pictures on their cards. In the next two games, the stamper pictures are hidden: Pick a stamper - who's got matching picture?

Components:

12 Teletubbies Stampers
4 Cans of Playdoh
6 Teletubbies Cards
4 Plastic Trays
Stamper Holder
Wooden Roller

name: Rosetta
description:
Rosetta is a boardless tile-laying game with hex-tiles. Each tile (except 3 extra-tiles showing a rose) shows one of the numbers from 1 to 7. They are available in four player colours and 7 times as white. The white ones are the general supply, forming three stacks, so the three top tiles are available. Each player has the tiles of his own colour as a "personal supply".
Gameplay: On a player`s turn, he can choose either a white top tile or a tile from his personal supply and place it adjacent to any tile(s) already placed on the table. It is allowed to place any white tile adjacent to any other tile, but coloured tiles must not be adjacent to other coloured ones. Aim of the game is to create as many "perfect Rosettas" as possible: groups of seven tiles, with a tile of your colour as the centre and 6 white tiles with the other six numbers surrounding it, which is 10 points worth in the final score. If one or more tiles of 7 tiles show the same number, the "doubles" are subtracted from the 10 points. Rose-tiles are "jokers" and stand for any number a scoring player wants.
The game ends, when all tiles are placed, or all coloured tiles are surrounded.

name: The Acts of the Disciples
description:
Players take on the role of Jesus’ Disciples, traveling with Jesus through Palestine and performing deeds consistent with His teachings. But the actions the players will take will not always be received favorably by the three factions that will determine the fate of Judea — the Jews, who alternate between loving and resenting Jesus; Rome, which is not interested in Jesus but simply wants to impose civility and order, and the Pharisees, who abhor Jesus and who, as their anger increases, are looking for a member of Jesus’ inner circle to betray Him…

Each turn, players receive 4 actions, which they may spend traveling to one of the cities in Palestine, drawing action cards, spending action cards to perform a Deed in a city, or requesting Jesus to perform a Deed. Deeds come in four categories (preach, heal, exorcise a demon, or show compassion), and the cost of performing a Deed increases with each Deed performed in that category. But players can call on Jesus to perform a Deed, which resets that category's cost track and awards players present in the area with Gospel tokens. Most of the Deeds also result in consequences on one or more of the political tracks, representing the crowds, the Pharisees, or Rome.

The game ends either when the Rome track reaches its end (indicating that Jesus and the Disciples have attracted too much attention and Rome decides to intervene), or when the player who was dealt the Judas card elects to end the game, and receives the payout indicated on the Pharisees track.

The players' score is comprised of victory points received from the Deeds they performed, the Gospel tokens they accumulated, and the conditions described on their secret Goal cards that they received at the start of the game.

name: Colors & Shapes Game
description:
From the box:

A fun game where children learn shapes and colors. Spin to collect game tiles to complete their colorful mystery picture.

No reading required.

name: Lester Patrick's Official Hockey Game
description: This game came in two formats one that used a die but earlier versions came with a spinner for randomization. The players are printed on the board and movement is the puck from square to square. There are printed squares on the board that if you take the puck to will can cause penalties to the opposing player in various ways including giving you a penalty shot on goal from a designated spot on the board that is also resolved with a die roll.

name: Frozen Front
description:
Issue game of Tactics #36 in Japan.
Designed by Ryuji Yamashita.
An operational wargame covering the battle between German and Soviet from January to April of 1942 around Demjansk.
The game engine is regular move + attack with exploitation.
The map is covered with dense woods. The supply rule is severer than usual wargame due to its climate.

name: Fruehlingserwachen
description:
An operational wargame covering the German last offensive in Eastern front March, 1945.
This offensive operation is done around Balaton lake in Hungary.
The game uses move + attack + exploitation engine.
Victory is decided by VP. The most important VP locations are Dunapentele and Dunafolvar along Duna river.
This game is Akira Ishikawa's final work just before his death.

name: Blue Chip
description:
This game is concerned with the acquiring of Assets. The Assets are acquired by making bids using cards. Every player has 56 Bid Cards, that range from 1 to 50 + 6 blank cards. When a player bids for an Asset, he selects one card from his holding. All bids are simultaneous. You don't have to bid if you do not want to. Bids are revealed and the highest acquires the Asset and all Bid Cards used go out of the game. Selling Assets is done in the same way but now the owner definitely won't bid but will collect the winning bid in cash. Again, all Bids made go out of the game.

Movement across the board requires no dice, you just move one Asset space to another each turn. You must follow the 'flight paths' of the planes printed on the board.

The objective is to collect Assets in the same group (Example: Group: Energy; Assets needed Nuclear, Gas and Coal). When you have a set of three Assets, you may declare it and claim a Blue Chip for that set. A Blue Chip holding doubles the value of a set. When 10 Blue Chips have been declared, the game ends. Players announce the value of their Assets, add in their cash, and thge highest total wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Community Challenge for Miami: Fort Lauderdale
description:
This is a Florida trivia game about the Miami and Fort Lauderdale area. The board features a variety of local landmarks and tourist attractions.

At the beginning of the game each player is given four "challenge cards" which correspond to spaces on the board. The object of the game is to become the first player who "captures" and controls all four of his or her challenge spaces. Players capture a space by correctly answering a trivia question. Spaces can be taken away from another player by demanding a challenge when a contestant's token lands in the square.

Includes two booklets -- Level I and Level II, with Level II questions being more difficult. Also includes the board, six tokens, a die, 24 challenge cards, and a storage insert.
.

name: Word Ace
description:
Manufacturer's Description:
Word Ace is the electronic word racing game seen by millions- a final four finisher on the American Inventor television show! Word Ace gives players a letter and number (A, 9) and they have to be the first to find a word that meets certain criteria, such as "a word that starts with 'A' and has 9 letters" (Armadillo!). Multiple variations keep the game fresh, while teaching vocabulary skills at the same time.

Components:

Word Ace electronic console,
4 wipe-off boards,
4 dry erase markers
Requires 3AAA batteries.


While the game finished second during Season 1 of American Inventor, said competition was held in 2006 and Hasbro announced during the Season Finale that they would "work to make it a reality".

name: Flipping Out: The House Remodel Game
description:
Based on the theory of restoring houses quickly, and for profit, the game of flipping out combines worker placement mechanics with the unpredictable nature of the business of flipping houses.

The game was conceived in 2007, and it will debut in the 2011 Solitaire Game Design contest.

A player will have effort which they may expand over the course of a calender month. The core game will have:

Available on BGG in June 2011:
2 house boards
2 player boards
5 project decks
1 buyer deck
1 rule book

To be provided by the player:
1 pawn
12 "effort" markers (cubes)
6 additional markers (for skills and value)
1 monthly calender.

Goal:

The goal of the game will be to successfully sell the house by the end of the month.

Playing the Game:

The general course of play will be to assign effort blocks, resolve effects of placement, and advance a calender day. At the end of the month (or when 4 projects are complete), the player will consult they buyer deck to see if they can successfully sell the house.

Many cards will provide "curve-balls" that will usually be up to the player to resolve with careful planning. Rich in theme, a player will note that every cause and effect represents actual events experienced by the designer in his career as a home builder (and owner).
mechanics: Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Quiz Marathon
description:
Players try to answer questions in 5 categories. The category is determined by the roll of a die. Four categories contain simple trivia questions, with the correct answer giving 1 to 3 points. If the fifth category is selected, the active player can study a picture for 30 seconds, and afterwards has to answer a question about that picture.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the finish line of 43 points.

name: Elvis Presley DVD Board Game
description:
Pay a tribute to the King of Rock n' Roll! Recapture and relive the life of Elvis Presley as you collect artifacts to create the greatest moments in Rock n' Roll history! Featuring authentic video footage, images and photos of Elvis that will take you from the Gates of Graceland to Heartbreak Hotel and will leave you All Shook Up!

The object of this game is to collect artifacts that match those on the Elvis cards and make it back to his Graceland mansion.

Components:

game board,
playing pawns,
DVD,
die and
Elvis cards

name: Grand Prix F1 Super Memo
description:
A very difficult memory game about F1 racing.
The images on the cards by guessing are all Formula 1 cars of the late '90s.
Each player has a car to move forward on the circuit for each pair of cards turns out, also if the couple just discovered coincides with one of the cards he has in hand, obtained early in the game, will advance to a one bonus space.
When all the cards have been discovered player who is ahead on the circuit win.
Game Component:
88 cards
1 board
6 plastic cars
1 rulebook

name: Nal√° World
description:
The board represents a map of the world.

At the beginning of the game each player receives one blue destination card and three purple destination card. Players try to reach their destination by following the routes between the countries. If a player throws a double 6, he/she is allowed to take a shortcut.
Player can place a chip on a route of another player to block their way. When a player reached a destination, that player gains a chip. So other players know how many destination cards the players has fulfilled.
When a player has completed all three blue cards, he/she can go to their final objective. The purple destination card. The first player arriving on the destination corresponding to the purple card, wins the game.

name: Pro Golf
description:
An indoor golf game that comes in a huge box. Inside there are three playing boards which, when placed end-to-end, make up a plan of the Old Course at St Andrews, measuring 5 feet+ by 1 foot+. This course is depicted in minute detail. Super-imposed on the course is a squared grid, with each square representing 25 x 25 yards.
Club choice is represented by cards. You choose a club, draw a card and it will tell you how far you have hit the ball and whether it was straight or not. The playing pieces are made of metal, painted gold.

name: Komplett
description:
Goal: Be the first who completes 6 tiles in a row with at least one matching quality (size, colour, shape, pattern)

1 All 32 tiles (16 green & red) are shuffled and placed - hidden - besides the board
2 After decision is made which coloured lines on the board belong to a player each places one tile on a 6 x 6 board by turns
3 Now each player may move (= leap) a tile
4 The 1st who completes a set (one matching quality) on one of his rows wins

name: Word for Word Canada
description:
Enter the world of word strategy with Word for Word Canada.

Players embark on a race of wits from one side of the board to the other with their pawns by correctly answering the designated, category questions about Canada.

Armed with an arsenal of 1,000 razor-sharp questions, Word for Word Canada challenges players to spell words, provide definitions and solve word puzzles hidden in rhymes and scrambled letters.

name: Peter Puck DVD Board Game
description:
Put your skating and goal-scoring skills to the test in this action-packed, interactive DVD board game!
With Peter Puck as your guide, make your way around the board answering on-screen challenges and collecting cards while playing a game of hockey!

Players navigate the game board, designed to resemble a hockey arena. The rules of the DVD board game emulate the rules of hockey where ultimately the players attempt to score goals on their opponent's net. The player with the most goals after three periods of play is the winner. The DVD Challenges are based on hockey rules and will incorporate Peter Puck footage, as he teaches young and old fans alike all about the game of hockey!

Components:

Game Board,
Playing Pawns,
DVD,
Six-Sided Dice,
Ten-Sided Die,
Cards,
Pucks

name: Pizza Night
description:
This game has a pizza box packaging, spill-proof pizza-slice game cards and 150 different activities to do while eating pizza. Quick and easy to play, just gather your family, grab a pizza and begin the fun

It's easy to play! Once seated with your family and favorite pizza, roll the die. Whatever color appears on the die is the colored card you play. Follow your card's directions. Pass the die to the next person...that's it! Be first to get ready Your pizza with six slice.

name: Knick-Knack Paddy Whack
description:
Your favorite nursery rhymes are now exciting, new Cadaco card games. Two fun and educational card games for the price of one! In "Knick-Knack Paddy Whack," be the first to collect all the Knick-Knacks (thumb, shoe, knee, door and beehive), then throw the dog a bone and you win the game! In "Have You Any Wool," be the first to collect three bags full of wool, while avoiding the unlucky sheep and you win! The games teach picture recognition & basic strategy play.

Contents:

92 Playing Cards (2 card decks),
2 Bonus Nursery Rhyme Lyric Cards

name: Tycoon
description:
The Official game of Hillsboro, Ohio.
Played similar to Monopoly. Players roll the dice and move around the boards buying properties. Winner is the player with the most money.

Components:

6 markers
money
game board
cards
2 dice

name: Spider Stompin
description:
The game mat has 10 spiders which light up in sequence simulating that they are moving away from the nest and towards the outside of the game mat. All games begin with the spiders lighting up solid red near the center nest. If this center spider is not stomped in time, it will turn off and one of the spiders on the mat's outside edges will blink red. If this outside spider turns off before being stomped, the spider has escaped off the mat, and you will hear it bite you.

Just like Spider-Man, your spidey senses will be tingling when you play the Electronic Spider Stompin' Game--a squishy, battery-powered (three AAA, not included) test of reaction time for one or two players. The arachnid amusement begins when you unroll the three-dimensional, vinyl floormat portraying a colorful array of 10 soft-bodied, pop-up spiders that blink red at random intervals--depending on which of five game speeds you've selected from the push-button controls on the center nest. Players score points by stomping their feet on the blinking beast before it escapes off the mat, all the while enduring smart-aleck cobweb comments like "Ha Ha, ya missed me!" or sound effects like a satisfied "Chomp!" after a successful escape. Add to the mix a razzle-dazzle underscore of silly music during each round of play, and the Electronic Spider Stompin' Game provides more than an itsy-bitsy bit of fast family fun.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: The World Peace Game
description:
from the author's website:

The World Peace Game is a hands-on political simulation that gives players the opportunity to explore the connectedness of the global community through the lens of the economic, social, and environmental crises and the imminent threat of war. The goal of the game is to extricate each country from dangerous circumstances and achieve global prosperity with the least amount of military intervention. As “nation teams,” students will gain greater understanding of the critical impact of information and how it is used.

As their teams venture further into this interactive social setting laced with highly charged philosophical issues, the skills needed to identify ambiguity and bias in the information they receive will be enhanced and more specifically they will rapidly perceive that reactive behavior not only provokes antagonism, it can leave them alone and isolated in the face of powerful enemies. Beliefs and values will evolve or completely unravel as they begin to experience the positive impact and windows of opportunity that emerge through effective collaboration and refined communication.

In essence, as meaning is constructed out of chaos and new creative solutions are proposed, the World Peace Game players will learn to live and work comfortably at the frontiers of the unknown.
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Kroko Zoff
description: Players roll the die and move their figures on the game board from the coast through the jungle to the small village to bring there some medicines. But they must beware of one big electronic crocodile moving along its way on the game board because sometimes their paths cross.

name: Faction Wars
description:
From the website:

Faction Wars is a skirmish game designed for 2 or more players and involves using 28mm miniatures on a table with some terrain to represent your forces. Each player has a squad of around 10 to 15 models with which to beat their opponent.

Most wargamers who are interested in the sci-fi genre will already have a large collection of suitable miniatures. Instead of having to buy more, you can use the ones you have got to play Faction Wars.

The game is very easy to learn, but still offers a level of detail that should engage even the most experienced wargamers. Faction Wars is set in the not-too-distant future, so some of the technology and weapons will be familiar, but with plenty of added science fiction to bring the universe to life.

The human race has escaped the clutches of Earth and colonised the galaxy. The invention of wormhole technology has allowed the vast gulfs of empty space to be crossed. However, this vastness is also leading to the downfall of the Commonwealth. The supreme political figure is the High Guardian, who is losing control over the rapidly expanding wave of colonisation. A number of factions, all with greatly different agendas and ideas battle against each other in small skirmishes right across the galaxy.

The rulebook contains:

* An introduction to the Inviroate Commonwealth of the Federated Worlds
* Background material on each of the 9 factions
* Plenty of colour photos and original artwork
* Rules for playing the game, plus some scenarios
* Stats and background for each faction to allow you to build up your squad
* Stats and background for Special Characters
* Lists of weapons, armour, equipment, skills and psionic abilities to equip your sqaud
* Suggestions for creating terrain and setting up your gaming table
* Rules for using vehicles within the game
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: VISION Phantom Magic
description:
VISION is a Japanese dueling card game based on the Touhou universe.

Players tap "nodes" to play character, command, and spell cards to progress through the game.

Deck construction consists of exactly 50 cards with no more than three copies of each card.

Each player starts with 25 life, and players lose either when their life equals zero or they can no longer draw cards from their deck.

This is typically a two-player game, however there is a variant for a four-player game.

From the publisher website via Google Translate:
"VISION" is the use of all characters live in Gensokyo is a completely new type of card game that assumes a free deck building. This makes it possible to put a deck of cards only their favorite characters and illustrations, is now available to experience the charm of the building is also handy for beginners deck card game yet. Continuing to make the point that the game was popular in the past in terms of production systems, further pursuit of fun. It is a product to satisfy heavy users from light users.

This work was ostracized for the rarity of the card you want to build a simple deck. In addition, there are endless construction pattern, even if you purchased only one set. There is no need to buy a lot from scratch.

Publisher website: http://huyutuki.com/vision.html

name: ChaOS: Touhou Kontonfu
description:
Touhou Kontonfu is a dueling card game based in the Touhou universe using the ChaOS system.

Your Main Deck is built from 50 cards, including characters, events, set cards, and the like. You may have up to 4 copies of cards with the same name. Extra cards can't go in your Main Deck; you may have an Extra Deck with up to 10 cards. If your Extra Deck has under 10 cards (for instance, 0) you can still play the game.

In Chaos TCG, your Main Deck is your Life. Each player's goal is to reduce their opponent's Main Deck to 0 through attacks and card effects.

ChaOS (Character Operating System) is the second dueling TCG by the makers of the extremely popular Weiß Schwarz. This system focuses more on individual characters and their abilities.

Translations of the rules and cards are available from the websites listed below in the links section.

name: I'm Debt Free!
description:
The game about getting out of debt and achieving financial freedom.
You start off with 3 debt cards and 1 investment card. The object of the game is to get out of debt by paying off your debt cards. Along the way you will run into bumps in the road which can put you deeper into debt if you're not prepared (with an emergency fund).

In this game You can

Build an Emergency Fund
Invest in Real Estate
Buy a Small Business
Pay off Credit Cards
Invest in Stocks and Mutual Funds
Increase your cash flow
Work to become DEBT FREE!

name: Oh-Spell!
description:
A card game which combines the concept of 4 suits with the 26 letters of the alphabet. The result is a game of infinite possibilities, in which all of the permutations of word creation are virtually endless.

The game challenging each player to create one or more words using all of his cards. A hand can require from 1 to 10 minutes.

Components:

travel pouch
115 cards
mini dictionary that includes all the wierd 2-3 letter words, Q words that don't have a U, words that end with the letter X, etc.


S* coring pad and pencil

name: Flip Flap Chicken
description:
A dexterity game with similar mechanics to Battledome. Each player is a chicken with Pinball-like flipper-feet. Balls are placed in a central depression and then released all at once. The balls rush around a circular playing area and the Players use their flipper-feet to keep the balls from falling into their 'goal'.

The winner of the game is the chicken Player with the fewest balls in their goal.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: The VirtueGame
description: To win the game, kids have to earn five out of the ten virtues by completing the tasks described on each card they draw. For example, a "Thankfulness" card asks the player to hold their breath for as long as they can. When they are finished, they card asks; "Aren't you thankful to breathe again?" and reminds the player to be thankful for things that we sometimes take for granted. Tasks often have to be completed cooperatively and require respectful listening to other players.

name: Magic 10
description:
From Publishers Website:

Magic 10 offers a creative way to master basic number combinations. The game helps players understand how different number arrangements can add up to 10.

Using both the die and playing pieces, players create different Magic 10 combinations. At the same time, players are encouraged to develop reasoning strategies.

Brightly colored plastic playing pieces and number templates help players learn basic math skills. Along the way, players attempt to gather as many playing pieces as possible to win the game.

name: Fraction Whirl I
description:
From Publisher Website:

Fraction Whirl I, a one-of-a-kind game, unravels fraction complexities by using colorful cards and a user-friendly fraction slider. Fraction Whirl I is fun, quick-paced, and easy to play. The game is perfect for classroom instruction and home learning activities.

The distinctive Fraction Whirl I cards - with standard fraction notations in addition to groupings of dots, blocks, and pie shapes - help players understand the relationship between different fraction representations. While the cards whirl around the table, players try to collect 4 matching fraction cards and be the first to quickly grab a Whirl token.

The trick? Players need to keep their eyes on both the cards and the tokens. Need help with the answers? The Fraction WhirI I slider is always there to help.

name: Fraction Whirl II
description:
From Publisher Website:

Fraction Whirl II, the unparalleled game of comparing fractions, just takes minutes to learn! Simply turn over your top card and compare it to your opponent's card. The player with the largest fraction wins the round and retains the cards. And the player with the most cards wins the game.

Need assistance with the answers? The Fraction Whirl II chart will come to the rescue!

name: Flip 'n Link Money
description:
From Publishers Website:

Ages 8 and Up
2 Players
5 Minutes to learn
Playing time: 10-15 minutes
Flip ’n Link™ Money

The Fun-Filled Strategic Money Game!

Flip 'n Link Money is an engaging and action-packed strategy game. Players learn how to count coins while reinforcing basic addition skills. Simply add the value of the coins on the game cards and match that amount to the appropriate playing piece.

To win, a player must strategically create a link of five playing pieces. But there's a trick! Players must plan ahead to avoid being trapped by their opponents and having their playing pieces flipped to the opponent's side. The action continues until one of the players creates a link. Players win with clever strategies and a bit of luck.

name: Flip 'n Link Time
description:
From Publisher Website:

Flip 'n Link Time is an engaging and action-packed strategy game. Players explore time in three forms: digital, analog and written word. Simply match the analog clock or word time on the game cards to the digital time on the appropriate playing piece.

To win, a player must strategically create a link of five playing pieces. But there's a trick! Players must plan ahead to avoid being trapped by their opponents and having their playing pieces flipped to the opponent's side. The action continues until one of the players creates a link. Players win with clever strategies and a bit of luck.

name: Flip 'n Link Fractions
description:
From Publishers Website:

Flip 'n Link Fractions is an engaging and action-packed strategy game. While enjoying the game, players learn the concepts of fractions and how they relate to a whole. Simply identify the fractions listed on the game cards, then match their values to the appropriate playing piece.

To win, a player must strategically create a link of five playing pieces. But there's a trick! Players must plan ahead to avoid being trapped by their opponents and having their playing pieces flipped to the opponent's side. The action continues until one of the players creates a link. Players win with clever strategies and a bit of luck.

name: Pinkerella Pink-O Lunchbox
description:
Players takes turns drawing and playing cards. When a card in your hand matches an icon on your game mat, place a cupcake on that icon. Yell out "Pinkarella" when your game mat is filled.

Components:

54 cards
24 cupcake discs

name: Administrando o seu Dinheiro
description:
Translation of the back of the box: The Game managing your money is a game of many adventures and while you to have fun, you learn how to manage their own money. With the game managing your money you also take a tour you learn how to take care of your money.

The oldest player will take the money and the Bank will distribute $ 22.00 for each participant. After randomly designed player, the first launch since the walk and the corresponding number of homes, and perform the requested task at home to stop. Whenever a player lands on a blue house, and perform the task, turn the wheel and receive or pay an amount to the bank, according to state that roulette.

name: O Pequeno Empres√°rio
description:
Translation of the back of the box: A fun game for small entrepreneurs!

In this game from rolling dice players travel the board to get their houses in the colors of their pawns to thereby have the opportunity to roll the wheel and increase their earnings. Game for teaching children to manage money and make their first mathematical operations.

name: Sevens Down!
description:
Promo statement from the rules:

"Sevens Down is an entertaining and fast-paced card game for the whole family that uses special cards to switch the action and give the players a jolt of fun.

Inside the box:
(2) decks of cards (1 red back, 1 blue back) with cards numbered from 1-14 in 4 different colors; red, blue, green, and gold. (8) wild cards and (4) skip cards.

Rules summary:
Players are dealt a number of cards based on the number of players.

A Seven starts the play off On their turn, players play as many cards as they can in alternating colors in ascending or descending order from the seven.

A player's goal is to play all of their cards. They receive points for the cards left in their opponents hand as well as for every seven they play.

Game is over when the target number of points is reached. Target is determined by number of players.

name: All Hallows Eve
description: A fun, fast paced card game for the whole family, full of spooks, spectres, creepies and crawlies. Each player takes a turn and plays up to 3 scary cards, each with different powers and point values. The highest total wins the Haunt. Whoever finds the most Haunts wins!

name: Wallet Warriors
description:
They’re brave, adventurous, ready to fight! And they fit in your wallet!

Fill your billfold with 10 different adventurers! Explore the depths of your pocket book with 12 different dungeons! Discover dozens of traps, treasures and monsters, all within your purse!

Wallet Warriors is a quick adventure game that you can play while you wait for the bus, wait for a table or wait for the movie to start. It can be played alone or with multiple players. The sturdy cards are both durable and portable. It plays in just minutes but the mutable map and multiple quests insure that the fun can go on forever!

With a simple roll of the dice or spin of the spinner your adventurers (such as thief, druid or elf) move through the randomly created dungeon and discover either a monster, trap or treasure! If your level and roll is high enough, or if your abilities are good enough, you can beat the adversaries and continue on to succeed in your quest of finding gold, rescuing the princess or just exploring the entire map!

name: DIVE! The Board Game
description:
Tired of the everyday hustle and bustle of everyday life and work, you decide to try to earn your fortune with a yacht you have inherited from an uncle you never knew. You fly down to the yacht’s location, but as it turns out the “yacht” is a small junker that is questionably seaworthy.

Can you make a living with this boat? What can you do? Fish? Become a rum runner? While contemplating your future at a local restaurant, the local news station runs a story depicting a man and his crew popping a bottle of Champagne as they celebrate finding a wreck full of Spanish treasure. “Why not me?” you ask yourself.... Why not you?

Armed only with your boat and 50 Trade Credits (TCs), you decide to set out tomorrow to find treasure and fame in the waters between the U.S. and the Bahamas. You will have to learn to dive, sail, and methods for search and recovery. Will you try to advance conservatively, or try to advance quickly by luck? Will you try to depend on cheaper equipment, or spend the fruits of your labors on the latest in high-tech equipment? It will not be easy, and the competition with other wanna-be treasure hunters will be fierce.

Your goal is to become the most renowned treasure hunter the Bahamas has ever known. Up to 6 players take on the role of one of 16 international treasure hunters, each with different individual strengths. Players may choose to visit the ports of Miami, Port Lucaya, or Alice Town to purchase and sell dive equipment, boating equipment, search and recovery supplies, and other merchandise; players may choose to explore unexplored areas of the sea by turning over sea tiles with random depths, or dive in explored areas.

A player begins as an unexperienced diver, limited to shallow depths, limited by poor air consuption, and lack of equipment. Beginning divers will be glad to recover minor treasures such as lobster, and shells during their freedives. The more dives that are completed the more experience is gained. The diver is allowed to make dives leading to greater depths, and with a larger possibility to obtain greater treasure. The greater the treasure the diver recovers, the more Trade Credits a diver will earn at market. The combination of experience and Trade Credits will allow the diver to eventually recover treasures that are worth too much money to sell on market, but can be donated to the Miami Nautical Museum in exchange for Victory Points. The first player to win 10 victory points becomes the most renowned treasure hunter the Bahamas has ever known, and is the victor!

DIVE! is a board game made by a diver, but which can be played by divers and non-divers alike. No dive experience is needed, however, those familiar with diving will recognize diving concepts. Divers will also recognize some of the concepts in this game are not exactly realistic. That is because making real concepts unrealistic, makes the game fun! That being said, playing DIVE! should not be seen as a substitution for scuba training, and the concepts in the game should not be used in actual diving. If you are interested in diving, please contact your local PADI dive center.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Africa Wild!
description:
Players move along a track on the game board, toward a watering hole. The number of spaces a player moves is determined by the number on the top quiz card at the time of their turn. Animals are placed on spaces along the route, and players may pick up an animal if they land on the animal's space.
