If two missiles land on the same space, the one with the higher power wins and knocks the other one of the board. Blank spaces on dominoes allow for players to remove an opponents piece. The first person to get four missiles in a row in the playing area is the winner.

name: Nelaxtam
description: Nelaxtam is an abstract strategy game in which players are trying to land troops on an island, represented by a 12x12 board. Each space on the board is marked with a white or black marker and the goal is to destroy your opponents territory and remove those markers from the board. Troop movement and action is revealed simultaneously by both players. Troops can either move or destroy an adjacent enemy territory. The game is over once one player cannot position any of his five troops in a position to destroy further enemy territory. The player who has removed the most enemy territory is the winner.

name: Noort River Fur Traders
description: The winter ice will soon be swept out of the Noort River, and the new trading season for furs will will begin. All winter, Indians have been trapping beaver and other fir-bearing animals. They are now on their way to Dutch Fort Orange, 150 miles north of New Amsterdam, with bundles of pelts for sale. You have stocked your sturdy ship with a selection of desirable trade goods, welcome to both settlers and Indians alike. Your task is to sail to Fort Orange, selling your trade goods at a profit along the way, arriving at Fort Orange ready to buy furs. Time is precious as you look for the best price to buy, then sailing back to New Amsterdam (or New England) to sell your cargo of furs at a profit.

name: Color Quest
description:
Color Quest is a "magical strategy game for 2-3 players. Players travel the board using color, acquiring gold, gems and magical abilities." This is "a computer-assisted board game, where room contents are preselected by computer, and hints progressively revealed to players... Once a player has 25,000 gold pieces, and at least 1 Power Square, they may attempt to win." Other players may attempt to thwart the victory attempt and win themselves.

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

name: Fantasy Franchise
description:
Fantasy Franchise is "a real estate game where players purchase franchises, lease space in central Florida malls, and eventually purchase the malls themselves!" The malls feature "everything from movie theatres to Mall Security. Nearly all the names are tongue in cheek." The names of the stores and movie posters feature puns and parodies of popular brands such as "Taxi Driver II: My Fare, Lady!" and "While You Were Sleeping... the Movie Ended"

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

name: Castles & Caverns
description:
Castles & Caverns is a fantasy game in which players try to "build the most beautiful castle", but are faced with numerous challenges. The game features "magic and swordplay combined with bidding and strategy, and of course, lots of treasure!" The game board is marked with four cavern areas, "Spire Falls", "Gold Ridge", "Ice Flow", and "Enchanted."

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

name: Heroes of the Solar System
description:
Heroes of the Solar System is "an educational science game for 2-4 players who provide supplies to mankind's colonies throughout the solar system. The colonists on each planet need different things to survive, and award "Rescue Points" to the player who offers them the most of what they need." The game is designed for team play.

All quotes are taken from the designer's website.

name: Party Gras
description:
Party Gras, billed as "Bourbon Street in a box", is a game of drinking, groping and flashing. Players are given strings of beads, which they can lose to, or acquire from, other players by way of instructions on the spinner or spaces on the board.

In true Mardi Gras fashion, bead exchanges are most often accomplished by flashing other players, or having other players flash you. The rules state that this involves baring one's chest, but also suggest that guys may be "a bit more creative".

The base mechanic is "spin and move" as the player's pieces (shot glasses) move along a winding track. Players must follow the directions on the spinner and board. The person holding the most strings of beads when any player crosses the finish line is the official winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Dicey Wheels
description:
According to the box, this game was designed to help players become safer drivers.

Players start with $3,260 and make a $250 down payment on their "Klunka" (car) to start the game. On each turn, the player rolls the dice to travel along the highway and draws a card, following its instructions. Cards may instruct the player to go to various points on the board, recite a tongue twister, pay a fine, go to jail, earn money or answer a driver test question.

First player to get 10 points on driver test questions, make four payments on their Klunka, and have $5,000 wins the game.

name: The Shade of Zombie
description:
The Shade of Zombie is a merger between game of strategy and game of letters where the player must manage eliminate the Zombies against which he is to be able to count. A slightly conventional mechanics drags the player to a combat against enormous hordes Zombies.

The game this one thought to receive added since they can be new cards with new values and attributes beside introducing concrete areas of game since it can be boards and scenery.

It uses several systems of game of exclusive creation since it is CdB's Runic System and the System sequence to establish dynamic not cyclical shifts.

The aim of the players is to eliminate Zombies, nevertheless the game this one very modified since all the systems for which it operates have been designed separately, we will see that systems have used and his application in game.

The system of shifts "System Sequence" is a system of shifts for level of priority, this is established by the value of the Zombies against which we fight.

Initially of the game every player receives 2 Zombies's cards establishing by means of the sum of his values a total quantity that will be his priority of game.

Procedure: maximum of 3 Zombies for player, increase of priority for the not irresolute Zombies and decrease for the irresolute Zombies.

This gives like proved a different value between players and the order of the shifts decides, the system repeats itself during the whole item and this gives like proved a different order from shifts constant.

The player once in his shift must resort to eliminating Zombies, for this it was using a special system of so called combat " SEDD Runic " formed by 3 cards that give like proved combinations two-color on having placed in pyramidal formation.

Every Zombie that the player possesses in front of, includes 4 cards that in his set they form combinations Two-color, similar to the combinations obtained for BE Runic, using BE and in similarity of combinations the player ire withdrawing segments of the Zombies up to managing to eliminate them.

There are 3 types of Zombies, the positives " increase priority " negatives " diminish priority " and puntuables " they allow on having played to count for the final inventory ".

Once it is achieved to count, the player must study where to count since we speak about the system Faction.

The system Faction is a system of punctuations for faction, this one based on a board divided by 2 different decrees, the first board that is completed is used for the final inventory. Every section can include a maximum of 10 points, nevertheless the players only possess a maximum of 6 cards to include in the board, thus the system of punctuation is established like strategically.

The system of shifts, the system of combat and the system of punctuation are 3 bases on which Zombie operates on The Shade of, his architecture has as aim be strategic for the player since on having established a correct strategy, the shifts can be extended, we can create alliances between players and can create a sequential strategy of shifts that give us mas opportunities against another player for the simple fact of creating an order of shifts based on the basic calculation of increase and level decrease of priority.

All that achieves by means of 25 cards that there includes the game that they are the technical base of all his development, whereas the rest of components alone are cards to mark condition and others both with the player and with the Zombies.

It paginates of exhibition: http://cdb.creatuforo.com/the-shade-of-zombies-tema68.html

name: Cross Town Coordinates
description:
Go on a cross-town scavenger hunt to practice geometry and graphing! Coordinate cards direct players to move to different community places. Flip cards over to see if you moved correctly. Game board features positive coordinates on one side, and both positive and negative coordinates on the reverse for more advanced play.
Add the fun of a scavenger hunt to geometry lessons! Teaches the Cartesian plane in a real-world context. Board features positive coordinates on one side, and both positive and negative coordinates on the reverse for more advanced play.
- Draw an x-y coordinate card
- Use the game board coordinates to move your pawn to the location on your card
- Look at the community building picture on the back of your card to see if you moved correctly; if so, mark the location off your checklist
- Finish your checklist first to win!
-Positive and Negative Cartesian Coordinates

Contents:

150 Coordinate Cards
4 Game Pawns
Scavenger-hunt Checklist
Double-sided Game Board
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Snap Shots Across America
description: Need a Vacation? Snapshots Across America, The Vacation Fantasy Game you can play at home. Travel across a game board map of the U.S.A. by car, train, boat or plane to see top tourist attractions from all 50 states. But watch out for bad weather! A hurricane, blizzard, tornado or other bad weather could spoil your vacation. Win by being the first to visit 7 different tourist attractions that are pictured on the cards. A fun way to learn U.S. Geography and discover great vacation destinations. Average game plays 15-20 minutes. Ages: 8 and Up, 2-6 Players

name: Champion
description: Object is to collect the most points by throwing the sandbags into the point slots. Player or team with the most points is the winner.

name: The Regatta
description:
Race game. There are 80 squares to move along. No rules known to exist but is probably a roll-and-move game, with rewards and forfeits depending where you land.

The board depicts the Isle of Wight Regatta

name: Treasure Pools
description:
Object of the Game is to be the first player to collect at least one of every Tidal Pool Animal Card to fill your sand pail. You can win the game with 6 different animal cards or 5 animal cards and a Treasure Pool card.

Players then follow, taking their turns, to the left of the starting player. Play moves clockwise around the outside track with the larger "squares" by rolling 2 dice. If doubles are rolled, that player may take another turn. You may only enter a Tidal Pool path by landing on the arrow marked Enter. When you enter a Tidal Pool path you may use only 1 die to move your piece. If you land on one of the squares in the path with an arrow pointing at the animal cards, you may pick one up and put it on your Sand Pail Card. You may get more than one of the same animal cards. They are good for trading or dealing with a sea gull snatching up your animal.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Naughty Improv
description:
Naughty Improv is a game of story telling using cards depicting funny and suggestive illustrations. Each player is given a hand of five cards.

On playing a card, the player must build on a continuous, common story, with the new addition to the story having a direct link to the card played. Players are judged on the new contribution to the story, and if not accepted the player retrieves the card and also takes a penalty card from the deck.

There is no set play order -- any player can play at any time with the exception that no player may play two cards in a row. Points are scored for the number of cards played.

A round ends after a player has no more cards remaining. The player with the most points after five rounds wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Wise Alec: Civilize This!
description:
Hello Time Travelers! Explore the world’s cultures across time with the trivia game based on the award-winning Wise Alec Family Trivia Game. There are 300 questions to test your knowledge of Ancient, Medieval, and Modern cultures. Two levels of questions on each card let everyone from young scholars to history buffs play together. Plus, Wise Alec cards will have you doing tongue twisters, brain teasers, and fun exercises!

The cards from this game can also be used to expand your own set of Wise Alec Family Trivia Game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Trivia

name: Wise Alec: Sports Buffs
description:
Hey Sports Fans! Play the ultimate sports trivia game based on the award-winning Wise Alec Family Trivia Game. There are 300 questions to test your knowledge of sports history, athletes, and rules. Two levels of questions on each card let everyone from rookies to veterans play together. Plus, Wise Alec cards will have you doing tongue twisters, brain teasers, and fun exercises!

The cards from this game can also be used to expand your own set of Wise Alec Family Trivia Game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Sports, Trivia

name: Wise Alec: Nature Nuts
description:
Hello Nature Nuts! Explore the marvels of nature with the trivia game based on the award-winning Wise Alec Family Trivia Game. There are 300 questions to test your knowledge of animals, plants, and the Earth. Two levels of questions on each card let everyone from the nature novice to the eco-expert play together. Plus, Wise Alec cards will have you doing tongue twisters, brain teasers, and fun exercises!

The cards from this game can also be used to expand your own set of Wise Alec Family Trivia Game.

Contains:

1 multicolored die,
3 decks of trivia cards,
1 deck of Wise Alec cards
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Trivia

name: Warriors of the Four Circles 3
description: The third set in the Warriors of the Four Circles Set takes the S&G skirmish game system and adds "Kung-Fu masters and martial arts experts." In this edition, the students of the Monkey Master compete against a monster made entirely of ash.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Grammatical Conversation or English Grammar Familiarized
description: An educational trivia game. Each player plays an agreed number of counters into the pool. A pack of answer cards are dealt so that everyone has a equal number of cards. The host or hostess then draws a question card and any player can claim that they have the correct answer on one of their cards. If they are correct, they take a reward from the Pool. If they are wrong, they add some counters to the Pool. The winner is the first player to have no answer cards left.

name: War of the Psychic Gods
description: War of the Psychic Gods is a fantasy fighting game in which The God of Reason has been overthrown and his opponent Gods are fighting for who shall reign supreme. The game uses the Steel and Glory system but changes the battle field to an Astral Plane and the traditional weapons to physic weapons.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: War of the Psychic Gods 2
description: War of the Psychic Gods Set 2 is an expansion to War of the Psychic Gods. This game adds the Four Horsemen and several scenarios including a quick playing Small Skirmish.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: War of the Psychic Gods 3
description: War of the Psychic Gods Set 3 is an expansion to War of the Psychic Gods. This game adds demons to the game and features a scenario called "All Out War" in which the Gods and Demons fight for ultimate control of the world. The game is played by maneuvering your piece into a casting circle and attempting to survive for three turns. If no one can accomplish this in 12 turns, the game ends in a draw.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Scarlotti
description:
Scarlotti is a science fiction board game which was published in the Britsh role-playing magazine, Imagine (issue 9 - Dec 1983). It was a two page article with a pull out card board and counters, and was sub tiled "An easy to play boardgame for up to four players".

Game equipment is a board and five sets of four counters (four stars and 16 ship counters), also two packs of playing cards are required.

The object of the game is to collect a star and return it to your home base.

The board is a grid with the the home bases at each corner of the board and the cards are for movement and combat.

The rules have also had a number of variants options.

name: Snap Shots
description:
A question and Answer game with 96 question cards. Each player gets a board on which they place markers. First to get 12 right answers on their board, wins.
The box proclaims "A Game of Historical Interest.
Marked only as 'British Manfacture'.

name: Mickey Mouse Target Game
description:
Children's game featuring a Mickey Mouse target. The 'Bull' in the centre of the target is a delicate part of Mickey's anatomy.
The game comes with 4 plastic arrows with rubber suckers in the end, plus a pop-gun.
The first to score an agreed number of points, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Les Passe Boules
description:
Action game. Any number of players may play. You have to hit the target with your white balls, a little like Table Tennis balls but smaller.
The target is a Clown's face with his mouth wide open. Players aim to throw or bounce their ball into the mouth for a good score, or into two holes below his face which scores less points.
Play to an agreed number of points.

name: The Game of M.P. or Government and Opposition
description:
Card game with 52 cards. 27 are bordered in red and illustrate the government. 25 are black bordered and depict the opposition.
I have no rules and it is difficult to tell which game this is related to, but it is probably a set collecting game.

name: Historic Boston Freedom Trail Trivia Game
description:
This trivia game tests a player's knowledge of the Freedom Trail, the American Revolution, historic Boston, plus Cape Cod and New England. Contestants move around a board featuring actual locations in Boston. The pathway begins in Boston Common and ends at the harbor. Special cards might give a player the chance to continue moving even if he or she misses a question. The final routes to the harbor includes special spaces for the Freedom Trail.

Includes board, 6 tokens, die, cards, rules, and question booklet.

name: Aladdin and the Magic Lamp
description: Promotional game, made to advertise Cadbury's Selection Boxes (chocolates). A simple race game. The playing pieces need to be cut out of the box.

name: The Electric Oracle
description:
A novel question and answer game. The questions are on one disc and the answers are on another. There is an electric probe that leads from the question and you touch it next to your chosen answer. It will then indicate if you were right or wrong.
First to get an agreed number of answers right, wins.

name: Zanni's Wireless Wonder
description:
Trivia game that used 1920-style technology to impress any buyers.
There are 6 double-sided discs. Slot a disc into the box and read a question. Then, by a series of magnets, the disc will reveal the correct answer.
First to get an agreed number of questions right, wins. Limited replayability as only 72 questions are provided in total.

name: Battle Armor: Hive Invasion
description: Battle Armor: Hive Invasion is the third expansion for the Battle Armor game. In this expansion, the heavily armored humans battle the Hive collative. There are several new weapons, option and rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien Armada
description: Alien Armada is the first expansion for the game Space Armada. It is also a stand alone game. It adds two new alien races to Space Armada who must battle for control of the universe.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Alien Incursion
description: Alien Incursion is the second expansion for the Battle Armor game which adds armored crab-like aliens to the battle against the battle armored humans.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Robot Jocks 2
description: Robot Jocks 2 is the first expansion to Robot Jocks and is also a stand alone game. The game adds new battlegrounds, weapons, and attacks.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Tales of Brave Princess and Lovely Knight
description:
Tales of Brave Princess and Lovely Knight is a boardgame based on yonkomas of the same name.

In this game players take roles of mighty(or not so mighty) heroes of their native realm and try to accomplish as many heroic deeds as possible before Violent Paladins kill all monsters and bring eternal peace. If players achieve enough fame when last the monster falls, they will be glorified in ages.

During the game you will be able to meet strangers who could become your faithful friends or cruel foes, visit unexplored places, complete epic quests like killing basilisk or washing tableware from whole village, find rare and useless artifacts.

Features:

Unique encounters mechanic
Diceless combat system
Unusual quest design
Full or semi cooperative mode
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fishin' Frenzy
description:
Place fish, coins and the treasure chest in the barrel. Assemble the two halves of each fishing pole. Choose a player to go first. Players take turns fishing. The player who catches the treasure chest wins. You can also play in challenge mode where players fish at the same time. The player that catches the most objects wins! And in Advanced game mode, players fish at the same time. Fish are worth 1 point each, coins are worth 3 points, and the treasure chest is worth 5 points.

This game is non magnetic, the worm tips dangling from the poles each have velcro, and all fish, coins and treasure are made with strips of velcro.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Animal Twins
description: This game for preschoolers can be used as a simple matching game or on a board where players move tiles around to get matches next to each other.

name: Deutsches Kriegsspiel
description:
This is a simple old german roll and advance board game. Each player places a bet and then in turn rolls a die to move his figure around the board. The first to reach the goal, Paris, has won.

On his way the player may encounter different tiles which may advance his figure or cost him so of his money and so on.

As being part of war propaganda is includes some insults towards other european nations.

This game was found in the Focke-Museum (http://www.focke-museum.de) in Bremen, Germany.

name: Kotipihan √ñt√∂k√§t
description:
From the publisher:
In the three games of the Backyard Nature series, the player will be introduced to nature’s creatures by being challenged to recognise them. The attractive picture cards portray common insects in a realistic manner, and the player must name them correctly. The game can also be played outdoors – finding the corresponding insects in nature will help the learning process!

name: Captain Hook
description:
From the publisher:
In this exciting new board game, you are allowed to be both greedy and cunning! Outwit your pirate friends, find hidden treasures, and sail around the unpredictable seas of Neverland with Captain Hook, Smee and the rest of the crew of the Jolly Roger. But beware of other pirates, and ticking crocodiles! There can only be one winner, so make sure it is you!
Youngest player starts and game goes clockwise. Players goal is to collect as much treasure as possible by the end of the game. Players travel on the game board from place to place using action cards and collecting tokens which can be saved as treasure, but also can be used as actions as well. For example 2 diamonds can be used to cut through the wall to the other side of the island.
Game ends when one player reaches the high peak of the island. Then the score tokens are scored and the one with the most is the winner.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Moranme Jobswurf
description:
Moranme Jobswurf was published in the Britsh roleplaying magazine Imagine (Issue 12 -Mar 1984).

User Description

The game is about the bitter inter-departmental rivalry for working for a company - ie; Passing the Buck.

It is a two player game played on a grid with 18 counters (8 sales counters, 8 publication counters and 2 bucks). Each player take's the role of the sales team or the publication team.

The object of the game is for the first player to transfer thier buck into the other players in-tray.

name: Par Contract for the Home
description:
An early attempt to make Duplicate Bridge into a game you can play in your house yet test yourself against experts who have played the hand before you do.
Two packs of playing cards but each card has a different back design
Two rule books
A pad of bidding slips
A book with the analysis of the hands provided
An indicator to show the dealer and vulnerability
Each playing card has an indication on the back. Check the game number you are about to play, then check the back of the card and deal it to the player indicated. Do this with all 52 cards and everyone should have a hand of 13 cards. Bidding then takes place and the hand played out.
At the end of the hand, you can check analysis book to see how 'experts' bid and played the hand. Points are scored during each hand. First each pair might score points for bidding correctly. Then points can be won for making the correct lead to trick one. And finally you can score points for making the final contract. Interestingly, whatever the bidding, the hand must be played in the contract that the 'experts' suggest You can even complain to John Waddington (the publisher) if you feel your opposition bid in such a way, you did not have a fair chance of reaching your correct contract.

name: Chariot Racing in the City League
description:
Chariot Racing in the City League was published in the British roleplaying magazine Imagine (Issue 21 - Dec 1984).

User Description

Chariot Racing in the City League is a complete game which allows you and your fellow players to re-enact the drama of chariot racing. The game was published as companion to the Pelinore article in Imagine (Issue 21 - Dec 1984), "The Arena", but the game is playable on its own, through you can use of your characters from the Dungeon & Dragons role-playing game.

The game board is made out of a number pieces of track which are hex and a number of counters which represent the chariots.

The winner is the chariot which goes the furthest across the finishing line on the final turn.

name: Mindmeld
description:
Mindmeld was published in the British roleplaying magazine Imagine (Issue 26 - May 1985).

User Description

Mindmeld is about psionic warfare, it can be played as a solitaire game or by two players. Equipment is a set of counters which is either a creature or a weapon, a hex game board (all published as a four page pull out) and you also need some dice.

The game is about a secret "Order of the High Brethren", which it's monks graduates in the order by battling each other by using thier mental skills.

In the solitaire game the player takes part af a single monk pitted against six of the Brethren and in the two player version each player takes turns as the defending monk, attacked by the other player.

name: Caught in a Trap
description:
A set collecting game. The four cards to a set tell a story. The first is the Victim, the 2nd is the Trap, the 3rd is Caught!, and the 4th is the Escape!

Players are given an agreed number of counters, some of which are added to the Pool. When you take certain actions, you may have to put more counters into the Pool or you might be lucky enough to take counters from the Pool. The one with the most counters after all sets have been collected, wins.

The game must be Victorian (for example, one card makes mention of crinolene, an essential part of a Victorian lady's fashionable attire.

No artist mentioned, which is a shame because the illustrations are of a very high quality.

Any number of persons may play. If five play. Ten sets only are used. If seven, the dealer has one card short.
The cards (which are termed the “Victim” “Trap” “Caught” “Escaped”) are dealt round face downwards, and a game may be won by a player or side.
All cards are played face upwards, and laid on the table, but when a set (either of three or four) is made up, it is turned face downwards.
A player having more than one card of a set, may only use one at a time, in his turn. Only the player of a “Victim” may play the “Escaped” (Except in Rule 5), and he is allowed only one chance to claim a set with it (Rule 4). If he claim a wrong set, he cannot try with the same card again.

name: The New Game of Picture Proverbs
description:
A Victorian game. The sets in the game are made up of two cards, one with the first word of a proverb, the other completing the proverb.

Players are given 24 counters, six of which are placed in the Pool.

In your turn you may ask any one player for the other half of a Proverb. If you fail, you may then ask any other player for the same card but if this is also a failure, you add a counter to the Pool and your turn ends. When a completed Proverb is collected, you lay it in front of you and you receive one counter from the Pool. When all the Proverbs are collected, the player with the most claims all the counters left in the Pool. The player with the most counters, wins.

When asking for a Proverb card, you should ask for it by naming the part you need. It is suggested that if children are playing, they can ask for a number (the card pairs all have a number on them).

The game is for 5 or more players but there are special rules if under 5 are playing.

name: Dinosaur's Journey to Wellness
description:
The object of the game is to answer the question cards appropriately and cross the finish line. In Dinosaur's Journey to Wellness there are only winners; you can't lose. Every player that crosses the finish line is a winner. The cards help children to explore their feelings about being sick and being different, to know about their illness, to take care of themselves and to be more assertive.

Contents:

1 Game board
75 Game cards
25 Cave of acceptance cards
25 Land of courage cards
25 Valley of knowledge cards
6 Dinosaur movers
1 Standard 6-sided die

name: Looney-Bin
description: Looney Bin is a skill game that is full of frenzied fun for all ages. Looney Bin can be played against the game or against other players. The object is to place 15 colored marbles into holes in the game matching the patterns of the play cards, within a limited time span.

name: Enermen
description:
Enermen is a card game to initiate everyone to the energy chain. It provide a simple way to do it with a colour code, and very simple symbols to understand primary energy sources, transformer, and services with its associated risks.

During the whole game, players are confronted with the dilemma :
- I can upgrading my personal development as fast as possible (which make victory points and so a chance to win) and the consequences of this which can lead to a major environmental risk which synonym of his own defeat (end of the game and his score is reduce to 0...)

In order to avoid any reject due to the theme, all primary energies are described as superhero.
For example the nuclear power is described as Nucleoman.

name: Checkout Chase
description:
A simple die-rolling game for children, where everyone has to visit different shops and fill their shopping list first.

Everyone has a shopping list with five different things on it. The number of items also ranges from one to five. Shops are colour co-ordinated - bakery is orange, market green etc. There are coloured squares on the list as well - bread is next to orange square, tomatoes next to green etc. All the shopping lists are different.

When a player lands on a shop and doesn't have the item from it yet, he/she has to ask for it and also name the correct quantity: "One loaf of bread, please" or "Five tomatoes, please". They then get the picture of the item to put on their list. If they already have the item, they miss their turn and play passes to their left.

There are four squares on the board without any shops, two showing people shopping and one someone having lunch. These squares also mean that a player misses their turn. However, if a player lands on the "Checkout" square, he/she can ask for anything on their list.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Collodian Conspiracy: Science Against Chaos Unleashed
description:
The Collodian Conspiracy is a strategic game in Galaxy-Foundation Games' strategic Battle for Andromeda: Conflict for a Trillion Suns! series. It uses the series rulebook, Andromeda Foundation Official Battle Manual.

This particular game pits the Collodian Confederation (colonial outposts of the Xenon Empire) against the Kons Empire (or Dirak of Kons). The game can be combined with The Xenon Empire's Star Wars: Crusade Against the War-Lords in some way which is not entirely clear.

The game-specific rulebook has a lengthy description of the background (the forces are fighting over deposits of cesium, trillium, and magellinium), discussion of strategy, and the specific rules for this game. In the latter category, there are some special weapons for each side and neutral powers which might join the war.

According to the rulebook, a kit was available which added extra counters to enable play of "the famed Xenon-Kons Frontier Battles of the First Galactic War."

From a GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


This connects to the previous Game and the Collodians represent the Colonies of Xenon above. In this game for the first time a Culture meets the KONS forces directly - not merely their Allies. There are many counters in this game as the Collodians must use stealth and trickery to protect themselves. The Kons Main Fleet, as governed by the Regent and Viceroy of Cyon is beyond number in power, yet the Kons can send 5 more fleets LKIE THIS at a snap of the fingers! But the Regency is surrounded by barriers of deadly Nebula of Gasses, Radiation Forces, Clouds of Anti-Matter near the Monopole. If the Collodians can move through the Tunnels of Low Energy and strike the Regency, they can cripple it long enough so new Kons forces will have to fight for a long time to reconquer the Zone. When they do, they will have to move up the narrow corridors (like the famous pass defended by Leonidas and his 300 Spartans against the Persion Host of Darius!), likewise limit the number of Kons Craft that can attack at one time. So a Culture with good fighters though outnumbered, can win. If Xenon (on the other board) wins, help will arrive and the Kons expansion might be halted in this direction permanently. Then this would bring Xenon a springboard for its own counter-war!




Xenon Export Cruisers and Collodian Fleets containing the fastest ships in the Galaxy, are included with 40 Kons war—ship counters in Imperial White. A beautiful Mapboard 22x28 inches long, even better unique rules go along with this BFA Game.

name: Kid's Book of Questions: Truth or Dare Game
description:
The Kids Book of Questions Truth or Dare game is a compilation of the best "truths" or questions from the best-selling book by Gregory Stock, Ph.D. plus a dose of zany dares that kids never tire of performing. Designed for kids 7 and up, this game is great for the whole family. Just like in traditional Truth or Dare, players first get to pick which category they want. With the game, they also get to select a 1- or 2-point question or dare, with the latter being a bit more difficult. They score points for answering the "truth" or performing the "dare." The first player to score 25 points wins. Any number of kids or grown-ups can play.

Contents:

Book of questions cards


Honors and Awards:
1999 - The National Parenting Center Seal of Approval
1999 - Winner of A Parent's Guide Children's Media Award
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based, Party Game, Trivia

name: Rapid Shoot Action
description:
The object of the Rapid Shoot Action game is to out score your opponent using rapid shoot disk shooters at the ends of the game board.

Contents:

1 Plastc Game base
4 Plastic pockets
2 Plastic Disk shooters
32 Plastic disks
16 Blue disks
16 Orange disks

name: Cubiko Word card deck
description:
Add to the depth of play with Cubiko Word by using the new rules and cards in this new expansion.

This 23 card deck adds a new way to play the basic game. Try to get rid of the letter cards in you hand by creating words on the board containing those letters.

name: Combi 4
description: Combi 4 can be played two different ways: Combi 4 SOLO and Combi 4 TOTAL. In both cases the pattern-cards are slid into the pillar. The timer is set and the pillar spins around for +/- 2 minutes. During the spinning of the pillar players have to reproduce the pattern using 16 cubes. (game introduction, translated from Dutch)

name: Almighty Heroes Adventure
description:
The object of the game is to travel around the board with spinning the spinner and help the Almighty Heroes accomplish their tasks and be the first to become an Almighty Hero.

Contents:

1 Game board
1 Spinner
24 Game tokens
6 Fairness tokens
6 Faith tokens
6 Honesty tokens
6 Love tokens
4 Almighty hero movers
4 Plastic mover holders
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Amazing State Race Trivia Game
description:
This trivia game is an auto race across the continental U.S. by answering questions about the states. The game board poster, about 19" x 11", is a map of the U.S. with color coded paths for 4 roadsters. A correct answer advances your race car one point along the route. An incorrect answer keeps the cars stationary until next turn. The first race car to reach the end of the route (answering 10 state trivia questions correctly) wins the game.

You can develop the game further by creating your own flashcard questions about the states.

Includes 1 foldout game board, 4 game pieces, 48 state trivia cards.

name: Don't Tell Me
description: In this game, each player wears a vinyl headband which holds two cards. The cards form a two-digit number, and the object of the game is to guess the number on your head. This is done by calling out numbers and having the other players tell you "high" or "low," with the information being tracked on a vinyl board. A round is won by the first person to guess their number, and the first person to win three rounds wins the game.

name: The "Trivia" Game of Sheboygan, Wisconsin
description:
This game was made as a fundraiser for the Accents of Sheboygan, a color guard team. The spaces on the board are business sponsors or lists of individual sponsors, featuring such historical local classics as Zurheide's Ice Cream and Prange's, neither of which still exist. The trivia cards are a mix of general trivia and Sheboygan history.

Roll the dice and move. The first to answer 12 questions correctly gets to try to answer a question from the Jackpot. The first to answer a question from the Jackpot wins.

name: Mob Boss
description: Shuffle deck. Deal out to each player one card at a time until all cards are dealt out. Each player checks their cards and discards all pairs. The player to the left of dealer offers their hand to the player on their left hiding cards from their view. That player then takes one card from the hand. Again, any pairs are discarded. Playing continues. "The Boss" card can be passed around several times. The object is to be left with "The Boss" card. Finally, when all pairs are laid down, there will be one person left with "The Boss" card. That person is "Boss of ‘The Family’".

name: Les cinq Dalton
description:
The batlle continues between the lonesome cowboy and the most notorious outlaws in the West. This game is a battle of wits, with Lucky Luke and his faithful steed Jolly Jumper on one side, and the Dalton brothers and Ma Dalton on the other.

The game consists of a plastic board, 8 squares by 8, on which are placed 64 counters. The orange counters represent Lucky Luke and Jolly Jumper. The purple counters the Dalton brothers and Ma Dalton.

Rules: the game is for 2 players. The aim is to get 5 counters in a row (4 Lucky Luke + Jolly Jumper or 4 Daltons + Ma Dalton)
Each player puts down one counter at a time, and his opponent must try to stop him making a line, ath the same time gaining points himself. each complete line is worth 1 point, and the player with the highest number of points is the winner

name: Air-musement Park
description:
In Air-musement Park the ride through the amusement park can be played alone or with others. Single players can work through each maze to improve their skills and improve their time. With multiple players, time each player's attempt and the player with the best time wins! If the player loses air control of the ball, the player must start over. Players can physically move around
each maze as they manipulate the ball through each challenge run; however, the player can not touch or move the maze itself.

name: Green Gators
description:
This silly word game includes 80 game cards. Players take turns describing the object (noun) on each card without saying the word on the card. The first person that guesses the correct word wins the card. When a player gets a card with a green alligator they give clues to the other players to help them guess the activity (verb) the alligator is doing. The person who correctly
guesses the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Pool Party
description:
The object of Pool Party game is to be the first player to bring their frogs (disks) into a row, starting from the smaller inner circle next to the island and continuing in a straight line out to the largest circle is the winner. Which frolicking frog will be first to hop in and form a row in the pool? Only the dice can say. This suspenseful game encourages kids to call on their thinking, basic math and social skills.

Contents:

1 Game board
30 Frogs (disks)


(Each disk size is in 6 colors: red, blue, green, purple, orange, yellow)
5 Large disks (1-3/16")
5 Semi-large disks (1-1/16")
5 Medium disks (7/8")
5 Semi-medium disks (13/16")
5 Small disks (19/32")

2 Standard 6-sided dice

name: What's Different? Matching game
description:
Look carefully! These images are very similar and as players match picture cards to them they develop concentration, observation, and critical thinking skills. Players match the picture cards with the pictures on their boards. The quickest player is the winner.

Contents:

4 Game boards


1 Balls game board
1 Cat game board
1 Clown game board
1 Tomato game board

36 Lotto picture cards


9 Balls lotto cards
9 Cat lotto cards
9 Clown lotto cards
9 Tomato lotto cards

1 Check sheet

name: Crayolino
description:
Unique charade card game where the players have to throw a dice and then depending of the number that comes up have the possibility to have drawn the same amount of pictures to figure out whats on the other players card.
The dice rolls... and it is a «2»! The player has the right to 2 drawings in order to make you guess by association of ideas, the object drawn on his card.

Contents:

100 cards featuring 600 objects in all,
5 pads of paper,
5 pencils
2 special dice.

name: Pirate Polo
description: Pirate Polo is a frantic live-action game for 2 - 4 "pirates". The game is played using a mini-trampoline as the playing surface. Each player has 5 dice of a single, unique color. In the center of the mini-trampoline is set a heavy, non-fragile cereal bowl. The players space themselves evenly around the mini-trampoline and place all five of their dice on the game surface in front of them. Each player has a polo mallet (at times also known as a serving spoon). On the starting signal, all players strike underneath the mini-trampoline with their polo mallet to try to propel their dice into the bowl. The first player to get all 5 dice in the bowl is the winner. This game is an alternative to the difficult to obtain Piratenbillard.

name: GeoSafari World Challenge
description:
This electronic talking quiz game challenges kids with fast-paced high tech fun! High quality digital Texas Instruments voice technology asks questions about world countries, rivers, mountains, landmarks and more. Over 7,500 intriguing questions! Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

Contents:

1 Electronic game unit features four light-up Play buttons for one to four players. Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

name: Snag
description: Players compete to accumulate the most tiles using a combination of memory, alertness and luck. When a 'Run' of 4 tiles in a row appears, the first to yell 'Snag!' is entitled to place them in his winnings pile. Players maneuver 80 wooden pieces on the board. Object of the game is outwit and outguess the opponents.

name: Wildcard Football
description:
This football strategy game revolves around a pair of selector cups, one for each player. The cups are built into the thick gridiron board and function as dials that determine the play selected by each coach.

The outcome of each offensive play is determined by die rolls in the selector cups. The offensive team rolls for yardage gained. The defensive player rolls two dice that can generate random events like a fumble or a penalty.

Play follows the rules of football with punts, field goals, and every other element of the sport.

The board includes a sliding football marker and a matching first down marker that also slides up and down the field. There is a huge scoreboard plus the rulebook.

Published in 1978 by Wildcard, Inc.

name: TT Races
description:
This is a simple roll and move game of the TT Races on the Isle of Man. The players take turns rolling dice and moving around the board, a 'satellite photo' style representation of the TT Races course. At various points they encounter obstacles that may slow them down or speed them up. They may land on spaces that cause them to draw Race Situation or Pit Signal cards which can affect their progress positively or negatively.

The game components as listed on the rules card are:

Board (TT Course)
Eight playing pieces of different colours (small plastic motorcycles)
One Throwing/Equipment Holder Box
Two Dice
Once Dice Cup
Six sets of Lap Scoring Cards (each numbered 1 - 6)
Sixty-six Race Situation cards
Sixty-four Pit Signal cards

name: The National Game of the Star-Spangled Banner
description: An educational game based on an earlier British game. One of the first games published in the USA.

name: Secouris le jeu de cartes
description:
Really close to happy families or games of trades, the goal is to collect a complete set of cards.

the theme of the game is first aid and families are related to to it (hazardous Products, first aid kit, holiday hazards, ect..)

after asking for a card, you need to answer the question on the card to win it.

The first player to collect a complete set win the game.

name: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High
description: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High is the first expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Gremlins and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters
description: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters is the second expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Giant Bugs, Dogs, Army Personnel, and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon's Dance
description: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon’s Dance is the third expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion provides a set of campaign rules with seven scenarios. It links all other games in the Dept. 13 series together and each is required to play. The results of each scenario are carried forward to the next scenario and can drastically affect the future events. This expansion adds new locations to the game as well, such as a Connecticut Mental Hospital where the Nazis are using the patients for bizarre experiments.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory
description: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory is the seventh expansion to the Steel and Glory games. This expansion adds mounted units, new terrain, and Squire and Barbarian characters to the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Comic Book Heroes 2
description: Comic Book Heroes 2 is the first expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Night Stalker and a new villain called Brute. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Comic Book Heroes 3
description: Comic Book Heroes 3 is the second expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Miss America and a new villain called Master Mind. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Comic Book Heroes 4
description: Comic Book Heroes 4 is the third expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Iron Eagle and a new villain called Doctor Death. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Monster Bash: Psychos and Cosmics
description: Monster Bash 3: Psychos and Cosmics is the second expansion to Monster Bash: Bloods and Lupines. This expansion adds insane clowns, psychotic children, and other strange creatures to the base game. New scenarios are added that allow the monsters to fight one on one or in large groups. Each monster has a collection of cards that list fight abilities and special powers that are used in battles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: NHL Slapshot: Western Conference Pack
description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game
Adding new carddeck with players from Western Conference.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: NHL Slapshot: Eastern Conference Pack
description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game
Adding new carddeck with players from Eastern Conference.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: TROLLBURGER
description:
The players are gnomes in the employ of a troll on a burger restaurant. The troll told them: "One of you will be fired at the end of the day; the one with worst cash!". The troll will take the customer’s orders and he hope the gnomes make their work fast, very fast; because if they delay an order, the customer (another troll, usually!) will get angry and leave the restaurant without paying.

GAME COMPONENTS

15 order cards
95 product cards
12 counters: 3 green, 3 blue, 3 yellow and 3 red
Rules

GAME PLAY

"Trollburger" is a 2-player card game. At the start of the turn, the starting player turn over the top deck card and show the number on it.

If that number is equal or higher thant the number of order cards on table, another order card is drawn and placed on the table.

Then the starting player choose to perform one of 4 actions on his turn. He can make that action as many times as the number shown at the start of the turn:

-Take cards from the product deck
-Search a card from the product deck
-Discard cards from the hand
-Place products on the table to build a burger

Then, he can choose to deliver a burger to the customers. The player can deliver an incomplete burger, in the hope that the customer does not realize.

Next, the other player takes his turn, using the same number;
and at last he becomes the starting player for the next turn.

If at any time, a 5th order has to be added on tha table, the older order on table is discarded (and any player who was working on it, loses his product cards).

GOAL

When a player devilers an order he takes that order card.
The game ends if 4 orders are discarded or the last order card is drawn.
At the end of the game, each player add the victory points of his order cards. The player with more victory points is the winner.

(Here you can find all the files to print & play your own Trollburger).


Los jugadores son gnomos que trabajan para un troll en una hamburgueseria. El troll les ha comunicado que uno de ellos sera despedido al final del dia; aquel que aporte menos al negocio. El troll es el encargado de coger los pedidos de los clientes y espera que los gnomos hagan su trabajo rapido, muy rapido; pues si se retrasan en entregar un pedido, el cliente (normalmente otro troll!!) se va a enfadar y se ira del restaurante si haber consumido.COMPONENTES DEL JUEGO

15 cartas de pedidos
95 cartas de productos
12 contadores: 3 verdes, 3 azules, 3 amarillos y 3 rojos
Reglas

EL JUEGO

"Trollburger" es un juego de cartas para 2 jugadores. Al principio del turno, el jugador inicial gira la carta superior de la baraja y muestra el número que aparece en ella.

Si ese numero es igual o mayor que el numero de cartas de pedidos en la mesa, aparece una nueva carta de pedido y se añade al centro de la mesa.

Después el jugador inicial elige cual de 4 posibles acciones quiere realizar en su turno. Podra hacer esa accion tantas veces como el numero que se ha mostrado al principio del turno:

-Coger cartas de la baraja de productos
-Buscar una carta en la baraja de productos
-Descartar cartas de la mano
-Colocar productos en la mesa para elaborar una hamburguesa

Despues, puede elegir entregar una hamburguesa a los clientes. El jugador puede entregar una hamburguesa que no este acabada, con la esperanza de que el cliente no se de cuenta.

Acto seguido, el otro jugador realiza su turno, usando el mismo numero; y al final se convierte en el jugador inicial para el siguiente turno.

Si en algun momento, se debe anadir un 5º pedido a la mesa, el pedido mas antiguo que hubiera en la mesa se descarta (y cualquier jugador que estuviera elaborando ese bocata, pierde los productos que tuviera en la mesa).

OBJETIVO

Cuando un jugador entrega un pedido se queda esa carta de pedido.
El juego finaliza si 4 pedidos se han descartado o si se muestra el ultimo pedido del mazo.
Al final de la partida, cada jugador suma los puntos de victoria de sus cartas de pedidos. El jugador con mas puntos de victoria es el ganador.

(Aqui puedes encontrar todos los archivos necesarios para imprimir y jugar a tu propio Trollburger)

name: Kung Fu U 2
description: Kung Fu U 2 is an expansion to Kung Fu U. Players use fighting cards to battle each other in Kung Fu matches. This expansion adds several new fight moves, defense techniques, opponent holds, and special attacks. New characters are added as well which are fully compatible with the characters in the first game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Runes 2
description: Runes 2 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 2 adds the Magical Schools of Necromancy and Elemental Earth to the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Runes 3
description: Runes 3 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 3 adds the Magical Fields of Conjuration and Elemental Air to the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Runes 4
description: Runes 4 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 4 adds the Magical Fields of Wizardry and Elemental Fire to the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Runes 5: Mystic Items
description: Runes 5: Mystic Items is an expansion to Runes, which adds cards to the game which modify the battle system. The expansion comes with 30 cards, each depicting a magic item, armor, or weapons which the players must purchase to use. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 5 is the only expansion to not offer new characters or spells, instead featuring only the Mystic Item Cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Paperclip Railways: Great Forest
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was published at publisher Facebook profile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: World Record Buck
description:
From the rules:
Welcome to the world of the furtive whitetail buck! Considered by veteran hunters to be one of the most challenging big game species on our continent, he is an amazingly adaptable animal, inhabiting regions from the fringes of our cities to remote wilderness.

Join fellow hunters in the stimulating, educational, sometimes frustrating, but always exciting chase as the whitetail seeks to elude you on his own turf.

WORLD RECORD BUCK is more than just a great game. It is a fine training tool for the young or future hunter, and serves as a reminder to us 'old timers' as well as we prepare for the next season. This game will help you get it all together! And who knows? The taker of the next 'World Record Buck' just may be you!


In this game, players play both a hunter and a deer, trying to stalk the deer belonging to other players while moving their own deer away from any hunters. First player to bag two deer win the game.
publishers: The Makers of World Record Buck

name: Darn!
description:
Darn! is an abstract, tactical, card playing, dice rolling board game taking place on three different areas.
On the playing board players move their pawns from field to field, try to collect tokens and to be the first to enter the goal field.
The dice pool contains a number of dice with positive and negative numbers. Players may choose dice from the dice pool when making moves.
Cards are played to perform moves, manipulate the dice or modify the way the dice are used.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Wall Street
description:
The game was developed with the aid of stock exchange brokers. The target audience are those people who want to have an easy introduction on the way the stock exchange works.

The aim of the game is to make your starting capital grow by buying stocks and gold. The worth of the stock fluctuates throughout the game, and the aim is to buy/sell stock at the most opportune time.
Rules also include Tender offers and Holdings.

Winner is the player with the highest worth of stock and gold.

name: SCHEELSopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A Monopoly style game featuring the Scheels sporting goods company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Let's Rodeo
description:
Let's Rodeo is a game for people to enjoy the sport of rodeo anyplace, anytime. This game is designed to show how one rodeos, starting from the amateur right up to the pro circuit and through to the finals.

Players roll a die and move around the game board, which consists of two circuits, amateur and pro. All players start by moving around the amateur circuit. Players enter rodeos by landing on a rodeo square and paying the entry fee. A card is then drawn which gives the player's result in the rodeo and money is awarded. Each rodeo can be entered multiple times. There are places on the board where players must pay money and some where broke players can earn money. Filling a "permit" (earning a set amount of money) is necessary to move into the pro circuit.

Once in the pro circuit each player must enter and place in each of the 8 pro rodeos. Each rodeo can only be entered once. Once any player has completed all 8 pro rodeos the finals begin. Any players still on the amateur circuit are eliminated. All players on the pro circuit roll dice to find out their standings in the final events. Winnings in the finals are added to money earned in the pro circuit and the winner is the player with the most money.

name: Counter: Real Time Miniature Combat
description:
Counter is a miniature game that lets you assemble a squad of troops that meets your requirements and then pit them against your opponents in real time.
Played in 30 second rounds, players race their miniatures over the contested hot-spots of the battle field while targeting and throwing out cover fire as best they can.

But speed and reflex must be tempered with strategy and patience.
Expend more resources than your opponents and they will get the drop on you.

But perhaps your squad has an ace or two up it's sleeve?
Did you bring more gunners than your opponent to likely win any fire fight? Or perhaps you opted to bring Heavies to devastate the battlefield and control the field of play? Or maybe you decided to unleash the kind of tactics and tricks that only your Ops can bring to a squad?

In any case, the battle will be fast a vicious, and leave you with plenty to consider and tinker with before the next battle begins.

---

Game play for Counter consists of 30 second rounds of frantic live action troop maneuvers performed by all players simultaneously.
Strategy and nerve must be used to lay out your action chips on the zones marked out in the battle field, as their placement will allow for different actions to take place:
- place them down in a zone and you can then move a troop on top of them, provided you can get him there fast enough
- place your chip on top of another players chip to lay down cover fire, preventing an enemy entering that zone.
- use your chips to target the troops in a zone, then get your troops in range to finish them off.
- reserve your chips to build up your intuitive and get the drop on other combatants, firing before they do.
All of these actions and more take place fluidly, and then the action resolves in a snap when the timer chimes, then in a flash it continues on in subsequent rounds until the battle field is secured or left devastated.

The dynamic real time action system along with team construction and the various orders and tactics that players can field with Op cards ensures every game of Counter will demand thought and instinct of a high caliber from all players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Zanshin
description:
Zanshin is a fast-paced bluff-based game about samurai fencing inspired by kendo and "Book of Five Rings". This game is my attempt to focus gameplay on "learn your opponent" rather than "learn in-game tactics".
Each player has same hand of skill, bluff and attack cards and five random Strike cards. Each round player try to spend less skill cards than his opponent in order to get advantage or catch an opponent on opposite strike. Players play their skill and bluff cards face down to form their intention for current round, than reacts on opponent's strikes and than ether evade or counterattack.
Three player variant Twofaced Dragon allows player to recreate 2vs1 fight. This variant keeps almost all mechanic from main rules and all players starts with same sets of cards, so wining this fight is very thought challenge for Dragon. I tired to make this variant as close to real situations in kenjutsu as possible. There is no artificial benefits or constrains and every mechanic change justified by real aspect of that kind of fights.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Les c√†cous de Marseille
description:
Les càcous de Marseille is a french roll & move game around the town of Marseille (a high place of regional specificities) it's culture and history in the humorous way.

Players move on the board then answer questions and make imitations to move ahead.
the subjects are the town, the language, the history and the soccer club (of course !)

Player who first arrives in the Vélodrome stadium win the game.

name: Seven Weeks
description:
Designers Note:

Have found a potentially interested publisher, and several changes to the design have been made. I'm very pleased with them, but this may mean that the description here will change. - Alex

SEVEN WEEKS is a 2 to 3 player Euro-style war game that aims to recreate the maneuvering, bloodshed, and events of the Austro-Prussian War of 1866 in the German and Bohemian theaters. (The Italian front is also represented as an influence upon forces available and overall morale.)

Players represent the Prussians and their North German allies, the Bavarian and Federal German forces (including Baden, Hesse Darmstadt, Nassau, and Wurttemburg amongst others) , and the Habsburgs (who also control the Saxons, Hanoverians, and Kurhessen/Hesse-Kassel forces). The Bavarian and Habsburg forces must work together to stop the Prussians from achieving the historical victory - a crushing blow for the Habsburgs, a defeat for independent states in Germany, and the beginning of a long era of Prussian hegemony over German affairs.

The game utilizes hand management and card driven mechanics. The map is a traditional hex map, depicting major population centers, fortresses, and rail lines. The combat system uses a system of "tactical cards" and battlefield deployment, implementing some fresh ideas intended to represent the player's role as the commander in chief of a military establishment and the necessity of relying upon the battlefield doctrine practiced by his/her forces. Prussian forces, for example, heavily rely upon open order formation and "Schnellfeuer" technique, while the Habsburgs are fond of the "Stosstaktik" approach and rely upon a superior artillery arm. The game is completely diceless.

The aim is to produce an exciting wargame that can easily be played within two hours. The game is currently in playtesting, and hoping for a "Sooner than Later" publication date as we look for a publisher.

name: Space Pirate
description:
Each player starts with 25 "ovni's" in his own color, 4 blue "ovni's" and 1 white "ovni".

The players take turns placing "ovni's", which are gears, on the board, thus creating a chain of gears. The gears must placed so that the gears can still turn.

A player can block an opponent's chain by placing a pirate (blue "ovni") at the end of his chain.

The player that can make the opponent's gear turn wins.

name: Jack-the-Lad
description:
A game of wheeling 'n' dealing - ducking 'n' diving - making or breaking!

Players move their character around the board, buying and gambling until there is only one player left with any money.

This is a roll-and-move game, where each space is either a gamble for gain or a penalty space.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Occupation of the Rhineland
description:
The tiniest of games I have seen, I think this one is smaller than Panzerpranks?

4 hexes one counter

The object is for the Germans to occupy the Rhineland just prior to WWII. A die must be provided by the players. The sequence is pretty simple, the German player attempts to enter the hexes of the Rhineland. Rolling on a chart to see if his move is successful. The French player does nothing. With a bad roll a French 75 goes off accidentally stopping the
German Move. The German wins if he enters all hexes of the Rhineland, the French player wins if he does SOMETHING!

Tounge in cheek, simple effective rules, I do see that it needs a little errata though.

name: Ben 10: Mission
description:
Ben 10 is on an important mission, join him on his quest in this Ben 10 Mission Board Game. A fantastic adventure for 2 to 4 players aged 5 and up.

Travel around the board collecting power tokens, transforming into alien warriors and battling Ben's many enemies. The first player to collect enough power tokens and reach the finishing square wins the game!

Included:

* Game board
* 4 playing pieces
* Die
* 12 power tokens
* Instructions
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ranger Rick-opoly
description:
Ranger Rick-opoly has all the fun of a traditional property game with some wild twists.
Go hiking and be a caretaker for your favorite animals in the Deep Green Wood. Raise the rent by collecting blocks of fresh CLEAN AIR and trade them in for a big PINE TREE! Learn fun facts on each animal deed... and MAKE CAMP and join Ranger Rick and his friends on a wonderful adventure.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Answer That!
description: This "Scene It?" variant is based on the Christian children's radio show "Adventures in Odyssey." Players take turns rolling a die and moving their character around a game board. There are five different kinds of trivia categories that can be landed on, including two that utilize a DVD player. First person to get to the end of the board wins. The DVD also features a boardless "Lightning Play" mode said to be best for fast play or a party situation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious, Trivia

name: Serious Pursuit
description:
Subtitle: The "Evil Empire" Exposed

This is a military trivia training game developed by the United States armed forces.

"The basis of the game is an understanding of the Soviet Union through its history, personalities, capabilities and its allies. Soviet seapower is more than just ships, aircraft and doctrine. It is centered around the men. This game will provide you with an understanding of these sailors. There is nothing trivial about the Soviet Navy. They are our greatest maritime adversary.

The following play equipment or implements are included with the game:

Colorful Game Board showing militaristic spaces printed in English and Russian; Assortment of Different Colored Wooden 'Ships'; Assortment of Different Colored Playing Chits; Five sets of question cards; Large Rules Book with Answer Key; and, 2 Dice."
publishers: Navy and Marine Corps Intelligence Center

name: Armageddon: The End is Near
description:
The game is played in a scenario on the brink of the Doomsday. Everything is scarce, raiders roaming free, nanotechnology is being used freely and natural resources are coming to an end. The so called government is trying to crowd control an inevitable riot but what they really want is to leave the planet before the end. However, only a few people know this plot.

Each player is a faction opposing the government but due to the latest information leak you will be struggling to participate in the escape route. Or you can start a Coup and take over control. Game ends when world ends or when the Coup is triggered. Whoever had the most influence wins the game and explores the new dawn.

Armageddon is the first of a three-game trilogy telling the history of some surviving factions in a post-nuclear war environment.

It's mainly a dice placement game using dice "pips" to get whatever goods are remaining, fight over some decay buildings and government privileges. The game lasts 7 rounds and each round one space for gathering resources is taken away.

Taking its basis from Stone Age and Alien Frontiers, it's intended as a highly-tematic dice-placement games of struggle for survival.

name: All About Syracuse
description:
The object of the game is for players to travel on the gameboard to the locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to their residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on their shopping list wins the game!

The board is made up of 6 oversized jigsaw puzzle pieces. It shows local businesses that players must travel to via the streets and highways. Spaces with question marks indicate a player must draw a Surprise card. Players must travel to the places on their shopping lists and return to their residence to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: I Luv London
description:
Localized version of the popular family board game Monopoly.
Players roll the dice and move around the (Canadian city!) London buying properties and trading.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Vampire Hunter's Roller-Dice Game
description:
Vampire Hunter’s Roller-Dice Game. All Alchemy dice games come in the same metal mint tin, Alchemy Gothic Aleus Occulta.

Object:
A two-player game, played in two turns.
Each player takes his turn to see who can be the most successful Vampire, roaming the night and attacking victims, before the Vampire Hunter eventually kills him.

Game Play:
In each turn, one player is the Vampire, while the other is the Vampire Hunter. When the Vampire is eventually killed, the players reverse roles for the second turn and the Vampire who finishes the best ‘score’ of victims, wins.
Each turn lasts as many nights as the Vampire can stay alive, with each die roll representing one night. The Vampire rolls first and notes his ‘score’. The Vampire Hunter then rolls to try to kill the Vampire or save his victims. This continues with the Vampire adding his score, until he is eventually killed.

The Vampire’s roller-die is marked with:
3 bats = 3 victims this night.
2 bats = 2 victims this night.
1 bat = 1 victim this night.
Sunrise = No victims caught on this night.
Fangs = Attacks the Vampire Hunter and wins two free nights, (without a Vampire Hunter die roll).
Coffin = Remains resting in Coffin for the night.

The Vampire Hunter’s roller-die is marked with:
Garlic = Saves (cancels) all Vampire victims this night.
Crucifix = Defends against, (cancels) Fangs.
Decapitation = Kills the Vampire, if not in his Coffin.
Stake = Kills the Vampire, if caught in his Coffin.

name: Polly Pocket Pollyville Card Game
description:
From the box:
Travel with Polly and her friends to explore 18 fun-filled locations in Pollyville. Along the way you'll stop at their favorite places: the Pet Shop, Pizzeria, Zoo, Beach and more.

The adventure starts by collecting three cards to complete a scene. The first player who matches four scenes wins the game!

Gameplay: Each player starts with seven cards. On each turn, a player draws one card, then lays down any matches they have (of 3 cards). If a match is laid down, the player draws three new cards. The player can continue to lay down matches and take 3 new cards until they can make no more matches. To complete the turn, the player discards one card. Cards cannot be picked up from the discard pile, but that pile is reshuffled to become the draw pile if that pile is depleted. First player to complete 4 matches wins the game.

name: K-Stateopoly
description:
From the box:
Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's List and collect a $200 scholarship. Play the traditional version or the 1 hour version.

This Monopoly variant utilizes locations and cards appropriate to the campus of Kansas State University.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Belmont Stakes Handicap Horse Racing Game
description: Handicap Horse Racing is basically a solitaire game which recreates a horse race. It takes the Daily Racing Form Past Performances and shows how to analyze it and fill out a Handicap Form Analysis Sheet. The player then alternates turns between using a spinner for the Analysis Sheet and playing Action Racing Cards. The box states that players will learn to read horse racing performance charts and how to handicap (predict) race results for all types of bets including; Daily Double, Quinella, Exacta and Tri-fecta. A clever and unique approach.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Golden Trivia Cards: Disney Edition
description:
Cards set for Golden Trivia Game Disney Edition.
