Contains 216 new Trivia Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Barbarians Attack!
description:
A horde of angry barbarians has landed on a remote island inhabited by peaceful villagers! Eager to please their capricious king, the barbarians have organized the conquest into a contest, with each faction vying to send home the best selection of captives. And so the warriors ravage the island in search of specimens from the strongest tribe to send back to the mainland.

Barbarians Attack is a strategy game that encourages players to craft the deadliest barbarian army. A player may acquire his choice of leadership traits and special powers during the game until his barbarian warriors are pillaging experts. The game rewards both sound tactics and clever power combinations.

Each turn, players use their allotted action points to acquire captives though battle and other means. Players earn fame in battle which they can spend on a selection of additional powers. When the island has been drained of captives, the player who has the most captives from the strongest tribe (the tribe with the most villagers remaining on the island) wins the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Trade-off: The Land Use Planning Game
description:
Trade-off, the land-use simulation game, allows participants to experience a wide range of community development situations in a relatively short period of time. Trade-off players will think about land-use and resource problems they have probably never considered before.
In Trade-off, 3 to 7 players act as Planning Commissioners, serving to regulate the actions of the 4-8 players who represent the Agricultural/Forestry, Industrial, Residential, and Commercial Center/Tourism Developers. The Developers aim to build their respective projects by purchasing and improving land on a grid map of a river valley. Meanwhile, the Commission, along with a Banker and Recorder, must maintain the area's environment and settle disputes between developers.
Time is measured in Trade-off with a Monopoly-type track running around the board. A full run of the track represents an in-game year. At each space on the track, events occur that affect the Developers, such as stock market fluctuations or environmental damage.
The game ends when the players agree to finish. At that time, the Developers assess the extent of their accomplishments, while weighing them against the environmental damage they potentially caused. Trade-off is primarily a classroom aid, and so discussion of actual land development is encouraged. No "winning" Development team is chosen officially, but players may use the map and each player's wealth to make a decision regarding victory.
categories: City Building, Economic, Educational, Environmental, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Voting

name: Street Basketball
description:
Basketball on the blacktop, fast and physical half court 3-on-3: that's Street Basketball, a two-player flicking game played on a custom wood surface.

Each player has 3 discs representing the players on his or her team. Players take turns flicking their discs driving and defending, and passing and shooting the basketball disc. Each time the basketball drops into the hole in front of the backboard, your team scores a point--two points if you launch from behind the arc. Thematic action Cards can be used at key points in the game to change the momentum in your favor.

The rules and cards are available to make a do-it-yourself version. Build the game, and check the rock!

(Note: included is a Soccer game on the opposite side of the board that plays similar to air hockey)

name: TOT Trivia
description:
Over 600 questions and answers
A complete set of illustrated Alphabet flash cards
A complete set of illustrated Number flash cards (1-9)
Ideal for home, or compact for travel. Game complete on its own or a great add-on to other trivia games. Large durable cards; easy to follow rules.

Cards are large 3" x 5" yellow in color and have trivia designed for 3-6 year age group.
The first player or team of players to discard all 4 character cards by answering correctly wins.
to play:
Separate the 7 draw cards and the 16 character play cards.
mix up the remaining play cards and return to the box. distribute 4 identical character play cards to each player or team. stack the draw cards and lay face down in a draw pile.
player to the left of the quiz-master begins the game.
select draw card to determine question number to be answered by the current player. if 1-6 is drawn then answer the appropriate question if 7 then show the image on the reverse of the card.

name: Mechropolis
description:
Mechropolis is currently under development.

Mechropolis is a game of adventure, tactical combat, and choose your own adventure-like campaign play. As added replay value, the game also incorporates a quicker player vs. player combat system included in the base game.

Taking place in the turmoil-ridden machine-city of Mechropolis, players assume the role of a mechanical freedom fighter, and travel the land in attempts to unhinge the current regime ruling the city with an iron (literally!) fist.

Players will have access to hundreds of items, weapons, skills, powers and upgrades, giving them fully customizable characters to play with.

Two ways to play:

1) Follow the "choose your own adventure" style game play in the cooperative campaign and fight against the enemy using tactical combat on a large, interchangeable game board. Players play against the game itself, no "dungeon master" needed. While not in combat, player traverse the terrain on the overall city area map, visiting locales, buying/selling scavenged items, and fighting through random encounters.

2) Play with or against your friends in player vs. player deathmatch, capture the flag, king of the hill, and other team games for a free for all, fun filled action packed gaming experience.

If you enjoyed PC games such as the Jagged Alliance series, X-COM, or Fallout: Tactics, you'll enjoy the tactical game play and customizable options in Mechropolis!

If you like games such as Star Wars: Epic Duals, Frag, and Gunslinger, but wish the game was more epic, strategic, less luck driven and deeper with more replay value, this will be the game for you!
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: StalkerQuest
description:
Players take the role of stalkers. They explore the Zone and try to survive in that environment. Each of them has its own purpose. The Zone very sensitive reacts to their every act, and the choice of the action can greatly influence not only on their fate, but also on the surrounding reality and to the fate of other stalkers.

In the beginning of the game each player gets a specific task, it's their personal goals, which induced to go into the Zone. Stepping outside the perimeter, they do not have to start to fulfill a task immediately, although it is well rewarded in victory points. They can simply explore the zone and get valuable artifacts. For their task fulfillment and searching artifacts they will receive a certain number of points.

Zone is a dangerous place, full of anomalies and unexplained creatures, a place where the other laws operate, neglect of which means to put themselves under the great risk. The zone is unpredictable. It will evaluate each action and make its verdict to each player.
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Clacto ; 4 and 4, Game with magnetic marbles
description:
Game contents :
- Game board
- 3 Red magnetic marbles
- 3 Blue magnetic marbles
- 2 Black magnetic marbles

Every player gets 3 marbles of equal colour and a black one. Both players start at the same time laying their marbles in the 3 holes of the equally coloured flowers. He, who succeeds first in doing so, then places his black marble in the flower in the middle. When marbles are attracted together and click, both players start all over again.
Do not play on a metal surface.
Contains magnets.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Heroes Inc 2
description:
Heroes Inc 2 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This expansion adds several scenarios, two new heroes - named Cat and Mouse, as well as new thugs for them to fight.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 3
description:
Heroes Inc 3 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This expansion adds new heroes to the game, including Black Bolt and Ace of Spades, and adds a large scenario in which players are able to bid to determine what objects will be placed on the map. Each player has 10 object points to spend and can choose from a variety of sizes (the cost varies by size). These objects are placed by the players on the map and can be used as obstacles or weapons.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 4: Character Builder
description:
Heroes Inc 4: Character Builder is an expansion to Heroes Inc. This game includes several new heroes and villains that can be used in the other scenarios, as well as a detailed set of instructions for players to design their own heroes. A formula is given to determine the cost of new heroes which is then used to purchase the hero in scenarios.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 5: Master Mind's Revenge
description:
Heroes Inc 5: Master Mind’s Revenge is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, a villain named Master Mind is attacking the city with giant robots, hired thugs, and other super villains in order to be crowned king. Master Mind is a disembodied brain. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. The villain side has certain objectives (such as rob the bank and exit the board) and the heroes win if they prevent these objectives from happening.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 6: Overmind's Invasion
description:
Heroes Inc 6: Overmind’s Invasion is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, an alien villain named Overmind is invading the Earth and only two heroes (Firefly and Liberty Lass) are there to fight him. Overmind is an alien with a very large brain and over-sized head. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. The villain side has certain objectives (such as do a certain amount of damage to the city and exit the board) and the heroes win if they prevent these objectives from happening.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 7: Mystic Pain
description:
Heroes Inc 7: Mystic Pain is an expansion to Heroes Inc 1, 2, and 3. All three games are required to use this expansion. In this expansion, Master Mind is back and has teamed with a magical new villain named Mysterion to once again try and take over the world. A young heroin named Magic and the other heroes must stop them. The scenarios in this expansion are linked together and are meant to be played in a specific order. For example, if the heroes lose scenario one, they move on to scenario two. If the heroes win, they can skip to scenario three.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes Inc 8
description:
Heroes Inc 8 is an expansion to Heroes Inc. In this expansion, a new hero named Star Girl has just started using her powers to fight crime. A villain, named Storm Queen, from a distant planet has come to Earth to conquer the inhabitants. It's up to Star Girl and the other heroes to stop her.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate for super hero fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Asteroid Racers
description:
Asteroid Racers is a racing game in which players are racing space ships through an asteroid field. Players may attack their opponents during the race in order to slow them down. Before the race, players can build and customize their ship using a points system. Players have 35 points to spend on ship components. Each player has a playing mat that keeps track of all upgrades to the ship as well as damage received from the asteroids and other players. The game also includes an Asteroid deck of cards which players use to track race progress and events.

From the publisher:
Asteroid Racers is a fast game of resource management and card play. The goal for each player is to be the first to traverse the deadly asteroid belt, racing at brake neck speeds so that you can be the first to cross the finish line and be declared the newest Asteroid Race champion. Be careful though, not only do you have to deal with the dangers of the asteroid belt, but also the other racers, for they will be armed with deadly weapons and missiles, each trying to shoot you down before you can win the race.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Dragon Ranchers
description:
Dragon Ranchers is a card game in which players build a dragon using cards that feature the dragon's attack and defense capabilities as well as other statistics. There are several rules governing traits the dragon can possess, such as no more than 10 attack or defense cards.

The players each have a hand of five cards which they use to build the dragon. At the start of each turn, they will roll an activation die and can only use cards with a value equal to or less than that number. As the players build their dragons, cards that have been placed on the table are playable but only those with a value less than the activation number are active.

From the publisher:
Dragon Ranchers allows players to build a dragon deck made up of various cards. When both players have constructed a deck, they then battle each other, using attacks and defensive moves as they try to defeat their opponents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Scooter Computer and Mr. Chips
description:
Madcap card game with a computer twist. The fun begins as players lay down cards in sequence, attempting to win the game by building a computer "program". More fun follows as the winner must act out his program, reciting tricky tongue twisters and performing hilarious stunts.

Scooter Computer & Mr. Chips was a segment which occasionally appeared in the Schoolhouse Rock educational cartoon TV show from 1982 to 1984.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Men of Bronze
description:
Men of Bronze takes the Steel and Glory system to the world of Steampunk. The game pits two groups against each others, one called Sky Patrol and one called The Masters of Terror. The game includes several characters from each faction and includes scenarios for large group battles and man-to-man fights.

The game uses a points system to buy characters with. Players have 40 points to spend on their heroes and villains in order to build the best group. The game follows the core rules of the other Steel and Glory games but adds new rules to accommodate the new Steampunk fighting techniques.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Multiverse Jumpers
description:
Remember Quantum Leap and Sliders? Maybe reading the Exiles series from Marvel Comics? Well this were it's at The game is a 3-5 players co-op where players work together to get back to their home dimension (Earth Prime). To do so they must split their forces between completing missions for/against historical figures encountered in alternate worlds and repairing the Navigator, a device that may lead them home... at least before it's out of power.

Introduction:
…You just woke up... the last thing you remember is being on that late night bus, slipping in and out of consciousness, rocked by the vibrations of the almost retired vehicle. Then you’re here, wherever that may be, everything looks strange but familiar, like looking through a cracked mirror. The other passengers are here too, and they found a device they say can take you all home. How do they know? Who knows indeed? It’s worth a shot, anyway you’re not liking the sounds of whatever is approaching.

You and the others have fallen through the dimensions that make the multiverse, an infinity of alternate realities where the best utopias and the worst nightmares can be found. The strange device you found, this "Navigator", seems to be the key to get home. But it doesn’t seem in good shape. Was it damaged before, is it the cause of your being here, is it some sort of test? All you know is that the batteries are fading fast and you and your fellow multiverse castaways better fix it and find your home dimension before you stay stranded forever...

Aim of the game:
Players must work together to complete the missions set by the Navigator on each world they land and repair the Navigator along the way to ensure that they make it back to their home dimension: Earth Prime. Each turn, the players will encounter a historical figure in a new dimension where things are different and must somehow be righted: a ruthless Benjamin Franklin has sided with the machines to destroy mankind and must be stopped, a benevolent Genghis Khan needs help surviving in a dying world... those are but a few of the thousands of possible missions the players will have to complete before going home.

Gameplay:
Each player receives a character card, indicating their strengths and weaknesses along five stats (Status, Fight, Intellect, Stealth and Tech). Each turn, by revealing one of each Alternate World, Target and Mission cards, the players get to face one of over 25000 challenges. As a group, they decide who will attempt the mission and pool their relevant stats to form the mission dice pool. Scoring more successes than the target in the contest set by the Mission card will allow the other players to repair the Navigator device. It's up to the players to assess their chances against various challenges and decide when to use the precious power left in the Navigator until they reveal the Earth Prime card hidden among 29 Alternate World cards to win the game. However the players can lose the game if the Navigator runs out of power or if they run out of World cards.

name: Nimxus
description:
This is game #16 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

Nimxus is in the Nim family. It has a unique feature where players can be forced to place pieces in a column or row, based upon how many pieces their opponent played. Each turn, players place 1-4 pieces on the board. This number, 1-4 corresponds with the number or row the player's opponent put pieces in. Each player has their own unique row, while sharing a column.

Play continues until a player has no legal move. At that point, that player wins the game.

name: Ordigo
description:
This is game #20 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

In this game, players alternate turns placing one or more pieces on the board, in attempt to be the first to gain control over at least half the board. Players have the ability to place more than one piece by placing pieces adjacent to one of their own and enemy pieces currently on the board, or surrounded a space that is either empty or containing one of their opponent's pieces.

name: Keine Mark zuviel
description:
Merchandising game

Players have to roll dice, move meeples over the board and reach target spots in order to get Bargain cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Butterfly Stop
description:
The whole carddeck are distributed among the players.
The players play the top card of their hand in the center of the table face-up. Whenever the "Butterfly stop" card is played the one who played it must exclaims "Butterfly stop" and is entitled to all the cards that have been played, but in case he omits to do so before the next card has been played, the cards must remain on the table.
At the end of the game the player holding the greatest number of cards scores 5 points.The one holding the card "Regal Silver Wing" scores 3 points and all the other butterfly cards scores 1 point each. Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Object, Action, Creature
description:
In this game teams compete to collect one card from each of three categories (Object, Action, and Creature).

Each member of a team brings 5 items (together the items must all fit in the palms of the hands of the person who brought the items) and those items are then used as props for that team.

On a turn a member of a team rolls the die, draws a card, and then using the props for the team (those items which each member of the team brought) attempts to get the other players of the team to guess the word on the card that corresponds to the roll of the die.

If a team fails to guess the word, the other team(s) have an opportunity to guess the word and steal the card from the team.

The first team to collect an Object card, an Action card, and a Creature card wins the game.

name: Grote Schattenjacht
description: this was a promotional game published for maredsous cheese. the purpose of the game is to find the hidden treasure in the abbey of maredsous. to find the treasure you must roll the dice, collect coins and answer questions. the game has 2 stacks of cards. 1 difficult and one easy.

name: Trial & Balance
description:
"The Off-Balance Game For Levelheaded People"

This is a vintage dexterity game from 1969. Based on the business executives shown on the cover illustration Trial & Balance was the kind of decorative item a corporate ladder-climber would keep on his desk.

The challenge is based on a fulcrum and balance beam with six slots spaced at regular intervals. There are six small weighted tokens that are maneuvered in these slots during play as the beam wobbles like a teeter-totter.

name: Richochet 4
description:
Players try to slide the puck off the bumpers into the right holes. Object is to be the first to get 4 in a row to win the game.

Contents:

2 part electronic game base
2 sliders
16 yellow discs
16 red discs
6 super rubberbands
8 pegs & 4 legs

name: Quintett
description:
Released in Spielerei No. 3

A game based on an idea from the movie "Quintett" from Robert Altmann.

Each player receives 3 playing pieces in one color. Additionally 3 dice are required.

A game is played in three rounds, each round consists of two phases: At the start of a round, a game chief is determined by rolling dice. This chief places one playing piece of each player on the hunting circle, to determine the hunting order: The order shows, which color can be attacked or must defend itself from the other colors.

Afterwards the players place their remaining playing pieces on the game board. Depending on the dice numbers they move their pieces and try to attack the appropriate colors. Certain dice combinations are keeping the own playing pieces safe. The game chief can redistribute the hunting order during the round. The winner of this phase plays against the game chief in a second phase. The player with remaining playing pieces on the game board wins the round.

name: √úberl√§ufer
description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 4.

Besides the game board you need three different playing pieces, four dice and paper and pen.

At the start of the game every player chooses one of the embassies at the edge of the game board and secretly chooses one of the playing pieces as a double agent.

The playing pieces start in the center of the game board and the players try to move them into their chosen embassies. All players roll their dice. Starting with the player getting highest result, the players moves one of the playing pieces. The players an voluntarily use less movement points or can cooperate with other players to move their agents as wished.

At the end of the game the players score points for agents in their embassies and for their double agents. The player with most points wins a game of "Überläufer".

name: Sheeps
description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 5.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, representing the sheeps and a differently colored playing piece, representing a dog.

With help of their dogs the players try to chase the sheeps into their enclosure. The sheeps start the game on their starting spaces. The dogs are in their kennels.

A player's turn consists of two actions: Firstly, he moves his dog one space in any of the eight directions. Secondly, he moves all sheep standing on one of the orthogonal or diagonal lines away from his dog.

The first player with all his sheep in his enclosure wins the game.

name: Punktejagd
description:
Place 5 at the "Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb 1989".

Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 15.

You try to geet the most victory points at game end.

The playing board shows a game track, a points track and a bonus track. Players start with 3 playing pieces on the game track. By rolling a die they move the pieces on the game board. On certain spaces the playing pieces can move from the game track to the points track and further on to the bonus track. Players can remove opposing playing pieces.

Game ends as soon as the first player has no playing pieces left on the outer track. All players count the points on the spaces of their playing pieces. Highest score wins the game.

name: Hexteroyd
description:
Hexteroyd is an abstract strategy game for 2 players with a background theme of Asteroid Mining. It plays in approximately 20 minutes.
Players take turn placing and removing pawns (the Colonies) on an hexagonal board (the Asteroid belt) with 5 hexagonal cells (the Asteroids) per side.
Playing the Colonies allow to have the controls of the cells through double-sided discs (the Mines).
Aim of the game is having control of the most valuable group of Mines (a Chain): the value of a Chain is given by the sum of the values of the adjacent Colonies.

The game will participate in an Abstract Strategy Game Design Contest in the mathematics festival "Tutto è Numero" in Caldè (Italy) at the end of July 2011

What's so special about Hexteroyd ?

Hexteroyd is a kind of connection game but with several twists:
- First and foremost, you don't need to connect distant parts of the board. You must connect points to... gain points !
- The pawns you use are shared between the players and have a double role: they allow the players to make actions and they are the points themselves: positive if you connect them on the board, negative if you keep them in your hand.
- You don't directly place the connecting pieces on the board: they come into play as a consequence of your playing a pawn, whether you place it on, or remove it from, the board.
- Connecting pieces (the discs) aren't fix, they have a certain degree of variability as the result of players' actions: once they are on the board, they remain on their cell, but they change owner, therefore changing the connected pawns.
Thanks to these characteristics, some parts of the board (usually the peripheral ones) are constantly subject to subtle but meaningful changes and the victory is somewhat uncertain till the end.

The strategic aspect of Hexteroyd originates in the different ways in which you can use pawns: if you tend to empty your hand, you will have more territory control but less mobility; if you keep them in hand you risk to lose points in the end if you can't get rid of them.

name: Global Challenge: The game of international peacekeeping-operations
description: Game produced by Identity Games Int. at the request of the dutch army. Its for 2-4 players and take 1-2 hours. The gameboard shows different countries where peacekeeping-operations can be done. Each peacekeeping-operation has 3 different sub-missions (Humanitary-aid, Peace-keeping, Peace-enforcing). When landing on a country the player takes a Oppertunity & Threats card which shows what mission needs to be prefomed and what is needed to complete it. The player also takes a Strategy card that can be used for special effects. Completing missions and being in charge of a region (on of the board edges) gives victory points. depending on the number of players 5, 7 or 11 victory points are required to win.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Modern Warfare, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Invest
description:
The Fortune Building Securities Game.

Starting with $10,000 players buy stock in leading corporations- selling them back for profit or loss depending on whether they're in a Recession, Depression, Prosperity or Recovery.

First player to reach $50,000 in cash and stocks is the winner.

name: In 80 Tagen durch Ozeanien
description:
In 80 Tagen durch Ozeanien is a card game of the Game of Authors and Top Trumps school. It is noteworthy primarily for incorporating mechanisms to allow the games to be playable with incomplete sets, thus allowing for a collectible format.

The photographs of marine fauna are rather nice. The card ratings, on the other hand, occasionally seem somewhat dubious.

name: Raptor Rampage
description:
Set in a remote research station, Raptor Rampage is a fun dinosaurs (velociraptors) versus humans game of survival for 2-6 players.

Players take sides, being either Raptors or Heroes. Along the way Heroes must search for weapons and items to defend themselves from the vicious Raptors. Meanwhile the Raptors use their instincts and guile to eradicate those pesky humans and their dangerous weapons.

To add to the variety, each character has their own set of skills and abilities. Add in a liberal dose of dice rolling, various missions and a modular map, Raptor Rampage is loads of rompin' chompin' good fun.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Cardomino
description:
An interesting game, that looks like it is card dominoes but it is a game in its own right. Each player chooses a colour and places that card in front of them. It has no part in the game other than to remind players who has which colour. I don't know why but the rules say that "this colour is kept for the WHOLE EVENING". (Their capital letters, not mine).
The deck is shuffled and each player gets 10 cards. The remaining undealt cards form a face-down draw pile. A player may, in turn, play one card in the middle of the board as in dominoes. Then the player replenishes his hand by drawing a card from the pool. The winner is the player who has the colour of the last card played when the pool is exhausted. The rules give a strategy tip - do not play cards of your own colour until victory looms. This will give you a good chance to play for a win.
Betting is suggested as an option, even onlookers are encouraged to bet on who will win.

name: Deuce, The Card and Lawn-Tennis Card-Dice Game
description:
Card game for 2 or 4 players
All the cards are dealt to each player and placed in front of them face-down. The server now rolls the die and that indicates if the serve was good or a fault. If the ball stays in play, the opponent reveals his first card from the stack in front of him. If the return of serve is good then the original server reveals the top card from his stack, and so on until the point is won.
Scoring is exactly the same as in real tennis.

name: Backseat Battles
description:
"PUNCH BUGGY NO PUNCH BACKS". Ah remember the good old days in the back seat with your siblings, and how red your arm was be the time you got to grandma's house? Now you can relive those fond memories without the pain, in the dice game "Backseat Battles".

Backseat Battles is played with 8 battle dice and 2 revenge dice. During the players turn they roll all 8 battle dice and set aside any hits they have rolled. The player continues to roll and building their score as long as they risk or until they roll no hits and dad pulls the car over losing all their hits. Beware of sibling rivalry, if a revenge is rolled, their opponent gets the chance to fight back and possibly steal their points.
A simple game of lucky with a touch of strategy built in. For ages 6 and up.

name: Prayer Path
description:
"Take a journey with Jesus"

This is a religious game based on the Rosary. Players move along the "bead" pathway and answer questions. A correct answer moves a player's token forward... after he or she has recited the appropriate prayer. The first contestant to complete the rosary is declared the winner.

Includes colorful game board, tokens, rules, cards, and a storage insert.

name: Sudoku Slide!
description:
Race against your opponent to form Sudoku! This version of Sudoku pits two players against each other in a contest to see who can form Sudoku first on the board by sliding chips.

The "Sudoku Slide" is a 2 players game. Players must race to see which one can arrange the tiles in "Sudoku" order - one of each, none repeated in 5 vertical columns and 5 horizontal rows first.

A real time game reminiscent of Alex Randolph's Square Off but using Sudoku as a basis.

Contents:

The Table
Frame
24 Blue Numbered Tiles
24 Red Numbered Tiles
2 Blank Tiles
2 Tile Storage Bags

How to Play:

Place the 24 Blue Numbered Tiles on one playing surface of the Table; and

The 24 Red Numbered Tiles on the other, all number face up.

One player mixes the Blue tile order while the other player mixes the Red tile order.

When both players are ready, turn the table around so that each player has the other set of tiles.

Begin to slide the tiles, using the empty space to arrange them in SuDoKu numerical order. That means, one of each, none repeated from number 1 - 5 on each Vertical Column and Horizontal Row. The Blank Space is "wild" and may count as any number.

The first player to accomplish the SuDoKu Slide must bring the frame down to the opponent's side and declare himself to be the winner. The other player may examine the tiles to confirm that they are in fact all in SuDoKu position. If in fact they are in SuDoKu position, the first player wins one point. If they are NOT in SuDoKu position, the challenging player wins 2 points.

Players may play as many rounds or for as many points as they agree upon. It is customary to play until a player wins 3 points for the short game or 11 points for the full game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Cricket World Cup
description:
Description from the box:

"An exciting game ...full of ups and downs !! Are you ready for it ..!! Enjoy the game of cricket in the form of board game with the same intensity and see if you can control your heart beat.

A unique double sided board with an option of two kinds of plays...either from the bowling side or from the batting side!! Interesting and captivating ...So what are you waiting for...!!!"

Actually, this game is a basic roll-and-move, collecting "world cup coins" along the way according to instructions on certain spaces. When all players have reached the end of the track, the one with the most coins wins. There is not a single decision to make in the game.

The game was made for "Poundland" stores by Play Craft Traders, trade marked by Fun-Tastic.

name: Mil nombres de la A a la Z
description:
A very easy educational board game for children where each player in turn must pick a thematic card with drawings, look at it secretly and name an animal, object, etc related to the card and beginning with the letter his pivot is on, starting with the "A" and advancing along the alphabet track.

Each player has 30 seconds to say a name, if he can not do it, he hands the card to the next player. The first person to reach the Z position on the board is the winner.

Contents:
-4 coloured pivots
-Track board
-16 thematic cards
-Rules (on the back of the cover box)

name: Combat Lines
description:
OVERVIEW: A dice game for two players. Players create random FORCE POOLS, arrange them secretly into four Lines opposite each other, then reveal their setups and resolve combat. The leftover 5 COMMDICE may be added to a player's Line using SPECIALS [surprises]. Loser of each combat surrenders a die from that Line. After three rounds of play, the player with the most captured dice wins.
DETAILS: Each player starts with their own pool of 45 dice. Select 10 randomly and roll, repeating twice for a possible 30 dice FORCE POOL [some may be chosen over others]. Players then bid for a COMMON DICE POOL of 10 dice. Winner rolls the COMMDICE, keeps three and passes two to the loser. Players then secretly arrange their dice into four Combat Lines [hence the name]. Each opposing Line is resolved [with special dice that can remove, add or manipulate dice in their own or opponent's Line] with the loser surrendering one die. After three rounds of play, the player with the most captured dice wins.
COMPONENTS:
90 dice [total]
- 45 of one color [Player A]
- 45 of a different color [Player B]
- 10 of a third color [Common Dice]
a pair of hand-sewn dice bags
a 20 page rulebook [includes a complete game, in step-by-step example format]
a pair of laminated cheat sheets
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Frontline General: Spearpoint 1987
description:
Frontline General: Spearpoint 1987 is a new standalone modern combat card wargame from veteran designer James M. Day (Panzer, 88, Armor, MBT, IDF, Kaiser‚Äôs Pirates, and a host of computer games to his credit) and system designer Byron Collins of Collins Epic Wargames (the publisher).

The basic Spearpoint 1943 card-based system is applied to a near-modern 1987 European hypothetical conflict setting between the US and USSR, drawing from Jim Day's expertise on cold war era US and Soviet military equipment. This game includes Command, Unit, and Damage Cards, dice, tracking counters, rules and scenarios, and is expected to be released in 2012.

Box Art by Mark Mahaffey is coming soon with additional previews and information to follow.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Heroes of the Slam
description:
Simple statistical replay game on tennis, featuring 4 sample tournaments (Wimbledon 74, Roland Garros 76, US Open 87, Australian open 2005).
It contains data for each player in the tournament, each rated for service, return and decision factor.
Game play is very easy: roll a percentage dice for the service of the first player; if the roll is inside the range, he wins the game, otherwise roll on the return factor of the opponent and see if he wins the game; if not, the decision factor and another roll of a die give the game to one of players.
Many expansion set forthcoming, even for such esoterica as mixed doubles!

name: T√ºrkisch f√ºr den Urlaub
description:
Türkisch für den Urlaub is a simple quiz game about translating German phrases into Turkish.

Players roll a die, move their pawn, and - depending on the area they reach - are asked to translate a phrase. If they do so correctly, they score a point. The first player to score 5 points is the winner.

name: Brand Manager in Business World 2000
description:
Players take on the role of investors expandning their own business with new branches being established and opened continuously. They need to balance out all economic activity to be able to progress evenly and gain points in the best possible way.

Players use pawns moving on a circular board each Round (in a typical roll-and-move fashion), cards from variuos piles according to the spaces they land on and their own judgement in managing their branches.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Let's Learn About Different Food
description: A fun and simple game for children who want to learn about different food. Solving tasks, and set the tiles shuffled on the table. If we solve all the tasks correctly, you will find the fun side of the board background image! The game includes 8 playing boards and 72 different levels to do - learn the food like bananas, oranges and other in the simplest and more difficult like meat, cakes and meals for hardest. The winner is the one gets right all the pictures! Easy and fun game for small children.

name: The Cub Scout Game
description:
The object of the game is to collect Cub Scout proficiency badges by moving around the playing board using a six-sided dice, answering questions on the chosen subjects. There are 26 subjects and 468 questions. (The questions are published at the back of the rule book.)

The winner is the first to gain a complete set of badges. The players' boards are images of sleeves, where the badges are placed, exactly like the real badges.
publishers: R. F. Development Co. Ltd., The Scout Association

name: Konami Beast Shooter
description:
Game Contents: Customizable game board, 1 Bag of Bumpers, 1 Bag of plastic rivets to hold the bumpers in place, 4 Plastic Monster on a roller base - including Godzilla, Mechanized Godzilla, Mothra,& Three Headed Hydra, 2 Skyscrapers, 2 Train Cars, two shooters (one red and one blue) and the instructions - all in Japanese.

The Board is set up in a maze fashion using the bumpers. The goal appears to be either to get your monster from the the start to the finish. Bonus points are scored for destroying skyscrapers, train cars or other monsters along the way.

name: Scam
description:
Subtitled "The Game that turns your living room into a street corner ."

Players of Monopoly (q.v.) will find themselves in very familiar territory, as players roll dice to move around the game board and purchase property. The houses and hotels from Monopoly are replaced by fields and factories. Players determine the end game conditions by mutual agreement but the winner is the player with the most money.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Siege of Havana
description:
This is a game about the Spanish-American War that was published in 1898.

The map depicts a harbor defended by artillery batteries. The attacking player maneuvers a fleet of wooden "battleship" tokens along the pathway through the channel. Wooden "artillery shells" are used to mark hits.

Includes a colorful board, four ships, ammunition tokens, a dice cup, dice, and a spinner.

name: 3-D Bullz Eye Dartz
description: 3-D Bullz Eye Dartz, takes the tradition wall-mounted dartboard and lays it on its side. The dartboard is magnetic and can be played flat, or in 3-D mode. It comes with 2 sets of magnetic darts that are launched from spring-boards. Any number of traditional dart games such as 501, 301 and Cricket can be played on the table-top board.

name: Mojje
description:
From the publisher:
Game made after a local kids show Mojje. Show is for children and in the show the kids will have to sings like animals. This game made after the show comes with a soundtrack from the show and a DVD as well.
Game itself is easy and short. Game has a lot of identical puzzle pieces with a piano string on them.
The game comes with a bunch of cards, one picture on each of them.
At the start of the game parent start the soundtrack. It has about 30-40 short songs on it. Every time Mojja says on the CD "Let's sing along" players add a new piano piece to the board. Game ends when all piano pieces are in place.
Players get each 8 cards at the beginning of the game. Now every time they hear a noise one of the cards in their hands make (dog, cat, pig) or named item (bananas, oranges) they have to mimic it and then play the card. First player to get rid of the cards is the winner.

name: Go & move
description:
Go & move was developed under a project of the German Economy in Cologne. It is purely a board game without computer assistance. It should give pupils a hands-on introduction to the business world. The goal is to inspire these young people for the economy, to lead them in mind as representing diverse economic decisions for entrepreneurs can be. It is primarily for school lessons in the region of North Rhine Westphalia thought. Thus it can not be ordered or purchased outside of this region.

Players assume the role of owners of printing companies. They are advertising for their business, acquire orders that regulate the number of employees, advertise for public orders. They always have to make sure that the orders are fulfilled on time.
A particularly interesting element is that, the pupils, beyond the basic rules, can arrange their own ways of dealing with the taks: by making arrangements, joint ventures and transmission of orders. The game length is variable. The game ends immediately when a company becomes insolvent.

name: The Conversation Circle Creator
description:
The conversation circle is a party game that attempts to start meaningful conversations. The game is made of 3 dice that each have a conversation prompt written on 5 sides, and a Grand Marnier bottle on the last side.

The rules give 3 variants using these dice: A party game where you roll the die and give them to other players to answer, a couples game that plays similarly to the "newly wed game" and a team game that uses the prompts on the die for charades.

The game comes in a plastic cylinder and includes the following:
-A 3 page rule boo
-3 Plastic 6-sided Dice
-1 black cloth pouch
-8 coasters

name: Der blitzgescheite W√∂rter-Detektiv
description:
Educational game aimed at teaching kids the difference between word classes (adjectives, verbs and nouns). A "board" is laid out from track cards. Then the players roll and move around a track. When they get to an obstacle field, they have to draw a card and determine the class of the word on the card in order to proceed. The first player to cross the finish line is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: FaceOff Hockey
description:
FACE-OFF is a complete simulation of the game of professional ice hockey. It does not cut corners with detail and includes every facet of the fastest team sport in the world.
Dice based game that accurately reflects the speed and action of a professional hockey game.
Players consult charts and individual player cards for actions including passing, shooting and goaltending.
Solo or face to face play is possible. Play is divided into 24 second action segments, and is fast moving with the die roll.

name: Paperclip Railways: Eastern Bazaar
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was published at publisher Facebook profile.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Schatzsuche
description:
Learn German easily with the thief Razeputz and security-agent Gupfinger!

The game players chase thief Razeputz, who stole a valuable treasure. The treasure is hidden in the thieves' cottage deep in the dark forest. If a player has a key for the cottage, he can recover a treasure chest and bring it quickly to security-agent Gupfinger. But of course that is not so easy. To get to the goal (Gupfinger) there are several dangers awaiting the players. Suspenseful entertainment is the goal, good knowledge of German language is the result. This game is not only fun for children, but adults can enjoy this game as well.

name: Teufelskicker: Moritz macht das Spiel!
description:
Objective: Gain most victory chips/points
- acting by turns -
players form 5 + 1 (centre) areas with victory points inside; 7 buttons (hidden) are placed around/among, 4 with individual images; active player is questioned to flip requested image; if successful player may us a large chip to flip a small one into a previously determined area - success? Take a victory point.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Sure Shot Basketball
description:
The object of Sure Shot Basketball game is to be the player to score 15 Baskets. Players take turns at being the SHOOTER and the BLOCKER for a period of 5 shots. When a SHOOTER attempts 5 shots his turn is over. Players then change places so that the player who was the SHOOTER becomes the BLOCKER. They continue changing places after each 5 shots.

Contents:

1 Base
1 Arch
1 Backboard
1 Basket
1 Shooter
1 Shooter's shooter
1 Blocker
2 Basketballs

name: Whoops
description:
From the Manufacturer:
There are 12 Whoops stepping stones on the floor. Players
challenge their balancing skills in this whole body game that requires agility and coordination. To play Whoops, players take turns placing numbered stones in any pattern they choose. Players must then pick up each stone in numerical order - but they have to balance on the other stones, without touching the ground! One little slip and the turn are over.

name: Hip Hopscotch
description: Hip Hopscotch combines the old and new in a contemporary version of hopscotch. Offered several placement options, players set up the game pads in wildly creative patterns and then take turns jumping and moving from START to STOP. Players must not land on the ground or miss a number. They must be quick on their feet, too, as special direction pads require them to do certain kinds of jumps.

name: Upset
description: Toss the Bean Bags and be the first player to get at least one bean bag in each of their 3 cups. Hit the upset button to dump your opponent bean bags.

name: The Hooker
description:
When the night settles on the city of New Sodomy nightly creatures begin their work. The customers are waiting and need sadisfaction...

In Hooker players try to work their way up on the human market - selling themselves. Players have 6 skills (oral, anal, vaginal, fetish, social, lesbian)and stamina which is used up as the night passes.

There is two ways to win: when a hooker has collected $ 50 she's able to buy herself out of the system and get a normal life; if a hooker should get 3 points in every skill she'll be offered a work in high-class establisment and she can get off the streets.

name: Mercenaries and Rebels
description:
Players throw dice to move from prison in Bab Alazizia to Tripoli. The game starts at a square in Benghazi marked February 17th (2011), Libya's first "day of rage". It ends at a square in Tripoli marked Freedom.

From the Economist.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Buffalo in-a-box
description:
This is a version of Monopoly that features landmarks of Buffalo, NY.

From the box: Buy property, build a skyline, trade the skyline for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough--but add a traffic jam, property taxes, car fines and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: War on Drugs
description: "War on Drugs" is a roll and move Trivia Game designed to help parents and educators have discussions with children about the dangers of Drug Use. Players roll a die, and move, then are asked a question. If they get it correct, they roll again so on and so forth. The first player to get their piece to the square marked "100" (they are in numerical order) wins!

name: Pixeline for fuld fart
description:
From the publisher:
A fast and active children's game where players must perform fun tasks and move forward on the game board. Some of the tasks the children get up from his chair, while others require quick thinking. For the tasks performed players have won coins which they can use to buy pieces to their puzzle. First player with complete puzzle wins.

name: Fr√•gekort: Musik och underh√•llning
description:
From the publisher:
300 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about music and entertainment around the world. Get 6 right befor the end, and you've won!

name: Trivia Game Sport and Entertainment
description:
From the publisher:
300 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about world sport and entertainment. Get more right for the end, and you've won!

name: Biblical Biographical Exercises: No.3 Judges and Giants
description:
23 cards. A game that might be used by a teacher or, more especially, a Sunday School teacher. The cards quote verses from the Bible and the teacher asks his pupils to quote chapter and verse verbatim. If they are correct they can either take the card or he can award points. The first player to collect a pre-set number of cards or to reach a pre-set number of points, wins.
The cards have no graphics at all and could best be described as functional.

name: The Round Card Game of Sparx or Listening In
description:
A game from the early days of radio. There are seven sets of seven cards and you use one set per player per game.
Players call out for cards they need to complete their set (in the manner of Pit) and points are scored depending on the place the set originates from e.g. London. Glasgow, etc..The player has to call out "Tuned In to London" or where ever for his set..
There are two special cards:
Oscillator - which is a penalty card if another player calls "Tuned in to xxx" whilst you hold the card.
K.D.K.A. American Broadcast Station - Can be used as a wild card to replace a proper card. If you can complete a set without the use of this card and you have it in your hand, then you score double points for your set.
The cards are rather nice, showing radio call-signs in those first few years.

name: Sect: The Religious Party Game
description:
The object is to be the first player/team to collect all four knowledge pieces and ascend into Enlightenment. Answering questions correctly from the four categories (Islam, Judaism, Christianity, and Potpourri) gains knowledge pieces and allows players/teams to continue on. An incorrect answer ends the turn.

"The Ultimate Goal of This Game: Hopefully playing this game has put a more human face on a religion or religions that you did not know much about. Perhaps it inspires you to read more about a particular religion. The internet or your local library is rich with resources on religions of the world. Or perhaps, playing this has made you more tolerant of religions other than your own. If any of these things have happened, my game will be a huge success." - Unnamed Creator (taken from the rules page)

name: Run Sheep Run
description:
Each player spins the spinner and moves his playing piece.
OBJECT: Be the first player to reach THE POPCORN STAND.

name: Soapbox Derby
description:
The heat is on! In this fast and furious card game, four teams of rambunctious racers steer their homemade soapbox derby cars toward the finish line. Every turn is timed, so think fast and get out in front of your wily opponents. But watch out for those potholes, oil slicks and pesky squirrels or you'll be digging out splinters from the ditch!

Soapbox Derby features a deck of 45 cards, with four soapbox racers on each card in different configurations that represent race positions (i.e., first, second, third, fourth). There are three face-up card stacks that represent stages of the downhill course, a face-down draw deck, and two face-up cards next to the main draw deck for card options during play. Each turn a player chooses one of two face-up option cards, or one random from the face-down stack, and chooses one of the three open race stage stacks on which to play the card. Placing a card on the first stage stack has no special effect on the race, but placing a card on the second stage stack allows a player to choose one card from the first or third stage stacks and take it out of the race and back to the "pit" - the two option stacks next to the main deck. Placing a card in the third stage stack forces the player to swap the position of that stack with the first or second stack.

The race is timed - three minutes for each heat. Then players score points for the positions of their racers when time runs out. Three heats decides the winner!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Network and Route Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Destruction Derby
description:
Two to eight drivers find themselves in an arena, each aiming to wreck his opponents' vehicles.

Each turn, players program one action token and one movement card, which are then revealed and resolved in turn order. (Unless you played your "1st Player" one-shot action token to get out of a hellish situation -- or take advantage of a once-in-a-lifetime impending ram-o-thon...)

The game features no weapons, so you MUST ding up your own car in order to inflict damage to the opponents' cars. In fact, managing that self-inflicted damage is at the heart of the game. (And there's only so much a factory-installed ramplate can take.)

Once a third of the cars have been wrecked -- either because the armor is completely gone from one section or the car sustained one too many critical hits -- whoever has scored the most points (i.e. inflicted the most damage to opponents) AND is still alive is declared the winner!

name: Paperclip Railways: Nobility City
description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was published at main game entry (among other images) by the designer.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Honeycomb 6 Domino
description:
Honeycomb 6 is a round game based on a combination of the well-known dominoes and the shape of a honeycomb.
You claim completed hexagons by putting a colored chit in it's middle.
It consists of 119 differently marked tiles as well as 6 x 12 counters in 6 colors.

name: Indian Scout
description:
Native American themed family game for 2-4 players. With assistance children of all ages can play, though the simple wooden movers might be hazardous to children under the age of 3. The game employs a simple spin-and-move mechanism where the first player to reach the finish wins. Players move ahead the number spun. There are spaces on the board with special instructions indicated by the red arrowheads. If a player lands on one of those spaces the player must follow the instructions. If a player lands on an occupied space, that player moves back 5 spaces.

It's a classic late 1930's American game with simple mechanics and tremendous graphic appeal.

name: Shoot the Crow
description: Target shooting game. Shooter uses a cardboard gun as a platform for aiming a rubber band loaded with a wooden ball at standing crow targets. Each of the crow targets has a different point value (five or ten) based on the size/shape of the crow silhouette. First player to hit targets totaling 25 points wins the game.

name: Loose Cannons
description:
Those crazy Clowns have taken over the circus cannons again. They've created a wall of colorful blocks and are taking turns blasting it with cannonballs. Blocks and cannonballs are flying everywhere. Each Clown has a favorite color and he's trying to keep the other Clowns from blasting the blocks of that secret color.

In Loose Cannons players are clowns that take turns playing range cards, that represent cannon fire, at a wall of colorful blocks. Each clown is attempting to remove the other clown's secret colors and protect their own color.

The first phase of the game involves the building of the wall. After players have discovered their secret color and a secret numbered block they take turns pulling blocks from a bag and placing them in the wall.
When the wall is complete, players take turns playing cards from their hand to knock blocks out of the wall. The deck includes a lot of special cards to make cannonballs miss-fire, go long, fall short or even knock 2 blocks off in one shot.
There are a limited number of cannonballs per player, which varies based on the number of players, so when the first player shoots his last cannonball, the round is completed and scores are tallied.

name: Telling Time With Tibbar
description:
Time to learn!

Learn to tell time with Tibbar! Practice telling time by moving Tibbar's hands on Tibbar's Clock Puzzle. Learn three different clock formats (analog, digital, and 24-hour) by playing the memory game Tibbar's Time Game.

The last player to get out of bed this morning starts the game. This player begins by turning over 3 clock tiles, one of each color (red, green, and blue).

- If the tiles each show the same time, the player collects the tiles and begins a new turn. A player may continue taking turns as long as they can reveal the correct tiles.

- If the tiles do not show the same time, the player must turn them back clock-face down. The player to the left then takes the next turn, following the same rules.

After all tiles have been collected, the game ends. The player with the most completed sets wins! Note that the back of the rules booklet contains a handy guide for players having trouble reading the times at first.

Teaches:
Memory
Fine Motor Skills
Telling Time in 3 ways

name: Jinx
description: Jinx is a simple roll-and-move game for 2-4 players where the winner is the first to reach the top of a 10 step cardboard staircase that you assemble. Four colored plastic pawns are used as movers. The single wooden die is rolled once per turn and the players follow the printed instructions. Rolling JINX moves the player's pawn back to step number 1.

name: Paia
description:
Paia is an abstract game played on a grid of 7x7 squares. Each player has a set of pieces with various lines of fire. When a piece of the opponent is within two of your lines of fire, the opponent's piece is destroyed. The goal of the game is to have the most non-destroyed pieces on the board when all pieces have been placed.

Official Rules

name: Scrabble Junior: Charlotte's Web
description:
Scrabble Junior: Charlotte's Web is a Charlotte's Web version of the Scrabble Junior family. The game features a two-sided gameboard and 104 letter tiles. The words to be created are printed on the gameboard, and the players take turns placing up to two letters per turn onto those words, always placing the next letter of the word in order. Points are scored for being the player to place the letter tile that completes a word.

From the game box: "Match up letters and spell out the words in Charlotte's Web! Join Wilbur and Charlotte on the Zuckerman's Farm. Use your letter tiles to spell the words Charlotte spelled, and many more. Every time you finish a word you get a scoring chip. When all the tiles are played, the one with the most chips wins!"
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Word Game

name: Brawl Inn
description:
In Brawl Inn each player rule a tavern , and they compete to attract the best clients and collect money to hire staff and buy furniture.
In the tavern , you must serve drinks to clients to get money, but if you serve him too much , they can start a brawl!
Choose wise wich clients will drink more, but beware with those who drink too much!!
Hire Staff as waiters and security to improve your tavern and keep it safe from destructive brawls.
You must make rise your tavern and start brawls on the tavern's oponent, buy furniture and winning the game obtaining the ultimate prize for a tavern...
The mithril fork!

name: Hot Bats Baseball
description:
Hot Bats Baseball is played in three innings. Like real baseball, three strikes equal an Out and three Outs (per player) equal an inning.
Players try to strike the balls with the help of (like pinball) flippers.
Whether you play alone or against another, the object of the game is to achieve the highest number of runs (points) possible within three innings.

Contents:

1 Hot Bats Baseball Arena
4 Plastic basketballs (1 1/4")
6 Playing cards
1 3-Piece baseball net
1 Top piece
1 Left piece
1 Right piece
4 Mini-Baseballs (7/8")

name: Hats Off
description: Hats Off is a wooden game made by Schylling. There are 6 colored wooden clowns on a rod that rotate when the wooden ball hits them. Table top bowling. When the ball hits the clown the hat falls off. Each player has 3 rolls to try & knock all the hats off the clowns.

name: Agent Bones In: Mission Bonehead
description:
Mission Bonehead is an educational trivia game designed to be used in the classroom to review, expand and enhance students' knowledge of bone health. Through the use of action cards during the gameplay, it also gets students to move their bones while they play!" Mission Bonehead divides the students into four different teams with one or more students per team: Team Calendar, Team Hand, Team Sandwich, and Team Shoe to answer trivia questions and perform bone-building activites.
In a quest to reach the end of the board, players answer multiple choice questions about bone health or perform activities such as doing fifteen jumping jacks to move varying numbers of spaces on the board based on the difficulty of the question/activity. During each team's turn, a player from an opposing team will read out either a blue question card, which has a multiple choice question which the team must answer, or a green action card, which will have an activity which the whole group must perform.

name: Fu: The Game of @#%* Up Politics
description:
A satirical political game of cunning and intrigue. Players take turns playing cards and casting votes attempting to be the first to reach the stated goal conditions.

Each turn, players draw a card, and then play a card. Certain cards require a vote. Each player starts with one vote, but may acquire more through some cards. If a vote passes, the card is played. If it fails, the card is discarded. Either way, the player's turn is considered to be over.

The victory conditions fluctuate, ala Fluxx, with goal cards being played by the players on their turn. The first player to match the current goal condition wins the game.

Mostly a joke game, this game satirizes politics with cards such as "Everybody Wins - Current game ends with everyone winning" and "Communism - All players play with their hands face up on the table. Anyone may play cards from anyone elses hand."

name: Legions
description:
A card game of commanding armies. Players take turns in this game building armies to smite their foes.

Each player shuffles their own deck, and draws 5 cards, along with some resource markers, to begin the game. On each player's turn, the following phases are worked through:

Ready Phase: the player either draws a card from their deck into their hand, or gains one gold, and all expended cards are readied (untapped, ala Magic: The Gathering).

Production and Upkeep Phase: All cards that may produce resources may do so now. If they do, they are expended (turned face down). After resources have been collected, minion's salaries must be paid from the player's resource pool. Any minion whose salary isn't paid is discarded from play.

Main Phase: Use resources to buy more minions and resource producers.

Attack Phase: Declare attacks against the other player with your minions. The defending player determines which of their minions block. Any unblocked minions deal damage to the defending player's health. When a player's health is reduced to zero that player loses the game.

End Phase: Discard down to 5 cards in hand.

The goal is to reduce the opponent's health to zero while preventing yours from receiving fatal damage. To do this, a clever combination of resource management and strategy in attack is required.

name: Dante's
description:
A board game about saving souls with mass consumerism. Players go through a mall in search of the seven mystical symbols to escape from Dante's shopping mall.

On each turn, the players roll a die to determine the amount of actions they may take, which include moving between various parts of the mall, shopping to find weapons and other items from the Fate deck, and attacking other players, angels, or demons in order to further their goal of finding the seven symbols.

Unfortunately, a few key pieces of information are missing from the rules site, such as a description of the board and the fate wheels, but these may be constructed through a good guess after reading the rules.

name: Callejeros Viajeros: el juego
description:
From the web of the publisher:
Juego de recorrido cuyo objetivo consiste en ser el primer reportero en conseguir todas las ciudades de su tarjeta ruta.
Para ello, cada reportero deberá viajar de una ciudad a otra tirando el dado, recorriendo el tablero y contestando todas las preguntas necesarias para conseguir la ficha de la ciudad.
Para aumentar la diversión, si caes en una casilla de sorpresa deberás coger una tarjetas sorpresa del montón, estas tarjetas harán más fácil o más difícil conseguir tu objetivo

Translation: Game of trail in which your goal will be to be the first reporter in getting all the cities of your trail card. To achieve that each reporter will have to travel from city to city using die rolls, answering all the questions needed to get the city token. For more fun, if you land on a surprise spot, you'll have to draw a card from the surprise deck. This cards will make your task easier, or more difficult.

name: Traplines
description:
Traplines is based on a prior design that was the predecessor to Linebreakers, and never released. The design is what was originally intended but deviated from with the introduction of chess pieces in Linebreakers.

Traplines, like Linebreakers, utilizes custodial trapping and delayed capture. In this, two pieces of a player will "bookend" a line of enemy pieces and freeze them so they can't move, but can be captured in a future turn. The origins of the idea came from pondering what would happen if you took Othello/Reversi and moved pieces on the board. From this the custodial trap, with delayed capture, move came about.

In the game, there are a number of starting configurations and multiple variants that involve capturing opponent's pieces or exiting one's own pieces off the board, in order to win the game.

name: Ocho The Game
description:
Ocho is sorta like Gin Rummy with power cards, although it has mechanics that we have never encountered before. It is ideal for two players, two teams of two, or large multiplayer games. You collect pairs. You need to play your pairs in order from Ones to Eights. You can SEE an opponent's hand, GET a card from their hand, DIG in the discard pile, or destroy their highest pair with a POW! You can also negate any power card with NOT.

One of the key mechanics is the hand size requirement. You must always have exactly six cards in hand before playing anything on the board. Each player starts with six cards. You draw one card to start your turn, then discard one card to return your hand size to six.

Ocho The Game is incredibly balanced. As a competitive game it rivals Poker and Rummy. We are launching it on Kickstarter currently, and we hope to run World Championships at GenCon 2012.

name: Rise of the Raj
description:
Rise of the Raj is a light-to-medium complexity game for one player based on the exploits of the British East India Company in India starting from their foundation in 1600 until their dissolution in 1858 following the Indian Mutiny.

Play focuses on navigating the political, economic and strategic landscape on the board using a limited number of cards and a chit-pull/unit system to drive the AI.

The goal is to generate 60 pounds for the founding shareholders before the three game turns are over.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Variable Phase Order

name: Psychic Fighters
description:
Four fighters are gathering to contend for supremacy. Each of them has a unique supernatural power to utilize: Air, Fire, Earth or Water.

Psychic Fighters is an ABSTRACT fighting game. In this game, players choose their fighters, take the Character boards and 36 Battle cards for the characters. To take an action with his cards, the player places a card on his board so that the icons showed on the cards in an action space are connected in a row.

The game round consists of many offensive and defensive turns alternately. In an offensive turn, the player has 3 action points to spend for the Move, Attack and Power-up. During a defensive turn, he may only react to his opponent's Attack, with Dodge, Block and Counter-attack.
