They may also accumulate Qi, which is used to increase the strength for Attack or Block or to power up for activating their special abilities and actions!

If the player make his opponent's life points 0, then he wins the round. The first to win two rounds will win the match!

You can also see the rules: http://mountedcloud.tistory.com/50
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Plumb Crazy Pipes
description:
Plumb Crazy Pipes is a pipe turning, tool brandishing, plumbing board game. The goal is to get the most doodies to make it all the way through a maze of pipes to the sewer below. Whoever gets the most wins the job as head plumber. The problem is that the last plumber was a mad scientist, and some of the pipes accelerator, duplicate, change direction, and beam the dooodie around the board.

Each plumber has a set of tools that allow them to mess with the other plumbers or helps themselves. Plumbers may also rotate a pipe during their turn. It's a fast-paced strategy game with doodies.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Borderline
description:
In Borderline, players race to bring their pieces across the board to their home row.

The board is arranged in two 6x6 fields, separated by a two square "borderline". Rolling two dice, players bring pieces onto the board and move them, with each die being used to move one piece. Pieces may only move two spaces in a single direction before being forced to change direction. In this manner, the pieces will zig-zag across the board.

Landing on an opponent's piece will cause it to be returned to the holding area. Designated safe spaces will prevent this capture.

When a piece lands on a square in the borderline it is possible for that player to bring on an additional piece.

The first player to bring all 6 pieces to the home row is the winner. Alternatively, a player may win by removing all opposing pieces from the board.

name: Crunglecheese
description:
A 1-player game in which players control a team of 'Crungleteers' as they move through a winding subterranean cave and attempt to eat their way through a rapidly-multiplying mass of Crunglecheese, a culinary abomination, in order to repair six failing machines to avert disaster.

The game is played on a modular board, somewhat like a Carcassone board, with the option to track all points with moving dials or with conventional counters.

The game consists of repeating 5-step rounds, the steps of which are revealing a new tile (each tile is two spaces, leading to some strategy in placement), rolling a die which will lead to growth of the 'Crunglecheese', which can block cave passages and damage machines (the next round), and directly damage machines. On the player's step of the round, four pawns with different abilities may take actions including moving, eating crunglecheese, and repairing machines among other actions. There are a limited number of actions, so these must be taken carefully.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Token Wars: Battle for Table Plain
description:
Token Wars (tm): Battle For Table Plain makes you king of a medieval army. The Table Plain is a coveted trade route once owned by a Merchant Prince, a merchant prince that has been reported dead (though no evidence of his death was ever found). He was loyal to no king and had no heir. Now, eager Kings from adjoining lands battle for control of the Table Plain in hopes that it will bolster their kingdom and further their means. Will you be the victor or will you watch your opponents take control of the land you so covet?

Token Wars is a 2 player head to head battle of skill and strategy. Each player takes control of an army of tokens that they must strategically push into the battle field (any flat surface with very little resistance). The game is played in four rounds with each player having two turns to defend and two turns to attack. In order to win, one player must either kill the other player's king, take the other player's flag, or capture all three of the other player's chests. If at the end of four rounds there is no victor, the player with the most powerful army wins.

Whenever your tokens survive a round, they level-up thereby making your army more powerful.

It is a fun game that is easy to learn but difficult to master. Buy your copy today and start owning your friends tomorrow!

Some Assembly Required.

Available through thegamecrafter.com

name: Se si pu√≤
description: Light set collection card game with a generic family-everyday life theme, where the players main aim is to collect members (dad, mum, daughter, son, granpa and granny) of one of six families (the artists, the ecologists, the money-makers, the musicians...). It also involves special cards allowing to score additional points, damage other players, or cancel other cards.

name: Auto Auction
description: One player is the car auctioneer. S/he reveals the car and the features of the car (i.e. air conditioning, power windows etc.) and opens the bidding. Players are dealt eight bidders cards with values ranging from 25 to 10000 dollars. The bidders select a combination of cards to create their bid. The player that is closest to the reserve price, which is only known to the auctioneer, wins the round.

name: My Body
description:
Tagline: 5 games to show what you're made of

The 5 "games" are:
1. Puzzle for one child: Assemble a human body
2. Lotto: Puzzle pieces are picked out one by one. First player to name the part and place the piece gets a point. Highest points wins.
3. Dominoes: Assemble a human body puzzle, starting with a corner. The next piece used must connect to a piece already in place. First player to place their pieces wins.
4. How well do you know your body: Puzzle pieces are picked out one by one. Players place a counter on the location where they think the piece go. Only one counter can be placed in a location. The player with the right answer gets a point, highest points win.
5. Anatomy: One player reads a word card relating to an area of the body (i.e. kidney, upper jaw). The other players find the area just read on one of four figures. Players place a counter on the location where they think the piece go. Only one counter can be placed in a location. The player with the right answer gets a point, highest points win.

name: RIVER UP!
description:
Once a year, salmon undertake an epic journey, leaving the sea and going up rivers to reach their spawning grounds. Throughout this journey, the salmon are not fed, and struggle to make headway against the strong flow river and survive natural predators, as well as fishing gear man. Only stronger survive, thus becomes the natural selection of species and genes are transmitted from the best individuals.

In this game, each player manages a group of 5 salmon, its aim is to cross a river card deck using a deck of cards numbered from 1 to 45. The choice of cards is secretly and simultaneously, by order of the value of the cards, players choose which cards remain in the river, trying to accumulate miles and to avoid bears and fishermen. But playing big cards can cause fatigue, and the player playing the highest card must take the lowest. In addition, a positive score high cards at the end of the game, if held in hand. Finally, the only way to draw cards without waiting to drain your hand, issacrificing a salmon ....

_______________

Una vez al año, los salmones emprenden un épico viaje, abandonando el mar y remontando caudalosos ríos hasta llegar a sus territorios de desove. A lo largo de dicho reco-rrido, los salmones no se alimentan, y luchan por avanzar contra la fuerte corriente y sobrevivir a los depredadores naturales, así como a las artes pesqueras del hombre. Sólo los más fuertes consiguen llegar; de este modo, se hace la selección natural de la especie y se transmiten los genes de los mejores individuos.

En este juego, cada jugador maneja un grupo de 5 salmones; su objetivo es recorrer un mazo de cartas de rio, usando una mano de cartas de impulso numeradas del 1 al 45. La elección de cartas es secreta y simultánea, y por orden del valor de las cartas, los jugadores escogen qué cartas de río se quedan, tratando de acumular kilómetros y evitar osos y pescadores. Pero jugar cartas altas provoca fatiga, y el jugador que juega la carta más alta es penalizado robando la más baja. Además, las cartas altas puntúan positivamente al final del juego, si se conservan en mano. Por último, la única forma de robar cartas sin tener que esperar a agotar la mano, es sacrificar un salmon....

name: Criminals and Detectives
description:
There is Estonian map on the game board with 10 cities and 2 crime-scenes per city.
The cards have city on the upper part of the card and evidence on bottom part of the card.

Player move around board and make actions according to their character.
If criminal plays a card with the city he stands, he makes a crime to this city and draws one face-down evidence tile (footprint, fingerprint, dna, witness) to avaialable crime-scene of that city. Detective may visit that crime-scene and may turn the tile face-up by playing a card with that city. If criminal has 3 or more face-up evidences, detective may catch him and improson by playing 3 cards matching with the evidences of that criminal.

Objective for criminals is to make 8 crimes to win.
Objective for detectives is to investigate crime-scenes, gather enough evidences and catch all criminals to win.
With combinations players may remove or add evidence-tiles to crime-scenes.

Both character-types may deal and exchange cards with their partners.

Contents:

game board
8 character cards
55 action cards
32 evidence tiles
32 crime tokens in 4 colors
4 criminals in 4 colors
4 detectives in 4 colors
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Keroppi and Friends: Secret at Donut Pond Game
description:
This is game of personality analysis and deduction for children. It is similar to the adult game "True Colors" and uses a system of "secret" messages to provide clues about each kid's thoughts and ideas.

Player fill out a Secrets Score Sheet with responses to questions drawn at random from a deck of cards. The score sheets are "hidden" in a cardboard clubhouse at the center of the board. The players now move along a pathway and attempt to guess who wrote what answer when the child lands on a "Guess One Secret" square.

The first player to guess five secret answers is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, the clubhouse, cards, stand-up character tokens with plastic stands, score pad, a die, the rules, and a storage insert.

Designed for 2-5 players age 7 and older.

name: Royal Execution
description:
In Royal Execution you create your own military and political faction of commoners, nobility, and royalty to claim the Thrones of an imaginary Realm. Align yourself with one or more Royal lines of succession to control the thrones of King, Queen, and Bishop recreating the numerous dynastic civil wars of the Middle Ages.

The Challenge: Your opponents have troops, assassins, and can stage revolts. Rival royalty and their factions may attempt to imprison you - or worse - gather the right support to condemn your royal to death by execution.

Just like the power struggles of the Middle Ages you'll soon be facing fierce competition for political and military power, which quickly becomes shamelessly ruthless, viciously vengeful, hilariously melodramatic, and just plain fun!

If you are fascinated by the pomp, power, and melodrama of Medieval royalty and their struggles for power - this is the game for you!

The objective is score as many points as possible by claiming sovereignty over territories and controlling the royal thrones. Players maneuver to capture the Thrones of King, Queen, and Bishop of the Realm and control their lucrative territories - scoring points along the way. The first player to reach a predetermined number of points is declared the Supreme Sovereign of the Realm and game winner.

Every player is entitled to make one common play during their turn. Common plays represent the powers of the lower classes and a treacherous noble’s access to the royal court. For example, revolts were ways the populace kept royalty and their policies in check. Assassins often gained access to royalty with the help of treacherous nobility. Both of these cards (Revolt and Assassin) represent real threats to royalty who fail to protect themselves.

Royalty may make an additional Royal play during their turn. Royal plays represent the unique powers of reigning royalty and are easy to identify by the Royal Play scroll on top of each card. They can be used to protect your royalty (for example, Troops) and to eliminate hostile ones (Royal Execution).

Play Options: Teams; Role Playing; Historical Based Games; Adding the Medieval England Feudal Deck; Adding the Medieval Combat Deck, Alliances and Pledges.

name: Combat Wings: Chapter I ‚Äì WWI
description:
Combat Wings is an air combat game set in the First World War.
WWI period aircraft were rather fragile machines, with hardly any power or operational capacity, however suprisingly enough these handicaps were more than compensated for by their high degree of manoeuvrability.
At the start of each game, players select an aircraft, which in turn forms part of a squadron. Each plane is different with its own aircraft’s characteristics with a series of specific manoeuvres and special abilities, hence making it distinguishable from the other members of the squadron. CW, allows players to customize both flight style and combat technique, consequently the same model of aircraft can perform a varied range of manoeuvres or be endowed with a series of specific special abilities, depending on the Plane Data Sheet (PDS). The sPDS of the squadrons are based on historical facts and list the characteristics, abilities and hardware of the most renowned squadrons of the FWW which, in combination with the mission allow players to recreate the entire history of the war.
Throughout each game, players are awarded experience points which in turn permit a series of abilities or manoeuvres, the ultimate aim of which is to be awarded the category of ace.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Farmlands: Darkness & Ice
description:
Farmlands is an old style trick-taking card game set in the ancient land of Keldabore, often played in Keldabore's murkiest pubs and taverns through the long winter months. Farmlands pits farmer against farmer, battling for the best harvest, using a modified standard deck of cards.

Each turn, one of three cards is placed on any one player's land.  When these cards are harvested, which may occur at various times throughout the game, they are removed from play and scored at game end.  

This is a simple and quick, draw one card, play one card, stick it to your opponents trick-taking card game. It is a modified standard deck of cards, all the RED suites are now Crops, all the BLACK suites are now Weeds, all the FACE cards are now Workers and the JOKERS are Thieves.

There are 2 separate Base Game 54 Cards decks, "Farmlands - Darkness & Ice" and "Farmlands - Fire & Earth". Both are individually 2-4 player games, same rules, just alternate artwork and characters.

name: Texas Wildcatter
description:
From the rules manual:

"Texas Wildcatter is a board game designed around the Texas oil industry. Players pit their skill and luck against the risks of the oil wildcatting business as they vie to lease and develop 16 of Texas' most famous oil fields. Authenticity and quality have been the bywords in the creation and publication of this originial board game."

Players must move around an outside track landing on properties they can lease from the bank. Once leased, players can attempt to develop their properties and collect. Players may also form joint ventures or farm out agreements. If the property is not developed and a player lands on a property, they can attempt to buy out the lease out from under the owner.

Players may also purchase services or oil transportation companies that allows them to collect from other players who happen to land on that property (similar to rent in Monopoly).

The object of the game is to be the first person to accumulate $1 billion cash.

name: Easy Questions
description: Easy Questions belongs to a series of card games designed for teaching English and mathematics in primary schools. Title of the series is Edukacyjne Karty do Gry Joker. This one is for learning English. Cards have questions on one side and answers on the other. Players ask questions and search for answers in their own cards and the player who holds the questions and answers card checks if the answers are correct. There is also a solo variant: the cards are laid on the table whith answers visible. The player turns cards over to see questions and searches for answers.

name: Atlantyda
description: Atlantyda is a simple roll-and-move game in which players try to reach the centre of the board. It depicts three sections of the island. Players need to stop on certain fields in order to receive coins required for passing bridges and advancing to the next section.

name: Million
description:
Million is a tabletop game of futuristic combat between fighters in high-tech combat armor. It was published in 2001 in the French gaming magazine Backstab, issue #35.

The game is played on a square playing surface of one meter length. The magazine provides counters for the playing pieces and scenery, but players are advised to build their own scenery and use plastic or metal miniatures.

Each player first builds a combat armor using a set number of points, buying systems in each of three categories (Mobility, Offence and Defense). Each of these systems is represented by a counter. These counters also represent the armor's "hit points": once a player runs out of counters, the armor is considered to be too badly damaged and the player is off the game.

Each player then makes three piles of face-down counters (one for each system), put her figure in one corner and play begins.

Each turn, each player secretly chooses two of three systems to activate (Mobility and Offence for example). Players then reveal their choices, draw enough counters from their activated systems to replenish their hand to five counters, and roll a d10 for initiative (players can expend counters to gain a bonus on the initiative roll). Each player then take an action, alternating between players until there are no possible actions left or each player passes, at which point another turn begins. Each player can take a move action and a shoot action each turn, and also play counters as an action.

Damage is resolved by rolling on a damage table with a lot of different results (loss of counters, fighter pushed back and/or stunned...). The last fighter standing wins the game.

name: Sweetie The Candies, Cookies, Goodies Game
description:
Manufacturer Description/Rules(quoted exactly):

The object of the game is to "Shop" for the various "Goodies" along the game path. To Shop for Goodies, a player must land on an orange circle with a name of a Goodie that the player has a Goodie marker of the same kind. To begin play, punch out the Goodie markers and place them name down and mix up well. Players draw an equal amount of Goodies markers. Players choose the color of playing piece they wish and place it at "Start." In turn, spin the spinner and move along the path the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner dial. When a player's playing piece lands upon an orange space they may "Shop"for the Goodie named and place the Goodie marker on the Ice Cream cone. There are two spaces where a player may choose any Goodie marker from their pile to discard. A player having two of the same kind of Goodie markers may discard only one at a time when "Shopping." Play continues around the path until a player has "Shopped" for all the Goodie markers, and this player wins the game.
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co., Warren Built Rite Games

name: HyperCribbage
description:
HyperCribbage is Cribbage with a special board and wildcards.

The board adds four five-hole "dead zones". A player who ends in a dead zone is not allowed to count any single scoring event more than the holes remaining to the final hole. (A player can score normally from the final hole.)

The deck also includes Jokers, which may count as any card. Their value can change between pegging and counting out the hands.

A variant, HyperCribbage-7, includes seven card hands and cribs (and much larger maximum scoring combinations), and is played twice around the board.

As in Cribbage, players are each dealt a hand of 6 cards, of which they discard 2 into a special pile called the Crib. One card is then cut from draw pile and turned face up - it is considered part of each player's hand and of the Crib. The players then alternately play a card, scoring points for hitting certain totals, or for making sets or sequences. Score is kept by moving pegs around tracks on the cribbage board. This is repeated until all players have exhausted their hand of cards. Once all players are out of cards, each player picks up his hand and determines all possible scoring combinations, pegging points again on the cribbage board. The dealer then picks up the Crib and scores it for all possible points. Then the cards are shuffled, the deal alternates, and the process is repeated. The winner is the first person to peg 121 or more points.

name: Des Crus et des Vins
description:
Des Crus et des Vins is a French game about exploring French wineyards and collecting fine wines. The game can be played by 3 to 6 players, one of them acting as gamemaster. The goal of the game is to be the first to collect 300 bottles of wines in a week (7 turns).

Each player starts the game by creating a character by rolling dice and consulting tables to determine what type of car she has, her driving style, and where in France her family is located (the character can spend the night in this region for free). The gamemaster prepares a secret list of hazards (car accidents, police controls...), and each player picks a town to start from.

Each turn, each player takes turn telling the gamemaster what her character's actions for the day are (driving, resting, visiting wineyards and ordering wine, where to spend the night). The gamemaster consults his list of hazards and the game tables and resolves the consequences (a character who is a fast driver will gain more fatigue points than a cautious driver for example).

At the end of the seven turns, the player with the best wine collection and the most money left is declared winner.

name: Flip-It Jackpot
description: Players must flip chips into the plastic fruit machine which is the 'board'. If you get three into the right slot, the board pays out. Flip Wilson is on the box (he has two other Aurora games with him on).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shooting on the Moors
description: Target shooting game, using a pop-gun. The targets are Pheasants, Wild Duck, Rabbits, a Hare, plus two others, a Cuckoo and a Keeper. The latter 2 count as penalty points if shot in error.

name: Jumblex
description:
Party Game. 12 cards, all featuring objects drawn on the cards, but all jumbled up. When your guests arrive, they are given a card and a time limit. The guest who identifies the most objects, wins.
Series 1. Four Series were available at the time.

name: Fabula: Il gioco di Lei e di Lui
description:
This game come with 100 cards.

50 cards are copy of 4 characters (15 of Alberto, the male protagonist, 15 of Beatrice, the female protagonist, 10 of Carlo and 10 of Carlotta (the others)).

The other 50 cards are transitive and intrasitive verb cards, like "Loves", "Don't loves", "Seduces", "Kills" (transitive) and "Dies", "Is Happy", "Kill Himself" (intransitive)... there are speak card like "Says", "Think" and "Lie". There also two jolly: One can change letterally anything (also the gender of a character!) and one can return a character in a form of a ghost!

There are two types of play: Each player have a own story and one where all players narrate one story, each trying to finish his/her hand.

The manual also say you can try to "read the future" trough this cards.

The game wasn't sold, was gifted to "Amica" Subscriber in Italy. The game was designed by the famous semiotician and novelist Umberto Eco and semiotician Paolo Fabbri.

name: Aristocracy
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Aristocracy is a revolutionary good time about the rise and fall of some of histories most infamous ruling elite. Designed with quick, cut-throat game play in mind, Aristocracy is a reign-of-fun for both new and veteran players.

name: Oz
description:
Oz is a peg-filling game. The object of the game is to fill all 25 holes in the game board with pegs so that no peg is next to another of the same color.

Twenty-five pegs (five each of five different colors) are loaded into an interior compartment of the handheld base. One by one the pegs are removed from a hole in the base.

The first four pegs must be placed in turn in the four corner holes. Each following peg must be placed next to a peg already on the board. Pegs may be placed horizontally or vertically, but never diagonally. No peg may be placed next to another of the same color in any direction.

May also be recognized as 'Are you a Wizard of Oz' (based on box copy)
publishers: Skirrid Company of Great Britain, Ltd.

name: 1st Blitzkrieg
description:
1st Blitzkrieg simulates the course of the military operations in Central Europe at beginning of the World War II, where the new doctrine of Blitzkrieg, based on armored and air forces was used by the aggressor to crush the defender within weeks rather than months.

Game scale:
Units are generally Divisions and Brigades.
Each Turn represents 4 days.
Each hex represents ca. 25-30 km

Mechanics is hex and counter, of course. Activation uses the chit - pull system. Generally one chit represents one army and units can only be actvated once during the turn. Except for German panzer and motorized units, which can also be activated by special chit "Schenlltruppen". That makes the Polish player feels like he can be really outmaneuvred by the Germans.

Important factor is use of the air force. It can either support combat or interdict movement of ground units and rail transports. Luftwaffe can really dominate the sky.

Combat table seems to be pretty "normal" - it has 6 rows, but you are rolling 2 dice instead of one. Unlike many other games, the results are not added but substracted... The range is from 0 to 5. After calculating the probability you may notice, that 1 is the most likely result (16,6 %) and 5 is the less likely result...

Depending on the scenario, the players take part in:
- the historical First Blitzkrieg – German strike on Poland in September 1939,
- the alternative Red Blitzkrieg coming from the East, or
- the hypothetic Blitzkrieg of 1938 (the defense of Czechoslovakia).

In the 1939 historical scenario Wehrmacht is superior to Polish forces. But do not worry, PL gains VP either for holding terrain objectives or inflicting causalties to German units. German player must eliminate PL unit to gain VP for it. Therefore, usually the Polish player has more VP during the game - and the German player must perform a really good Blitzkrieg to gain victory.

What is more, the players will get a chance to play the Red Blitzkireg scenario, and check how Polish Army can act vs. the Red Army. This scenario shows the actual Soviet deployment of 1939 versus Polish defense plan East, which was only theoretical.

Another what if scenario is Czechoslovakian defense of 1938, supposing that the Munich dictate was rejected. There are quite heavy fortifications along the border, and the Wehrmacht isn't as strong as it was it 1939. In expanded version, this scenario is going to be for 4 players: Germany, Czechoslovakia, Poland and USSR.

name: Soldier Emperor: Revolution
description:
Soldier Emperor: Revolution extends the game to cover the decade of bitter warfare following the French Revolution, from the Battle of Valmy in 1792 to the Peace of Amiens in 1802.

It includes six scenarios, a new map, and a set of fifty playing pieces (40 2/3-inch leaders and 10 one-inch-square army/fleet pieces).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Sunday Enjoyment
description:
A Bible related religious game. 48 cards, each with a question on one card and another card has the answer. A question is read out and, eventually, will be paired with the right card. The object is to collect pairs of cards with the question and answer matching. You had to be good at Bible reading to win this game!

The front cover of the rules says "The New Sunday Pastime for our Little Folks".

name: Eternium
description:
Eternium is a mythical card game where you can trade and battle. The aim is to 'dominate' - create the ultimate collection of cards that will let you win every time.

You create the dominating card collection by trading and battling. In a battle, both players may 'risk' a 4 or 5 star card and whoever wins keeps both.

There are three types of Cards: Monster, Combat and Special. You must always play a Monster Card - both Special and Combat cards can be used in addition to the Monster on each turn.

The game is popular with younger children because there is a vivid story and the monsters are found to be very imaginative and in some cases comparable to people they know in real life.

name: Total It!
description:
From the box: Addition & subtraction have never been so much fun (or fast)! Players have to match the number of the card in play by using + or -! Collect the most points or discard all your cards first and you win!

Gameplay: Each player gets 7 cards. The remaining cards become the draw pile. The dealer turns over the top card of the draw pile. Each player tries to match the number on the card with either an exact match, or using two cards with + or -. Multiple matches can be played. Players keep matched cards in front of them to track points. The dealer then brings all players back up to 7 cards. Then a new target card is drawn. When there are not enough cards left to bring everyone to 7 cards, the game is over.
An alternate rule set eliminates the target card and plays 11 rounds using the numbers 1 to 10 and a wild round where each player names their own target number.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Air Hoops
description:
This is a dexterity game with a basketball theme. The design is similar to "Space: The Game that Defies Gravity" and features the same battery operated air cushion. Contestants guide the floating basketball across an abstract circular court as they maneuver the ball around two teams of basketball player figures and into hoops.

There are four levels of play based on the number of figures on the court and the number of basketball goals positioned on the outer ring. There is also a timer to increase the level of competition.

Includes the plastic court display, two teams of plastic players, three basketballs, and the rules.

Requires 6 "C" batteries or 9V DC adapter (not included).

name: Uniworld Tri-Lang
description:
An educational game where players take turns drawing and placing cards onto the board. Players score points by completing "books" of three orthogonally adjacent cards of the same type. The player with the most points wins.

The cards feature people from different countries and are written in three different languages (English, French, and Spanish). The game was developed in concert with UNICEF.

Also contains instructions for an advanced variant for adults.

Contents:

54 character cards
1 plastic gameboard

name: Scotland
description: The object is to get rid of ones cards before the other players by playing the cards in pairs; either two DOUBLE cards, or two Number cards on which the black FACTORS when multiplied together give a product on one of the two cards played.

name: Strategy Manager Baseball
description:
Discover this exciting new way of playing Baseball. You are now the Manager of your own team. You can make every choice that a major league manager makes. You decide when to HIT and RUN, whet to STEAL a base, or when to use your all important PINCH HITTERS! This game is as easy to play as real baseball. It's hours of family fun at home and at parties, for everyone.

Each manager places his four base runner discs in the dug out. The pinch hitter is placed in the bull pen and moved up one space as they are used. Place the out disc at the top of the playing field and move it as outs are made. The manager whose team is at bat should place his first batter at home plate (H). Take the dice and say aloud which play he is trying from the ten selection at the top of the game board. Example: Aloud "Bunt for hit", now pitch the dice. Combine the face value of the dice roll and find the result of the play on the board under the play selection. Each time a base runner crosses home plate one run is scored to that team.

name: War Gods
description:
From publisher's website:

The ultimate trading card game of strategy and skill.
Are you ready?

You are battling against evil Pan, your power is down, out of nowhere your opponent strikes you with a Nymph! But what he doesn't know, is never expecting, this is going to blow him away...

Your hands tremble, can you pull this off... the most powerful card ever to cross a tournament table... YES!! you can do it!
The all powerful Zeus! the rarest card from the realm of the Gods!

The game is yours.

Until next time...

War Gods was to be a collectible card game featuring creatures and gods from myth and legend. The first release, the Titan Battle Set, would feature the Greek myths. The 130 card set (including holographic cards) would be available in 60-card starter decks and 11-card booster packs . The second release would have been the Wrath of the Gods expansion set.

Cards were divided into three different levels: Level 1 was mere mortals, Level 2 was powerful creatures and heroes, and Level 3 was the realm of the gods. Defeating an opponent at each level would give a player access to the next level of characters and cards. Location and Action cards would supplement a player's battle tactics.

A pre-release set of 104 cards was published and demo decks were shown at game stores. A two-day tournament was held in Virginia Beach, Virginia. The game was scheduled to be in stores by Summer 2001, then Summer 2002, then Winter 2003. The project was cancelled before its official release.

name: Puffogoal
description:
Board game inspired by the Smurfs (Peyo Copyright).
The game consists of a magnetic board representing a football field where the Smurfs are placed (5 per team) and other accessories.
The players, rolling a dice, move the Smurfs towards goal.
The winner is who scores more "puffogoal" in the preset time.

name: Il Miliardario
description:
The game board is a wheel where players roll the dice and move their pawn on a path where business can be influenced by astrology (good or bad luck) and other events. The roll of the dice will also resolve the lottery winnings or roulette or horse racing and the stock exchange gains.
The winner is the "billionaire" with the most money.

name: Shifter Duel
description:
2 players duel for control of a endlessly shifting plane of existence. By moving gems around a grid of tiles, the players lay claim to the map. But, at the end of your turn, you must shift the board, moving 1 tile. The winner is the first person who can force their opponent into a position where they can not shift the board.

Due to The Game Crafter wanted me order the game before I can put it up for sale, I (the developer) have chosen to just post the rules in PDF form here.

name: ESPN Scorecards:  The Game
description:
Don't just watch. Play! Score! Win!

Did the ball touch the pylon? Was the coach knocked down on the sideline? How long was the touchdown run?

With Scorecards, you're not just watching football with your friends, you're competing against them. Scorecards features 120 cards with possible plays, announcer sound bites, camera shots and more. Now you can WIN even if you're favorite team doesn't.

name: Paperclip Railways: Shire Games
description:
Promo station card for Paperclip Railways. The base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

This Promo card was given to customers of Shire Games.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Elvis Trivia, From Tupelo to Graceland
description:
Trivia game containing 1000 questions and answers in four categories: Records, Movies, Little Known Facts, and All Shook Up.

The object of the game is to start from Tupelo and move around the board answering questings pertaining to the life and career of Elvis Presley, until you reach Graceland. The first one to Graceland to corretly answer a final question wins.

name: Durch das Jahr
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Which month follows the month of May? And who can first find December? In the course of three games in Durch das Jahr - a memory game, a tile-laying game and a reaction game – children will experience all the seasons of the year and learn all of the months.

name: Karla Kuchenfee: Obstsalat
description:
Karla is creating a fruit salad. As in the base game, all the ingredients for the salad have a different number of syllables.

This expansion can be combined with the base game in various ways.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Over the Brink
description:
It's a tug of war game to the finish!

Each player has four plastic men attached to a "rope" stretched across a raised bright yellow plastic playing field. A chute (representing a waterfall) separates the two teams. A crank at the back moves the rope left or right, moving the men with it.

Each turn, players roll dice. The player with the highest roll turns the crank a number of times equal to the total of both dice. This drags their opponents closer to the edge of the brink - pull far enough, and the men will drop down the waterfall. Once per game, each player can play a special card which doubles the total of the dice.

Pull all the opposing team "Over the Brink" to win the game.

name: CARD-tamen Rome
description:
Myth. . . history. . . literature. . . law. . . ROME!

Who changed history more, Cicero or Augustus? Who inspired more stories, Hercules or Jupiter? Ancient learning and ancient fun unite in CARD-tamen Rome!

CARD-tamen Rome, The Pericles Group’s first CARD-tamen set, is designed to accompany the Operation LAPIS program. CARD-tamen Rome also works beautifully as a stand-alone game involving topics from Ancient Roman culture. This game plays well in any setting, in or out of the classroom.

CARD-tamen is an exciting new card game developed by The Pericles Group, LLC. Intended to promote intelligent discussion and debate about a myriad of topics, CARD-tamen consists of decks of CARDs (Classical Attunement Reward Devices) organized around particular themes.

GamePlay: Players shuffle their decks and deal themselves seven CARDs at random. Players have two minutes to provide the most compelling argument as to why their chosen CARD wins a controversy selected by a d20 roll from a list provided with the game. The player who rolls the die to choose the controversy also makes the first argument. An independent iudex (judge) determines whose argument is more compelling. That player is awarded a point. The first player to three points is the winner of CARD-tamen™.

There are also rule variants for 3+ players and integration into the practomimetic Latin curriculum, Operation LAPIS.
publishers: The Game Crafter, LLC, The Pericles Group, LLC

name: Find'em
description: A popular party game. Guests are given a picture with mistakes in it and then they are invited to spot the errors during the evening. The one who finds the most, wins. THere were at least two in the series and this version is known as The Street Scene.

name: Picture Bingo
description: 36 cards, each featuring colour pictures of assorted items. The deck is divided in two, with one deck used by the 'Caller' and the other deck by the players, who must match their hand of cards with the other cards as they are displayed. A simple children's game.

name: Feudal Clans
description:
Each player controls a clan in the Highlands or Lowlands of Scotland. The game recreates a period of Scottish history when famous clans struggled for control of Scotland.

Features in the game include - mountain passes, boats on lochs, alliances, hand to hand fighting, capturing men, ambushes, scaling castle walls and a changing weather aspect.

The designer printed prototype copies and advertised them for sale, with instructions how to paste up the board.

name: The Greyhound Racing Game
description:
You needed good lungs in 1927! The 52 cards which had to be collected individually from packs of "Black Cat" cigarettes, are as follows;

15 Whips
16 Obstacles, including The Course
10 Dogs
10 Greyhounds: five Singles and five Groups
1 Hare

Each turn players must play a card face-up in front of them. This continues until someone plays the Hare card. then the Chase starts and the first player to play a single greyhound card, wins.

Very nice artwork on the cards.

name: Allgemein-Wissen f√ºr Kinder
description:
Who is first guessing requested term?

One of the players draws a card and asks a question, to be answered by the others - as quick as possible.
example:
1st question - a guy who is loved by all
2nd - behaves mischievously
3rd - makes people chuckle
4th - has a red nose
5th - you'll meet him in the circus

Of course, after the 5th question every child knows the answer, but the earlier you activate the noisemaker
and shout the answer the better you are - only you may move your meeple one step ahead.
Wrong - move one step back.

Finish first - you win.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: "A Dog's Life"
description:
Promotional game made by a top British dog-food supplier (still doing that in 2011.
A simple roll and move game. Each player chooses one of the dogs listed and places their playing counter there. Each player is given 20 biscuits (provided by Mum I guess) and any remaining biscuits are placed into the pool (a biscuit tin). So, if four are playing this, Mum has to provide at least 80 biscuits. They must have liked their biscuits back then.
If your piece lands on a picture square, you must obey the instruction. Most often it will ask you to give X biscuits or take X biscuits, from the pool or/and other players.
Once a dog reaches home square 90, that dog tales all the biscuits left in the pool. The player with the most biscuits, wins.

name: Nimble Spider
description:
All cards are dealt evenly among players.
Each player plays one card at a time and if it matches with the card on the table he takes the trick.
The Object is to take as many spiders as possible.

name: Wissens-Quiz Der Mensch
description:
The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 1000 questions out of different fields of 'human' knowledge:
body, viscera, sexual reproduction/sex education, nutrition/healthiness, cardiovascular system/bloodstream, nervs, mind, diseases/cure, human being (in general)

During player's turn die is rolled; he/she may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, die is used to pick a question - if the answer is correct, player may add an additional turn - moving again. You pick a chip if you find a correct answer on a space of the outer circle.
To compensate lack of knowledge children may draw - if they fail - an additional card.
Content:
Board 30x 30 cm, 110 cards with more than 1000 questions
8 register cards (diff. colours), 6 meeples, 48 coloured chips, 1 die, rules

name: Rival
description:
RIVAL is a collection of 5 two player abstract games, all played on a board consisting of black hexagons divided into diamonds, white hexagons and white triangles and none of the individual games is called RIVAL. These games are:-
STARTRAP
The object is surround a white star with your own pieces whilst preventing your opponent doing likewise. Each player has 16 playing pegs which move "diagonally" on black diamonds, one guard peg which blocks a black diamond to all other pegs and one jumper peg which occupies a point where black hexagons meet and blocks all movement through that point.
MASTERSPY
A chess like game played on black diamonds in which each player starts with 10 hunters, 4 detectives, 2 secret agents and a masterspy and the object is to capture your opponents masterspy.
TWENTYONE
Each player starts with 7 pairs of counters numbered 1 to 7 which move on black diamonds only. The object is to surround a white star with counters that add up to 21 whilst preventing your opponent from doing likewise.
FIFTEENS
Each player starts with 15 counters numbered 0 to 9, one each of values 0, 1,8 and 9 and two each of the rest. The object is to make groups of 3 counters on a black hexagon (one on each diamond) which add up to 15. One of those three counters may be the opponents.
BLOCKER
Played on the white diamonds only, players start with 12 counters and 3 guards each. Players take turns in rolling a d6 which generates their movement allowance. Movement may be divided between more than one piece. To capture an opponents piece one must use the full movement allowance on a single piece and land on an opponent's piece thus eliminating it. The object is to eliminate all opponent's pieces.

name: Cra$h
description:
Cra$h is a simple dice game that utilizes probabilities, luck, and a lot of book keeping to simulate the vagaries of the stock market. The game is comprised of six rounds were each player takes a turn to try and beat the odds or try not to lose too much money.

Cra$h is a simple game and was envisioned to help parents encourage basic mathematics skill and to open children up to the idea of the stock market.

Cra$h uses 6 ten sided dice as the amount of money you wager on the stock market. you may choose to roll up to all six dice. This is then compared to the market mood die (the 7th d10) anything below this number loses cash(k), anything that beats the market gains cash(k), anything that matches gains 10k.When a Player rolls triples it causes a crash and all players need to roll to see how much they lost. With each player starting with only 50K this game is fast!

The game continues until there is only one player left or whoever has the most money at the end of six rounds.

Leiker Games
Give us a "Leik" on Facebook!

name: Starship! The Game of Space Exploration
description:
-Summary-
In Starship! you play as the captain of an enterprising ship and her crew searching for valuable cargo amongst the stars. Each turn you will be upgrading your ship, stowing away cargo, exploring new star Sectors and fighting to keep shield, weapons, and engine upgrades out of the hands of your opponents!

-Overview-
The game of Starship! is played in a series of turns where players reveal Star Sectors in order to conquer them and claim their resources. Other players may hinder your conquest by playing cards onto the revealed Star Sector card. If you you claim the cards in the Star Sector pile and can use those cards for Ship System upgrades, hindering your opponents or stowing one as cargo.

Leiker Games
Give us a "Leik" on Facebook!
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Sargon's Kingdom
description:
Check out an older tile based strategy PnP game by Leiker Games, it's FREE!!

-Overview-
Play as a great King in ancient Mesopotamia, take control of your city state, and balance the expansion of your towns and territory held, versus the conquest of your enemy.
Two Game modes, Quick Battle and Grand Campaign, allows for different strategies and game length.

You can win via conquest of your opponents city state or economic victory, by building a set number of towns.

Sargon's Kingdom channels a little Carcassone (tile flipping and placement) and Settlers of Catan (Towns and resource generation) in this light beer and pretzels strategy game.

In SK Quick Battle, you start by laying a random 6x4 spread of tiles, Ore, Barley, Mountains, and Mountain Passes. The Grand battle sees you choosing were each drawn tile goes in an 8x6 spread.Each tile has a representative number that when rolled with a town built upon it, generates a resource. These resources can be used to build armies or towns.

Combat is undertaken by your armies that can stack up to a total of 3 armies per tile. Armies have different properties and abilities based on their stack size, Smaller armies can raze towns and move quickly, bigger armies can control occupied towns but move slowly.
Combat is resolved using standard D6's. Each Army receives 1D6 when attacking or defending and receives a success on a 5+. results are compared and if the attacker has a larger number of successes they destroy one of the defenders armies.

Towns, Mountains, and Mountain passes can generate defensive bonuses for your armies and Towns built upon Mountain Passes act as fortresses. creating an interesting tactical imperative for the placement and disposition of your towns.

-Items you'll need-
1 Yellow City State- Triangle Stand
1 Green City State- Triangle Stand
10 Yellow Towns- Houses
10 Green Towns- Houses
10 Yellow Armies- Stackable Pawns
10 Green Armies- Stackable Pawns
6 6 sided dice (6D6)
(or some other equivalent, coins were used in early iterations)

-Items included in the PDF's-
24 Barley Resource Cards
24 Ore Resource Cards
48 Tiles

Available on DrivethruRPG.com and BGG.

CopyRight DigiPen IoT

Created by Keith Leiker
Leiker Games
Give us a "Leik" on Facebook!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Super Mario Balance Block
description:
User Summary

Super Mario Balance Block is similar to the game of Jenga, but with a theme based on the Super Mario series of videogames. Players push out bricks from a tower and place them back on top. The player who makes the tower collapse is the loser! The art style features blocks from the Mario games, including the iconic question mark blocks. It also includes a Mario stick that is used to push the blocks and Super Mushrooms that add a unique twist.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: Make Frank's Monsters
description:
Frank Einstein is known for his monsters... and his factory makes the best monsters bar none.

Make Frank's Monsters is four different card games that can be played with the same deck of cards. Although each of the four games are a little different in theme and play; basically you are trying to build monsters by getting the four different cards needed (the Lightning Bolt /Helmet, the Head, the Arms/Torso and the Legs) to complete a monster and score points. But, when things don't quite work out you can lose points. Starting with Make Frank's Monsters 1, each of the four games are a little more complex and strategic then the previous game.

The deck consists of 64 cards: the 4 types of cards, in 4 different colors (Red, Blue, Yellow and Gray) with 4 of each card in the deck. In the first two games the colors are not used, but in the last two they are. There are also two kinds of tokens (the +3 tokens and the -1 tokens) which are used for scoring.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction
publishers: (Web published), The Game Crafter, LLC, tjgames

name: Breadcrumbs
description:
Breadcrumbs is an abstract strategy game for two to five players with a modular board and partial shared-point mechanics.

In Breadcrumbs, players take turns moving to claim sections of the board, which translate into points. If a player claims a tile that matches their color, they claim double points. But, players must be careful of their movements, as revisiting a tile that you've already moved to results in you losing your claim! And beware, other players can stake a claim into your tiles to reduce your points and claim some of their own!

name: Characters from Charles Dickens
description:
52 cards, forming 13 sets of four, that is, four characters from the same book.
You will need a number of coins or buttons before play begins because, as was often the case in Victorian games, players must place a stake into the 'Pool', which will go to the eventual winner.
Play involves a player leading a character card, say, from Oliver Twist. The next player must follow suit if he has an Oliver Twist character in his hand. The next does likewise and if a trick is completed, the player completing takes the cards and they will form one trick. If a player wins 3 tricks before the cards are exhausted, he wins the game.
The date is a guess but it must be in the late 1850's because three books are not mentioned, including Great Expectations, which were not published until after that time.

name: Achtung Ampel!
description: Children's game with a message "Take care on the roads". This concentrates on advising about traffic lights. On the box, a cute bear and a blue dog are helping two children to cross the road safely.

name: Air Race
description:
Simple roll and move game, given away free with a birthday card. Roll the die and move along the track, obeying good and bad instructions that you land on.
Probably 1950's I think

name: The Centenary Amusu Electrical Game
description:
From the box "Educational and Instructive".
Trivia game relating to Australia.
Point your 'plug' at a question it is your turn to answer. Then place your plug into the answer mode and a light will indicate the correct answer. The player who gets the most correct answers, wind. Probably very hi-tech for 1933.

Two versions exist. The Centenary of Victoria and the earlier general version of the game

The game's name may reference the AMUSU cinemas which operated in Australia (Sydney, Perth and Maroubra, NSW) and in the United States (California, Texas, etc) at the time.

name: The Bombardier
description:
Australian action game.

Aim your 'bombs' and catapult them into the box. The insert features various holes, just big enough to 'receive' one of your bombs. If your bomb ends in a hole, you score points.

"You'll have explosions of laughter" according to the box.

name: The Grand Naval Game of Tactics
description:
Australian game of World War II vintage or slightly earlier.
Box features a group of adults playing game. The box contains a board pierced with holes, around 400 wooden coloured matchstick-type pieces and the rules. Each player controls his own fleet at the same time trying to locate the enemy forces.
I think this must be a Battleships-type game but the pieces, that you thrust through the board to hopefully score a hit, are different colours and this must have some effect on game-play. The manufacturer describe it a "Thrill for Adults". But, covering all bases, it is also suggested for children. Nice to see wooden components.

name: Gypsy Queen Fortune Telling Cards and The Game of Stars
description:
36 cards. Half a fortune telling accessory and half a game. The important part of the rules, the Game of Stars, is a card game in the spirit of Black Maria in Britain or Hearts in America.
Two to four persons can play. The cards rank in the order indicated by the number in the corner, 1 being low. The cards are dealt one at a time until each player has eight cards. The object of the game is to avoid taking tricks which contain cards in the unlucky suit of Stars. There are four suits, Squares, Circles, Diamonds and Stars. The highest numbered card of suit played wins the trick. Players must follow suit if they can. After each hand every player counts the number of unlucky cards (Stars) he has had to take. Every Star card counts one against him and the winner of each hand wins one point for each Star card in his opponents' tricks. First player to get 25 points wins the game.
The unlucky Stars are:
1. Pride
2. Danger
3. Malice
4. Gossip
5. Calamity
6. Envy and Jealousy
7. Sickness
8. Disappointment
9. Tears and Sorrow

name: Zwiffel
description:
Zwiffel includes rules for two games: Flaggenspiel and Zahlenspiel. It was published about 1992-1994 as a Volksbank promotional giveaway.

In Zahlenspiel players try to build ascending rows of 6 cards.
The 32 cads are numbered from 1 to 32. The deck is shuffled and than each player is dealt 6 cards face down. Each player places his cards in front of him in a row with the face down. The rest of the cards go in the center to draw from. The starting player reveals the first card of the stack and chooses a card in front of him that he replaces with the drawn card face up. He than reveals the replaced card and gives it to his left neighbor. That player again chooses one of his cards to be replaced by the given card.
The first player to form a row of six ascending numbers wins the game.

Flaggenspiel is a regular game of Memory.

name: Wargods of Hyberborea
description:
From the playtest manual:

'There is a Greek legend that tells of a frozen land at the top of the world, a place many days sail beyond the most northerly human settlement. Here the cold sea is studded with floating mountains of ice, turning the waters into a frothing tempest that can crush the hulls of the strongest ships and freeze the bodies of the unfortunate sailors who dared to sail there. The land beyond the frozen sea is Ultima Thule.'

Wargods of Hyberborea is a tabletop miniatures game using metal miniatures that is closely related to Wargods of Aegyptus and Wargods of Olympus. Unlike many other tabletop miniatures wargames, the Wargods system uses hidden activation counters in order to simulate fog of war.

In this reincarnation, players simulate massive battles in the land of Ultima Thule by taking control of a race of fierce creatures called the Wendigo, who are led to battle by formidable Ice Witches, masters of snow and wind. Although one off clashes occur frequently between warring factions, Wargods of Hyberborea offers dedicated warmongers an immersive game play experience through campaign play. In campaigns, players play through scenarios, progressing to differing scenarios and acquiring new special powers for their Wargod depending on who the victor is.

name: Tricorne
description: Detailed set of wargame rules and background material on the Seven Years War for 20mm to 30mm miniatures. Special section on unit formations of this period and how to duplicate them on the wargame table. 50 pages.

name: Target For Tonight
description: Australian action game. Players hold their 'bomb' over the boards and drop the bomb, hoping it will end up in one of several holes. Rather like Bagatelle, you score points if it does go into a hole.

name: Anno Mundi
description:
'A Scripture Recreation For The Young'.
I cannot find any rules but I think it is going to be a set collecting game but with only two cards per set. It may even be a Pairs memory type game, where all the cards are laid on the table face down. In a turn, the player chooses a card and then looks for its match. This is made more difficult with these cards because you are matching a date with an event.
Half of the cards feature a biblical event, the other half feature dates. All of the date cards feature a B.C. year.
I think this is pretty heavy going for a children's game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Religious

name: Electric Arithmequiz
description:
Childrens game to help increase their math division skills.
A sheet of sums are provided. The player can attempt one and press their answer attempt. When you are correct the right answer lights up. Any number can play and, I guess, the one who gets the most right answers, wins.
The box is determined to make a parent buy the game. It says:
Commended by Parents Magazine
Learn Division the Playway
When the answer is right, you get the light

name: WORLD WAR THREE: The Last Option
description:
After more than 40 years of tension and arms build-up between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R., it has become clear the Soviets must take action in order to survive as a global empire. It is the summer of 1985. It has become World War III.

Take control of Soviet or NATO forces in a conflict that stretches from Oslo to Riyadh! With an all new combat system based on our favorite parts of the Axis & Allies series of games, you will nuke, bomb, and battle your way to victory using 7 different types of units, supplies, and diplomacy.

The playing board is a map of Europe, Western Asia, and the Middle East divided into areas that players control with their combat forces, represented by plastic figures like the ones from Axis & Allies or Table Tactics. Players can influence neutral countries, launch nuclear missile strikes, fly air combat missions, and attack with ground units to take control of the other side's countries and resources to force the enemy into surrender. Combat system works best with D12, but optional rules are included for a D6 system. The game is over when the victory conditions are met. Can be played by 2,3,or 4 people dividing the factions of USA, NATO, Soviet Union, and Warsaw Pact.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: The Money Game
description:
Objective:s

To accumulate $100,000 in "rare coins." Actual coins count $20,000 each - coin cards have designated values $2,000 or $5,000.

Equipment:
Gameboard and trays with 12 "money bags", 10 real uncirculated coins from 10 different countries symbolizing valuable "rare coins", 10 Coin Selection Cards, and 50 playing cards.

Method of Play:
1. Players sit opposite each other
2. Remove coins from bottom of box (undernearth plastic tray). Place coins at random, (in full view of both players) one under each of 10 "money bags" (2 bags will remain empty).
3. Dealer shuffles the small Coin Selection Cards (those depicting the actual coins used in the game) and deals five to himself and five to his opponent, alternating and FACE UP. During the subsequent play of the game, each player will try to obtain as many of the coins shown on his small cards as possible. Obviously, this combination of coins will change with each game.
4. Dealer shuffles the Playing Cards and deals five cards to himself and five cards to his opponent, alternating, and FACE DOWN. The remaining cards are placed faced down in the DRAW tray.
5. Players pick up the five playing cards. The dealer draws a card and must then play a card from his hand either in front of him to count toward his score, or into the discard tray. At no time after playing a card may a player have more than five cards remaining in his hand.
6. If a player has a SEARCH CARD, he may play it face down in the discard tray and then "search" for one of his coins (designated on his Coin Selection Cards). He does this by touching one of the "money bags" and declaring, for example "the Turkish kurus is in this bag." He then lifts the "bag" and if the Turkish kurus IS underneath the "bag", he removes the coin and places it in front of him as part of his score. He then replaces the "money bag". As the game progresses, ocoins and empty areas will be exposed and it will become increasingly important to remember their locations. If a player exposes one of his opponent's coin, he merely replaces the bag and it is the opponent's turn. If the opponent has a SEARCH CARD, he is in the happy position of eing able to acquire a coin immediately. Players draw and play cards alternately.
7. If a player has a $5,000 or $2,000 COIN CARD he may hold it for future play, he may play it face up in front of him counting toward his score, or he may discard it.
8. If a player has a WINDFALL CARD he may lift ANY bag and remove the coin - IF it is one of HIS coins.
9. If a player has an ILLEGAL COIN CARD, he may play it on his opponent's score pile. The opponent then may not play ANY card except a LEGAL COIN CARD or a SEARCH CARD on his next turn. In the meantime he must discard one card into the discard tray after every draw. If he plays a SEARCH CARD, this permits him to search for a coin. If he plays a LEGAL COIN CARD, he takes no further action until his next turn.
10. If the "Draw" tray is emptied before the game ends, reshuffle those in the "discard" tray and continue play.

WHO WINS:
The first player to accumulate $100,000 or more in coins and cards. Actual coins from COIN CARDS count $20,000 each. The COIN CARDS count $2,000 or $5,000 according to their face value.

name: Game Battle ships with key chain
description: Each player deploys his ships (of lengths varying from 2 to 3 squares) secretly on a square grid. Each player shoots at the other's grid by calling a location. The defender responds by "Hit!" or "Miss!". You try to deduce and find where the enemy ships are and sink them. First to do so wins.

name: Motamot
description:
Motamot is a game based on the French vocabulary.

A word of between 5 and 10 characters is looked up in a dictionary. (for example Marabout)
The last letters of this word is now used to form a new word (for example 'aboutir). The players have one minute before time. The points are determined by the number of letters that is reused in the next word.

name: Pooh's Hunny Pot Card Game
description:
Object of the game is to capture the "Hunny is Yummy" card.

Gameplay: Each player plays as one of four characters: Piglet, Tigger, Eeyore or Roo. Each player gets four cards face up on the table. The remaining cards form a draw pile, and one card is turned up for the discard pile.

The turn starts by drawing one card. At this point, you may trade an "Oh Bother" card (which has a picture of an object and character) that belongs to another player for one of their cards. The receiving player takes the card, turns all of their cards face down, and shuffles them. The giving player picks one of the cards and adds to their hand. The turn ends with a discard.

If you get a "Busy Bee" card, and are the first one to discard this card when another player shouts "Honey!" to signify they have four hunny pots, you get to take one Hunny Pot card from the player. The first player to avoid the bees and get the "Hunny is Yummy" card by holding four hunny pots wins.

Alternate rule sets for younger players eliminate the Busy Bee cards and players try to collect all six "Oh Bother" cards that match their character.

name: Pooh's Tales of Adventure
description: A Character card is drawn as a story starter. On each turn, any player starts the story with the character, starting with card border #1. Then any player continues with #2, and again for #3. Whoever claims the #2 card wins the "Tale". Most tales win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: 1001 Erz√§hlungen
description:
Tell stories by using picture cards. Several ways to play. The 90 cards portray concepts from life and fantasy. There are cards in 5 colors(on the frame), 15 each.
It's basically an earlier card version of story cubes

(90 picture cards from each selected five cards that the player's turn to build an imaginative sense. If the players approve the sentence, the player scores 5p.

Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.)

The lion's game 1302 is an initiative of the Historical Museum of Flemish Fight in Aalter at Belgium. The game concept is based on the "lion Vermaekelyk game" from the 18th century

The game board shows a spiral-like trail and is located around the events of the Golden Spurs in 1302. Playful learn the museum and its collection through the familiar images of the 63 subjects.

Players roll dice and moves their pawns. Who reaches first at the end wins the game.

name: 24 Game: Fractions/Decimals
description:
Players win points by being the first to correctly identify how the four numbers on the card can be manipulated using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division to arrive at the number 24.

This edition includes four numbers, fractions or decimal numbers on each card. Through a combination of these there is a goal to calculate number 24.

name: 24 Game: Integers positive/negative
description:
Players win points by being the first to correctly identify how the four numbers on the card can be manipulated using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division to arrive at the number 24.

This edition includes four positive and / or negative numbers on each card. You must use each digit exactly once to the exact target number "24" and "-24" to obtain.

name: DiceGangsta
description:
This game short dice game designed to play while waiting your turn in other type of games. The game takes no more than 5-10 minutes and 6 rounds to play.
To run the game you need to have 5 dices, 1 sheet of paper and 1 pencil.

How to play:
Every turn, each player rolls all the dices then pick a number from 1-6 (it can be from the rolled dices), count all the dices with that number and take them out of the game, if there are dices on the table the player rolls them one more time and see if they turn the same number he choose before to add those to the before count. Until the end of the game that player can’t choose that same number again.

name: SIX D SIX
description:
SIX D SIX is a set of six strategic board games playable with dice. All six games were designed to rely on luck as little as possible in their outcomes. In most cases, the "randomness" of the die-rolling is used to set-up the game, but does not influence who will win.

All that is needed to play are 36 six-sided dice in six different (non-black) colors, and an additional 36 six-sided black dice (for most of the games). One also requires a chessboard, and some require keeping score with pen and paper.

SIX D "ONE": A tactical game that allows each player to get creative and "make" a gameboard to stump the other players. Play consists of claiming a spot on the gameboard each turn, scoring for pip count and connections with other claimed spots.
SIX D "TWO": Roll a big pile of dice and take turns removing two dice of the same color. When all the dice have been removed, or there are no more matches left, whoever has the most pips showing on all the dice they've removed is the winner!
SIX D "THREE": Relying the most on luck of any of these games, the gameboard consists of a 6x6 grid of randomly rolled black dice. Players draw a "hand" of three dice (which they roll), and can play them on the gameboard in any space matching the pip count shown. Points are scored for matching adjacent die in color or pip count.
SIX D "FOUR": A "pure" abstract strategy game, played on a chess board, where you'll need to capture your own pieces in order to capture the black pieces that ensure victory.
SIX D "FIVE": A simple but strategic dice stacking game for 3 to 6 players. Place your dice matching the dice already in play. You'll need to think in three dimensions for this one!
SIX D "SIX": A game that involves identifying rows and columns on the gameboard consisting of "same color, different pip count", or "different color, same pip count". Players will place the pieces they identify into a personal play area, scoring points as they do.

The complete rules for each game are available in this PDF: http://chesstris.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/6D6.pdf
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Game System, Print & Play

name: Skorpion
description:
Skorpion is a two player abstract strategy board game.
The object of Skorpion is to play a piece in the center of the board. The game is played by playing pieces on the board, connecting newly placed pieces to ones already on the board. To play a piece on a connected space that’s your own or the neutral color only requires one existing piece to be connected to it. Playing a piece on your opponent’s color requires that you have two pieces in play connected to that space.
Instead of playing a piece you may also move the Skorpion. The Skorpion and his tail (which is always in the previous spot the Skorpion occupied) not only blocks spaces but also will remove a piece from the board when it moves into it.

name: In-N-Out Opoly
description:
(From the back of the box.)

Go directly to In-N-Out Burger. Do not pass up this opportunity to play America's favorite board game with an In-N-Out flavor. It's the all new In-N-Out Opoly Property Trading Game.

...

The In-N-Out Opoly Game is a hamburger lover's dream come true - build your own empire of the most sought after In-N-Out collectibles, menu items, locations, as well as other assets of the company. Players vie to own them all in this very unique In-N-Out Burger game which comes complete with custom pewter tokens, including the celebrated Double-Double burger, an order of fries and the "Burger's up" bugle. Own it all!

This plays similar to Monopoly, but some of the properties are priced differently than the same spaces in Monopoly.

Pewter Tokens: Beverage Cup, In-N-Out Logo, Double-Double, Burger Coin, French Fries, Bugle, Palm Trees, Apron Pin.

This was given as a Christmas gift to In-N-Out employees in the year 2000. This was never sold to the general public.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: 200 Steps to Freedom
description:
200 Steps to Freedom is an educational trivia game based on the American Revolution. The game was published by American Way Games and "copyright" in 1776 (but published in 1977).

The gameboard has two different paths, either the 100 Days or the 100 People path. At the start of the game, the players decide if they would like to play either the 100 Days or the 100 People path. All player tokens are then placed at the start of this path. Each player in turn will roll the die and move the number of spaces on the die. The 100 Days path has 100 different dates on the spaces, while the 100 people has 100 different people listed on the path. The player then must state one or more facts about the person or the date that they landed on, and if they are correct then they would get a point. For example, if they land on December 14, 1782, the player would get a point if they state that The British pulled out of Charleston South Carolina. Once all players finish the selected path then all of the player pawns are then placed back at the start for phase two, the Question phase. The players then move around the track again, only this time when they land on a space they get to answer a multiple choice question from the book that corresponds to their space that they landed on. Every correct answer gets one point. Once all players cross the finish line of the question phase then the player with the most points is the winner.

name: 3D Dino Dominoes
description:
This game has like objectives, develops matching skills and reinforces hand-eye co-ordination for the children.
The game begins with the slots on the same side and place in the middle of the players.
After deal 7 dominoes to each player and place the rest in a pile where everyone can reach them.
The player with the shortest name starts by slotting together a matching dinosaur with the starter double domino.
Players then take turns to slot matching dinosaur together, ensuring they are the right way up.
If a player cannot go they take another domino from the pile.The winner is the first child to play all their dominoes or, in the event of a stalemate the child with the fewest dominoes remaining.

name: Lazy King
description:
An abstract strategy game with perfect information, designed to be playable with extremely common components. Allows for quick play and various strategic maneuvers. A sketch of a notation
system is included to allow for correspondence play and record keeping. Theoretically compatible with the ELO rating system for tournament or ladder play.

In Lazy King, players must move their King to a goal space on the opposite side of the board. Sounds easy, right? One hitch: the king is extremely lazy, and cannot move on his own. So, other pieces must escort the king to safety. But beware, the more pieces that escort the king, the slower they move. Avoid the trap squares, mind the walls, and trick the opponent into a false sense of security.

name: Slidey
description:
Slidey is a fast-paced abstract board game in which players goal is to achieve four in a row on a constantly changing playing area. Slidey is really easy to learn but hard to master.

Gameplay: On his turn player places one of his pieces on the edge of playing area and then pushes it into the game board. Push may interact with other pieces and thus change the situation a lot in one turn. This continues until one of the players achieves four in a row.

Content: Wooden game board, 22 wooden pieces, rules

name: Terrax Warriors
description:
Terrax is a world of conflicts and magic, and while kings and lords fight for lands and power, some adventurers with their warbands are fighting for the many gold veins found all around Terrax. In this board game, players take the role of these adventurers, and fight other players with the same greedy goal. This game is about fighting tactics, wise character movements and actions, and destroying your enemy's characters. Use every warrior in your warband at their best, and you have good chances of winning some of the riches of Terrax.

Each player has a team of mercenaries from these 6 groups : Amazons, men, elves, dwarves, orcs, and goblins. Each group has a different feel and playstyle. The goal is to conquer and exploit, on a randomly placed game board, the gold veins that will make you rich. But the fight is hard to get what you want. The tension is all around the battlefield, every place where there is gold needs to be taken, and protected. Move your characters and attack, cast spells, heal the injured, move to conquer ungarded veins... When you have enough gold, hire more mercenaries to help you fight harder, and protect more gold veins. The goal of Terrax Warriors is to take out one player after the other, until only you remain in the game.

Website :

http://www.darvexgames.com/TerraxWarriors.html

There is now a FREE PC version of the board game, downloadable on the website.

name: Simulateur JR10
description:
Generic wargame played on a hex grid pitting two asymetric forces against each other.

The mounted game board features a river, forests, a hill, a road and a bridge.
The 40 units are mortars, tanks, antitanks and infantry. They are rated for movement and range.
A strict IGO-UGO sequence is followed.
A timer is used to add some stress.

An electronic device with blue, yellow and red lights (we are talking 70s here) is used as a randomizer to calculate the odds.
Depending on the type of combat, a plastic plate is introduced into the primitive computer to give a result.
For example :
- infantry attacking tank : 25% inf destroyed, 65 % no result, 10 % tank destroyed.
- tank attacking infantry : 5% tank destroyed, 70% no result, 25% inf destroyed.

Complete name :
Simulateur JR10
Jeu de stratégie électronique
