N°1 bataille des forces blindées

Awards : Oscar du Jouet 1972 (France)

name: Conspiracy Tactics
description:
Conspiracy Tactics is a fast-paced two-player board game of psychological combat. As the leader of a clandestine faction, players move their pieces on a grid and try to find and assassinate their opponent's Puppet Master (King) while concealing their own.

The core of the game revolves around a series of bluffing games that are wagered to reveal, conceal, and remove pieces from the board.

The easy-to-learn, hard-to-master mechanics further challenge the psyche with a number of special, one-per-game abilities, called Pressure. Pressure unleashes powerful abilities onto the board that change the state of the game - a proper read on an opponent's intentions can lead to a dramatic turnaround late in the game!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Dice, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: Disney Classics
description:
A CCG of Disney released for the super markets company Match and Smatch in Belgium. Each package includes 4 cards with the entire collection existing out of 216 cards.

The rules for the game are simple: Every player takes at least 5 cards face down. Now the first player takes the first card from his deck and chooses one of the four characteristics (friendship, courage, team spirit or humor) which all have a specific score. After choosing the category the player places the card on the table so that everybody can see it. Now the other players take the first card from their own deck and compare the score of the choosen characteristic. The player with the highest score on that characteristic wins the round. The game goes on until one person has won all the cards in the game.

For collecting purposes people have made their own interpretation of the game or let the winner choose a card from one of the losers decks.
categories: Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Market Game: L'avvincente gioco del supermercato
description:
Each player must to buy all the products (Barilla, Mulino Bianco and others) listed in his shopping list.
Offers, discounts, opportunities, promotions and ATMs service make the game lively and unpredictable.
The winner is the player who save more money buying all the products of his shopping list.

name: Algorix
description:
Scrabble like game where is numbers and "+","-" etc. chips instead of letters.
In his turn player must lay on the game board a math operations (eg 3 +4 = 7) and scores points shoed on the chips.
By forming a operation and any chip is laid on bonus square on the game board the point values of chip or word may rise.

name: Fish Food Card Game
description: A fun game for the whole family. It's a fish eat fish world out there so watch out. Get ahead by eating smaller fish and growing bigger. Use action cards in your hand to modify your size or the size of attacking sea creatures to give yourself a temporary defensive boost or to help attack an opposing player. You can even use the Swim Away card to run away from an encounter. Look out for Event cards like the Shark or Take the Bait which can mix up the game. The first player to size 10 wins, but if you get knocked down to size 0 you lose! Simple math skills are used throughout the game, although there are plenty of chances to use advanced strategy and team play too! The game instructions include several rules variations to suit the skill level of any type of player.

name: Florissima
description:
Unpublished game.
Has won a German award (Deutscher Lernspielpreis 2011) in the category "Unpublished games". The following description is a translation of the text found on the award website:

Flowers for sale! In the most vivid colours! If you want to realise a good price, you have to buy on good terms, water smartly and create the right floral arrangements. Buying, selling, calculating and always keeping an eye on the competition - a classic economic game with beautiful components.

Source (description in German): http://www.deutscher-lernspielpreis.de/sieger/2011.html

name: Genie Ass
description:
A trivia game from the makers of games "Smart Ass" and "Dumb Ass".

Players aim to be the first to release the Genie from her bottle by correctly answering the most all-play trivia questions.

If you get the "Genie Ass" category you can answer a question all by yourself.

("Genie Ass"? Pronounce it aloud)

name: Popeye Pipe Toss Game
description: The game has a stand-up card image of Popeye, with a three-dimensional pipe in his mouth. Players must throw rings to try to get them to hook over the pipe (as in the traditional Quoits game).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Clowns Party
description:
Each player has his/her own board with a grid of 16 clown pictures. Each clown is unique, but somewhat similar to the other clowns. A card is flipped over and all players search for the clown on that card on their grid. The first player to find it shouts the letter or the number assigned to it on his/her board. If correct, s/he can keep the clown card.
The goal is to get three cards of the same "family" - the same clown in three different clothes.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: TriYang
description: The game consists of triangular tiles on which each corner is colored. There are five basic colors, plus orange as a joker color. In his/her turn, a player places a new triangle to the game area, trying to form color areas that are as large as possible. Interestingly, a triangle cannot only placed with full contact to another triangle, but also with half contact, so the game area can take a rather unusual shape. For each color area that a player adds to, a point is scored for each corner involved (including orange corners). The goal is to score the highest number of points this way.

name: Vegas
description:
Gambling game, a promotional item for Woodpecker Cider. Casino themed game in which the board provides a number of different betting options as players land on spaces. However, as well as making a bet when landing on a space, if you win you get the chance to buy the space, and act as banker for other players landing on it.

Includes a deck of playing cards with the Woodpecker symbol on the backs.

published ca 1980

name: Sky Dancers
description:
The object of Sky Dancers is to be the first Sky Dancer to return the stolen Sky Swirl Stone to Queen Skyla. Players first move through the Wingdom world, the Chaos Universe and finally to the High Hope Academy. To move from one world to another, your Dance Student pawn must change its form and turn into its Sky Dancer pawn.

Contents:

1 Game board platform
High Hope Academy
Chaos Universe
6 Sky Dancers pawns
6 Dance student pawns
1 Sky-Clone pawn
13 Plastic pawn stands
66 Game cards
Spinner

name: 33 Miners Board Game
description:
ABOUT THE GAME
Mining was their only livelihood. It was expected to be a normal working day when suddenly the upper galleries of the gold and copper mine collapsed, causing the miners to be trapped for months. In this rescue mission game, you and your team must try to overcome all odds in order to rescue these thirty three (33) trapped miners. To be successful, you and your team must meet all the government’s mandatory health, safety and environment (HSE) standards, acquire the necessary gears, and endeavor to avoid danger zones. Remember, the perils and rewards are high - just when you think you are about to enter the chamber to rescue a trapped miner, your mission might suffer a setback as the other rescue team progresses. This game is about individual effort, team work, risk, strategy and sacrifice.

NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 2 - 6.
AGES: 12yrs to adult.
PLAYING TIME: 45-60 minutes.

YOUR CHALLENGE
Your team’s objective is to rescue as many trapped miners as possible. This process is not without its challenges such as: the unavailability of cash to acquire the necessary gears, risky danger zones, overcoming fluctuating gear costs imposed by the Greedy Merchant and the ability to meet the mandatory standards imposed by the government through its agency The Bureau of Standards. Lives are at stake! The longer you wait, the more unlikely it will be that the trapped miners will survive. Can you rise to the challenge? Only time will tell.

GAME CONTENTS
The game box consists of game rules and instructions, 1 board, 1 dice, 33 tokens (depicting the trapped miners), 6 player pawns, 6 rescue gear kits (or placeholders for the players’ gears), 42 tokens (depicting the gears), 1 game price chart, 1 debtor sheet, 20 Bank Notes of $5, 30 Bank Notes of $10 and $20 respectively, 6 ‘holding card placeholders, and 2 decks of cards (HSE and Bureau of Standards). The deck of HSE cards are 35 in total and the deck of Bureau of Standards cards are 42 in total.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spread the Wealth Around
description:
From the publisher:

The political boardgame, Spread the Wealth Around, exists to train you bitter clingers to practice the art of class warfare, dodge death panels, cheat on your taxes and do your small part to increase our national debt.

Choose membership in one of four organizations: Public Service, ObamaCare, Big Labor or Wall Street. From your perch atop the ruling class, you’ll bankrupt other players, drag them before show trials, carve them up in unnecessary surgery or just get one of your big labor goons to wack ‘em in Rocko Roulette.

Rather than accumulate wealth in Spread the Wealth Around, you’ll rack up mountains of debt just like Obama’s America. Scam dead people and collect their Social Security in Public Office. Unplug granny and play the lawsuit lottery in ObamaCare. Gamble and go burnin’ and lootin’ with Big Labor. Cut in line for your Wall Street bailout it’s all for the children.

Spread the Wealth Around is the perfect gift to cure that troglodyte Republican friend or conservative relation. No need for sensitivity training or coaching on tax and spend Obamanomics. Put away those teacher’s union pamphlets and Mao’s little red book. Play the political game that’s making the world safe for socialism!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Maan roos vis lotto-spel
description:
This game is meant for starting readers.

Each player has a card with pictures and the corresponding word. These words all miss 1 letter, which the players need to find.
Players start their turn by turning over a chip with the number 1 to 3 in one of the colors (red, blue and green). This determines how many letter chips in which color can be turned face up. Any letters which fit on the lotto card can be put on the card. The rest is turned face down again.
As with regular lotto you try to fill your card as quick as possible, with the first to complete his/her card winning the game.

The cards come in 3 different levels, with which you can build up the game as the child(s) improve their reading skill.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: CyberTank!
description:
CyberTank! is a set of rules for an arena combat game involving futuristic tanks. (The players provide their own hex map, counters, and dice.) Tanks have elaborate designs, with many different possible types of weapon, different firing arcs for the weapons, drones, armor, ECM and ECCM, wheeled vs. tracked movement, etc. A number of sample designs are provided and players are encouraged to create their own. The game system is fairly simple, with most of the complexity coming from the interaction of the various systems.

The game was made available at a 1992 convention as a "pre-edition beta." It is not certain if there were any further versions of the game.

name: Little Mouse
description:
"Little Mouse" is a children's sequencing game which uses the imagery and phrasing from the book, "The Little Mouse, the Red Ripe Strawberry, and the Big Hungry Bear" by Audrey and Don Wood. The game contains 48 thick cards with 4 each of the 12 different phrases to play any of six different games.

[paraphrased rules]

1. Solo Sequencing
Solitary sequencing in which one set of 12 different cards are laid face-up. The player places the cards in sequence according to the original story.

2. Scramble Sequencing
For 2-4 players. All 48 cards are placed face-up. The first player to complete a sequence wins.

3. Skill Sequencing
For 2-4 players. Cards are shuffled. The top four cards are laid face-up, the rest are dealt to the players. Each turn, the player places a card before or after one of the four middle cards. First player to use all cards wins.

4. Quartet
For 2-4 players. Players seek to obtain all four of a particular card. Player with the highest number of sets wins.

5. Snap
For 2-4 players. Traditional Snap game.

6. Matching Words to Pictures
For 2-4 players. A single storyline set is dealt to each player. A leader displays either picture or word card and the other players have to match its opposite (words-to-picture or picture-to-words)

name: The Game of Pegpen
description: The Game of Pegpen is a sort of Dot and Boxes game on the 5x5 grid with a significant twist. Normally in Dots and Boxes a square is enclosed with move marks. However in The Game Of Pegpen requires the players to peg each corner of the square as well as the middle position of each line on the square. Thus 8 moves are required to close the box.

name: Best Seller
description: Promotional game, made for the milk delivery firm, Unigate Dairies. Business game of buying and selling groceries. A four stage game. 1) puchasing products, 2) marketing expenditure, 3) selling products, 4) marketing income. An unusual mechanism gives the players a variety of choices of what to buy and sell and at what prices. The marketing phases involve moving around various tracks on the board, with options on where to move next, and choosing how to make the best of the opportunities presented.

name: Dark Tree: Battles
description:
From the publisher:

Lords are gathering warriors to their sides to defeat their foes, claim powerful artifacts and grow rich in gold. This is a miniatures battle game where the Lord and his warriors are on the field to sow terror and reap glory. All melodrama aside, DTB is a quick and simple battle game. Any kind of miniature can be used as long as it is of a similar scale as the others used. Figures are not even needed. Slips of paper or different color poker chips can be used. As long as all players know who belongs to who, it does not matter. Players keep their record sheets to bring their Lords and warriors back to the table to further increase their spoils.

name: Maerchenwelt
description:
A collection of 4 games themed around fairy tales. It contains 4 games:
1) Who awakens sleeping beauty with a kiss: The players must roll and move their way to sleeping beautys mouth. There are obstacles, which can only be removed by a rolling the exact number.
2) Bremen town musicians: This game is Ludo/Sorry/Pachisi/Mensch aergere Dich nicht.
3) Who finds the way to the witches house: A game with memory, players must match cards and place them on their path to the house.
4) Hare and tortoise: 1 or two tortoises (here hedgehogs) play against one hare by rolling dice. Both paths for hedgehogs and hare are the same length, but both hedgehogs can play together.

name: Football Trivia
description:
The game contains 2,400 questions on the worlds favourite game as well as a die, score pad and pencil.
Each player takes it in turns to be the question master and they roll the die to see which of the six questions on the card they should ask. The additional twist in this game is that there are also picture cards included.

name: Inspector McClue: The Red Rose Murders
description:
Murder mystery dinner party game.
In the dog-eat-dog world of 1950s Hollywood there's only room for one top-dog - and he's the cigar-chomping agent to the stars, Rich Toad. So when he's found dead in suspicious circumstances, floating face-down in the swimming pool of his mansion, surrounded by a hundred scattered red roses, the whole film world is shocked to its core. There's no business like show business, they say, but when it comes to murder, a suspect is just a suspect. And one, or more, of Rick Toad's illustrious clients is about to get fingered for killing the most powerful man in entertainment. Your task is to discover who that killer is. Fortunately the famous Inspector McClue is on hand to assist your investigations.
The guests are: MARILYN MANSFIELD - The blonde bombshell whose flamboyant life both on-and-off-screen has delighted the gossip columnists for years.
ROCK HOUSTON - rugged, rough and rowdy, Houston was the biggest male star of them all, the ultimate in American masculinity; now he's going into politics and talking about running for the presidency.
MARLON MEAN - The most famous teenager in the world. Mean is actually 27-years-old now, but he's still making a career out of screen rebellion.
PRINCESS KELLY OF RURITANIA - before her marriage to the Crown Prince, the most eligible bachelor in Europe, Princess Kelly was simple Kelly Kennedy, the sophisticated star of romantic comedies.
MADAME VELDA - clairvoyant to the stars, she has been a familiar figure in Hollywood circles for many years, predicting the future with surprising accuracy.
WAYNE FONDA - also known as the Hillbilly Hero, Fonda is a rock and roll singer who might just cut it in the movies.
MAE VEST - author, actress and activist, Miss Vest is seldom seen without a devoted young man on her arm, a glass of champagne in her hand, and a quip on her lips.
SALVADOR DILLY-DALLY - Europe's most famous surrealist artist has come to Hollywood to work in the movies, and to make his fortune.
The game includes invitations: simply choose which of your friends play which devious suspect and invite them to come along as that character. Also included are menu suggestions, recipes and of course, a really tasty murder to solve!

name: Meerkat Mayhem
description:
Children must be quick to play this grabbing game!

The plastic board has a central slot into which a green plastic thingie (for want of a better word) is inserted. When the thingie is removed, up pop random Meerkats and you have to grab one if you can.

Each player must try and prevent losing their meerkat to the dreaded cobra. Position your meerkat, start the spinner and get ready to grab your meerkat before the cobra strikes.

Whoever has the most meerkat's at the end, wins the game!
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Postman Pat: Mayhem at the Sorting Office Board Game
description:
A simple roll and move game for the very young. Children will need a little luck to be the first to find the letters that matches the character name on their postcard. It is a nicely themed game about this popular children's TV favourite.

From the publisher;
Today is total mayhem at the sorting office! Letters are everywhere and no-one know what to do, so Pat has no choice but to stop his deliveries and help sort out the mess! Players each have a postcard belonging to a resident of Greendale, then race around the sorting office turning over the jumble of post to find the missing letters. The first to find all their missing letters from their postcard is the winner!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tip of the Tongue
description:
Aimed at children, this is a game reminiscent of Taboo, where you must describe an object on the card but without using certain key words. For instance, it might say 'Balloon' and you cannot use the words 'pop’, ‘inflate’, ‘bang’ or ‘float’?

The subjects are graded so that different age groups can play.

The cards are dispensed from a yellow plastic head and the cards becomes its tongue, so to speak.

name: My Little Pony Merry-Go-Round Game
description:
Object: Be the first to get eight stamps on your score sheet.

Each player gets 4 cards (one for each pony) and a score sheet. Before each turn, every player chooses one card to place face-down. The player whose turn it is then spins the merry-go-round, and when it stops, one of four colors will display through the merry-go-round windows.
Anybody whose face-down card matches the color displaying through the windows may use the pony of that color to stamp his/her score sheet.

Contents:

Mechanical merry-go-round with ball top
Sheet of stickers for merry-go-round base
4 stamper pony pieces with stamp caps (Posey, Heart Throb, Cherries Jubilee, & Medley)
16 pony cards (4 of each pony)
1 pad of score sheets to stamp and color
Instruction sheet

name: El Dilema / The Dilemma
description:
It is a strategic game in which opponents should make them conducive chance.
You can play two, three, four and two teams of two players.

Each player receives 15 coins to start the game.
The first action of the game is to fill the board with so many games.
After each set the players traded currencies as the play tells them. And redo the box
score play.
The game ends when one player gets all the coins.
Each player is identified with one of the letters: A, B, C or D, and with a color: Blue,
Red, Green and Yellow.


Es un juego estratégico, en el que los adversarios deben hacer que el azar les sea
propicio.
Pueden jugar dos, tres, cuatro y dos equipos de dos jugadores.

Cada jugador recibe 15 monedas al iniciar la partida.
La primera acción del juego es llenar el tablero con los tantos de juego.
Después en cada lance los jugadores intercambian las monedas que la jugada les indica.
Y rehacen la puntuación de la casilla jugada.
El juego finaliza cuando un jugador se queda con todas las monedas.
Cada jugador se identifica con una de las letras: A, B, C o D; y con un color: Azul,
Rojo, Verde y Amarillo.

name: Mechanical Yacht Race
description:
Early 20th century action game.

Your yacht is attached to a length of string in such a way that if the string is pulled, raised or shaken, the player can make the yacht 'sail' along the string to the finish line. The strings are attached to the table. The box illustrates rather well the set-up and the game-play.

Really cute cats are in the illustration on the box, watching mother and son playing the game.

name: The Game of Punch and Judy
description:
Simple race game. The object is to reach the end of the track first so that you can see the Punch & Judy show.
The track has several negative squares, Lose 1 turn, lose 2 turns and Go Back to Start. There are no positive squares.
You need an exact throw to win.

name: Clipper Dice
description:
Object of the game is to throw a series of dice combinations to win.

In his turn player throw 5 dice and one of the combination, as shown on the cards appears. He may choose it or try a higher combination re-throwing some of his dice. If he fails he cannot then claim the original combination he abandoned.
If he was successful the next player must attempt the combination re-throwing his dice up to three time.

name: Damsels in Distress
description:
This is my third game inspired by the Venn diagram. In this game, players choose a fruit cart in the marketplace, and gather the fruit located there. Each carts' contents overlap so taking fruit from the cart affects fruit taken later from the same cart. Using only cards, the Venn idea was definitely abstracted a bit.
In Damsels in Distress, the players are wicked queens/witches that have determined through their talking mirrors, that damsels in the area are more fairer than they. Taking the fruit they poison the apples, feed the monkeys, draw cards, and hinder the prince charming on his way to save the damsel. The apples if given to the damsel before the prince arrives, will put the damsel into a deep sleep (coma). The player who does this will gain the prestige for doing so, of her wicked guild of witches and warlocks. The charming Prince of each Kingdom is headed towards his Kingdom's damsels, and each round saves one, unless hindered (slipping on a banana peel, perhaps? Or better yet, attacked by a band of flying monkeys?). In this community of Witches, there is more prestige for a collection of damsels from different Kingdoms.

name: Polltics
description:
From the publisher's website and press release:

"A neat mixture of Politics and strategies that gives you control on how intense to play (Casual relaxed social mood or competitive against opponents)."

"The game kicks off as participants choose their favorite VOTE chips and PARTY card along with four PROP cards from the deck. Players then take turns campaigning, purchasing potential votes, and rolling the dice against opponents for State’s Supremacy.

General Elections are called, votes counted, and winners of the Presidency, House/ Senate Majority, and Supreme Court judges are revealed. Players are paid according to the total number of VOTES earned. The cycle continues until someone wins the game by achieving Absolute Majority. Players use strategy to determine which states to campaign in, how much money to spend on a given state, and decide when to pass a BILL to hinder their opponents."

"The game can also be played as a type of POKER in a relaxed setting."
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Cocaine
description: A game in which the players act as drug lords competing to have the reputation for supplying the best drugs. Players bid for turn order, action selection, and a bonus privilege, jointly. Actions include producing drugs, distributing drugs to dealers, and influencing the number of sales a particular dealer makes. Player identity is secret and players take the above actions in such a way that drugs sold by dealers they are associated with are of higher quality than those of their opponents.

name: Spinaroo
description:
Goal:
Spinning the tops score as many points as possible

1. Determine sequence of players
- each player spins a top on the board;
the one who scores most (ends up in the highest
compartment) starts ...
2. Use 3 tops - spin them one at a time in rapid succession
in the center square of the box/board - no delay
allowed, immediately you have to spin the following during
the other(s) are in action
3. After the three tops have come to stop ==> scoring takes
place (= numbers of the compartments in which the tops rest)
4. The player who first scores 100 points, wins the game

name: MAS-WWII Plane Pack #1
description:
This first official expansion for MAS-WWII adds 11 new aircraft:

Netherlands
D.XXI
G.1A

Poland
P.11C
P.23B Karas
P.37B Los

Commonwealth
A-20 Wirraway
Halifax Mk. I
A-46 Boomerang

Germany
Me.323 Gigant
Hs.129B
Me.410A
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Three Men In A Tub
description:
Goal: Hit the men in the tub with the balls and tip them out

1. Place the three figures back of the tub so that their fingers rest very slightly on the edge of the tub and the feet of each figure shows through one of the openings at the bottom of the tub

2. Object of the game is to snap or roll the balls at the opening, hitting the feet of the three figures and tipping them out of the tub and into the imaginary water

3. Each player has 3 shot at a turn and scores 5 points for each figure which is thrown clear of the tub into the "water".
A figure which is hit and still retains a grip on the tub does not score

4. The first player to score 100 points wins the game

name: Titanium Age
description:
Titanium Age is new, fast paced sci-fi strategy game for two players that is based on hit RTS video games.

It is the 23rd century. Mankind has finally united under the Terran Star Empire, and has taken fledgling steps to colonize the solar system. However, another power has similar plans. The scions of the first attempt to colonize mars, the Hegemony of Ares has risen to form a military super power that rival the Terran forces. Now the two Empire's must fight for the future of the human race with new, terrible weapons and vehicles. Now begins the Titanium Age.

Titanium Age is a hex based game that combines city building, civilization syle research, and mass strategic warfare into one epic light-wargame. There are even some very light deck-building elements, allowing you to customize your play style with artillery attacks and buffs for your army, which can contain over 100 units at once! All these elements are combined under a single, simple dice based ruleset that has two modes of play; Skirmish , which is a streamlined version for beginers and nonwargamers, and Warzone, which adds tactical depth by adding cards, an upgrade tree for your units, and a terifying unit called the ultra mech. The objective of the game is to destroy your enemies HQ structure, winning a battle in the war for the red planet.
categories: City Building, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck

name: Basketus
description: Basketus is a 20-minute basketball game. Each player manages a team of 5 chips basketball players who are available to move around the court, throws the ring, passes, steals the ball. The game uses two dice, but winning the game depends largely on the actions of the players. Print and play.

name: Recruiting for Kitchener's Army
description:
Goal: Collect as many (visiting = recruits) counters as possible before a player reaches Dover

Game is played on a board carrying a map of the British Isles.
Players move round the map according to the throw of dice.
Similar to 'Snake and Ladders' you gain or loose movement points, depending on the space your turn ends (==> see table on the board). Luckily you also may collect counters entering the big cities.
The player who reaches Dover finishes the game, collecting 10 additional counters.

Historical background:
Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum and Broome, 1850 - 1916, British field-marshal.
His excellent reputation was used to recruit men for the 'killing fields' of WW I. He and most of his staff drowned when his ship struck a mine off Orkney.

name: Soap Opera Challenge: The Young and the Restless
description: Trivia game featuring questions relating to The Young and the Restless TV series. Each card has 6 categories. A die is rolled and that indicates the question subject to be answered,
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Fields of Battle
description:
Fields of Battle is a simple tabletop wargaming ruleset published in Warlock (Issue 12 - Oct/Nov 1986). The game is designed to introduce Fighting Fantasy gamebooks readers to tabletop gaming.

The rules are derived from the Fighting Fantasy rules: each unit has a STRIKE and a STRENGTH rating (which work like FF's SKILL and STAMINA), and a MOVE and ATTACK score. Move is the distance the unit can move in inches, Attack the number of attacks per turn (most units have only one).

Each game turn, units move or fire, then combat between units in contact is resolved (each unit adds a 2d6 roll to its STRIKE rating, the unit with the lowest result loses 2 points of STRENGTH). After combat resolution, units that have suffered losses must pass a morale test or rout. A routing unit must test morale again in the next turn and is removed from the game if it fails that second test.

The rules also include a few special rules for flank attacks, cover, fortifications and siege engines.

The rules come with a scenario (The Battle of Grey Rock) for which colour counters are included in the magazine.

name: Charudes
description:
Risqué version of Charades. The fun is in the subject matter and probably best played by teenagers a and older.
As the box says, can you handle;
Free Willy (Movie)
Sexual Healing (Song)
Naked Gun (Movie)
and they get a lot more suggestive than that!
"Rude You Win, Prude You Lose"

name: Carr√© 2000
description:
The pieces are scattered at the start of all the squares except the finish squares. In corners only movement to adjacent squares is allowed. In central zones pieces may jump over each other with the exception of the four central squares that allow travel diagonally.

Player who moves all his game-pieces to his finish-corner is the winner.

Carré 2000 is available in two versions: the small version with nine pieces per player, and the larger version with twenty-five pieces per player.

name: Steel and Resolve: WW1 Naval Warfare
description:
"Steel and Resolve" is part of our Naval Warfare series of next generation comprehensive naval wargames covering entire time periods of naval combat. Easy to learn yet fun to play and detailed for the scale represented thus giving quality combat results. "Steel and Resolve" is designed to cover many of the major navies that fought during WW1 and includes submarines, seaplane carriers, aircraft, dreadnoughts, pre-dreadnoughts, battlecruisers, armored cruisers, light cruisers, destroyers, coastal batteries, land units, and much more! User printable data/record sheets show the combat details of each individual class of ship, sub, and aircraft, each with a side view graphic. Solitaire and multiplayer rules are included.

This is a significant revision of the original "NW:Naval Warfare" series, and adds additional details and rules to the system (including floatation loss and individualized weapon data). The Rules are modular, allowing for Basic, Advanced, and Optional/Expanded rules systems.

This game is professionally printed with mounted couters and full color heavy cardstock maps. The 'data cards' from the previous game series has been discarded in favor of user-printable data sheets on a CD-ROM included with the game; each sheet contains combat logs for up to 7 ships/subs or squadrons of aircraft.

Features include:


Countries included: Britain, Germany, France, Russia, Italy, and Austria-Hungary.



Detailed yet streamlined combat mechanics including basic, advanced, optional, and solitaire rules.



Data CD-ROM with fully printable data/record sheets covering 200 ship classes (including merchants, raiders, and transports), 36 aircraft/airship types, 30 submarine classes, 12 types of land units.



Each printable Data/Record Sheet contains the combat statistics for the unit, condensed combat tables to help during combat, a side view of the unit, with logs for ammunition/damage records for 7 ships/subs or aircraft squadrons pre-printed on each sheet.



60 page printed Rules Manual with 20 scenarios, including the full Battle of Jutland.



6 Color maps 11" x 17", a color combat matrix, and 280 die-cut 1/2" color counters.



Search Matrix, 2 Play Sequence charts and 5 color reference charts.



Includes 4 six-sided dice (only standard 6-sided die are used for play).



Semi-historical Campaigns covering the North, Baltic, and Mediterranean Seas.



Tactical and Operational battles covering surface combat, seaplane carriers, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, bombardments, etc...



Combat examples are included as well as condensed combat tables on each unit data/record sheet.



The game is intended to be played either as as a board game or with miniatures.

name: B.C.
description:
B.C. is a strategic tile laying game using elements of abstract strategy and deck building games to tell the story of four rival tribes battling it out for control of vital resources on the Pre-Historic earth of Leakey, Von-Daniken, and "Eegah!"

Each player takes control of one of four tribes: The Aliens, Great Apes, Homo Sapiens, or Neanderthals, and attempts to gain control of the largest part of the prehistoric landscape, as represented by a grid marked by variable terrain features. Each tribe begins with a small selection of Tiles, and then must spend further actions to place those Tiles and earn "Enlightenment Points", which can be spent on new tiles and new options for the game.

The game is over when there are no further plays left on the board. Victory goes to the Tribe whose player has taken control of the most sections of the board. In the case of a tie, victory is determined by the number of Enlightenment Points still controlled by the Tribes at the end of play.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Muz Hit: Le Jeu du top!
description:
A music trivia game (think Music-themed Trivia Pursuit)!

A diamond disc race ensues between players! They can be earned directly on the "Diamonds" boxes or exchanged for a 5 vinyl discs.

The questions are all in the form of multiple choice and offer 3 major categories: 'Reprises', "Artists' and 'screens and boards"

Each player has 2 pawns of the same colour, which go through the corridors of the plateau board, in an inward-spiraling player track. The questions trace the life of french and international hits in categories of Top 50, rap, rock, etc... from 1984 to present day.

name: R.I.G.S.
description:
OverviewR.I.G.S. has players acting as newly appointed future captains of industry on a newly colonized world. Within a set period of a time, they must generate, trade, and gather as much wealth as possible with the holder of the most wealth being the controller of industry for this colony. This won't be a trivial task. The world experiences strange weather, pirates and gangs loot, and other players get revenge for your own actions against them (or just simply doing better than they are). Technology isn't exactly your friend as the cranky and failure prone (Reconfigurable Industrial Gathering Systems) RIGS will produce but with the risk of spontaneously blowing up. Unfortunately, they are the key tools for industry... and the only one available.

Players are grant plots of land, survey the land for Luxuries (the only thing the rest of the universe wants), place RIGS on plots, and hope for the best as Disaster and other players strike. Weather the disasters that affect your production, resources, and RIGS. Manage to produce not only Luxuries, but other needed Energy, Metal, Supply resources to keep your operation running and growing. Then, sell the Luxuries on the ever-changing market. Make deals with other players for simple trades or pacts against other players. In the end, final value of all resources a player has (except RIGS... no one wants those troublesome things) is determined. The player with the greatest wealth wins.



ContentsContent Checklist
Rule Book



DecksPlot Deck: 27 cards
Survey Deck: 27 cards
Karma Deck: 36 cards
Market Deck: 32 cards
Disaster Deck: 18 cards



TokensEnergy Tokens x 50
Metal Tokens x 50
Supply Tokens x 50
Luxury Tokens x 50
RIGS Tokens x 75



Money1 Credit Bill x 40
5 Credit Bill x 40
10 Credit Bill x 40
20 Credit Bill x 40
50 Credit Bill x 20
100 Credit Bill x 20



Vinnie (Loan) ScriptEnergy Vinnie Script x 20
Supply Vinnie Script x 20
Metal Vinnie Script x 20



OtherSix-sided die
categories: Card Game, Economic, Humor, Negotiation, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Tibbar's Big N Little
description:
The Game of Little n Big!

Move the Slider Tiles to try to discover a Little Baby Tile that matches one of your Big Mommy Tiles. Reunite the most Big N Little pairs to win the game!

The box is a crucial part of the game setup. There is a tray which fits in the box, and the 25 Little Baby Tiles are placed randomly on the tray. A plastic punchout overlay sits on these tiles, and 24 slider tiles are placed on this with one space open. This will give you something similar to a Sliding Puzzle.

Players each have 3 face-up Big Mommy Tiles. On your turn, choose one of your face-up tiles and announce that you're looking for its associated Little Baby Tile. You get up to 5 slide-moves to try to find it. A slide-move consists of moving an adjacent Slider Tile into the open space. This will uncover a different Little Baby Tile where the tile used to be. You may continue sliding tiles until you either find the match for the Big Mommy Tile you named, or you have moved five Slider Tiles.

Tiles match if they have a Mommy and Baby of the same animal (the game rules includes pictures of all the matching sets). They also will have the upper and lower case versions of the same letter. If you uncover a match on your turn, take a "MATCH" Scoring Token and cover the Big Mommy Tile. Draw a new tile so you always have three face-up tiles.

After the last Big Mommy Tile is drawn, continue playing until the next MATCH is scored. The game ends immediately, and the player with the most matches wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Concept of Big & Small, Upper & Lower Case Recognition, Memory & Matching

name: Fluchmory
description:
Fluchmory, an auditory memory game, is played with 24 cards and 24 tiles, which come in pairs. On each pair, a proverb is printed (both on the card and on the tile).

At the start of the game, the tiles placed face-down on the table in a grid, and the cards are shuffled placed face-down in a stack. The first player draws the first card and reads its text out loud. Now, the players take turns picking up one tile (without showing it to the other players) and reading the text out loud. If the player has found the tile matching the card, he keeps the tile, and the next card is read. Otherwise, the tile is returned to its spot on the table, face-down.

The game ends when all tiles have been claimed. The player who has collected the most tiles wins.

name: Miniature Golf Game
description:
Play golf on the mini table and get Your balls in the holes with smallest number of kicks.

Contents:

1 Plastic pool table
1 Plastic pool ball rack
1 Metal golf club
2 White weighted golf balls

name: Mulligan Madness
description: Each player (or team) tries to answer as many questions as possible, in order to be the first to advance from the start and around the playing board back to finish. The first player to do this is the winner of the game.

name: The Global Business
description: Monopoly-like game produced for the Indian market. Includes an additional four games: Car Rally, Snakes & Ladders, Ludo, and Cricket. Properties are Indian locations and prices are in rupees.
mechanics: Market, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dirty Dice
description:
Dirty Dice is a Dice-Within-A-Dice game for gambler lovers! There are 4 types of ways to play Dirty Dice:
Blanket Craps
Twenty-One
Dirty Casino Craps
Upsmanship

"Twenty-One" - Players takes turn with both dice. Each player gets one roll per turn and every roll produces a score.
2 "outer dice" totals count as "plus" score. 2 "inner dice" totals as "minus" score. So the "inner dice" must substract from the total of "outer dice". The object of the game is to accumulate a score of "21" first. Either +21 or -21.

For Craps variants look at the game Craps

name: Zouave II
description:
Miniature Wargame Rules for Warfare in the Age of Transition 1861-1871

Zouave 2 is a revised version of Zouave, a member of the Repique System, and the latest miniatures rule set by Bob Jones of Piquet fame.

Unlike Zouave, Zouave 2 uses a rondel system for command control.

The game offers command level and grand tactical options, for 6mm to 28mm miniatures.

The period covers the ACW, but also the Franco Prussian War, 1866 and the Maximilian Adventure.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Rondel, Simulation

name: East Asia: Tang Dynasty and Korea
description:
Web Wargame for 2 to 5 players. The game is a little wargame about the ancient war in East Asia. Players play Tang, Japan, Goguryeo, Baekje and Silla with 1 map and 21 counters. If Tang wins if it captures Korea and destroys all enemies before the fifth expedition, otherwise the other sides win! Players may move, attack, recruit during the game.

As we know, Sui Dynasty had attacked Korea, but failed. Later, the Tang Dynasty attacked Korea five times and occupied it. During the war, China, Japan, and Korea's various forces had appeared. It is east Asia's great war!

name: Sandcastles
description:
It's a beautiful day at the beach and the lifegaurds just announced a Sandcastle Building Contest. This isn't your typical "who can build the greatest sandcastle", this is a race to see who can build their castle the fastest.

Sandcastles is played with 6 special beach dice. During a players turn they roll their die a total of 3 times to try an get various combinations. Different combinations lets the player build sections of their sandcastles by placing cardboard tiles. But watch out for rogue waves and your opponents "accidently" stepping on you castle.

A simple game of lucky with a touch of strategy built in. For ages 6 and up.

Sandcastles was designed for 2 players, but does include rules for 3 and 4 players, and two different solo games.

name: Pick-Up Pizzas
description:
Pick-Up Pizzas comes with nine mini-pizzas which fit into the round openings on the "jumbo pizza" playing board. The game also comes with two pizza delivery persons. Vinnie with a green cap and Bella with an orange cap. All the mini-pizzas and both delivery persons contain magnets.

Because magnets have polarity, five of the mini-pizzas can ONLY be picked up by Vinnie. Four of the pizzas can ONLY be picked up by Bella. Can you help Vinnie and Bella figure out which pizzas to pick up? Be the first to deliver three pizzas, and win. Hurry! The pizzas are getting cold!

name: Zero-Sum
description:
Zero-Sum is an abstract strategy, tile-laying, area control game for 2, played with dominoes and chips.

Players take turns laying down dominoes and manipulating the playing surface to gain points by the end of their 13th turn. The player with the highest score wins. But that would be too simple... too bland. So to change things up, every turn you give your opponent points as you're giving yourself points. Strategy reigns supreme here.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: H√∂rt! H√∂rt!
description:
In Hört! Hört! (Hear! Hear!)

A board showing several objects is placed on the table. (The game comes with various different boards.)

Then, the board is covered, and a card is drawn which names all of these objects but one. This card is read out loud, and the players have to name the object that was missing. The first player to give the right answer keeps the card, and the next card is drawn.

After all cards have been given out, the player who collected the most cards wins the game.

name: Wir reisen mit Karl May -Durch die W√ºste-
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first to reach field no 110

Simple 'Roll and Move' game
based on the book/story of 'Karl May',
well known German novelist;
Schmidt aquired rights to republish Game 1950 -
2nd edition is equipped with 6 cute pewter figures.

name: Schwarzwald-Reise
description:
Object of the game:
Be the first arriving at field 34

Simple 'Roll and Move' game, learning the cities & places of interest of the Black Forest.
Equipped with large plastic pawns, die and playing board.
traditional Black Forest dress
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: F√ºnf Tierfreunde
description:
Fünf Tierfreunde (Five Animal Friends) is a memory game.

The game is played with 25 tiles. Each tile shows one of five baby animals: a foal, a piglet, a kitten, a baby dog and a baby goat. At the beginning of the game, these tiles are arranged in a 5x5 grid. On your turn, you roll two dice, which show the five animals and a question mark. You then have to turn over two adjacent tiles that show the animals shown on the dice. If you roll a question mark, you may choose what animal you will turn over. If you turn over a correct pair, you gain a friends token. The tiles are turned facedown again, and are covered with a cloud token. Until another successful pair has been turned over, the two covered tiles cannot be used again.

You win the game when you have collected four, five or seven friends tokens(depending on the number of players).

name: Dial
description:
Players try to complete as many telephone calls as possible for the highest score.

Themed around the exchange telephone numbering system once utilized in the United States, players spin for exchanges or draw numbers to add them to calls. Each exchange can only be called once in the game; once all numbers have been drawn, the game is over.

name: Auf Autostrassen durch Europa
description:
Objective: Be the first to reach Berlin

equipment: 6 coloured cars, 35 (city) cards, 2 dice, large board with 35 (numbered) cities,
rules inside cover

Simple 'Roll and Move' game:
Each player starts in Berlin, drawing (city) cards to determine his route

Note: 1st edition (before WW II) differs from 2nd edition (after WW II) ==> see images
because of the success of the game it was reedited after WW II
without borders and - of course - expensive tin cars
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ovalette
description:
A cricket game "First-Class cricket in your home". The publisher goes on to say that it is hard to imagine a more thrilling game on your table.
The board is "gaily coloured" and represents the Kensington Oval, a revered cricket ground in South London.
The fielding team player can place his fielders on different locations on the board, hopefully to stop runs. The bowling and batting seems to be decided by card play (but it could be as simple as draw a card, read the result, i.e. no skill). Unfortunately, I only have a magazine advert to go by as this game is unknown in the British collecting circle.

name: Kings Plate: Card Game ‚Äì Series II
description:
In Kings Plate, based on the traditional Japanese chess game Shogi, the player's goal is to checkmate the opponent's king.

To do this, you must use the various units in your army, with each unit having different abilities in terms of movement and special actions. Players can create their own armies from the cards included in the game, thus forcing them (and their opponents) to rethink their strategy each game.

Kings Plate: Card Game - Series II includes a king for each player and a variety of army units, including powerful monsters like devils, unicorns, dragons and angels. These cards include suits and ranks as in a regular deck of cards, and they can be mixed with the other series in the Kings Plate family.

name: Kings Plate: Card Game ‚Äì Series III
description:
In Kings Plate, based on the traditional Japanese chess game Shogi, the player's goal is to checkmate the opponent's king.

To do this, you must use the various units in your army, with each unit having different abilities in terms of movement and special actions. Players can create their own armies from the cards included in the game, thus forcing them (and their opponents) to rethink their strategy each game.

Kings Plate: Card Game - Series III includes a king for each player and a variety of army units, including the strongest monsters yet and advanced human units. These cards include suits and ranks as in a regular deck of cards, and they can be mixed with the other series in the Kings Plate family.

name: Das Geheimnis von Trelleborg
description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.





In order to quell the civil unrest in Nordland, King Harald Blauzahn orders his son Sven Gabelbart to build a castle: Trelleborg. However, as soon as the work on the first houses commences, there is already evidence of sabotage. It seems some of Forkbeard's own people are involved, but no saboteur has been caught. This places a double burden on the people: to build the castle and to uncover Trelleborg's secret!In Das Geheimnis von Trelleborg, players gain investigation points by investigating the secret. However, it is just as important to gain construction points by aiding in the construction of the castle and loyalty points by supporting life in the village.

When the Stone Circle has been completed, the player who can contribute most to the construction of the castle wins.

name: Handmade Wars
description:
Handmade Wars is a strategy war game. It consists of electronic pdf files, which the user before the first play, has to print and cut the necessary pieces out. The game emulates the development of an empire, by building villages, gathering resources and in the end constructing military camps and units to conquer the enemy.

The players in the beggining have only their capital city and some resources. They have to build worker villages next to the field's resource blocks to generate more resources each turn, needed to build more buildings. Specific buildings allow military units to be produced (which also cost resources). The military units can attack the enemy's units or buildings, with a dice rolling battle system.

The winner is the player who manages to destroy the enemy's capital city!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Ohne halt Kameradschaft voran!
description:
Objective: Be the first finishing the game circuit twice (field 50); 2nd goal: Your team (2 players) should be the first

Each team chooses a car with the same colour white/red/dark blue/yellow. Determine sequence of players - use only one die to move your car.

First round: only red fields 'create' events

Second round: only blue fields 'create' events

Due to mechanics of 'event orders' it is recommendable to help
your 'stranded' partner.

The design of the cars is - of course - suitable, the painting of the board very detailed and cute.

Remark of the publisher: More than 6 players can participate - you have to buy additional cars
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of Stock Car Race
description:
User Summary

This is a relatively simple title in which players advance race cars on a track by spinning a spinner. Each space on the spinner has two colors with associated numbers. When the spinner lands on a spot, both cars with the appropriate color move the number of spaces indicated. (For example: There's a spinner spot that shows a yellow 5 and a blue 3. When the spinner lands on this spot, the Yellow Car moves five spaces, and the Blue Car moves three.

Cars may change lanes if they have an unoccupied spot to move to. (A car that is boxed in my even move backwards to get free.) If two cars "collide" by occupying the same space, then the car that initiated the collusion is penalized two laps, and the car that got hit, one lap.

The number of laps is determined by player agreement at the beginning of the game.

Game includes a board, four plastic cards, and an insert with a spinner and a series of peg holes to track the laps. (Some plastic pegs are also included.)

There is no indication of copyright year on the box, but based on other similar titles by the same publisher, it was probably produced in the 1960s.

name: A.R.P.
description:
Abstract patriotic game, made at the start of WWII and trying to appeal mainly to young boys. Each player places his planes (pieces) in one corner, if a 4 player game, or in two corners if a 2 player game. Movement is one square at a time, with the objective to be the first to get all your planes first to the opposite side of the board. The gun placements in the middle of the board are out of bounds for the planes. If an enemy plane is next to one of your planes, you may fly over it, but, note, no planes are ever captured.
The game has been inspired by Chinese Chequers.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, World War II

name: Race-O-Rama Game Chest
description:
User Summary

This title includes 4 "Exciting" race games Grand Pree Road Race, Demolition Derby, Drag Race Championships, & The 500 Mile Race. These games share some of the same components, but each game has a unique board, and two of the games have card decks just for them. It appears that none of these games were ever produced separately. All games may be played solo, or with a number of other players based on the game.

Grand Pree Road Race

Players use cars 1 through 12 and move the their cars around a game board track as instructed by a spinner and by use of a deck of cards that comes with the game. Special rules govern how many cars may occupy a space, and which car(s) get to move in the event of too may cars heading toward the same space. First player to pass the finish line wins.

Demolition Derby

Up to 30 cars may be included, although 10 players seems to me the suggested maximum. (This allows each player to control three cars.) Game is played on the Demolition Derby board which features some Safe spots where cars may not be hit.

Cars move by means of a spinner (numbered 1 to 30) to determine which car is moved and a special deck of cards which determines distance and direction of movement. (Some cards allow for a choice about direction.) Since there is a set turn order, a player may end up moving an opponent's car.

When a car passes onto or over another car, the stationary car takes a Hit. Cars that take three Hits are eliminated from the game and removed from play. A wipe-off scoreboard with a crayon and a felt eraser are included to keep track of Hits. Play continues until only one car remains.

Drag Race Championships

Again all 30 cars are used. The game uses the Drag Race board. Before play begins, the 1-30 spinner is used to determine which cars are in which Heats. Play progresses by using the 1-12 spinner which shows which color car is moved, along with the roll of a single die to determine distance. One car advances from each of the 6 Heats. A final round is played to determine the Champion.

The 500 Mile Race

This game is played on the box insert which shows an oval track with various Sequence Tables printed in the center. Game may be played with up to 30 players, each controlling an individual car. The game starts with the Sequence Marker on Sequence Table "A". Two dice are rolled and the numbers are added together. (The Sequence Table contains results from 2 to 12.) The result of the Sequence Table tells which cars may be moved... these cars are all advanced 3 spaces on the track. In the next turn the Sequence Marker is advanced and Sequence Table "B" is used. The Sequence Marker moves each turn, and goes back to Table A again if the game last long enough. Some Sequence Table results show hazards like Crash, Pit Stop, etc. The 1-30 spinner is used to determine which car is affected.

Four cars abreast stop cars behind them from advancing. However, there are a couple of spots on the board where cars are considered to crash if there are ever four cars on them. (This cuts down on the amount of log jams in a really crowded game.) Play continues until a car crosses the finish line. In the event of a tie, play continues until one car advances ahead of another.

The (many) game elements for this title include: one double-sided rules sheet, 30 die-cut pressboard cars, a sequence marker, a double-sided game board (with the Grand Pree race board on one side, and the Demolition Derby and Drag Race boards on the other), a wipe-off scoreboard (for Demolition Derby), a crayon & felt eraser, a 1-30 spinner, a 1-12 spinner, two 6-sided dice, a deck of 20 cards with an image of a tire on the back (for Grand Pree Road Race), & a deck of 20 cards with checkered flags on the back (for Demolition Derby).

No publication date is included with this title.
publishers: Warren Built Rite Games, Warren Paper Products Co.

name: Autorennen wie noch nie
description:
Objective: Be the first to finish

'Roll and Move' game with some modifications.
Of course, there are some fields to accelerate or decelerate your car (your bride is waiting for you, you have to make a phone call...), but using your three dice ==> only '1' and '5' are giving you the speed you need. It's up to your choice - if you gain a 1 or 5, to roll the remaining 2 dice again for all or nothing (early 'Can't Stop).

Remarks:
Due to (sometimes) small changes it's very difficult to track versions and define the publishing date of the first edition;
there are (at least) 3 different Gräfe editions and from 1970 the Spika one; if you check the boards you can detect a (confused?) numbering system - see images.
Some Sellers (e.g. on ebay) declare a publishing date mid 1935, but to my knowlegde those 'Bikini maids', printed on the early edition were not permitted/accepted by National Socialists. But even more confusing - one auction shows hand written notes (to replace (lost) rules) in Sütterlin writing.
- feedback is highly appreciated -

name: Buchstabengitter
description:
Buchstabengitter is a word-searching game.

The game comes with 160 different word search puzzles, like the ones that appear in the newspaper. However, players will search for words simultaneously. Each round, a die is rolled, which indicates how many words must be found. Then, that number of cards is drawn; there is a word on each card.

Now, the players have to search for the words in the puzzle and mark them on their sheet. The round ends when a player has found all the words. Then, each player gains one point for each word found. The player that has gained the most points after four rounds wins the game.

The puzzles do not only contain each German word, but also the English translation, which makes it possible to use this game to learn English.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Notch
description: Notch - A Tumbledum dice game from REMCO from 1955. This is a very simple game where you turn a tumbler over. That tumbler has dice in it which results in your roll for the turn. You can land on various spaces on a board (that board is actually a rolled up piece of plastic that has to be opened and flattened before you can play) There are go back spaces and there are GET NOTCHES spaces for capturing outlaws. When you reach the finish space the one with the most notches wins the game.

name: Call Up Put Down
description:
Call Up Put Down is a boardgame from Trading Pursuits Pty Ltd, a trading education company.

The objective of the game is to earn $1,000,000 from trading options. They begin with a starting capital (usually $10,000), and then make decisions whether to buy / sell Call options or Put options based on the charts viewed on the DVD.

The DVD contains 50 sets of charts, and only one chart is viewed at a time (by selecting a card that contains numbers 1 to 50 at random). The players make their decisions, and then moves to the next screen of the trade by using the DVD controls. When it reaches the last day to trade, all players must sell their options, and compute the final balance, which is recorded on the Trading Diary.

The board contains a track showing amounts from $0 to $1,000,000, and player's tokens move forward or back on the track depending on their balance. The first player who reaches $1,000,000 wins.

Components:
- 1 board with a dollar-sign track
- 6 tokens
- trading diary pads to record trades
- calculation pads to record stop-loss and profit targets
- strategy cards depicting signals when to buy/sell call/put options
- 2 DVDs (an Options informative DVD and a Trades DVD)
- game manual
- pencils
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simulation, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Dan Dare's Race in Space
description:
This is a simple roll and move game. If you land on an orange square you must obey the instructions. The best squares allow you to take shortcuts. The first to get to the end of the track, wins.

Dan Dare was a hero from boy's comics, making his debut in the Eagle comic in 1950. He was drawn by Frank Hampson. The character was an immediate hit and there was even a weekly serial transmitted on Radio Luxembourg.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mickey Mouse Quoits
description: An indoor quoits game. You thow your rings, with the aim of getting them to settle on to a hook and you score points for every success. The first to reach a pre-set number of points, wins. Or, it can be ended after a pre-set time limit and then the player with the most points, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dan Dare Shooting Game
description:
Dan Dare Shooting game by Chad Valley is a target game with the board featuring several aliens advancing. The gun, is a spring loaded Pop gun with corks. Object of the game is to be the first to knock out the alien targets.

During the early 1950's the Comic Hero Dan Dare spurred several similar target games that can easily be confused. Featured on this link is Chad Valley's version with the simple title "Dan Dare Shooting" game. Chad Valley also produced another Target Game called "Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus".

Listed elsewhere on BGG is a Dan Dare Target game by the company Glevum with a very similar title called "Dan Dare Space Shooting".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Glevum Games

name: So You Want to Teach?
description:
So You Want to Teach is a card driven game for two to four players on the issues and events many beginning teachers must deal with in the course of becoming a professional educator. The game is meant to serve as an entertaining vehicle by which students and practitioners in education can discuss and evaluate issues, trends, as well as their individual motivations, in K-12 education.

Each “turn” players deal five cards and then take turns drawing a card from those that remain. The drawn card’s Event is revealed/ read aloud to the others after which players can bid for the event by playing cards from their deck. The winner of the bidding will then take procession of the card, adding it to their “Portfolio”. A card that is not claimed will go into the discard pile. Instead of drawing a card a player can also “Pass” and exchange any or all of the cards in their hand for new cards from the deck, or to “cash in” the point values of their cards to advance their “Epistemology, Axiology or Political” track markers. Players can also exchange cards in their deck for “Mentor” cards that can be used for various game functions.

The goal of each player is to acquire a portfolio of Challenge and Opportunity event cards, as well as a number of sufficient Axiology, Epistemology and Political points to pass the Praxis III (professional licensing) exam and win the game. It is possible for all, some or none of the players to win the game by the last turn.

So you want to teach? Learn, discover, reflect, and enjoy!

Graphics by Bruce Yearian.

Components:

84 playing cards
4 player aid sheets
24 markers
4 pages of rules

name: Vicious City
description:
Los Angeles, 10th of August 1953. A ceiling fan rotates awkwardly, slowly pushing stale air around an ill lit office. Near a darkened window a lonely detective sits in a rickety old chair, feet on a desk, reading a police report. A couple of filing cabinets, a coat rack with a fedora, a bottle of bourbon and an ashtray overflowing with cigarette butts complete the scene. "Someone needs to get to the bottom of this case, it sure as hell won't solve itself!"

Vicious City is a narrative deduction game for 2-5 investigators. A crime has been committed and the players are tasked with solving the case, attempting to gain a conviction against one guilty suspect whilst ensuring another suspect, who they know is innocent, is absolved.

When the last evidence token is drawn from the bag the current round is completed and the case is resolved. Players are awarded victory points based on the outcome of the case and the player who scores the highest victory point total wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: GBO Hawai'i
description:
Produced by www.GreenBusinessOwner.com, this game makes sustainability come to life in a fun, interactive way. Players are investors looking to make more than just financial returns by helping local entrepreneurs in Hawai'i develop sustainability-oriented businesses like organic farms, geothermal plants, green building companies, solar installers, and bike shops. The game is ideal for those who are interested in sustainability as a better way to do business, and can be played by 2-4 players ages 13+. It's also a great learning tool, and the parent company has produced free downloadable lesson planning materials for teachers! Check out www.GBOHawaii.com for more info on that.

The game consists of a beautiful board with the map of Hawai'i, several decks of playing cards used in the game, a green business property deck of businesses you can invest in, dice, player pieces, and a stack of money.

The game is set in Hawai'i, and players act as impact investors. Their goal is to start businesses that have a triple bottom line effect: make money, create good paying green jobs, and deal with three main environmental challenges of energy, food, and waste. To establish businesses, players must obtain certain resources like human resources (entrepreneurs, green collar workers, and the wild card--green MBA's). Some businesses require permits, mostly for larger developments and energy projects, and it's a humorous twist on permitting processes in local governments--full of possibilities and potential frustrations. Players must also navigate public policy and chance events that may or may not be helpful in achieving the goal of a sustainable economy in Hawai'i.

The player with the best Triple Bottom Line (people, planet, profit) score wins the game!

name: Hallo-Nicki!
description:
Objective: To earn the most shillings.

From TV series early 60's 'Nicki' (known as Noddy elsewhere)
it's a simple 'Roll and Move' game
Even some sources name 4 players only - 6 children may participate.
In the English edition there are only four car playing pieces.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jumbled Proverbs
description:
Party game. Guests are each given a card with a jumbled up proverb on it. Durind the party they can show each other their card, and if they know the correct answer, they fill in their record sheet. The person with the most right in the shortest time, wins.

Part of the publisher's 'Dainty' Series of Evening Party Games

name: Tell-Tale Tracks
description:
A clever party game. Each guest is given a card and all guests are encouraged to show each other their cards whilst chatting. If you know the answer, you write it on your record sheet. The guest who gets the most correct answers in the shortest time, wins.

It is clever because you only have the images of tracks (footprints and the like) to go on and some are quite subtle.

name: Auf der Eisenbahn
description:
Objective: first on target

Simple 'Roll and Move' game with cute meeples, based 'GDR rules' for educational purposes. Nice drawings

name: Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game
description:
Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game - an action-packed game of survival and Zombie combat.

Can your band of survivors escape the Zombie-infested village of Endicott before the town falls victim to an eradicating nuclear purge? Or will you become infected by the Undead and turn on your allies? The possibilities are endless in a game that utilizes randomization and custom structure mechanics that immerse players in a completely fresh scenario with every new round of play.

Based on the ENDICOTT EPIDEMIC multi-media series created by filmmaker and author Douglas Harvey, Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game is the first full board game that accompanies the Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion card game. While Infectious Contagion was the condensed, "lite" version of the main game, EE:TBG is an epic battle for survival that offers all of the insane mechanics and suspenseful buildup to destruction that the card game couldn't bring to the table (literally).

Utilizing game boards acting as maps based on primary areas of the Endicott Epidemic story (with fully functional expansion "connections" to mix and match your favorite ares as the game expands), players will drop their chosen characters (each with their own unique abilities that can be used strategically) into the heart of the epidemic and begin battling the Undead using classic roll-and-move mechanics as well as a series of unique "Intrique" cubes that modify gameplay with every roll. A deck of Inquest cards act as side-missions that can be ignored or completed to gain resources used to fight and survive, or to gain special tokens that can be used in many different combinations to unlock new areas of play as the game progresses.

Combat is as simple as choosing your weapon (or brawling unarmed, if you so choose) and rolling the Combat Cubes. Each face of each cube means a different value, giving you numerous combinations of attack to dish out against your chosen enemy. But while rolling the cubes is the simple part, bear in mind that your enemies can (and most of the time *will*) fight back or dodge your attack entirely. Strategize your plan of action before engaging the enemy to give you the best course through the hordes of Undead. Or, if you think you have the stealth abilities to do so, roll the dice to try to evade the groups of enemies and slip through unnoticed and live to fight another turn.

But beware - hidden with the game's deck of cards lay numerous deadly obstacles ranging from stronger than average 'Boss' Zombies, Black Ops agents, and even a handful of mutant Hazard Zombies, which spread MBI's toxic plume everywhere they go. Once these villains begin to appear, the spreading plume is something the Survivors must be extremely wary of. Plume markers begin to build in each area and once they reach their critical mass, deadly chain reactions are caused that could potentially wipe out every living thing on the board. The biggest and most brutal enemy within the deck, however, is the Countdown - eight cards that constantly remind players of the impending nuclear purge. Once the eighth and final card is drawn, the game is over - regardless of whether or not the survivors have completed their mission to find the Hermit, his critical intel, and his escape route.

With all of the chaos going on as each Survivor makes their way through the town to complete their mission, the gameplay could get a little too intense for some people's liking. Endicott Epidemic: The Board Game utilizes a completely customizable experience so that players can create the best scenario that is tailored to how they want to enjoy their game. Removing certain aspects of the game like Hazard Zombies or Plume counters can greatly reduce the amount of suspenseful buildup that could turn players off from a game that could potentially be nearly impossible to win. Inventory management and play deck building are also ways a group of players can ease the difficulty and ensure that the game, if played with all the right moves and strategic plans, can indeed be won without laying at the mercy of the Countdown or the roll of a die.

The board game, at its core, is designed for 2-8 players. However, like Infectious Contagion, the board game also allows a single player to enjoy the game experience as the lone survivor of Endicott’s shift from living to undead. Other game modes include a point-based Survivor mode that removes the Countdown and many other aspects of the game to allow players (or factions/teams of players) to battle waves of Undead, tallying up points at the end of each round and crowning a winner after a set amount of battles. Or, players (or teams) can simply battle each other without the inclusion of Zombies (but with a Countdown) in a vastly customizable VS mode.

A ticking time-bomb's clock, swarms of Undead that will chain themselves together to create deadly hordes, an ever-spreading toxic plume beneath your feet, stealthy Black Ops agents that mark you for execution when you fall within their sights, a limited number of resources that must be used in conjunction with an even more limited inventory system, a constant surge of adrenaline with every roll of the Intrigue cubes, making allies with your fellow Survivors only to find your group surrounded by Zombies with only two bullets and a grenade...all of this and more is what builds your game up from a simple beginning to an all-out epic battle for survival. Think you can handle it?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Number Please
description:
Party Game. Guests are given a card. During the evening, you will be given clues by other guests as to the telephone number you are trying to find. The first guest to guess their telephone number correctly, wins
(By the way, in the 50's you didn't just have a number, you have a place-name that comes before the number e.g. Maida Vale 1234 would be a possible number).

name: Playmates
description:
Children's party game.
Each child is given an answer sheet and must try to find out the ages of the other guests. This encourages social skills as you probe for answers. The first to complete their record sheet, wins.

name: Split Wits
description:
Two party games in one box.
The first. Each guest gets half a head picture and must find their other half to make a complete head. First to do so, wins
The second. Each guest is given a card with a word on it. They must then find another guest's word that will form a correct longer word when you link the two words together. First to do so, wins.

name: War Planes A Card Game for Aircraft Spotters
description:
A box of Second World War aircraft identification cards titled 'War Planes - A Card Game for Aircraft Spotters'. The game was a Quartet game but with the unusual difference that the sets were not equal. The thrifty government, at the outbreak of war, ensured that players could also use the cards for regular card games by taking out the extra suit of 13 cards.
The pack comprises of 67 cards organised as follows:
65 illustrated cards representing five different views each of thirteen British and German aircraft, and two 'Key' cards.

It was intended that Spotters, at airfields or on the roofs of London buildings, could practice recognising aircraft to improve their skills.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, World War II

name: Matchomino
description:
Contents: 90 square cards, cardboard stands, score pad & pencil

Each player receives 7 tiles. The remaining tiles form the face-down draw pile. One tile is turned face up, and the start player tries to match a tile from their hand to the face-up tile so that one edge matches. The next player then tries to match one or more edges etc. Black is a blocking colour and cannot be matched.

If a player manages to make a match, the score is the sum of the printed-on values of the tile they placed plus those of the tiles that this tile now is adjacent to. Some tiles have stars, these double the value of the edge that the edge showing the star is matched with.

If a player cannot match a tile on their turn, they draw another tile and game continues with the next player.

Once one player runs out of tiles, all other players get one more turn after which the values of their remaining tiles are deducted from their scores. Highest score wins.

name: Pitzelpatz Geburtstags-Party
