description: Its Pitzelpatz (a teddy bear) birthday! You want all 6 guests to come. For this 2 players each get a house and then try to use the colour die to pick the appropriately coloured guest. The first one to roll all 6 colours and thus get all 6 guests to his house wins.

name: Outlines
description: One player draws a card and describes the shown image to the other players who are simultaneously drawing what is described. The images are generally geometric shapes. After 1 minute the drawers judge their image against the original and receive 1 point if it matches. First player to 15 points wins.

name: Kasse-Gasse
description:
Kasse-Gasse is played with a deck of 36 cards and a die. Each card shows a word from which one letter is missing. The die shows six letters: b, d, g, k, p and t (the 'plosives').

At the start of the game, the cards are shuffled, and eight cards are drawn and placed on the table, face-up. Then, the die is rolled. All players now search for a word on one of the cards that can be completed with the letter rolled. The first player that finds such a card and pronounces the word correctly gets to keep the card.

Then, a new card is drawn and the next round starts. At the end of the game, the player who has collected the most cards wins.

name: Bournville Cocoa
description:
Cadbury placed this game into a children's Christmas annual, called Chick's Own, in 1952, as an advertisement for their hot cocoa drink.
Any number can play. Give each player a piece of paper and get them to write down Cadburys Bournville Cocoa on it.
The idea of the game is to collect all the letters that spell Cadburys Bournville Cocoa. Almost every square on the board has a letter, so if you arrive on a square you can tick off that letter from the name on your paper.
You need a 6 to start (of course!).
If you land on a square with special instructions, you must obey them.
The first player to tick off all their letters, wins. And the rules say you should get a steaming cup of lovely chocolately Bournville Cocoa.

name: The Last Edda
description:
The great World Tree is rotting...

The forces of Asgard and Vanaheim have turned against one another. The minions of Jotunheim and Svartalfheim have gone insane. Diseased, toxic creatures spew forth into Midgard, and the gods, once protectors of that land, have forsaken humankind in their blind rage against one another. Once their sacred protectorate, Midgard is now their battleground.

In The Last Edda, players take on the role of one of six Norse gods and do battle, taking control of the monstrosities pouring out of the tainted Yggdrasil, in order to defeat their rival.

The Last Edda blends the mechanics of player combat and deck building card games. Each turn, a player has the option of directing monsters from a common pool at his opponent, while his opponent has the opportunity to defend the attack by playing unit cards from his hand. The turn also provides an opportunity for players to buy cards from personal and common supplies, and construct buildings and artifacts that remain in play and help you to defend and attack more effectively.

Yggdrasil, the World Tree is rotting. The air grows colder and drier by the day. Murmurs of Fimbulvetr and Ragnarok can be heard across Midgard. Which of the gods is strong enough to survive the coming storm?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Race Thru Space
description: A game published by Ovaltine, presumeably a free giveaway to advertise their beverage. It is a simple roll and move game through the solar system.First to finish, wins.

name: Brer-Rabbit Ring a Bunny
description: The target for this Hoop-La type game is a rabbit with large ears, eating a carrot. Players take turns to try to throw their three wooden rings over the rabbit's ears. The player who has the most successes wins the game.

name: Tidley Skittles
description:
Early British game using Tiddlywinks' counters.
The board is placed in the centre of the table. On the board are placed a set of small wooden skittles. The object is to knock over skittles using your counters Tiddlywink fashion. If you do knock over a skittle, you score points depending on where it was standing.
The box image illustrates the game rather well

name: Auf zum Sachsenring
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (field 1)
‘Roll and Move’ game
Equipment: board, 6 meeples, 3 dice
1. Start positions are to be filled (use one die by turns – 3 turns max) – ‘1’ allows you to place your meeple onto the board
2. Race: use 3 dice - standard speed ÔÉ® 3; gaining a double ÔÉ® 6; a triple ÔÉ® 9. Per die-roll of a ‘6’ one additional space, so that a triple ‘6’ let you move 12 spaces forward
3. Events (brown marked) on the board may accelerate or decelerate or block you

Rules state that number of participants is not limited
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crickette
description:
Action game. The board consists of a length of baize, which is around 6 feet long. One player rolls a ball at the stumps (nice stumps and bails included)whilst the other player tries to hit the ball with his bat. The rules do not say how many runs are scored after the ball has been hit, you can decide for yourself.

The box suggests a date of around 1925 and it illustrates the game mechanic quite well. Note that the game is trying to appeal to adults (no children playing on the box image).

name: Formen und Farben
description:
Players roll the color-die and match game pieces in rolled color on their boards.

Player who finishes his picture first is the winner.

Contents:

4 player boards
24 game pieces punched out from the player boards with different colors and shapes
color die

name: Benjamin Bl√ºmchen: Karussellfahrt mit T√∂r√∂√∂√∂
description:
Rolling the special die players move around the carousel collecting chips for his tray tables. If the special symbol is rolled all the characters must enter and take a spin with the carousel.

Player who has collected all 4 type of chips first is the winner.

Contents:

A carousel (consisting of 2 parts)
4 tray tables
1 die
4-Benjamin game characters
16 chips (4 each in orange, red, yellow and blue)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Im Fluge durch die Welt
description:
Objective:
Start from NY around the world

Simple 'Roll and Move' game:
starting in NY, followed by South America, Africa, Europe, Asia and as traget back to NY city.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Benjamin Bl√ºmchen: Wer braucht was?
description:
With the help of Benjamin the Elephant children must match the pairs with different professions - one with the Benjamin in uniform and other with tools for this professions.

The smarter kid who finds out the most pairs is the winner.

Contents:

12 pairs of cards, each card consists of a pair of Benjamin Blümchen card and a picture card

name: Color-Combi
description:
Color-Combi is an abstract card placement game for 2-5 players. The game is comprised of 70 square cards, each containing a multi-colored cross, and five sets of colored tokens, representing up to five players. The game is housed in a cardboard box with color printed top and unprinted bottom. The box contains a plastic tray to hold the cards and the tokens.

Each player is dealt two cards, and the remaining cards form a draw pile. The first player draws a blind card and then lays one card from their hand face up on the table. Playing clockwise, each player takes a turn, drawing a card and playing a card on the table. Cards must be placed, edge to edge, so the colors match. Players must place a card if they are able, but rows of cards cannot exceed three cards in length.

The goal of the game is to create squares of cards and claim them with the colored tokens. Additionally, your can seize an existing square if you are able to replace one of the cards on the table with a card from your hand. The first player to claim four squares wins. There are additional rules for a points game.

name: Tricala
description:
Tricala is a two- to three-player Kalah game played on a triangular layout of twenty-one pits (six to an edge).

Players alternate placing stones in whatever pits they choose to set the board.

As with conventional Mancala games, a player's turn consists of "sowing" stones: all stones are picked up from any cup containing at least one stone of the player's color, then stones are redistributed one-by-one along a line of pits leading away from the source. Unlike most Mancala games, [1] there are between two and six sowing directions to choose (depending on the cup), and [2] the direction deflects when a board edge is reached. Sowing is extended ("re-sowed") if the last stone drops into a pit containing only the active player's stones.

Stones are captured when the last piece sowed lands in a pit containing an opponent's stone.

The game is won when a player captures nine stones or claims the majority in each corner pit.

name: Monster Mash
description:
Monster Mash is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where kids can buy designer monsters as pets and have them fight each other in a global sports league. The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of miniature monsters. Monster Mash gives players complete control over the creation of their monster. Players can create an existing monster from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is to beat any monsters that oppose you in the arena and win the match.

Monster Mash is a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle SystemTM game.

name: Buhu-Gespenster
description:
The little ghosts floating through the castle and look for their missing toys, who is first to find all of his favorite things is the winner.

Players roll the die and try to place colored and shaped game-pieces on their cards. If the game-piece doesn't fit on player's card he can keep it and use next round in exchange.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle

name: Benjamin Bl√ºmchen: als Zoodirektor
description:
Benjamin Blümchen must represent the zoo director to check and count that there are correct number of animals at zoo.

The cards with the animals are stacked and covered with the Benjamin Blümchen card. The 12 animals at the zoo are placed easily accessible for everyone in the middle. The player whose turn it is draws the top animal card and all players look at it.
The player who first recognizes which animal is missing or is too many, takes the animal figure from the table. Who gets the proper figure, receives the card. The beast goes back to the middle. If nobody got the right animal, the card goes out of play. When all cards are played, the child with the most cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game

name: TUGG 2
description: A "Tri-Level Game for Ages 7 to Adult" described on the side of the box as a "Fast Game of Fun and Strategy for Two". The board has some similarities to that of games in the Morris family, though piece placement is guided by die roll. The game's objective is to form sets of three pieces in a row, either via direct placement or via moving the pieces along lines on the board, with victory coming when a player reaches 16 points.

name: Eduard Vilde kaardim√§ng
description:
Cardgame made for Museum of Eduard Vilde.
Eduard Vilde was famous Estonian writer.(4th of March 1865 - 26th of December 1933).

There are 120 cards in this game: 60 green period-cards and 60 yellow creation-cards both in six time periods. There are questions on face-up and correct answer variant on face-down of the cards.
Cards are shuffled and put face-up stack in the middle of the table. Players/teams must answer the question of the top card in their turn and if the answer is correct they may keep this card. If this card is creation-card player/team must have also correct period-card to score a point.

Player/team who reach to prearranged score is the winner being "the most successful Eduard Vilde"

name: Benjamin Bl√ºmchen: Lernabenteuer Auf Weltreise
description: Benjamin Blümchen helps children learn more about our earth: the 6 continents, important monuments, people, animals, countries, and cultures. Depending on the game chosen, there are different ways to win, but always the flower forms must be placed correctly - this flower system allows control of the correct answers - the flowers only fit into one position.

name: Birds!
description:
From the Kickstarter description:

The game consists of two decks: the action cards and the event cards. The action cards make up your hand, and the event cards are played at the end of each each round in an attempt to "ghostify" your friends (a.k.a. kill them). Once a player has died, the game is not over for them! Players who die continue playing as ghosts, not able to win, but fully capable of messing with others.

The game is played in rounds. A round consists of players playing action cards, and a single player playing an event card at the end of the round. Players use action cards to draw extra cards or cause other players to discard in an attempt to favorably control the number of cards in players' hands, their own included. Events target players based on the number of cards in their hand, adding to the strategy elements of the the game. Some action cards also allow players to dodge events the main component of survival in the game.

The Kickstarter campaign failed to meet its funding goal on 27 November 2011.

name: Play By The Book
description:
An interactive literature-based game that uses ANY work of fiction.

The aim of the game is to get students talking and learning about literature.

Players move around a the illustrated game board, trying to reach THE END. Students travel ahead by correctly answering the reading comprehension questions on the game cards and by responding to each other's viewpoints. All types of learners are engaged through singing, acting, and drawing.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Postman Pat's Giant Picture Card Game
description: Over-sized cards for little fingers. 4 games featuring cards related to the TV favourite, Postman Pat. The games are as you would expect for a game aimed at very young children, Snap, Pairs; Memory; Happy Families.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Aerial Combat
description:
For its age, some quite clever ideas. Here are the important rules;

The game is intended for two players, one taking the 'planes' and the other the 'shells', both represented by discs.
The aim of the game is to get as many planes as possible through to the Objective. Each player moves in turn commencing with a Plane.
The Moves;
The discs move according to the number obtained by spinning the arrow. The exact number of places must be moved each time and only one disc for each move. Planes must be moved forward (never backward).
The red-circle shells move horizontal (sic) left or right only. The black-circle shell may move horizontal (left or right) or vertically (backwards or forwards) but not outside the green half of the board.
Shells can move only if the number of spaces to be moved brings the shell to a circle of the same colour as a plane in play.
Rules;
The planes' player moves any plane he chooses. He may try to reach his objective with one at a time or more if he so desires, but he must not forego a move if it is possible to move a plane the required space.
Shells may pass over planes but not over another shell.
Planes may pass over another plane or shell.
Losses;
A plane is hit (and thus out of the game) if it comes to a circle occupied by a shell or if a shell hits the plane. That is, if a shell is able to move to a circle occupied by a plane. A hit is also registered if a plane comes to one of the red circles in the yellow half of the board, provided the red line is connected with a circle of the same colour as the plane and this circle has a shell on it or a shell hits it before the plane moves on.
Now place the discs on the circles as marked taking care to put the black-circle shell on its appropriate circle.
If the arrow should stop dead on a dividing line, spin it again.

These rules make a little more sense when you look at the images. Note that it is never properly explained who wins. Does the planes' player win if he gets just one plane to the objective? Or more? I guess you need to make some 'house rules' before playing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: The Smurf Game
description:
The box top shows Smurfs riding logs which are floating down a river. The description from the inside game box: After a picnic in the woods, the Smurfs are on their way home. In order to get back to their village, they will travel along the stone path and take shortcuts by riding a log up the river. But watch out! The sneaky Gargamel is traveling up and down the river in search of Smurfs!

Each Smurf gets two log tokens. Using a spinner, player move Gargamel up and down a river. The Smurfs travel on a stone path, but can also travel up the river using a log token. Running into Gargamel while on the river causes the Smurf to be chased out of the river, losing the log token for the rest of the game and moving back to the nearest river crossing. First Smurf to finish wins.

Contents:

Smurf Gameboard
5 Smurf Characters
1 Spinner
8 Log Tokens
Die
Instructions on box lid.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Octino
description:
Easy to grasp high concept mind game (a math equivalent of Scrabble that is played like Domino).
It teaches/applies the four basic math operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) on various positive numbers. Future versions will contain also negative numbers, and fractional joiners (to form fraction numbers)

CONTENT:
Key game components are octagonal tiles with numbers in the center, equal signs, and half math operations between them (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division), decimal joiners, and tile holders.
Basic Edition contains: 33 Positive Tiles, 11 Joiners, and 2 Tile Holders.
Standard Edition contains: 66 Positive Tiles, 22 Joiners, and 4 Tile Holders.

GAME RULES:
Each player receives an equal number (6-10) of randomly selected octagonal tiles that he/she keeps hidden from other players on tile holders. The remaining tiles are kept in the bank face down.

One of the tiles from the bank is placed face up on the table. E.g. Tile no. 5 is placed on the table.

The first player makes a move by creating a math operation with his/her tiles by attaching them to the tile on the table. (E.g. The player that happen to have tiles 2 and 3 uses them to create the math operation 5-2=3)

The next player attaches his/her tiles to any number on the table creating his/her math operation. (E.g. The player that happen to have tiles 1, 4, and 7 may create the operation 14/7=2. (The double digit number 14 is created by placing joiner between 1 and 4).

The players take turns using up their tiles. The one who uses up all tiles first wins.

To prolong the game the players may take additional tile (or even 2 tiles) from the bank after each move

See. www.octino.com for more information

name: How's That
description:
Cricket game.
The board has 25 boxes, each marked with a number (runs) or an 'out' decision (Bowled, Stumped, etc.). A match consists of one innings by each player (longer games can be agreed at the start).
The first player to bat flips his 11 counters on to the board. If a counter is in a box with a number, it counts that many runs. If a counter lands in an 'out' box, then that counter is lost. After scoring runs, the same player flips again and the same procedure is followed. As wickets are taken, less and less counters are used, until you have no counters at all and the innings is over. Then the second player has his innings.
The player who scores the most runs, wins.

name: Sokker-Shy
description:
An action tabletop game. Very loosely connected to soccer.
At one end of the table you assemble a net and 5 hollow circles (called hoops). From the other end of the table, the players take turns to propel a ball towards the net, hoping to get it to settle in one of the hoops, thus scoring points. The propulsion of the balls is done by placing a ball into the bag provided and squeezing the bag so that the ball shoots out.

The box lid shows Dad and Son playing and is a good illustration of the game.

The winner is the one with the most points after a pre-agreed time.

name: Electroulette
description:
A simple gambling game. From around 1950, they obviously thought the kids would enjoy learning how to gamble because the box shows Mum, Dad, Gran and two young sons, all getting a thrill out of the 'race'.
The board is a large spinner with 6 numbers. It is connected to a battery and a set of 6 lights. There is also an area where you can place your bets. After all wagers are laid, the wheel is set spinning and as it does so, the bulbs will light up every time the relevant number passes a contact point. Eventually the wheel will stop and the last light bulb to be lit will remain lit and that is the number that pays out winning bets.
A game that seems devoid of skill.

name: Le Jeu de Sante
description:
Promotional game for Coca-Cola, published in French, in Canada.

A simple roll and move game along a track of 100 spaces. If you land on the special squares you must obey the instructions.

name: Dick Tracy Target Game
description: A shooting game. The gun shoots plastic 'bullets' with a sucker on the end. If you hit the target, your 'bullet' should stick to it. On the target board there are six scoring spots, where, if you hit inside one of them, you can score a number of points that range from 500 to 5,000.

name: The "Dinkie" Bowling Game
description:
This game was made by Spears in Bavaria around 1928-30. Sickeningly cute graphics.
Players roll balls at the doogie target and score either 2, 4 or 6 points for a successful bowl through one of the arches.
The one with the highest score after an agreed time, wins.

name: Infinite Power ECG: Gadget Archetype
description:
The Gadget Archetype adds the tricky and resourceful Gadget cards to the IP ECG game.

The Gadget Archetype is great at evading conditions and ridding itself of Limitations placed on it by others.

New cards include;
Experimental Blaster
Utility Belt
Med Bot
Inspiration
Power Failure
and many more!
3 each of 20 new cards, a fully playable deck!

Remember that all cards in the IP ECG are interchangeable and allow you to mix and match cards from different Archetypes to make the super you've always envisioned.
publishers: Bonsai Entertainment, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Numis
description:
Numis is a game that shows young people how money is made up. The object of the game is to be the first player to get one quarter (25 cent piece).

The game consists of the board, one custom die and 'fun money' modeled after Canadian coins. The board is illustrated with a stone pool, a barrel and a wheelbarrow. Each player starts the game with 3 pennies (1 cent) and 1 nickel (5 cents). The rest of the 'money' is placed in the stone pool. Rolling the die tells the player to either place the specified amount of 'money' in the stone pool or take the specified amount from the stone pool. Then the player must exchange their coins for a coin of larger value if they are able. To do this the player places their coins on the wheelbarrow and takes the coin of equivalent value from the stone pool and places it on the barrel. When all the players agree that the two amounts of money are equal, the player takes the coin from the barrel. The 'money' in the wheelbarrow goes into the stone pool. Play continues until one player has enough change to get a quarter.

name: Dis-Clue-Sure
description:
This board game has been developed by Employers Reinsurance Corporation to have fun in learning actions that may cause errors and omissions claims. Playing the game should harness the participants' spirit of competition, which is the lifeblood of the real estate brokerage business. - quote from the rules.

The object of the game is to reach closing of your listing and collect the most commission of any other player or team. This is accomplished by moving around the board and answering question cards. Correct answers gain money, incorrect answers cost money.

This is a teaching tool for real estate agents in game form.

name: Guardians of light
description:
Theme: Based on the motives of forest nightmares, Guardians of light are challenging and fun living card game, of combat skills, wisdom, adventure and fantasy played in battlefields of your minds where players desperately fight for their sanity.

Goal: To be first player to cross Dream road.

Mechanics: Each player takes 3 heroes that tries to cross the dream road as soon as possible. Dream road is made up of 5 cards, that is before him, set his teammate. The player whose heroes first cross dream road is the winner. There is no direct combat between players but there is plenty of strategy and impacts on opponents Heroes.

name: Val-Terra
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Enid Blyton's Journey Through Fairyland
description: Simple roll-and-move game. Players are one of the 'Adventurous Four' and compete to be the first to reach the end of the rainbow. Characters from Enid Blyton's stories help and hinder players' progress via 'Good Magic' and 'Bad Magic' cards along with special squares printed on the board.

name: Turbino
description:
Turbino is a spellbinding new blowing game. It's easy to blow the propeller into motion, but its not easy to control it to stop at a specific square. The game contains 2 picture circles with different degrees of difficulty.

The objective of the game is to blow the propeller and also stop it (You can't touch it!) so that the arrow points a picture You don't have already. Then You may put Your rubber ring next to this picture. Player who first gets his rubber rings next to
every picture on the cirle wins the game.

name: Astronaut, The New Game of Outer Space
description:
Space age card game designed by Truman Rothfus of Des Moines, Iowa, designed when space exploration was a 'brave new world'.
Played with 72 illustrated cards, with players contracting to build and launch rockets into orbit.
Collect cards to build your rocket's features and then try to launch it by playing alternative cards. Other cards allow you to raise funds, sabotage another player's cards and so on. The rocket cards are in three stages. When you have your chosen three cards, they can be laid end-to-end and you get a nice example of your rocket from the tail up to the cone.
Box proclaims "Exciting! Takes You from Base to Space!"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Exploration, Space Exploration

name: Motor Racing
description: Simple roll and move race game in the grand British tradition of such games. The track has certain spaces that can help or hinder movement and the instructions thereon must be obeyed.

name: The Little Ghost Game
description:
'An exciting game for boys and girls' says the box. The subject matter is probably related to the appeal of the comic book character Casper the Friendly Ghost without being an actual Casper linked game. Dates from the early 1960's.
A spinner regulates players' movement and also indicates which part of the house is being haunted. The board represents four floors of an old house, from the cellar to the attic.
Wooden pawns and a built-in spinner (next to the play-area of the board).

name: "Ole" Thousand Face
description:
Promotional game made by a chocolate manufacturer.
The game consists of five rectangular boxes, printed on all sides, that combine to make funny faces. Play consists of collecting the various components to make a face. Described as a parlour game, the game is in the grand tradition of British games like Mis-Fits and American games like Mixies.
The box was originally filled with chocolates.
The illustrator, Carey Orr, was employed by the Chicago Tribune as the creator of the Kernel Cootie comic strip.

name: Rocket Target
description:
A shooting game. Each player in turn fires darts at a target board, where there are 3 chances to score 25 points and three chances to score 75 points.

The Daisy Rocket Dart Pistol complete packaged set with darts and target could also be bought separately as a toy. Both gun and board made of metal.

name: Satellite Target Game
description:
Despite the name, this is more like a toy, although I guess you could take turns, say 12 tries each, and the player with the most 'hits' wins.
Battery operated, the target is a 'satellite' (a ball really) that is shot up into the air and the player must hit it with his gun that fires safe darts with rubber suckers on the end.
The shooting gallery with outer space scene, when assembled, stands 8 inches tall.
Game is complete with two satellites, a board, dart gun and darts
Game was retailed in America but was made in Japan, circa 1960

name: The Crocodile Game
description: A roll-and-move game about crossing an African river while avoiding hungry crocodiles. The box states that the game is "A playful introduction to the people and cultures of Africa." The sheet includes a folktale from the Baule tribe of Africa; players listen to the folktale and then play a game version of it.

name: Stjerne Quiz
description:
Title translated into English: "Star Quiz".
What do you really know about the most famous stars? Are the allegations true or false?

You may use your special knowledge about your favorite artists,
discover hidden aspects of the stars, or maybe you simply get fooled? In this game, you learn about the stars' amazing achievements and interesting lives.
The game is a different kind of quiz where the players simultanously guess if the allegations are true or false. The new twist is that you get two alligations each time you have to answer. You have six points cards that determine how far you can move. Do you dare to bet your best card on your choice? Here you have to think quickly and tactically!

The game is in Norwegian.

name: Court
description:
From Zillions of Games:

Court begins with each player having a force of twelve Peasants on the field. Each player has two Red Stones, two Blue Stones and an additional two Peasant in reserve.
Play consist of either moving a piece on the field or placing a piece from reserve on a Peasant to form a new piece.
Pieces move accordingly:
PEASANT - The Peasant moves to the forward empty cell, and captures diagonally forward (like the chess Pawn).

NOBLE - The Noble (a stack of Peasant and Blue Stone) moves and captures like the chess Knight.

CLERIC - The Cleric (a stack of Peasant and Red Stone) moves and captures like the chess Bishop.

BANKER - The Banker (a stack of two Peasants) moves and captures like the chess Rook.
Captured Red Stones and Blue Stones become the property of the attacker and may be played in subsequent turns. Captured Peasants are removed entirely from the game.
The game is lost by the player who has no Peasants on the field.

name: Fun with Sums
description:
Objective: Educational activity containing colourful picture cards to help the user with basic number skills.
Each of the 20 illustrated cards contains a number of exercises for the user to complete. The cards are numbered 1 - 20, each card being a little more difficult than the one before. The pictures on each card help to keep an interest and also provide a good starting point for conversation.
Game consists of a perforated base board, 20 calculation cards and 36 plastic number tiles.

If the calculation is done correctly the tiles will easily fit onto the appropriate square; the ‘snap’ of a correctly positioned number is actually pretty satisfying. A number in the wrong place will not fit (==> mistake proofing). Once a card has been completed the numbers are removed and another card selected.

On the base board all number tiles will fit into any position -
you can form any calculation up to 8 numbers.

name: Hearts of Oak
description:
A simple game of combat in the age of sail. Each player command from 1 to 4 ships against one or more adversaries.

Each box of HoO, or H2O tis italian nickname, includes 16 resin hexes 4' side to side that can be moved during the game to avoid players to play on the edge of the world and 2 copies of the 74 guns Castiglione, the first 74 guns of the Kingdom of Italy.

Starting rules are three pages long and the complete ones can be freely downloaded from camelot website but only if you want to use them for the H2O game and includes winds, different ammo, better rules for boarding parties, enfilade fire, critical hits, sand bar, reef, different class of ships and much more.

name: Jack and Jill Game
description:
Object is to be the first player to climb their hill and reach the well.
Players start at the bottom of their hill. They roll the colour die in their turn and move up to the next space with that colour. The player then spins the spinner. If the spinner points to a well, the player stays on that spot and play passes to the next player. If the spinner points to a bucket, the player goes back to the start and waits until their next turn. The winner is the first player to reach the well at the top of their hill and spin the spinner to point to the well.
A variation is included which use the number die. You roll this die and move up the hill the number of spaces indicated. Other rules remain the same.

name: Norfolk's Fine Food
description:
Promotional game for the Produced in Norfolk Collective.

Object is to be the first person or team to collect the ingredients for your meal and land on a cook square.
In their turn, a player rolls the die and move around the board. When you land on a square that you need for your meal, collect the matching food card from the map and place it on your shopping list board. If you land on a HAZARD square, you lose one card (return this to the map). If you don’t have a card to lose, you must move back 2 spaces. If you land on a BONUS square (Caley’s Chocolate or Kettle Chips) you are allowed to pick up one card that you need for your meal from anywhere on the map. If you land on a SOUPER square you can take any one food card away from an opponent, placing it back on the board. If this is a card you need, you can take it for your own meal. If you land on a JUMP square, you can jump to any other jump square on the board.
When you have all your food cards, you must land on a COOK square. When you do, your meal is cooked and you have won!
The winner is the first person or team who collects all the ingredients for their meal and cooks it.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: There Was an Old Lady
description:
Contents
4 old lady playing boards, 28 animal picture cards, 1 animal size guide
The object is to collect all the cards named on your Old Lady playing board. However, these must be collected in size order, from the smallest to the biggest.
The youngest player begins by picking up one of the cards from the face down cards on the table, showing it to all players. If the card they have picked up is a fly, they place it face up on their old lady playing board singing the line from the song. If it is any other animal they return it, face down, to the table. Play then continues in a clockwise direction with each player trying to collect the animals in the sequence shown on the animal size guide, singing the line from the song each time they pick up the correct animal card. Each card is placed on top of the previous card in the sequence on their old lady board.
The winner is the first player to pick up all the animal cards in the correct sequence, placing them on their old lady board, at which time everybody sings the song from beginning to end.

name: Fruit Trees Game
description:
Fruit Tree develops color recognition and identification while introducing your child to the fun and challenge of playing a game.

The contents are 4 tree boards, 20 fruit counters in 5 colors (red, green, orange, purple, yellow), and 1 color spot die.

Each player chooses a tree board. The fruit counters are placed face up in the center of the play area. Each player rolls the die and places a counter of that color on their tree board, If the color that is thrown is already on the tree the player does nothing. If a blue is thrown the player may pick a fruit from another player's tree. The winner is the first player to fill the tree.

name: Tyr
description:
From the Zillions-of-Games site:

Tyr is a variant of Hasami-Shogi. Object: Be the first to establish a Phalanx inside enemy territory. A Phalanx consists of 5 pieces in a line in any direction and is made up of 1 Lord and 4 Warriors. Enemy territory corresponds to the 5 rows on the opponents side of the board. The middle row, marked with the crisscrosses, is considered the front line of the battle and therefore mutually shared by both sides.

A player may also win by making it impossible for their opponent to create a Phalanx, either by capturing all four of their opponent's Lords or reducing their opponent's Warriors to three or less.

Warriors slide like rooks in Chess, i.e. any number of empty spaces up, down, left,or right. It can also make a single jump over another piece of either color that is adjacent to it horizontally or vertically. The jumping piece lands on the other side. This is not a capture. The only capturing is achieved by sandwiching your opponent's pieces between yours along a row or column. This is similar to Reversi, except that the pieces are removed from the board instead of flipped. A sandwich capture along an edge may wrap around the corner.

Lords have the additional power of moving and capturing diagonally. So they slide like Queens in Chess, i.e. any number of empty spaces up, down, left, right or diagonally. They may jump over another piece in any direction. Also they can make captures diagonally in coordination with another friendly piece.

name: Tabaluga W√ºrfelspiel
description:
Tabaluga is a cartoon character created by Peter Maffay, Rolf Zuckowski, Gregor Rottschalk, and Helme Heine.

In Tabaluga Würfelspiel, you start in the ice and snow, and travel along the path to green grass and blue skies. Special items on a space allow you to advance to the next space with that item. The skills emphasized are counting and matching.

The components are minimal: 6 cardboard movers with plastic stands, a wooden die, and a folded board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: N√ºrnberger Trichter
description:
- Ein Würfelspiel für Jung und Alt. -

Nürnberger Trichter is a simple dice game with 2 dice and a board with the numbers 3-10 and a funnel-field. The dice have a funnel symbol instead of a "6".
Each player gets one fixed number between 3 and 10.
The players roll the two dice, if the dice show both numbers the player has to a add one coin* on the number of the board.
If one of the dice shows a funnel, the player has to put coins equal to the number of the second dice on the funnel-field. The player who rolls (with both dice) the fixed number he got at the start, he gets all the coins from the number field. If a roll shows 2 funnel, the player get the coins from the funnel-field.

(user summary)

name: Dragnet Badge 714 Target Game
description:
Shooting game inspired by the TV series and featuring Jack Webb as Sergeant Friday on the box.
Two dart guns and four darts, each with a rubber tip. The target is made of tin, 11 inches tall and 13 inches wide. It features four plastic Police Target figures which spin when hit.
Pre-select a time limit and the player with the most hits, wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Corporation Incorporated
description:
Corporation Incorporated : A game of bluffing and resource management for 2-5 players.

From the humble beginnings of a swamp-lawyer farm on Bungle Prime, Corp Inc. has grown its empire across the galaxy making most of its profit from interplanetary sewage disposal and virtual casinos. Corp Inc. now employs over 60% of sentient beings and controls near 80% of the non-sentient labor force in the known galaxy. The difference between the two is considered a grey area.

Each player runs a department in a mega-corporation. They compete for resources from the corporation to fund their projects and may have to lie, cheat and steal to get the resources to do so. Though they should beware that the company does not become too corrupt or the company will be closed.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management

name: Racing Driver
description: Dexterity racing car game. Under the board there are magnets and the cars have magnets in as well. Using the steering wheel, you may connect magnet to magnet and advance the car round the track. Not as easy as it sounds. The winner is the player who manages the most laps after a pre-determined time runs out.

name: Motor Race
description:
A very untypical game from Glevum, published far away from their pre-war heyday.
A simple roll and move game. Throw the dice. If you land on a coloured square, go back six spaces, and so on until you have completed the track of 167 squares. It is so old-fashioned, you need to throw the exact number to win.

name: Carnage: The Board Game
description:
4 players compete in a fast-paced turn-based racing-game. Control your speed, drift the corners and send your opponents off the track with lethal weapons. You need to make the best decisions with limited options. Where is the next bend, what is the speed of your opponents, what weapons are available and who can you push in to that race-ending trap? Make sure you cross the finish line first or see to it that none of the other players do.

Players build the track before each race using tiles and customize their cars with equipment and weapons. Each new race delivers new challenges as cars are upgraded and tracks re-imagined.

Accelerating, hitting the brakes and using different equipment and weapons all needs to happen in a split second when racing so each turn your actions are limited. Managing speed is the key to victory! Enter the corners too fast and you crash, go hard on the brakes and weapon-pickups will be gone when you arrive and being careless might get you rammed in to traps by your fellow racers. You need to race smart as taking damage will cause your top speed to go down. A few dents are fine but taking too much punishment will eventually end both the race and your life.

name: Marriage Auction
description:
Card game by an unknown publisher, circa 1900.
32 cards in 4 suits of 8. The cards in each suit rank in this order and, if won, they are worth the points noted;
Bride 5 points
Bridegroom 4 points
Best Man 3 points
Mother-in-Law 2 points
Minister 1 point
Bridesmaid A 0 points
Bridesmaid B 0 points
Bridesmaid C 0 points
The suits are called Notes, Gold, Silver, Copper.
The Notes are white because this game harks back to the days when bank notes were always white.
The object is to win cards in tricks, that have a point value as described above. After dealing, each player should assess their hand and make a bid in turn as to how many points they will collect in their winning tricks. Each bid must be higher than the previous bid. High bidder can call any suit as trumps. When the cards are dealt, there will be 2 to 4 cards left over. These form The Widow and remain face down. The high bidder can choose to take The Widow (and discard the same number of cards taken from The Widow) thus, perhaps, improving his hand.
Normal trick play rules apply.
If the high bidder makes his points or more, then he scores. If he doesn't then all the other players score the amount equal to his winning bid. It will be noted in this game that the high bidder is on his own whereas the 'defending' players are a united team against him.
First player to score 150 points or more, wins.
The rules even carry suggestions as to how to use these cards for fortune-telling.

name: Triple Jet
description:
Shooting game. Triple Jet rocket dart gun and target set. The plastic space gun is 8 inches long, fires three darts in sequence. Jet target is lithographed tin, 7.5 inches x 12 inches with built-in stand. The darts are rubber tipped, to stick on to the target when they hit it.
Player with the most points after a pre-set number of shots, wins.

name: The Jolly Jungleers
description:
Shooting target game. You are on safari and aim to 'bag' some beasts (politically incorrect now, but in the 30's....)
Nice target ensemble with four charming stand-up beasts
The pistol has metal grip and wood barrel, shoots wood pegs
Big game hunting at home!
Player who hits the most targets after a pre-selected number of shots each, wins.

name: Aeroplane Race Round the British Empire
description: Simple roll the dice game. Players have to work their way around the world. Very patriotic in flavour.

name: Pocket Quiz: Wein
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Wine" and the questions are all about that topic.

name: Pocket Quiz: Buch & Buchhandel
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice answers. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Books & Booktrade" and all questions are about these topics.

name: Robot Sam the Answer Man
description: Electric quiz game with extraordinary graphics. Answer questions and point to the correct answer, and a bulb will light up. The game contains 6 answer sheets but double-sided to give you more replayability.

name: Splash Page Special
description:
The title appears to be an old journalism phrase, relating to special editions with lots of photographs about a special event.
Players must collect sets of two or three, by enquiring of other players "Do you have card so-and-so?". If a player gets a pair, he may play it in front of him but should someone get the third, they can claim the other two. At the end, a set in front of you scores points (each set varies in this regard). First to 50 points, wins.
The Splash Page Special card is a kind of Joker and is the only card not relating to a unique set.
Variant rules are provided for playing a type of Snap with the same cards.

name: Wiggle Waggle
description:
Game No 4375. For two or more players.

Directions for Playing : Place a ball upon each of the pedestals in the bottom of the box, placing them on the pedestal or corresponding color. To Wind the top: Place the wooden disk over the center pin with the small metal pin and end of wire spring against the top of the top. Hold the bottom part of the top firmly in the left hand and give the wooden disk a few turns to the right. To release the spinning part of the top, hold the wooden disk firmly in the hand and press one finger on the center of the metal pin. The spinning top must be dropped into the center small circle of the playing board. Each player has one spin at a turn and at the end of his turn the score is taken, counting the numbers in front of the pedestals from which a ball has been thrown. If two balls of one color are thrown, it doubles the score of those two balls. A game may consist of 300 points; or it may be played by rounds, the player having the greatest score at the end of an agreed upon number of rounds, being the winner."

The pedestals are numbered as follows in clockwise direction :

Red: 20 points
Blue: 15 points
Green: 10 points
Yellow: 5 points
Orange: 10 points
Red: 5 points
Blue: 20 points
Green: 15 points
Yellow: 10 points
Orange: 5 points

There is a wooden coloured ball, corresponding in number and colour to each pedestal. The game is played inside a square wooden box with a height of about 5cm (2"). The box is 34cm square (13.5").

Rules for this game come from --- Famous Belgian (famousbelgian). He also contributed a couple of pictures of the game which was in the Unidentified Game geeklist.

name: –ó–≤–µ–∑–¥–Ω—ã–π —Ä—É–±–µ–∂ (Star Frontier)
description:
A rare mineral was found on the planet Arktal-3. Needed by all advanced civilizations in the galaxy.
Grab the field, build factories, research centers and increase the power of your army, to achieve victory and secure your civilization the most important resources.

–ó–≤–µ–∑–¥–Ω—ã–π —Ä—É–±–µ–∂ ("Star Frontier") is a light miniature war game played on modular hextiles.
The units are composed of infantry, mechas and various tanks, produced in factories.
Players can use research cards to increase the power of their units.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Jolly Circus
description:
Race game which tries to be original in that you have two pieces (an animal and a rider) you can consider moving after you have thrown the die. After both pieces have started separately, the players must get their two pieces together on the same square. Once achieved, you can move both as one unit because you cannot win whilst your two pieces are apart.
First to the end of the track with rider mounted on animal, wins.

name: Turas
description: A game whose aim is to improve your mastery of the Gaelic language. The game focuses on increasing players' exposure to 12 frequently-used, improper Gaelic verbs. An audio cassette is included so that players can hear native speakers pronouncing Gaelic words and phrases. Players roll a D6, land on a numbered square of the colorful board, and refer to one of six laminated lists to find the corresponding instructions for that space. The instructions are written in Gaelic, and the current player must respond to the instructions correctly. The winner is the first player to get his token to the end of the board. Players are to speak entirely in Gaelic while playing.

name: Picture Rummy
description:
Not Rummy at all, but it is a set collecting game.
The top left corner of a picture and the bottom right of the same picture are placed in such a way that you can add 9 cards between them to form a finished picture. You draw and play cards to your picture much the same as you would in most card games of this type.
The pictures are very nice (see image for a coaching scene for example).
The first player to complete a picture, wins.

name: Home
description:
Home is a game of skill where the players have as principal aim displace his cards and manage to reach the cabin "HOME".

Objective: To mark six points in the cabin HOME, placed in the center of the board.

Beginning: One distributes in a random way to every player 3 cards.

Placement you register: There are placed 3 cards received in the cabin corresponding to his number in the end of the board to the right of the cabin "Beginning"

The first player: One adds the values of every card that the player has received. The player with major quantity, is the player in moving first.

Movement: It is possible to displace in every shift a maximum of "1 card" to an adjacent cabin on the one that is.

Every cabin corresponds to one of six cards of game, thus on having placed on a cabin with number "1" it corresponds to which is the turn to move to the card "1" and here to depend that player is his owner.

The value of this system resides in whom he is the owner of the card who has to play in the new shift.

Marking points: Once there is reached the central cabin HOME, there is marked " 1 point ". Later, the card that has reached the cabin HOME, returns to his initial cabin in the zone of beginning of the board corresponding to the player.

Winner: The first player who marks 6 points, which it is equal when reaches the cabin HOME six times.

Special rules: Every player possesses his area of playground. It is not possible to invade the opposite field.

Once there is reached the Cabin HOME and the card is returned to his cabin of corresponding exit, there is activated the norm of the following card in moving, being this same to a new adjacent cabin.

name: Tarnkappe
description:
Every player gets six differnt colored marbles and 6 same-color caps. One cap is pulled over each marble. The marbles must reach the goal in the right order. The players rolls a die to move the caps over the board. If the player rolls a 6 he can look under on of his caps. The first player who finished the sequence wins the game.

the goal sequences can be changed.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Erstes Wissen Indianer
description: There are 8 cards for each of the 8 themes. In play 8 rows with the themes are laid out, each theme once in every row, the first player to place all his cards wins the game. In his move a player lays down as many cards as he wants, never two cards from one theme into the same row, but always in the same sequence of themes. If a player cannot place cards, he can switch cards with his stack. Before each placement round players fill up their hands to the maximum and then draw a card from their neigbour.
categories: American West, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Erstes Wissen Ritter
description: There are 60 cards in the game with a knight motive and 15 theme cards, which show four motives belonging to the theme. Players must attribute the motive cards to the theme cards. The player placing the last motive card next to a theme card, receives all 5 cards, the first player to collect 4 theme groups wins the game. In his move a player draws 2 cards and discards two cards, either placing them next to theme cards or onto the discard pile.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medieval

name: Erstes Wissen Saurier
description: The game has 60 dinosaur cards showing 60 different dinosaurs. The header of the card states four facts: size, length and weight of the dinosaur and how many million years ago it lived. Players start with 6 cards, the die determines a category for each round, players then play one card. The player who has played the highest value in the current category wins all cards of the round. When all cards are played, the player with the most cards wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Erstes Wissen Tiere
description:
All players have seven cards, one card is placed in the middle of the table with condition which animal on the next card can be or cannot be. Player who has gameturn plays that animal, if possible, that satisfies the corresponding condition, and now calls itself a new condition that have to be on the next card.
If player hasn't correct card to play he mustdraw a card. Who plays his last card, immediately wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Erstes Wissen Unsere Welt
description: For each of the six continents, there are 10 maps with attractions, monuments, buildings, landscapes or animals. In the game series will be placed with the continents, each series comes once in every continent. Player who has gameturn reveals his top card and places them in a row where the continent is still missing. He is already represented in all ranks to begin a new series. Who sets the last continent in a series gets the whole series. Those who completed the ninth row, finished the game, who has collected the most series wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Wer parkt wo?
description: Players travel in the city by car and look for a place for parking. Players who park illegally are threatened by invisible trapss and must pay a penalty. If all cars have reached the parking place, the player with the most cash cards wins.

name: Alra
description: A board with triangle and rhombus spots for the playing pieces, diagonally arranged black starting squares and coloured squares for finish spots in the middle. On that special board a dice and movement game is played with special dice, which denote up, down, right, left, double move and lose a turn, directions rolled give a move of one spot, double move allows two moves of the player’s choice, but must be made. For some spots there are special rules, playing pieces in the finish spot are removed from the game, a player with all his 4 pieces out of the game has won.

name: Welches Tier versteckt sich hier?
description: Players have a set of small animal tiles, the big ones are slid one by one into the wood wall and must be guessed by the players. The Caretaker of the round reveals the holes, the player to guess the hidden animal may discard the corresponding animal card. A player who guesses an animal that does not live in the wood, may discard any small tile. The player with only two small tiles left wins the round and receives a chip. When all players have been caretaker once, the player with the majority of chips wins.

name: R√§uber & Gendarm
description: The children are playing Robbers & Police, in the game the players are the police trying to find the the robbers in their hiding places. 48 cards are distributed face down on the board, 12 of them are robbers. Players roll the die and move along the paths on the board. If they suspect a card to hide a robber, they pick it up and turn it over. If the suspicion was correct and it is a robber he is captured and the player takes the card. If the suspicion was wrong, the player has to free an already captured robber and put him back on the board. Who has the most robbers at the end of the game wins.

name: Das gro√üe Einmaleins
description:
Learning game for the "big" 9 times tables in three phases:
The learning phase teaches the 9 times table and children check with the ruler.
In the Using Phase the child draws cards, if the answer is correct a chip is placed on the corresponding number.
In the Training Phase players hold 8 cards each and play one to top the card of the previous player, the cards do not show the result, only the question, so the children need to calculate.

name: Die kleinen G√§rtner
description: The children are little gardeners and try to have as good a harvest as possible in their garden. Each has his own garden with 9 squares, in the middle of the table there are 12x3 vegetable cards, 4 watering cans, 4 x weeds and 4 x parasites. One card after the other is turned over, vegetables are placed in the garden. So are weeds, for a parasite a vegetable has to go out, for a watering can one can turn over another card. Who has managed to plant 3 cards each of three different kinds of vegetables in his garden has won the game. 2 game variants are given.

name: Vowel Lotto
description:
An educational game (as are all the other games by this designer). Again, it uses his principles of a Lotto mechanic. Players will learn to recognise vowel sounds and vowel combinations. When a player recognises a vowel sound, he then checks his card and if that sound is also in the name of an object on his card, he may match with it.
Part of the publishers Phonics series. Aimed at children from 5 to 10 years old.

name: Formel 1 Das Quiz
description: One may still be able to remember the last Grand Prix season with it's dramatic finale, but who can tell what has happened in the seasons 50 years ago? The game has 165 cards with more than 1000 questions in three categories: Cars and Technology, History and Drivers, Grand Prix Aktuell. The players roll a die and move forward accordingly . For each roll of the die he must pay with chips, also for wrong answers. For correct answers a player receives up to three chips, for overtaking another player 1 chip. If a player has finished one round (or more, if wanted), the player with the most chips is the winner.

name: Triomention
description: The 3 sides of the 25 wooden pieces show different characteristics (form, colour, number and filling) of symbols. Player may alternately turn or relocate a piece to bring three correct pieces into a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line. To be correct they must be a trio and a trio must have each of the characteristics either the same or completely different on all pieces. Who forms a trio may take it out of the game, the player with the most trios wins the game. Variant of the card game Set.

name: Triopolis
description:
There are 3 symbols in this game: sword, hear and scale, all with their strengths and weaknesses.

Each player represents one of the symbols. In the game, players turn to different means to achieve this primary goal. They try to uncover and capture enemy stones. You bluff by pretending certain strategic positions with their hidden rocks or by seeking an unexpected winning condition.

Contents:

30 triangular pieces (10 each in white, red and black).


In every color there are 3 stones sword, 3 scale blocks, three blocks and a heart stone eyes.

folded game board inside the pyramid-shaped game-box)

name: Ha-Shin!
description:
Ha-Shin is a tabletop miniature wargame set in fantasy medieval Japan, where the forces of Light battle the forces of Darkness. It was published in issue #9 (February 2002) of Ravage, a French miniature wargaming magazine.

Each mini has several stats describing its ability to move, shoot, fight and use "Chi" powers. The most important is Action Points (AP) which represent the character's life energy.
A player's turn begins by choosing one of several tactics. Tactics influence how many figures can be activated, how many APs are recovered at the end of the turn and what figures can recover APs. The player then chooses which figures to activate, and expends the figure's APs to move, charge, use a ranged weapon or a Chi power. Each fight is duel; duel are resolved by secretly choosing a combat action for each combatant (which can give bonuses or penalties to die rolls), then rolling for initiative, then trying to beat the opponent's Armour score with 1d6 + the fighter attack score. Each damage point lowers the victim's APs, minis with no APs left must make a save roll each time they are wounded to avoid death.

The last player standing wins the game, also players are encouraged to create scenarios and alternate victory conditions.

The rules include two army lists with classic Japanese folklore figures (samurais, ninjas, shaolin monks, kappas, onis...), a set of markers and tactical advice for both featured armies (Light and Darkness).

Scale: skirmish (1 mini = 1 combatant, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds)

name: Founders: A More Perfect Union
description:
Founders: A More Perfect Union is a trivia-plot game for 2-3 players or teams. Each turn involves roll and play, as well as the possibility of play cards.
Each player has authored a draft of the Constitution that contains the principles and protections necessary to unify the states. However, in order to present the draft at the Constitutional Convention, each author, must convince a certain number of states to join his or her delegation in support of the draft. Once the delegation is large enough, the author can travel to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and present the draft before the convention in Independence Hall. If you are successful in persuading the convention in your favor, your draft is ratified and becomes the Constitution of the United States! Players will have to study up to prove to these learned delegates will test your knowledge and reason before choosing to give you their support.
Answer trivia questions to get your state cards necessary to go to Philadelphia, but be careful, another player might have the play cards needed to steal a member of your delegation, or just send them packing home!

name: Electric Nature Quiz
description:
A Wildlife trivia game.
Players are read out a question and then told to touch a box on the answer sheet with an electrode. If their answer is correct, a bulb will light up.
Player who gets the most questions right, wins.
Look at the superb artwork on the box.

name: Silverstone Circuit
description:
British roll-and-move game, If you land on the red spaces, follow the instructions.
First to complete a pre-set number of laps, wins.

Silverstone, in Northamptonshire, was opened in 1948. The site was a British ex-WWII airfield.

name: Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame
description:
Intoduction:

Author and game designer, Elree Ellis, is the mind behind "The World of Lucidia". Lucidia is a living, high fantasy world manifested though a series of epic works. These epic works include a series of novels, graphic novels, short stories, board games and a role-playing game. The first of his works, Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame, will be released in 2012 via Time Warp Games.
Theme:

Entitled Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame, this prologue will transport players to the humble beginnings of Lucidia, to a place far removed from the mainland, to a time before time, to the very birth place of life.
Islandis is the largest and most populated island in the Tokelau Sea, serving as the cornerstone for the exploration and settlement of the Asazi Isles. The island is teaming with culture, beauty, bountiful sea life, a seemingly endless supply of resources, and all of the essentials for a growing populous.
In time, through innovation and exploration, neighboring islands are discovered and populated. The new found islands introduce the Asazi people to previously undiscovered resources, thus giving life to a perpetual network of trade routes, and an incessant market place.
Island life is sublime, until...
Villages wake to the sound of chaos. The island pulses and cries with anguish. Families stumble out of their bungalows and into the night, only to find themselves dodging debris from the sky. Turning toward the summit, screams echo across the sea as bursts of lava erupt into the night sky. Dark clouds loom overhead, and no stars are watching from the night sky. Almost word for word, prophesy unfolds. This way of life is coming to an end,it is time for a new beginning.
In Islandis, each player takes on the role of a great leader of the Asazi people. It is each player’s charge to lead their tribe in this prophetic time.
Each player has a whole host of strategic colors in his pallet. Some may decide to stay on the island and continue to gather resources, make trade, and nourish culture. Others may gather resources to build vessels, explore and settle undiscovered islands. The most successful leaders will exhaust both of these options in perfect harmony. Whether choosing to make significant contributions in trade, develop high culture, or spread the seeds of their people across the vastness of the great sea, one common goal remains: To not be forgotten, to make your mark on the history of the World of Lucidia.

Game Play:

At its core, Islandis is a 1-4 player, turn based worker placement game for ages 13+; however, due to the nature of epic works, players will find that Islandis is truly a set of mini games within the whole part. In accord with the worker placement mechanic, players will enjoy fending off sea creatures, making trade, exploration, variable player powers, dice rolling, set building, and empire building (including conversion sites, villages, monoliths, colossi, and temples).
There are five primary building resources found on Islandis (Stone, Iron Ore, Gold Ore, Cotton, and Timber). These five resources, in many cases, will need to be converted into their more useful forms (Ashlar, Iron, Gold, Textiles, and Lumber). In order to upgrade resources, you will need to utilize your conversions sites, and workers. Dice serve as workers in the game and the results of a roll indicate the productivity of workers. Throughout the game players will find ways to "inspire" their workers to be more productive with the assistance of innovative tribesmen and women!
In addition to the five primary resources, and their upgraded incarnations, players will find many uses for the four major imported goods (Copal, Bamboo, Dyes, and Fruit). These imported goods are earned by lending workers to the four neighboring islands as trade.
Finally, and most important, players will need to feed their people! Players will rush for the opportunity to fish from the shore, however, due to limited space, most will be required to employ their sea vessels to earn fish. The most successful players will begin planting fruit trees early in the game to supplement the demands of fishing.
During the game, players will be able to develop culturally, allowing for a variety of new uses for the 14 resources. These cultural advancements include heirloom recipes, jewelry, musical instruments, and more, each lending their tribes the ability to earn victory points through trading cultural goods.

Goal:

The goal of each player is to earn as many victory points as possible before Islandis is destroyed by molten lava. Victory points are earned in a variety of fashions: Trading resources at the markets, developing cultural items and trading at the markets, fighting off sea creatures, surviving deadly storms, building villages, monoliths, colossi, and temples on newly discovered islands.
mechanics: Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Wall Quoits
description:
Players take turns to throw small rings made of rubber at the target board. If the ring catches on to one of the scoring hooks, that score is added to the player's total so far.

First to reach a pre-set total, wins. Or, it can be ended after a pre-set time limit and then the player with the most points, wins.
publishers: (Unknown), Coca-Cola, G. J. Hayter & Co, Ltd.

name: AtomPunk
description:
1-4 player co-operative card game that lets players take control of a post-apocalyptic, retro-future, caravan.

"It feels like Race for the Galaxy Vs. Magic the Gathering with a splash of euro gaming with a nuclear fallout post apocalyptic setting."

Why are you in a nuclear desert?
Players control a rag-tag caravan that contains elements of how society was before the bombs dropped. Everything from road-converted steam engines to solar harvesters staffed by inviting female engineers, and it's your job to get these guys the-hell-outta-here.
AtomPunk makes use of some inventive new puzzle-mechanics and loots the best ones from elsewhere. It steals the best bits of card interactions but dispenses with the "Spend loads of money to play with our new cards" CCG crap - it is one game. It uses resource tokens like some of our favorite euros, but keeps them in an elegant card format. Its core puzzle mechanic means that players will have to use your mind to work out the best path in this treacherous dystopian backdrop
You and your buddies are alone against the harsh wastelands. The riding is tough. Horrific mutants, shady merchants, hardened outriders, religious tech zealots and crazed robo-emus. BUT on your side you have have speed, cunning, all the guns you can handle, and transformer-like laser beam trains.

What are the mechanics?
1. You control 5 caravan elements in a horizontal line that give each card to its left and right static bonuses. These bonuses activate special abilities on the elements. You will constantly need to be thinking about getting these in the best configuration.
2. An event deck throws everything at you from crazy cleaning robots, twisted mutants, resource giving oasis, and caravan weaponry upgrades
3. Each turn pits you in a certain land. This land card tells you what resources you need to move on to the next land. After 5 of these you will come up against the 6th and final hard-as-nails boss land which will tell you the final quest you need to complete.
4. Not only do you need to conquer these 6 lands, but each player has a secret achievement goal card that they MUST complete in order to be allowed into the winning team. Will you tell your team mates yours?

How do we win?
Once you fulfill the requirements to bear the 6th and final quest land the "players" team will be successful. But only if you have succeeded your secret mission goal will you truly win, otherwise you have not won or lost, but you are cast back into the wastes, to win another day...
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Trains
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Letter Go
description:
Qubic games evidently used same 3D board for two games, Qubic and Letter Go.

Letter Go is a 3D game to form 4 letter words on a 4x4x4 grid. The contents included the 3D board and cardboard letter chits. draw chits blindly and score points for words.

Similar to:

Four Letter Words

name: Duchov√©, D√©moni a Draci: Expanze 2
description:
Expanze 2 is the first expansion pack for the Czech talisman style boardgame Duchové, Démoni a Draci.

The expansion contains 48 new cards that are added to the games basic stack, and introduces several new statistics.

The player does now have to defend himself from three new types of attack (Hypnosis, Venom, Black magic) and a new creature ability is introduced (Flying).

The goal of this expansion is to increase the difficulty of the game, playability, replayability and entertaining value.

The designer of the game said, that the expansion is best played when two sets of the new cards are used.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Count Down Space Game
description:
1959 Toy Rocket Space Game by the Trans-o-gram Co. Yep, the same company that made cookie cutters and other baking products!

Cover states: "Force enemy rockets out of orbit.... and CONQUER OUTER SPACE!

A simple game with a spinner (1-6 values) where players move their rockets to knock others out of orbit by moving their rocket on a atomic symbol shaped track to collide with an opponents rocket to take it out of orbit.

name: Drunk Sloppoly
description:
As opposed to most published "drinking games", Drunk Sloppoly is a party game created by people who actually party. This is so much more than a drinking version of Monopoly...this game has four categories of cards that include group games, drunken duels, Puzzle bottle caps, alcohol trivia, sobriety tests and much more. The game also comes with four spinable wheels with different themes to flavor your party experience (sweet, sexy, fun, and evil). The game is intended for coed audiences 21+ and is "Not Recommended to be Played with Alcohol". There are alternate rules included if you're not in the company of people who like to kiss and remove articles of clothing. This game is ridiculous and fun and best with 4-8 players.

The game includes: the board and box, rules, bar deeds, 130+ game cards, 8 game pieces, 4 wheels that attach to the board, 2 dice, and 30 second timer.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Boston City Life
description: A Boston tourist game, with a Monopoly-like board. Object is to move around the board using dice, land on landmark spaces, and collect cards. When you have a card in each category, you can choose a category and try to collect one more card in that category to win.

name: Geh aufs Ganze!
description: For many years, Geh aufs Ganze! (Go the Whole Hog!) with its ZONK! has been one of the most successful game shows on tv in Germany based on the American game show Let's Make a Deal. Players are candidates in that show, sohw must always decide which portal they want to open or which envelope it should be or choose between portal and envelope or risk all that they have won before on the Big Deal or be content with a 1000.- DM. Being greedy or unlucky only gets you the Zonk! Players can try to actively influence the candidate in his decision by offering money or other bribes.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Pixi Abenteuer im Wichtelland
description: Pixi must keep the forest intact! On the board are 30 tiles that show his friends, his hat and his magic stone, players move along the track and try to fiend Pixi’s friends or his hat or the stone, because these items are needed to get over some dangerous spots. Who reaches the finish first, wins and saves the forest.

name: Wissens-Quiz f√ºr Kinder: Natur
description: This learning/quiz game follows the usual scheme for quiz and trivia games: One stops his move on a colored spot and has to answer a question from that category. If the answer is correct, the player receives a knowledge chip in that color. The first player who has 8 chips in different colors, wins the game. On the 110 cards there are more than 1000 questions and many pictures, the categories in that special edition "Nature" are Trees - Shrubs - Mushrooms - Flowers - Garden and Agriculture - Heaven & Earth - Environment and nature protection - Nature in general

name: Wissens-Quiz f√ºr Kinder: Tiere
description: This learning/quiz game follows the usual scheme for quiz and trivia games: One stops his move on a colored spot and has to answer a question from that category. If the answer is correct, the player receives a knowledge chip in that color. The first player who has 8 chips in different colors, wins the game. On the 110 cards there are more than 1000 questions and many pictures, the categories in that special edition "Animals" are Pets/Local Animals - Exotic Animals - Reptiles - Animals in and around Water - Birds - Insects - Prehestoric Animals - Animals in Books and Films

name: Das interaktive Wissens-Quiz f√ºr Kinder
description: With the DVD and a gimmick called GameDisk one can play solitaire or up to 6 players can play the interactive quiz show, provided one has a DVD player or a computer. Per player one needs one GameDisk or an answer pad. or 10 Quiz rounds can be chosen, each round has 5 games and each game asks 6 questions. For each question one decides on an answer and uses the button of the GameDisk or marks the pad. The DVD provides a control code after each game, with this code the Gamedisk can tell the number of correct answers given. The player with the most correct answers at the end of 5 rounds wins the game. Edition for children, playable without electronics using 110 quiz cards.

name: www.das-quiz.de
description: This quiz works by common scheme: Player enters a color field and receives a question of the appropriate scientific field. If the question is answered correctly, he gets a knowledge-chip. The player who has the most chips at the end of the game wins. There are given three different answers for each question. The questions are classified as mild, moderate and severely divided. Themes are the Internet, e-mail, e-commerce and computer.

name: Tivoli
description:
Objective:
Game 1: Avoid loosing more balls than your opponent
game 2: Catch three balls, fix them into intended space -
faster than your opponent
Board with battery powerd flippers, which move the ball into
random directions
Each player tries to avoid 'goals' (game 1), using a slider
Each player turns the slider (190 °), tries to catch three balls, one for each hole (game 2).
seems that frantic gamers may enjoy it

name: Das interaktive Master-Quiz
