description: With the DVD and a gimmick called GameDisk one can play solitaire or up to 6 players can play the interactive quiz show, provided one has a DVD player or a computer. Per player one needs one GameDisk or an answer pad. or 10 Quiz rounds can be chosen, each round has 5 games and each game asks 6 questions. For each question one decides on an answer and uses the button of the GameDisk or marks the pad. The DVD provides a control code after each game, with this code the Gamedisk can tell the number of correct answers given. The player with the most correct answers at the end of 5 rounds wins the game. Version with 110 cards for play without DVD

name: Die interaktive Quiz-Show
description: With the DVD and a gimmick called GameDisk one can play solitaire or up to 6 players can play the interactive quiz show, provided one has a DVD player or a computer. Per player one needs one GameDisk or an answer pad. or 10 Quiz rounds can be chosen, each round has 5 games and each game asks 6 questions. For each question one decides on an answer and uses the button of the GameDisk or marks the pad. The DVD provides a control code after each game, with this code the Gamedisk can tell the number of correct answers given. The player with the most correct answers at the end of 5 rounds wins the game. Edition without cards.

name: GameDisk Die interaktive Quiz-Show f√ºr Kinder
description:
Die interaktive Quiz-Show Junior verison.
With the DVD and a gimmick called GameDisk one can play solitaire or up to 6 players can play the interactive quiz show, provided one has a DVD player or a computer. Per player one needs one GameDisk or an answer pad. or 10 Quiz rounds can be chosen, each round has 5 games and each game asks 6 questions. For each question one decides on an answer and uses the button of the GameDisk or marks the pad. The DVD provides a control code after each game, with this code the Gamedisk can tell the number of correct answers given. The player with the most correct answers at the end of 5 rounds wins the game. Edition without cards.

name: Bomber √ºber England
description:
'Bomber über England' (Bombers over England) is like a pinball game that featured a map of England. The map contained holes in the location of key cities such as London, Liverpool, Birmingham and Newcastle, as well as points representing shipping targets in the North Sea.

Players shoot spring-driven metal balls representing "bombs" at these targets and are awarded points for hitting the enemy targets. Players are awarded a maximum 100 points for landing either on London or on the home base of the British fleet at Scapa Flow. Other cities and shipping targets are worth between 20 and 70 points. The game was clearly published during the "Phony War" period of late 1939/early 1940, since Calais in France is also worth 100 points, but neutral Amsterdam and Brussels score -80 points each (and hitting Germany is -100).

As with many games published during the Nazi regime, it was pure propaganda intended to focus players on supporting the war.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, World War II

name: Der Bauernhof
description: For the basic game players look at the movie from DVD and then play the game, they roll the die, draw and answer a question at the current field. Player gets chips for correct answers. Who has 8 chips first, wins.

name: Der Flughafen
description:
Learning game with the DVD to learn the many interesting things about the airport and the aircraft are modern, from the perspective and experience of a child.
Players look at the movie and then play the game, they roll the die, draw a card and answered a question at the current field, Player gets chips for correct answers. Who has 8 chips first, wins.

name: Die Feuerwehr
description:
Learning game with the DVD to learn the many interesting things about the Fire Department, from the perspective and experience of a child.
Players look at the movie and then play the game, they roll the die, draw a card and answered a question at the current field, Player gets chips for correct answers. Who has 8 chips first, wins.

name: Sc√©nario
description:
Scénario is a game about producing movies. It is a trivia game with set collection and negotiation elements

The players' goal is to make and publish movies. Movies are made by collecting a set of matching Actors, Title, Director and Producer cards as well as enough money to produce the movie. Money and cards are collected by moving on the gameboard and answering movie-related questions. A player can only have one card of each type in hand, so if additional cards are collected (for example a second Director card), they can be either discarded or traded with the other players.

Movement on the board uses a roll-and-move mechanic, with a few tweaks, like no "reroll" spaces, and several spaces allow the player to move her game piece anywhere she wants on the board. At first players only have access to the board spaces that allow them to collect cards or money (provided they correctly answer a question). Once a player has at least produced at least one movie, she gains access to all of the gameboard, including spaces which allow players to collect cash from their produced movies.

Once a player has made more movies than other competitors, she can win the game by going to the "Palme d'Or" space and answering a special question. End of game questions are designed to be more difficult.

Scénario won the 1989 "As d'Or" for best simulation game at the Cannes international games festival.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Conquest of Gaia
description:
For decades, peace has reigned Gaia. But now, for no apparent reason, the five kingdoms
powerful of the world have begun a fierce battle to ensure the supremacy of his
race. There is no time for diplomacy is now only time to conquer the world.

Game description

In Conquest of Gaia, each player assumes the role of one of the five kingdoms struggling to establish the supremacy of their race. The players' goal is to get more points than their opponents. To get points is necessary to control territory and build cities or castles in them. He who gets the most points at the end of the game wins the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: 21st Century Gold Rush
description:
It's 'Gold Rush' time again, here in the 21st Century! With the price of gold skyrocketing higher every day, it’s time you got a piece of the action. Round up a few hombre's to compete against and start digging for gold. Get your hands on a few mines and while your at it, jump a few claims from your competitors.

It’s an all out rush to see who can wrangle up one million dollars in gold nuggets first and get them safely to the bank. But watch out! When your dealing with gold, there is always some outlaw lurking around to steal it from you. It’s going to take more than a little luck to finish first in this game.

Game play
Players take turns rolling the dice and moving around the board in hopes of staking claims in one of the five mines available. Once a player obtains a share in a mine he may dig in it, once he lands or passes the ‘mine for gold’ space. When a player mines for gold he draws one of the ‘golden nugget’ cards and records the amount of gold found, on a score sheet.

During the game, the price of gold will fluctuate when players land on the ‘gold rises’ or ‘gold drops’ spaces, causing his gold to be worth more or less throughout the game. He must try to get this gold to the bank while the price of gold is still high, in order to receive cash payment for his gold. He may of course, deposit as much or as little of his gold as he wishes, hoping for higher prices later.

He must be careful though. There are outlaws waiting to steal all un deposited gold from you. Throughout the game, players can jump claims of other players, thus stealing away their shares of mines, preventing them from gaining more gold. The player who manages to get one million cash on hand first will win the game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das gro√üe KiKa-Quiz
description:
The players try to pull her figures on the quiz fields and answer a questions there or solve a problem.
Player gets reward chip after correct answer or solved problem
Who first has one chip in each color wins. The tasks are drawing and pantomime, the other pictograms are available for questions on the areas hobby, nature, culture, technology, or conundrums. The player can decide whether to draw task or take pantomime.

name: Das grosse KiKa-Quiz f√ºr die Vorschule
description:
Preschool verison.
This quiz is playable without being able to read, the tasks come from the daily life of children, each card shows the task and three possible solutions. In a turn a player rolls the die, moves and solves the question of a corresponding card. Tasks are: watch closely, listen acutely, recognize and allocate questions, count and compare or which pictures form a new word? The solution chosen is marked by holding the card with two fingers over the solution, if the finger at the back points at the "Schlaumeir", the answer is correct. For a correct answer player receives the card, the player who first has five cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sudoku Recycled
description:
Take a completed Sudoku and what can you do with it...how about getting a little more use before tossing it into the recycle bin...Sudoku Recycled are a series of pencil and paper games that you can play using a completed Sudoku. Currently, there are 3 different games you can play and all you need is a pencil, a completed Sudoku and the rules to the game you want to play.

There is:

Tic-Tac-Sudoku a simple Tic-Tac-Toe game for 2 players that brings Tic-Tac-Toe to a new level.

Snakedoku a 2-4 player game where you try and make snakes (the longer the better), but your opponents will try and stop you by cutting in front of you with their own snake. This game also has the Mongoose variant and everyone knows snakes don’t like mongooses.

Sudoku Warriors a 2-3 player game where you place you warriors around villages to gain control of their resources. When a battle breaks out you will need the village's resources to win the battle for a Province. Win the required number of Provinces and win the game.

Don't have a completed Sudoku to play on...no problem just make a Pseudoku.

name: Who Let The Dogs Out
description:
Who Let The Dogs Out (TM) is a new board game for all the family. The objective is to round up your four escaped dogs and get them back in your house with a bone for each. Remember - my doggie won't stay in if he don't have no bone.

The square game board is divided diagonally into four backyards, with a small house located in the middle of each edge of the board. The game commences with one of each players dogs placed on a marked starting position in each players backyard. Players then use game cards to move one or more dogs directly or to pick up sausages and/or bones to move their own dogs strategically towards, and eventually into, their own home. The first player to get all of their dogs into their house with a bone wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Lissy: Das gro√üe Pferdequiz
description: Quiz game on the subject of horses, with puzzles and poster, questions from the categories horse and humans, riding and sport, horse mannerisms, horses’ bodies, knowledge and horse breeds. The arrow is turned for the category, correct answers earn a puzzle part, one can place a tip for answers on other player’s questions and earn irons which can be changed into puzzle parts. The first player to complete his puzzle wins the game.

name: Die Kinder unserer Welt
description:
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

name: Die Welt der Technik
description:
"The world of technology" in English
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

name: Reporterspiel
description: In Reporterspiel, players are journalists that travel around the world trying to collect interesting material and pictures for a new issue of GEOlino. On their turn, a player either moves the journalist and takes a round tile, takes a text tile, or takes an airline-ticket. 3 round or 3 white tiles on one subject result in a conference: A theme disk is laid out, all players bid on correct answers. For correct guesses, players receive square pages for their issue. Complete magazines are scored for articles matching the title page, advertising, and longest consecutive article on one subject. The player with the highest score wins the game.

name: Koins
description:
Koins is a simple and engaging game for three players.

The players all start out with a handful of coins. Each turn, the players bet one or more of their coins, the bets are called "hands".
If all hands are different, the middle hand is the winner (ex. 5 out of 2, 5, 7).
If two hands are the same, the third hand is the winner (ex. 2 out of 5, 5, 2).
If all hands are the same, there is no winner and the coins are put into the pool.

The player with the winning hand takes all the coins that were bet that turn, as well as the pool if there is any, and a new round is played.

name: Unser K√∂rper Quiz-Spiel
description:
"Our bodies quiz game" in English
32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions – if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

name: Dinosaurier Quiz-Spiel
description:
Dinosaurs themed quiz-game.
32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and betting cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his betting cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by betting one of his betting cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

name: Matchet
description: The game of MATCHET is played with 36 triangle shaped pieces. These pieces are tri-colored and have numbers from 1 to 10 at their points. The object of the game is to match the colors and numbers in multiples of 5, First person to get rid of all his triangles is the winner.

name: Fliegerei und Luftfahrt
description:
"Aviation and aerospace" in English
32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

name: Das grosse Kosmos Natur-Quiz
description: Two parts are combined into a complete photo. The first player to gather 12 parts that is 6 complete pictures, one from each category, wins the game. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves the butterfly: On a sunflower, trefoil or poppy spot a question must be answered by the active player, in some cases the other players can place a tip for the correct answer. The correct answer earns the active player a picture part or a trefoil, for a correct tip one receives a trefoil. Four trefoils can be exchanged for a picture part.

name: Benimm ist in
description: The game comprises 110 cards with 220 situations taken from daily life. Each card describes the situation and suggests three different ways of behaviour, only one way is the correct one. Players roll the die and move their pawn, the end spot of the move determines what happens: On an empty spot they stop or buy another move with 3 Chips. On a "Benimm ist in" spot one draws a card and answers the question. A correct answer is rewarded with a chip. On the red "live"-spots one must enact the situation pictured on the board, the other players act as jury. Wrong answers send the player back 3 spots. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

name: Das Gute-Nacht-Spiel
description: The 36 Good Night tiles show 6 times activities necessary before going to bed. Each player tries to be the first to collect one motif each. In his turn he rolls the colour die and moves to the next spot in this colour, on a Sandman spot he can turn over a tile and take it if he has not got the motif yet. On the purple corner spots one has to give back the motif shown. Older children can play with the number die, then the "6" sends a player to the purple corner spot.

name: Das Indianer-Spiel
description: The game board shows an Indian camp in full swing, each player tries to find 8 tiles corresponding to his theme tile from a total of 48 tiles, colour coding makes it easier to spot fitting tiles. In his turn a player can turn up as many tiles as he wants - if "Überfall" is turned up the move ends and he receives no tiles. If he ends his move voluntarily he can keep all tiles corresponding to his theme. The first player who has found all 8 tiles can lay out all tiles on the board, ends the game and wins.

name: Solo Defence Zero
description:
The Enemy is attacking your borders and you must withstand the three waves of invasion heading your way.
You must choose and deploy your units to destroy the Invader before it eliminates them all.
This dice game is a solo version of co-ordinate based battle games, like Battleships or Salvo.

You choose which Units to use - Bunkers, Guns, Tanks and Command. Then deploy them on the grid to outlast the attack of the Invader.

Near misses result in bombardments that cover multiple grid points, so a well thought out deployment is essential.

You need to survive three waves of attack to win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Das M√§rchen-Spiel
description: On the board fairy tale pictures are connected by moss hills with and without arrows, forming a circuit. Each player starts on any of the story spots, 24 story tiles are laid out face down. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves the number of spots rolled. If he reaches a moss hill, the turn ends. On a moss hill with an arrow he can turn up a tile and replace it face down. On a story spot he can turn up a tile and keep it if it corresponds to the story of the spot, and he has another turn. When all tiles are taken up, the player with the most tiles wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Das superschlaue W√∂rter-Krokodil
description:
The "word crocodile" gobbles up all words it finds in its path, but cannot digest them and gives them back again letter by letter. A non-playing referee slides a card into the crocodile. At the beginning only the tip of the crocodile’s tongue is visible and the first letter of the word. Now all players guess which word the crocodile is spitting out and call out words. Each player may only call out one word for each new letter, if you call out more than once you are disqualified for this word. If somebody manages to guess correctly, the card is shown to all players and is given to this player. The referee enters a new card. If the word was not guessed correctly after the first letter, the next letter is slid out and all guess again. If you do not want to guess you need not do so. If the word is not guessed before the last letter appears the card goes to the player who reads out the complete word first.

At the end of the word a little picture clarifies and explains the meaning of the word and allows control if the guess was correct. The playing time can be varied by the number of cards used. When all cards have been played, the winner is the player who collected the majority of cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Der zw√∂lfmalkluge Zeit-R√§uber
description: The time robbers have stolen the hands of all the clocks, but the children can repair the damage and position the hands again. The cards are stacked hand-free clocks facing upwards. The bottom card is drawn, the picture on each card gives hints to the time-frame: A soup pot indicates lunchtime, a sleeping child night-time. You try to position the hands on the big clock as exactly as possible. The backside of the card shows the correct time - if you did it correctly, you receive the card. With 5 cards you win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Number

name: Fragst Du mich ,,, neck ich dich
description:
Card game which is a question and answer game for children.
All the cards are dealt out. Now the first player asks the person to the left of him or her (your neighbour in other words) a question. If they get the answer right, they get the card. If the answer was wrong, the questioner gets to keep it and it goes back into their hand. Now your left hand neighbour asks a question of his or her neighbour, and so on.
The one who gets the most answers right wins. Limited replayability I would think.

name: Die Jahresuhr
description: A dice game to accompany children through the year, in play they learn the 12 months with a typical situation for each month. The children learn the sequence of the months and can allocate the seasons with the help of the coloured bottom strips. Aim of the game is to collect as many month discs as possible, a player who places a disc on the correct month receives the disc.

name: Die M√§use-Piraten
description: Players try to caper the most valuable treasures from each other and try to have the biggest treasure at the end. Ships are loaded with 8 chests showing dice tots from 2-5, the surplus chests are flotsam. In his turn a player rolls the die and takes a corresponding chest from a player or from the flotsam. For a cannon the bottom card of a ship can be turned over and the treasure taken when there is only one treasure left on the card. When the last card of a ship is sunk, the player with the most treasure cards wins, mice are valueless.

name: Pikanterien
description: Question and answer card game for adults only. The risquè cards are shuffled and placed in the centre of the table. In your turn you draw the top card and ask another player the question, hoping to embarrass him or her. The most correct answers wins the game
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Kreuz und Quer durch √ñsterreich
description: Players criss-cross through Austria, amassing cards as they get to certain cities. The first to visit a pre-agreed number of cities, wins

name: Kreuz und Quer durchs Salzkammergut
description:
Each player starts at one of five starting spaces. The players take turns to roll and move. The players have to visit 8 cities and return to their starting space. At each city, the player collects a cardboard ring (which may be marked with the name of the city) to stack on his playing piece. The first player to return to his starting space with eight collected rings wins the game.

In Salzburg the players may choose to gamble if they have fewer than 7 rings on their playing piece. The player rolls the die and if he rolls as many eyes as he has rings, he wins the lucky coin, which allows him to immediately move 25 spaces. If the player uses the coin it remains in Salzburg and may be won by another player. If he doesn't use it, he may keep it to prevent the other players from winning it.

If a player gets on the same space as another player, he may take a ring or the coin from him. If he takes the coin he has to chose to use it or keep it. If he uses the coin it is returned to Salzburg and may be won again.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: International Tennis
description: International Tennis simulates a professional singles tennis game. Play is card-driven: the server draws a serve card to determine where the serve goes (after the receiver chooses a court position), if the receiver returns the serve a return card is drawn, if the server returns a rally card is drawn, etc. Tracks are provided for game, set, and match scoring.

name: Quinella
description:
Quinella is a game that brings you the excitement of the racetrack.

Players bet on which of 4 horses will win the race. The horses are represented by the suits of a standard deck of cards: Heart, Diamond, Spade and Club. Each round one player acts as the caller, dealing cards to determine the odds. Bets are placed using chips. When all bets are placed the caller deals cards to move the horses. When the race is over the caller pays out the winning bets. The player to the left of the caller is the caller for the next round. The winner is the player who finishes with the most chips.

name: Game of Flags of the United Nations
description:
Info on this game gathered from the ELLIOTT AVEDON
VIRTUAL MUSEUM OF GAMES.

This is a Card game. There are 40 cards in the deck.

The set of 40 cards shows the flags of the United Nations. They are divided into 12 categories, mostly geographic as follows:
•1 United Nations UN
•5 Veto Countries VC
•5 South American Countries SAC
•3 Central American Countries CAC
•3 Island Countries
•2 Scandinavian Countries SC
•2 African Countries AC
•3 Emblem Countries EC
•4 Moslem Countries MC
•3 Picture Countries PC
•3 Costume Countries CC
•6 Other Countries
The object of the game is to get and meld complete categories (see above list). With two people playing, deal 9 cards to each, three playing, 8 cards, and four playing 7 cards. Place remainder of pack face down in center of table and turn over the top card to start the face up stack. Player at dealer’s left starts by drawing a card from either stack, or by calling for a card from some other player. He must have at least one of the cards in the category for which he is calling. If successful he may call again from the same person until unsuccessful and then must discard one card on face up stack, which completes his turn. Then, the next player to left follows the same procedure.

Complete categories, and meld them, face up, in front of you as fast as possible. A player may pick up all the cards in the face up stack at any turn, but must meld at least one complete category after so doing. You must meld at least two categories before you can meld the single UN card. When any player has no cards left after his discard - the hand ends, and he scores a bonus of 100 for going out. Cards held by other players are discarded for next deal and each scores the total of the value of each card in their meld. Play for time available - highest score wins.

name: INI Quest
description:
Player crawl into a dungeon and try to get hand on mercenarys, golds and precious information about some Quest to mark points and win the game.
Each turn; the player have two choice.
Try to win room (where mercenary,golds and information are)
To do so, the player put face down one of is INITIATIVE counter on the appropriat card.Each player get 7 INITIATIVE counters (0-1-1-2-3-4-5) After, next player decide if i try to get the same room or Explore new one.
if he decide to explore new one, he must put one of is INITIATIVE counter on the new explored room.
When all player have play all is INITIATIVE counter the room was resolve one at time left from right.
Firts, return face up any INITIATIVE counter and countthe result. The player whit more INI win the room and resolve any event on room (if some) then take all supply listed on that room.
At the end, the player with the most information point and dead monstrers win the game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Shangri-La, PigWars Expansion Module #2
description:
Shangri-La is the second expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: PondWars, PigWars Expansion Module #3
description:
PondWars is the third expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: The Slaughterhouse, PigWars Expansion Module #4
description:
The Slaughterhouse is the fourth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The theme of the expansion is the horrors of that dreadful place that all young piglings fear the most; the horrors of the slaughterhouse...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: The Blizzard, PigWars Expansion Module #5
description:
The Blizzard is the fifth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

Snow has fallen in the sty, and the theme for this expansion is winter, but the battles in the sty is just as fierce and heated as always...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: A fistful of truffles, PigWars Expansion Module #6
description:
A fistful of truffles is the sixth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: Return of the BBQ king, PigWars Expansion Module #7
description:
Return of the BBQ King is the seventh expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name: Profiles The Biography Guessing Game
description: The Biography Guessing Game. Spend some time with some famous people! Profiles is the new game that gets you up close and personal with 500 of the most famous people from the past and the present! Listen to the catagory, decide whether you want multiple choice, then hear the question. Score one point when you answer correct using multiple choice, three points when you answer correct all on your own. Reach the finish line first and win the game. But watch out! Pitfalls await you along the way to make your Biography Quest even more challenging!

name: Schatzinsel Ahoi!
description:
Schatzinsel Ahoi! is an easy treasure hunting game for children with a memory element. The board is a grid of 36 squares, each showing a symbol / detail. A gold coin is placed on one of the squares.
There are 36 face-down tiles, each corresponding to a square on the board. Players reveal one tile, and if it fits a square adjacent to the own pirate, they can move there. Than the tile is turned face down again. The first player to reach the gold coin is the winner.

name: Filly Unicorn Abenteuer auf den Kristallinseln
description: In a display of 8 open cards and a stack you place your filly and then move it around the display for the number given on the top card of the stack. Then you decide on a card in the row with your Filly, you can take the top card from the stack, too. Or you pass. Cards taken are placed in your personal stack, you must not look at the stack during the game. Gaps in the display are filled from the stack. When the stack is finished, your personal stack is scored. You score 1 point, for 2 identical cards, 2 points for 3 or more identical cards, task cards that you can meet score 1 to 3 points depending on the number and kind of symbols. For task cards not met you lose 1 point. You win with the highest score.

name: Griechisch f√ºr den Urlaub
description:
"Greek for the holidays" in English
The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empti spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Travel, Word Game

name: Honeyz Das Spiel
description: Honeyz are collectible bears well-known from TV commercials, this game introduces four new ones: Never-Endy, Carefully, Silly and Cleverly are in Schlaraffenland and want to eat as many sweets as possible. The active player rolls the die for his bear of the round and depending on the bear has different number of rolls for moving the bear and may take different amounts and sorts of sweets cards. If all cards are taken or nobody could take a card for two rounds the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Italienisch f√ºr den Urlaub
description: The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empti spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Travel, Word Game

name: Wir laufen um die Wette!
description: Kikaninchen is the identifaction character for the children’s TV channel of ARD and ZDF. In this roll-and-move game KiKaninchen and his friends want to fill the empty harvest basket with apples which they want to pluck from the tree on the last track card. Players must bet on the winner of the race and the winner of the game is the player who has guessed the winner. Between the start card with the basket and the finish card with the tree you place any number of cards you like. Each player chooses one of his color dots and thus bets on the animal that will reach the finish first. In turn each player takes both dice and moves the animal of the color rolled as many steps ahead as the number dice die demands. When you roll red the player puts back an animal of his choice the rolled number of steps. When the first animal reaches the tree the winner is the player who chose this color dot.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kinder-poker
description: Cards are shuffled, each player is dealt 5 cards, the chips are distributed evenly. The player with the most chips at the end of a pre-agreed number of games wins. After dealing the phase improve cards is played, each player in turn draws 4 cards and then reduces his hand to 5 cards to form the most valuable combination possible. Then in three rounds players bid chips or pass, after that the players still in the game reveal their hand, the player with the best hand gets all the chips.

name: Mein Bauernhof
description: Four puzzles with farm szenes are put together to form a big picture, each puzzle has 12 parts. Each player receives a frame and in his move turns up one of the parts - if it fits into the picture the player takes it, otherwise it is put back. Contour drawings in the frame help to fit in the correct parts. The first player to complete his picture wins the game.

name: The Muddled Menagerie
description:
A game with first class illustrations.
It is a set collecting game, like a Quartet but with a difference. You are collecting the four quarters of an animal. A full set will be numbered 1 to 4 but in the early stages you may well collect the wrong animal part because you did not recognise it correctly. It also has child appeal because the box illustrates wrongly assembled animals, with a good sense of humour on behalf of the publisher.
The winner is the one who collects the most correct animals.

name: Auf zum Wintersport
description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach the finish line

Simple 'Roll and Move' game with cute drawings and - of course for games from the former GDR - fancy meeples

name: 3-Squared
description:
3-Squared is a dice rolling game where players try to score the lowest number of points. The game ends when one player reaches 150 points.

Overview:
The game begins when the first player rolls the 9 3-Squared Dice. 8 of the dice are colored with blue (3 sides), purple (2 sides) and red (1 side). The 9th die has 3 blue sides with a 10 on it, 2 purple sides with a 20 and 1 red side with 40 printed on it. The object is to NOT roll all of the sides with the same color and complete the 3-Square.

After the dice are rolled all players examine the results. The Score Die is set in the center of the play area and all other dice that are the same color are set along side it. If all of the other 8 dice are the same color as the Score Die, the player has completed the 3-Square, the round ends and the player who rolled the dice scores the points showing on the Score Die. If any of the other 8 dice are not the same color, play passes to the next player. The second player rolls all of the remaining dice that do not match the color of the Score Die and the other dice that were not set aside. Play continues in this manner until all of the dice match the color of the Score Die and the player who completed the 3-Square.

There are two little tricks however that can alter the gameplay. The first is the 10th die...called the Event Die, it has six different sides that can change the results of the dice rolls. One can end the round immediately, even if the 3-Square has not been completed. One can allow the player who completed the 3-Square to pass the points to a different player, others double, or even triple the points showing on the Score Die.

Each player is also given 3 Pass Tokens which they can use to skip their turn rolling the dice, shifting the turn to the next player. The 3 Tokens are not renewable so players must be careful when using them.

Contents:

3-Squared Dice (10 Total)
Pass Tokens (18 Total)

name: Rund um den Hund
description:
"Around the dog" in English
2.200 questions and answers on the subject of dogs, frequent play can make an expert of the players. Each correct answer can earn a chip, if the playing piece sits on the corresponding colour spot in the outer parcours. The first player to collect all 8 chips wins the game.

name: Picture Pool
description: The picture boards and a total of 27 picture tile show images for children. Animals from the front and from the back, penguin, pig, cat, raven and dog, a baby in three different versions and many different children. The tiles are spread face-down, each player gets a board. In your turn you turn up a tile: If you have this exact image also on your board, you place the tile on the board. If not, you put the tile back face down. The first to fill his board wins the game.

name: Talent Show
description: A game of memory combined with a kind of lotto. Depending on the number of players each players receives 1, 2 or 3 boards. These boards show one of the characters on a color background and a few items belonging to the character. These items are taken out and placed backside up on the table. In your turn you choose a disc: If it fits your board you can place it. The first to fill his board wins the game.

name: Not Under My Roof
description:
Not Under My Roof! is a fast-paced fighting game in which opponents battle their way through a building. Rather than sitting at a table, the cards you play knock your opponent from room to room until somebody is tossed through an exit. Some cards work better if an object like a lamp or TV is in the room with you. You will fight through the building until somebody throws you out and yells NOT UNDER MY ROOF!
(From The Game Crafter page)

name: √ñsterreich Reise
description: For each game another Fun Park in Austria is selected as final destination and each player chooses a city where he wants to start. Then each player receives 5 city cards, these cities the player must visit on this way from start to finish. The roll of the die determines how many cities can be visited in one turn, a "6" allows to fly to any city. If a player passes through or reaches one of his cities, he may discard the corresponding card. The first player to reach the Fun Park without any city cards wins the game.

name: Auf der Jagd nach dem Piratenschatz
description: Captain Sturmflut and his pirates Knollnase and Lücke flee the English fleet with the treasure they stole from the queen, which they want to hide on a lonely island. Monkey Kingo shows them the best hideout, but to become a real pirate Kingo has a lot to learn, especially to tie knots. In the game for up to 4 players the player will win who best remembers the story and is very good at knots.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Pirates

name: Pustekugel
description:
Puff foam marbles through archways

A somewhat different dexterity game - Pustekugel is played on the floor, you must puff the foam marble along a self-set-up track, either against another player or team or on your own against the clock. In a game against an opponent or opposing team only the cards showing three or less archways are used. You draw a card and then in turn players puff the ball through the archways. If you are the first to reach the starting point, you get the card. If you have the highest score from your cards after a pre-set number of rounds you win the game. If you race the clock you puff the marble along the track on your own, the fasted receives the card.

name: Quizf√§cher Pocketquiz Fu√üball topaktuell
description: A quiz in the form of a fan, on the subject of soccer, 1000 questions and answers on Bundesliga, Weltmeisterschaft and Champions League. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels, the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.

name: Quizf√§cher Pocketquiz Wunderwelt der Saurier
description: A quiz in the form of a fan, on the subject of dinosaurs, 1000 questions and answers sequenced by time periods. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels, the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.

name: The Game of Globe Trotters
description:
A lovely card game with almost Impressionist graphics.

Each card forms part of a set of four. There are 60 cards, so there are 15 sets to collect. Each set features a stage in your trip round the world, either a place or something in connection with travelling; for example - In the Far East or Means of Travelling. Players collect sets by asking each other for certain cards. If met with a "No" their turn ends. If successful, they can now ask someone else for a card and so it goes on.

name: Biblisches Frage und Antwortspiel
description:
A religious question and answer game, probably intended for Sunday Schools in East Germany in the fifties.
Contents: 20 Playing Boards + 96 Question and answer cards.

Up to 20 players get a board with 4 different chapters of the Bible. Every board is different.

The players (or teacher) take turns to read out one of the 96 Question cards. If another player thinks he recognises that scripture is one of his four chapters on his board, he can say the answer. If he is right he gets to keep the card and places it on the appropriate space on his board. If he is wrong, other players can guess if they want.
The first player to get all four chapters on his board covered, wins

name: Schneck Schneck
description: Players need to make their way out of the snail’s shell and be the first to reach the salad. Two dice are rolled and placed on the snail’s antennae, the third you roll and then move your snail the sum of the die rolled and one of the antenna dice. The dice used are then placed on the antennae. On the green path you move forward, on the red backwards. You cannot enter closed spots, a doublet earns you another turn, on occupied spots you place your snail on top of others. When moving on you take along snails on top of yours and leave those below. On spots so marked you must change to the other path.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spanisch f√ºr den Urlaub
description: The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empty spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.

name: Streichel-Zoo
description: The children carry their feeding bags through the zoo and look forward to meeting another animal. The feed tiles are laid out face down, the animals line up on the track. In his turn a player turns up a tile. If it is the favourite food of the animal first in line he can take the tile, otherwise he turns it down again. Then he places another animal in front of the line. When the forth food for any animal has been found and taken, this animal is taken off the board. When the third animal is taken off the game ends and the player with the most tiles wins.

name: Ticky Vorschultrainer
description: The training box stands upright, the colour chips fall down, then the box is placed horizontally again. One learning table is chosen and is slid into the box. The child must find the colour corresponding to the correct solution for the task and move a colour chip with the magnetic pencil onto the solution spot of the board. To check for correct solution one pulls out the board and turns it over and slides it back in, the colour spots now must correlate with the colour chips.

name: Zitterpartie
description: A cork plateau, building blocks and constructions, which must be made up from the blocks - and yet neither Bamboleo nor Make 'n' Break, but balance and dexterity, because you must balance the cork plateau on your back or your head or your knees and hold the plateau in balance for at least 2 seconds. You draw a card, place the plateau accordingly on head, back or knee and then the buildings blocks as shown on the card. When blocks tumble or the finished construction does not keep for 2 seconds, the card is put back beneath the stack. When the construction has been successfully completed, you keep the card. After the previously agreed number of rounds the winner is the player with most points on his cards.

name: Das DinoQuiz
description: A game for all friends of dinosaurs. The game holds 600 questions and answers on the subject, players try to win colourful dinosaur disks. A special point of interest are the short descriptions of more than 70 dinosaur varieties, including info text and 6 questions. The rule gives 2 game variants.

name: Carros
description:
www.yali-ron.com/game1.php

It is very complicated to find a parking place in the big city and even more amusing when other factors are on your way...
This is a comic card game, chalanging you to be the first one to park 4 cars by overcoming the difficulties.
So what are you waiting for, the keys are inside...

During the game the players need to collect a car card with a card of matching keys (matching the type of the car and its color). Meanwhile the players may use other cards to steal parked cars (with the thief card) from others parking lot, unless a guard card is used as an encounter maneuver.

From the publisher site (in Hebrew):

name: Das lehrreiche Feuerwehrspiel
description:
Objective: Try to (visit and) solve as many accidents as possible - collecting points/acting by turns

1 There are accidents - spread all over the board
2 If your die shows a 'five' - your car may start
3 Choose a route on which you can solve these accidents as quick as possible
3 Game ends if the last accident was followed up
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fu√üballQuickQuiz
description: Soccer quiz, the winner is the player who scores 25 points first. In turn players are asked a question, for a correct answer one scores a point. In case of a wrong answer all players can try to answer, the fastest player with the correct answer wins the point.

name: Aufgepa√üt im Stra√üenverkehr!
description:
Objective: Be the first to move your car over the finish line
(field 90)
Simple 'roll and move' GDR game learning traffic signs and rules
as typical for comparable products: Individual meeples (cars) and detailed coloured map

name: Reise durch die Schweiz
description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach target line
Typical 'roll and move' game before WW I.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns
Rules inside cover

Artist:
Emil Heinsdorff

remark: This game belongs to the series:
"Scholz künstlerische Spiele" - 2 different product codes

name: Carrancas
description:
Carrancas is a board game inspired by the Brazilian colonization process. In 1501, some men tried to explore the continental territory of Brazil using the San Francisco river to get inside the continent. These man were explorers and warriors, fighting against diseases, native tribes and the wild nature.

In Carrancas, the players assume the position of these men, going to the uplands of the rivers with manpower and food, bringing down gold, leather and silver.

Carrancas were the ancient spiritual totems used by the natives across the San Francisco river, to bring peace, cure diseases and all kind of help needed. This totems were used in the boats and villages. This Totems may win a war.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Hurra ich kann lesen
description: A nice and handy gimmick vaguely looking like a smiling face is filled with cardbord discs on which questions and answers are printed. All discs are shuffled and inserted into the gimmick. Then the child turns the "nose" on the front of the "Questioner" until the question can be read in the window. Then the child answers, using one of the choices given, and remembers the number next to his chosen answer. When he lifts the Question Mark, the number visible underneath shows the correct answer. The questions are sorted into three different grades of complexity, marked with 1, 2 or 3 stars. The question must be positioned exactly in its window to have the correct answer appear in the answer window. A nicely done and well working quiz and learning game, working well as a solitary game.

name: Clownpocalypse
description:
Clownpocalypse is a card game for 2-4 players, set in a world ravaged by evil clowns. One player plays the Clowns: their goal is to abduct the remaining humans and force them into the Circus. All the other players play Survivors, who roam the blasted wastes in a pitiful search for food, salvageable material, and safety... and who try to take out as many Clowns as possible along the way.

In Clownpocalypse, each player playing a human Survivor leads a Team. At the start of the game your Team is just a single Survivor, but a big part of the game is rescuing other Survivors and attempting to lead them to safety. Each Survivor you shepherd to safety at game's end is worth a victory point, but having a large Team during the course of gameplay can create problems: the larger your Team, the more attention they attract from the Clowns.

It also gets tougher to feed them. In classic survival horror fashion, you start the game with only a limited number of Rations, and you'll need to use your quickly dwindling supply to feed each member of your Team every turn. If your Team gets too large too fast, you're going to have trouble, and then you're going to need to do a hard moral calculus: do you let someone starve? Do you cannibalize your own Team? (Each of these choices has their own pros and cons.)

After you've fed your Team, you get the option to Travel. Traveling is the main way you move through the game deck, uncovering resources and, eventually, the Way Out. There will always be three cards in the gameplay area displaying three possible resources to Travel to. Those resources could be Locations, Rations, Salvage, Weapons, or other Survivors, and part of your strategic thinking in the game will involve assessing which resources your Team really needs--you can only attempt to get one per turn, leaving the rest on the table for your rivals.

And of course, there's danger. The Clowns want to stop you from reaching those resources. So, each turn, the player playing the Clowns places one Clown card, face down, in front of each resource on the table. This is where the game becomes a battle of wits. The Clowns have some cards that are stronger than others, and so they need to carefully choose where they place their best cards. Which resource on the table is the most valuable to the player whose turn it is? Is that the one that the Clowns should defend the strongest? Or should they bluff, placing a weaker Clown there in the event that the player decides to grab up a lesser resource, in the hope of avoiding confrontation? Being able to predict your opponent's strategic choices is an important part of this game.

Once you've declared what resource you're travelling to (or opted to stay put, which has its own risks), the Clowns flip the card they uses to defend that resource, and a confrontation ensues.

Clownpocalypse contains 64 cards (Clowns, Survivors, Weapons, Salvage, and Locations), a set of counters to represent Rations, plus some other goodies in an attractive, sturdy box. Clownpocalypse is hilarious, disturbing, challenging, and rewarding: you're going to love it.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Play Ball!
description:
Play Ball! is a dice game consisting of 3 dice. The dice are wooden, six-sided and consist of the following faces:

Red - Hit, 2 Base, 3 Base, Out, Out, Out
Blue - Hit, Hit, 2 Base, Out, Out, Out
Green - Hit, Hit, 3 Base, Home Run, Out, 2 Outs

The rules are simple and consist of the following (taken from the rules sheet):

1. Roll out 3 Cubes and use Baseball Rules of Play.
2. Always read Cubes in same order.
RED-BLUE-GREEN
3. Tally runs on Score Pad for each inning.
4. When 3 Outs are made, player passes Cubes to other team or player.

The contents of the game are:

One small, plastic canister to hold the contents
One 2" by 3" rules sheet/score pad
Three dice (Red, Blue,Green).

name: Urlaubsl√§nderquiz Frankreich
description:
Trivia game about France.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

name: Urlaubsl√§nderquiz Spanien
description:
Trivia game about Spain.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

name: Urlaubsl√§nderquiz Italien
description:
Trivia game about Italy.
The game consists of 240 questions on 48 cards, in the categories Town and Country, Art and Culture, History and Modern Times, Food and Drinks, Sports, Leisure and Holiday as well as Demands, 5 questions and 1 demand per cards, in varying sequences. Correct answers ears souvenirs, demands must be fulfilled when possible and change ownership of souvenirs. One can only hold a limited number of souvenirs of a kind, or must exchange them. Whoever has the most souvenirs at the end of the game wins.

name: Wissensquiz Pferde
description: A trump and guessing game on 32 horse races, the cards show a number range, the name of the race, the size and weight of the animal, the colours of the coat and the age of the race. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with key ring horse pendant.

name: Wissensquiz Raubtiere
description: A trump and guessing game on 32 kinds of predators, the cards show a number range, the name of the animal, the size and weight of the animal, the kind of protection it is awarded and the feed of the animal. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a predator tooth on a cord.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Wissensquiz S√§ugetiere
description: A trump and guessing game on 32 mammals, the cards show a number range, the name and the weight of the animal, its life span in the wild and the breeding time. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a thermometer.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Wissensquiz V√∂gel
description: A trump and guessing game about birds, the cards show a number range, the name of the race, the size and wing span of the bird, its life span in the wild and the hatching time. The cards are dealt, in his turn a player rolls the die and depending on the roll he chooses a very big or a very small number from the information on his cards, the next player answers with his biggest or smallest number in the same category. The player with the highest or lowest number respectively wins both cards. If one player has run out of cards, the player with the most cards wins. Packed in a belt bag, with a bird whistle.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Alle meine Tiere
description: Each child has ist own picture of a farmyard, the missing animals are only visible in contours. To make it easy to find the missing animals, the conturs are coloured. All 24 animals are put into a bag, and players take turns to pull out an animal from the bag. On each card 6 animals are missing, players must pay close attention which animals are pulled out of the bag, since the animals have different colors on each picture. On one the duck is red, on the next one yellow, and so on. Only animals in the correct color count, who is the first to fill his picture with all the missing animals, wins.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Salada de Silabas
description:
This in an educational game from Brasil. The child attempts to match images of fruits and vegetables by combining two beautifully illustrated cards. Each card contains 50% of the object and 50% of the name.

The cards fit together like two halves of a puzzle to form a complete image, so the child learns by trial and error as the game progresses.

A successful match helps the child learn the word for the object and teaches the child how the fruit or vegetable appears in the natural world.

Includes 22 cards, rules, and a storage insert.

A solitaire option is available.

name: Quidnam
description:
Find answers to eternal questions or get insight into burning issues such as life, the universe and everything, whether the earth will exist in 2013, or what really happened to Atlantis. Quidnam is not just a game; it’s a mirror on life and the totality of human existence.

Quidnam is a unique card deck that can be used for contemplation and illuminating solitaire meditation or in a groupthink party game. The heart of Quidnam is the deck of 64 insightful cards developed from fundamental principles of human existence using Set Theory. Each card has lore and art to provide verbal and visual suggestions as to their meaning. There are 4 suits of 16 cards. These suits represent the 4 planes of existence - physical, biological, cognitive, and social. Each plane (suit) has 4 unique elements and a color; each card in the suit is composed of a combination of those four elements from zero to four. The mix of elements is shown on each card.

Meditation. To meditate, simply decide on a topic, shuffle the deck, deal some cards using a pattern or method to your liking, and study the result. You can do this alone or with family and friends. Some patterns for reading are shown in the action shots. You can create your own patterns and methods. The topic is up to you.

The Quidnam deck can be used to play the Groupthink game. This party game is best played with at least 4 players; the more the better. A question or issue is chosen at the beginning of play. Play consists of one or more rounds. For each round, one player serves as a judge. The role of judge rotates from round to round. Shuffle the deck and deal some cards using a pattern or method that the group likes. All players look at these cards and develop a secret reading which they write down and give to the judge. The judge picks the best reading and the winner gets a point. Several rounds should be played. The player with the most points wins.

Important note. Quidnam forms the foundation for the exciting game of Totality.

Totality also shows how the set theoretical design maps the cards to the I Ching and Zodiac.

name: Puz-L-Game
description: Puz-L-Game is basically a 21" x 14" puzzle divided into four color-coded triangle sections. The instructions for the game are printed in the center of the puzzle on a 24-piece white oval. They instruct 2, 3, or 4 players to each collect one color-coded section of the puzzle (96 pieces) prior to the game beginning. Then players compete to see who can complete their section of the puzzle first. There are two themes I am aware of: African Animals and Race Cars. The African Animals Puz-L-Game consists of a blue rhino, a red elephant, a yellow lion, and a green gorilla

name: Kiddie Quiz
description:
A game to help 'Tiny Tots' to recognise names and objects. A question sheet is laid over the mechanics. On the left there are 3 pictures per line, making 12 pictures altogether per sheet. On the right are 12 boxes with the names of the objects. A child must touch an object with the lead and then touch the name. If correct, bulbs will light up.
When played competitively, the first one to get a pre-set number of questions right, wins.

name: Das Wilhemshaven Spiel
description:
A Monopoly clone set in the coastal town of Wilhemshaven, Germany. The game has sponsored by a local radio station and by various Wilehmshaven entrepreneurs, the players have to acquire and trade company shares instead of streets.

The penalties for players ending their move on an already occupied field only increase with the number of company shares with identical colors; the concept of additional buildings such as hotels been dropped. Instead, this game features profit and loss statements that are triggered by certain fields. They change share values, resulting in players paying money into or getting money from a money pool. There are also pool cards triggering the profit and loss statements of shares of one color.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
